  • Rounding your entries
  • Saving and printing
  • Deleting information
  • Submitting your Tax Return

General navigation

Whilst completing your Tax Return you will be prompted to answer questions and provide information. When you have completed a page you should use the 'Next' button to move to the next page. If you need to go back to the previous page, use the 'Back' button. You can also use the menu on the left to move around within your Tax Return.

If you want to see how much of the return you've already done, without going back to the start, look at the green progress bar along the top of the screen. This shows (graphically) how much you've done/still have to do. Alternatively for more detailed information you can click the 'Check your progress' button.

Saving your entries

There are various ways in which you can save the information you have entered to date. These are:

  • Click on the 'Next' button, at the bottom right of the screen. This saves everything you have done to date and takes you on to the next screen in the sequence.
  • Click on the 'Back' button, at the bottom right of the screen. This saves everything you have done to date and takes you to the previous screen in the sequence.
  • Click on the 'Save' button, at the bottom left of the screen. This saves everything you have done to date, and is the button to use if you want (to log out and come back to it later on.)

Rounding your entries

When completing the boxes we would advise you to enter whole pounds however you can enter pence if you wish. For example, if your State Pension was £3500.87, we would advise you to enter £3500. The calculation will always round in your favour.

Saving and printing

You can now view, save and print a copy of your Return to your own computer in two different formats which are black and white or colour. You can also view, print and save any attachments that you have uploaded. Follow the '7. Save your return' link from the left hand menu to to do this at anytime.

Deleting information

If you have made an error in a field you can overwrite with the correct figure/information. If you want to delete a whole form or worksheet you can do this by using the 'Delete' link at the bottom of the page.

Submitting your Tax Return

When you have finished completing your Tax Return you will automatically see the 'Submit your return' page . If you are not ready to submit, your return you can come back later and choose 8. Submit your return from the left hand side of the screen. You will be asked to enter your User ID and password unless you are a Digital Certificate user where you will be asked to confirm submission using this.
Welsh Content:
Cymorth wrth ddefnyddio'r Ffurflen Dreth

  • Llywio cyffredinol
  • Cadw eich cofnodion
  • Talgrynnu eich cofnodion
  • Cadw ac argraffu
  • Dileu gwybodaeth
  • Cyflwyno eich Ffurflen Dreth

Llywio cyffredinol 

Wrth gwblhau eich Ffurflen Dreth cewch eich annog i ateb cwestiynau a rhoi gwybodaeth. Ar ôl cwblhau tudalen dylech ddefnyddio'r botwm 'Nesaf' i symud i'r dudalen nesaf. Os bydd angen i chi fynd nôl i'r dudalen flaenorol, defnyddiwch y botwm 'Nôl'. Gallwch hefyd ddefnyddio'r ddewislen ar y chwith i symud o gwmpas o fewn eich Ffurflen Dreth.

Os ydych am weld faint o'r ffurflen yr ydych eisoes wedi'i llenwi, heb fynd nôl i'r dechrau, edrychwch ar y bar cynnydd gwyrdd ar hyd brig y sgrin. Dengys hwn (yn raffigol) faint sydd wedi'i gwblhau, a faint sy'n weddill. Fel arall, gallwch glicio'r botwm 'Gwirio eich cynnydd' am wybodaeth fanylach.

Cadw eich cofnodion 

Mae sawl ffordd y gallwch gadw'r wybodaeth yr ydych wedi'i nodi hyd yma, sef:

  • Cliciwch ar y botwm 'Nesaf', ar waelod dde'r sgrin. Mae hwn yn cadw popeth yr ydych wedi'i wneud hyd yma, ac yn mynd â chi ymlaen i'r sgrin nesaf yn y drefn.
  • Cliciwch ar y botwm 'Nôl', ar waelod dde'r sgrin. Mae hwn yn cadw popeth yr ydych wedi'i wneud hyd yma, ac yn mynd â chi nôl i'r sgrin flaenorol yn y drefn.
  • Cliciwch ar y botwm 'Cadw', ar waelod chwith y sgrin. Mae hwn yn cadw popeth yr ydych wedi'i wneud hyd yma, a dyma'r botwm i'w ddefnyddio os ydych (am allgofnodi a dychwelyd yn nes ymlaen.)

Talgrynnu eich cofnodion 

Wrth lenwi'r blychau, awgrymwn eich bod yn nodi punnoedd cyfan. Serch hynny, gallwch nodi ceiniogau os dymunwch. Er enghraifft, os mai £3500.87 oedd eich Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth, awgrymwn eich bod yn nodi £3500. Bydd y cyfrifiant bob amser yn talgrynnu o'ch plaid.

Cadw ac argraffu

Gallwch nawr edrych ar, cadw ac argraffu copi o'ch Ffurflen Dreth i'ch cyfrifiadur eich hun mewn dwy ffurf wahanol, sef Du a Gwyn neu Liw. Gallwch hefyd edrych ar, argraffu a chadw unrhyw atodion yr ydych wedi'u llwytho i fyny. Dilynwch y cysylltiad '7. Cadw eich Ffurflen Dreth' o'r ddewislen ar y chwith i wneud hyn ar unrhyw adeg.

Dileu gwybodaeth 

Os ydych wedi gwneud camgymeriad mewn maes gallwch ei drosysgrifo â'r ffigur cywir/wybodaeth gywir. Os ydych am ddileu ffurflen neu daflen waith gyfan gallwch wneud hyn trwy ddefnyddio'r cysylltiad 'Dileu' ar waelod y dudalen.

Cyflwyno eich Ffurflen Dreth 

Ar ôl gorffen llenwi eich Ffurflen Dreth fe welwch yn awtomatig y dudalen 'Cyflwyno eich Ffurflen Dreth'. Os nad ydych yn barod i gyflwyno eich Ffurflen Dreth, gallwch ddychwelyd nes ymlaen a dewis '8. Cyflwyno eich Ffurflen Dreth' o'r ddewislen ar y chwith.

Gofynnir i chi nodi eich Dynodydd Defnyddiwr a'ch Cyfrinair, oni bai eich bod yn ddefnyddiwr Tystysgrif Ddigidol pan ofynnir i chi gadarnhau'r cyflwyniad trwy ddefnyddio hon.

English Content:
This is an amount of tax withheld on certain payments to UK residents by some European Member States and other related and third party territories under the terms of the European Savings Directive and equivalent third party agreements. This tax will be in addition to any foreign tax deducted by the country of origin of the payment.

The countries that may deduct Special Withholding Tax (SWT) are:

Andorra, Austria, Curacao, Gibraltar, Jersey, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Monaco, San Marino, St Maarten and Switzerland.

Where SWT is deducted you are treated as having paid in the year of deduction an equivalent amount of Income Tax in the UK, which can be set against your UK tax liability of that year or repaid to you if the amount exceeds that liability.

If Special Withholding Tax has been deducted by one of the territories listed above from the proceeds of a transaction, which if a gain were to accrue on it would be a chargeable gain and chargeable to Capital Gains Tax, enter the total amount of SWT in sterling here.

Bydd y dreth hon yn ychwanegol at unrhyw dreth dramor a ddidynnir gan y wlad y tarddodd y taliad ohoni.

English Content:
Work out your net income for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 by following steps 1 to 4 below. If your net income is over £50,000 select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu, otherwise select 'No''

Step 1 - work out your 'net income'

Add up your taxable income, include things such as:

  • income from employment including any company benefits
  • profits from self-employment
  • taxable social security benefits
  • pensions including the State Pension
  • savings, dividend and rental income

then take off any tax reliefs that apply, such as:

  • payments made gross to pension schemes - those have been made without tax relief
  • trading losses, for example trade loss relief or property loss relief

This is your 'net income'.

Your net income is then adjusted - follow steps 2 to 4 below.

Step 2 - take off Gift Aid donations

If you made a Gift Aid donation, take off the 'grossed-up' amount - what you paid plus the basic rate of tax.

Step 3 - take off pension contributions

If you made a contribution to a pension scheme where your pension provider has already given you tax relief at basic rate, take off the 'grossed-up' amount - what you paid plus the basic rate of tax.

Step 4 - add back tax relief for payments to trade unions or police organisations

Tax relief of up to £100 is available if you make payments to a trade union or police organisation for superannuation, life insurance or funeral benefits.

If you took off an amount for this type of payment at step 1, add it back.

This is your 'adjusted net income' which determines if your income is over £50,000 for Child Benefit purposes.
Welsh Content:
Gweithiwch allan eich incwm net ar gyfer y flwyddyn dreth 6 Ebrill 2016 i 5 Ebrill 2017 drwy ddilyn camau 1 i 4 isod. Os yw eich incwm net dros £50,0000, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall atebwch 'Na'.

Cam 1 - gweithiwch allan eich 'incwm net'

Cyfrifwch eich incwm trethadwy - dylech gynnwys pethau fel:

  • incwm o gyflogaeth gan gynnwys unrhyw fuddiannau cwmni
  • elw o hunangyflogaeth
  • buddiannau nawdd cymdeithasol trethadwy
  • pensiynau gan gynnwys Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth
  • cynilion, difidendau ac incwm rhentu

yna didynnwch unrhyw ryddhad treth sy'n gymwys, fel

  • taliadau a wnaed yn gros i gynlluniau pensiwn - maent wedi'u gwneud heb ryddhad treth
  • colledion masnachu, er enghraifft, rhyddhad colled masnach neu ryddhad colled eiddo

Dyma yw eich 'incwm net'.

Caiff eich incwm net ei addasu wedyn – dilynwch gamau 2 i 4 isod.

Cam 2 - didynnwch gyfraniadau Rhodd Cymorth

Os gwnaethoch gyfraniad Rhodd Cymorth, didynnwch y swm wedi ei grosio i fyny - yr hyn a dalwyd gennych ynghyd â chyfradd sylfaenol y dreth.

Cam 3 - didynnwch gyfraniadau pensiwn

Os gwnaethoch gyfraniad i gynllun pensiwn pan fod eich darparwr pensiwn eisoes wedi rhoi rhyddhad treth i chi ar y gyfradd sylfaenol, didynnwch y swm wedi ei grosio i fyny - yr hyn a dalwyd gennych ynghyd â chyfradd sylfaenol y dreth.

Cam 4 - ychwanegwch yn ôl rhyddhad treth ar gyfer taliadau i undebau llafar neu sefydliadau'r heddlu

Mae rhyddhad treth o hyd at £100 ar gael os ydych yn gwneud taliadau i undeb llafur neu sefydliad yr heddlu ar gyfer blwydd-dal, yswiriant bywyd neu fuddiannau angladd.

Os gwnaethoch ddidynnu swm ar gyfer y math hwn o daliad yng ngham 1, ychwanegwch y swm yn ôl.

Dyma eich 'incwm net wedi'i addasu' sy'n pennu a yw eich incwm dros £50,000 at ddibenion Budd-dal Plant.

English Content: Enter class 4 NIC

English Content:
You are exempt from paying Class 4 NICs if on 6 April 2016 you were:

  • at or over State Pension age, at the beginning of the year of assessment (including if you reach State Pension age on 6 April 2016)
  • under 16 and the National Insurance Contributions and Employer Office had granted you an 'exception'
  • during the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 you were not resident in the UK for tax purposes (if you are not sure whether this applies to you please contact HM Revenue and Customs)

If one of these conditions applies, select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, please select 'No'.
Welsh Content:
Cewch eich eithrio rhag talu CYG Dosbarth 4 os oeddech ar 6 Ebrill 2016:

  • wedi cyrraedd neu dros oedran Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth, ar ddechrau flwyddyn yr asesiad (gan gynnwys os ydych yn cyrraedd oedran Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth ar 6 Ebrill 2016)
  • o dan 16 oed ac mae'r Swyddfa Cyfraniadau Yswiriant Gwladol a Chyflogwyr (Swyddfa NIC&EO) wedi caniatáu 'eithriad'
  • yn ystod 2016 i 2017 nid oeddech yn preswylio yn y DU at ddibenion treth (os nad ydych yn siŵr fod hyn yn berthnasol i chi yna cysylltwch â Chyllid a Thollau EM)
  • yn ystod 2016 i 2017 roeddech yn bartner segur - hynny yw, ni chymeroch ran weithgar wrth redeg y busnes dim ond darparu cyfalaf a chymryd rhan o'r elw

Os yw unrhyw un o'r amodau hyn yn gymwys, dewiswch 'Iawn'o'r ddewislen fel arall, dewiswch 'Na'.

English Content:
If you're carrying on a trade, profession or vocation and have received income from contracts for professional or other services then you will need to change the way in which you calculate turnover in your accounts. This is because there has been a change in the accounting guidance on service contracts for accounting periods ending on or after 22 June 2005. This guidance, issued by the Accounting Standards Board, is called Urgent Issues Task Force Abstract 40 (UITF 40).

Select this box if you provide services under contracts for professional or other services.
Welsh Content:
Os ydych yn cynnal masnach, proffesiwn neu alwedigaeth ac wedi derbyn incwm o gytundebau am wasanaethau proffesiynol neu wasanaethau eraill yna bydd angen i chi newid y ffordd rydych yn cyfrifo trosiant yn eich cyfrifon. Mae hyn oherwydd y bu newid yn yr arweiniad cyfrifyddu ar gytundebau gwasanaethau ar gyfer cyfnodau cyfrifyddu sy'n dod i ben ar neu ar ôl 22 Mehefin 2005. Gelwir yr arweiniad hwn a gyhoeddwyd gan y Bwrdd Safonnau cyfrifyddu yn Urgent Issues Task Force Abstract 40 (UITF 40).

Os yw'r arweiniad yn berthnasol i chi, mae'n bosib y bydd yn rhaid i chi gynnwys addasiad ar gyfer treth yn y Ffurflen Dreth hon.

Mae arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach i'w chael yn Nhaflen Wybodaeth 238 - Revenue recognition in service contracts - UITF 40

Dewiswch y blwch gwirio hwn os ydych yn darpau gwasanaethau o dan gytundebau am wasanaethau proffesiynol a gwasanaethau eraill.

English Content:
If:

  • you, or your former spouse or civil partner, were born before 6 April 1935
  • you make payments to maintain your former spouse or civil partner, or your child
  • those payments are made under a court order, or a Child Support Agency (CSA) assessment, or a written agreement then you may be entitled to tax relief. Relief (at 10%) is available on payments up to £3,220 in total

You must meet all 4 of the following conditions:

  • the court order, CSA assessment or written agreement is made under the laws of one of the following countries - UK, Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain or Sweden
  • the payments are made to your separated or former spouse or civil partner or, although paid to the Department for Work and Pensions (in Northern Ireland the SSA), are treated as if made to him or her
  • your former spouse hasn't remarried or your former civil partner hasn't entered a further civil partnership (if they have, the payments you made (not exceeding the maximum £3,220) up to the date of the remarriage or civil partnership will qualify for relief)
  • the payments are for his or her own maintenance

In addition, if the first condition is met and the payments you make are to the other parent for the maintenance of your child (or a child you have treated as part of your family) who is under 21, then you can get tax relief.

Please enter the lower of the payments you made or £3,220. Tax relief will be 10% of this figure.
Welsh Content:
Os:

  • cawsoch eich geni, neu ganwyd eich cyn-briod / cyn-bartner sifil, cyn 6 Ebrill 1935
  • ydych yn talu i gynnal eich cyn-briod / cyn-bartner sifil neu blentyn
  • yw'r taliadau hynny yn cael eu gwneud o dan orchymyn llys, asesiad yr Asiantaeth Cynnal Plant neu gytundeb ysgrifenedig, efallai y bydd gennych yr hawl i gael rhyddhad treth. Mae rhyddhad (ar 10%) ar gael ar daliadau hyd at gyfanswm o £3,220

Mae'n rhaid i chi fodloni pob un o'r 4 amod canlynol:

  • gwneir y gorchymyn llys, asesiad yr Asiantaeth Cynnal Plant neu gytundeb ysgrifenedig yn unol â chyfraith un o'r gwledydd canlynol – y Deyrnas Unedig, Awstria, Gwlad Belg, Cyprus, Gweriniaeth Tsiec, Denmarc, Estonia, y Ffindir, Ffrainc, yr Almaen, Gwlad Groeg, Hwngari, Gwlad yr Iâ, Iwerddon, yr Eidal, Latfia, Liechtenstein, Lithwania, Lwcsembwrg, Malta, yr Iseldiroedd, Norwy, Gwlad Pwyl, Portiwgal, Slofacia, Slofenia, Sbaen neu Sweden
  • gwneir y taliadau i'ch priod yr ydych wedi'i ymwahanu ag ef / hi neu eich cyn-briod / cyn-bartner sifil neu, er eu bod yn cael eu talu i'r Adran Gwaith a Phensiynau (neu'r SSA yng Ngogledd Iwerddon), cânt eu trin fel petaent wedi'u talu iddo ef neu iddi hi
  • nid yw eich cyn-briod wedi ailbriodi / cyn-bartner sifil wedi ffurfio partneriaeth sifil arall (os yw wedi gwneud hynny, bydd y taliadau a wnaethoch (heb fod yn uwch na'r uchafswm o £3,220) hyd at y dyddiad y gwnaeth ailbriodi / ffurfio partneriaeth sifil, yn gymwys am ryddhad)
  • mae'r taliadau ar gyfer ei gynhaliaeth ef neu ei chynhaliaeth hi ei hun

Ar ben hynny, os caiff yr amod cyntaf ei fodloni ac mae'r taliadau a wnewch yn cael eu talu i'r rhiant arall ar gyfer cynnal eich plentyn (neu blentyn yr ydych wedi'i drin fel rhan o'ch teulu) sydd o dan 21 oed, gallwch gael rhyddhad treth.

Nodwch swm y taliadau a wnaethoch neu £3,220, p'un bynnag yw'r isaf. Bydd y rhyddhad treth yn 10% o'r ffigur hwn.

English Content:
You can carry losses back to use against

  • income for the tax year 6 April 2015 to 5 April 2016. If your loss is more than the income you can use the remaining loss against the tax year 6 April 2015 to 5 April 2016 capital gains

Do not make this claim if you use cash basis.

  • Income in the 3 previous years. Starting with the earliest year

Only make this claim if your business began after 5 April 2013.

Do not make this claim if you use cash basis

  • Profits of this business in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 and in the 3 previous years. Start with the latest year. Only make this claim if your business ceased this year. The losses you can claim are the losses made in the last 12 months of trade

You'll also need to provide us details of the amount claimed for each year in the 'Any other information' section. If you use cash basis you can only claim for terminal loss relief.

The time limit for claiming is 31 January 2018
Welsh Content: Os ydych am hawlio rhyddhad ar gyfer colled 2016 i 2017 drwy ei gosod yn erbyn incwm o flwyddyn, neu flynyddoedd, cynharach nodwch swm y golled i'w chario'n ôl yn y blwch hwn. Os ydych eisoes wedi gwneud cais am gyfrifo'r rhyddhad yn y ffordd hon, dylech ddal i gynnwys y golled yma a rhoi manylion yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall'.

English Content: You can only deduct the costs you had to pay out in doing your job. If your employer has agreed a dispensation with HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) you mustn't deduct any expenses that are covered by that dispensation. If you need help with this, speak to your employer's pay section or contact HMRC.
Welsh Content: Dim ond y costau yr oedd yn rhaid i chi dalu allan wrth wneud eich gwaith y gallwch eu didynnu. Os yw eich cyflogwr wedi cytuno ar oddefeb gyda Chyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM), rhaid i chi beidio â didynnu unrhyw dreuliau sy'n cael eu cwmpasu gan yr oddefeb honno. Os oes angen cymorth arnoch gyda hyn, siaradwch ag adran cyflogau eich cyflogwr. Fel arall, cysylltwch â CThEM.

English Content:
'Unlisted shares or securities' are any not within the 'listed shares and securities' definition below.

For the purpose of this grouping only 'listed shares and securities' means any of the following: Shares or securities of a company listed on a recognised stock exchange throughout the period you owned them - ignoring any period when the listing or quotation was temporarily suspended - please see the Capital Gains Tax area of our website for more details on:

  • shares in a company that was a UK Open-Ended Investment Company ('OEIC') throughout your period of ownership
  • units in a unit trust that was an authorised unit trust throughout your period of ownership
This field cannot be blank. Please amend.

English Content:
If you have an account that pays you interest etc without the payer deducting tax at all (a gross paying account) please enter that untaxed amount. (Do not use this field for the gross of the previous field, if you do, you will be taxed twice on the same income.)

If you receive untaxed interest on a loan you have made to someone (including a member of your family) you should also include it in this field.

If your only foreign income was untaxed foreign interest up to £2,000 you can use this field to enter this information about your untaxed foreign interest rather than completing the 'Foreign' pages.

If you enter any untaxed foreign interest in this field, please add a note in the 'Any other information' field, to show the amounts of untaxed UK interest and untaxed foreign interest received.

Interest from government stocks, bonds, loan notes or securities from UK companies should be entered in the 'Interest from gilt-edged and other UK securities, deeply discounted securities and accrued income profits' field as appropriate.

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 or 6 April 2018 to 5 April 2019 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HMRC know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.
Welsh Content:
Os oes gennych gyfrif sy’n talu llog ac ati i chi heb fod y talwr yn didynnu treth o gwbl (cyfrif sy’n talu’n gros),nodwch y swm hwnnw sydd heb ei drethu. (Peidiwch â defnyddio’r blwch hwn ar gyfer ffigur gros y ffigur a nodwyd yn y blwch blaenorol, os gwnewch hyn, cewch eich trethu ddwywaith ar yr un incwm.)

Os ydych yn derbyn llog heb ei drethu ar fenthyciad a wnaethoch i rywun (gan gynnwys aelod o’ch teulu), dylech ei gynnwys yn y blwch hwn.

Os mai eich unig incwm tramor oedd llog tramor heb ei drethu (hyd at £2,000), gallwch ddefnyddio'r blwch hwn i nodi gwybodaeth ynglŷn â'ch llog tramor heb ei drethu yn hytrach na chwblhau’r tudalennau Tramor.

Os nodwch unrhyw log tramor yn y blwch hwn, ychwanegwch nodyn yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall', i ddangos y symiau o log yn y DU a llog tramor heb eu trethu a dderbyniwyd.

Dylid nodi llog o stociau'r llywodraeth, bondiau, nodiadau benthyg neu warantau gan gwmnïau yn y DU yn y blwch 'Llog o warantau gilt a gwarantau eraill y DU, gwarantau wedi'u disgowntio'n ddwfn ac elw incwm a gronnwyd' fel sy'n briodol.

English Content:
Choose the relevant code from the drop-down box. If you're making more than one claim enter 'MUL' or, if the claim or election is not listed, enter 'OTH'.

PRR - Private Residence Relief where Lettings Relief does not apply

LET - Private Residence Relief where Lettings Relief applies

GHO - Gift Hold-Over Relief

ROR - Rollover Relief

ESH - Employee Shares

ERL - Entrepreneurs’ Relief

NVC - Negligible Value Claims

SIR - Social Investment Tax Relief

OTH - Other claims

MUL - If more than 1 code applies

You must make a claim or election by clearly stating it in your attached computation. Some claims have to be made on a separate claim form which you complete and attach to your Tax Return along with your computation.

You should state the amount of any relief or allowance you're claiming and if you're claiming that any listed shares or securities have become of negligible value you should include as disposal proceeds for the shares the value specified in your claim.

Private Residence Relief (PRR) where a dwelling house which can include:

  • a house
  • a flat
  • a houseboat or fixed caravan

Which is your

  • only or main residence throughout your period of ownership
  • you have not been absent, other than an allowable period of absence or because you have been living in 'job-related accommodation' during your 'period of ownership'
  • the garden or grounds including the buildings on them are not greater than the permitted area (5,000 square metres)

and no part of your home has been used exclusively for business purposes during your period of ownership.

Lettings Relief (LET) cannot be given if the dwelling house has been your only or main residence at some time in your period of ownership and has been let as residential accommodation.
Welsh Content:
Dewiswch y cod priodol o'r ddewislen. Os ydych yn gwneud mwy nag un cais nodwch 'MUL', neu, os nad yw'r cais neu'r dewis wedi'i restru, nodwch 'OTH'.

PRR - Rhyddhad Preswylfan Breifat pan nad yw Rhyddhad Gosod yn gymwys

LET - Rhyddhad Preswylfan Breifat pan fod Rhyddhad Gosod yn gymwys

GHO - Rhyddhad Daliol ar gyfer Rhoddion

ROR - Rhyddhad Treigl

ESH - Cyfranddaliadau Cyflogeion

ERL - Rhyddhad Mentrwr

NVC - Ceisiadau am Symiau Pitw

SIR - Rhyddhad Treth am Fuddsoddiad Cymdeithasol

OTH - Ceisiadau eraill

MUL - Os oes mwy nag un 1 cod yn gymwys

Y

Rhyddhad Preswylfan Breifat (PRR) lle y gall anedd-dŷ all gynnwys:

  • tŷ
  • fflat
  • cwch preswyl neu garafan sefydlog

Sy'n:

  • unig breswylfa, neu'n brif breswylfa i chi drwy gydol eich cyfnod o berchnogaeth
  • ni fuoch yn absennol, heblaw am gyfnod o absenoldeb a ganiatawyd, am y buoch yn byw mewn 'llety yn rhinwedd eich swydd' yn ystod eich 'cyfnod o berchnogaeth'.
  • nid yw'r ardd neu'r tir, gan gynnwys yr adeiladau sydd arnynt, yn fwy na'r arwynebedd a ganiateir (5,000 metr sgwâr)

ac ni ddefnyddiwyd rhan o'ch cartref yn gyfan gwbl at ddibenion busnes yn ystod eich cyfnod o berchnogaeth.

Ni ellir rhoi Rhyddhad Gosod (LET) os mai'r anedd-dŷ

  • fu eich unig neu'ch prif breswylfa ar ryw adeg yn ystod eich cyfnod o berchnogaeth a'i fod wedi ei osod fel llety preswyl

English Content:
Please enter the gross amount of income (before any tax has been taken off) which you reported elsewhere and on which foreign tax has been paid.

Provide details in the 'Any other information' field at the end of the 'Fill in your return' section where on your Tax Return this income is included (for example, Employment page. If more than one page, specify which ones, for instance Self-employment, Partnership, Capital Gains Summary pages.)

If you've a business in the UK and the gross receipts of the business include income on which you've paid foreign tax you'll need to work out the amount of overall profits that came from the overseas receipts.

If the source of income is the overseas branch of a UK business, enter the gross profits earned by the branch and keep a copy of the branch accounts as HM Revenue and Customs may ask you for a copy.

In certain circumstances if your business basis period for the tax year 6 April 2015 to 5 April 2016 overlaps with your basis period for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 you may be able to claim foreign tax credit relief on the profits for the overlap period even though relief for the same tax may have already been allowed in working out your tax liability for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017.

Help Sheet 260 - Overlap provides more information.
Welsh Content:
Rhowch swm gros yr incwm (cyn bod treth wedi'i didynnu) y gwnaethoch roi gwybod amdano rywle arall, ac y mae treth dramor wedi'i thalu arno.

Rhowch y manylion yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' ar ddiwedd yr adran 'Llenwch eich Ffurflen Dreth', lle mae'r incwm hwn wedi'i gynnwys ar eich Ffurflen Dreth (er enghraifft, y dudalen Gyflogaeth. Os oes mwy nag un dudalen, rhowch wybod pa rai ydynt, er enghraifft, tudalennau Hunangyflogaeth, Partneriaeth, Crynodeb o Enillion Cyfalaf.)

Os oes gennych fusnes yn y DU a bod derbynebau gros y busnes yn cynnwys incwm y taloch dreth dramor arno, bydd yn rhaid i chi gyfrifo swm yr elw cyfan a ddaeth o'r derbynebau tramor.

Os mai cangen dramor busnes y DU yw ffynhonnell yr incwm, rhowch yr elw gros a enillwyd gan y gangen a chadwch gopi o gyfrifon y gangen, gan ei fod yn bosibl y bydd Cyllid a Thollau EM yn gofyn i chi am gopi.

Mewn amgylchiadau penodol, os yw cyfnod sail eich busnes ar gyfer 2014 i 2016 yn gorgyffwrdd â'ch cyfnod sail ar gyfer 2016 i 2017, efallai y gallwch wneud cais am ryddhad credyd treth tramor ar yr elw ar gyfer y cyfnod gorgyffwrdd, hyd yn oed os oes rhyddhad ar gyfer yr un dreth eisoes wedi ei ganiatáu wrth gyfrifo eich rhwymedigaeth treth ar gyfer 2016 i 2017.

English Content:
Fixed deductions are amounts of flat rate expenses HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) agree with the relevant trade unions, or other bodies, to cover the costs of maintaining or replacing tools or special working clothes.

You don't have to be a member of the union to get them. They may be included on your PAYE Coding Notice.

You may want to deduct the actual amount you spent on tools or special working clothes, rather than the fixed rate amount. If so, leave this box blank and enter the actual amount spent in 'Other expenses and capital allowances'.

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 or 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HMRC know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.
Welsh Content:
Didyniadau sefydlog yw symiau o dreuliau cyfradd unffurf y mae Cyllid a Thollau EM yn cytuno arnynt gyda'r undebau llafur perthnasol, neu gyrff eraill, er mwyn cwmpasu costau o gynnal neu adnewyddu offer neu ddillad gwaith arbennig.

Nid oes yn rhaid i chi fod yn aelod o'r undeb i'w cael. Efallai y cânt eu cynnwys yn eich Hysbysiad Cod TWE.

Efallai byddech am ddidynnu'r swm gwirioneddol a wariwyd gennych ar offer neu ddillad gwaith arbennig, yn hytrach na'r swm cyfradd sefydlog. Os felly, gadewch y blwch hwn yn wag a rhowch y swm gwirioneddol a wariwyd o dan 'Treuliau eraill a lwfansau cyfalaf'.

English Content:
If you are exempt from paying Class 4 National Insurance contributions (NICs) select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.

You are exempt from paying Class 4 NICs if on 6 April 2016 you were:

  • at or over State Pension age at the beginning of the year of assessment (including if you reach State Pension age on 6 April 2016)
  • under 16
  • during the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 you were not resident in the UK for tax purposes (if you are not sure please contact HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) or your tax adviser)

If you're a trustee or a diver or diving instructor you may also be exempt, contact HMRC if you think this applies.
Welsh Content:
Os ydych wedi eich eithrio rhag talu cyfraniadau Yswiriant Gwladol (CYG) Dosbarth 4, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'.

Cewch eich eithrio rhag talu CYG Dosbarth 4 os oeddech ar 6 Ebrill 2016:

  • wedi cyrraedd neu dros oedran Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth, ar ddechrau flwyddyn yr asesiad (gan gynnwys os ydych yn cyrraedd oedran Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth ar 6 Ebrill 2016)
  • o dan 16, neu
  • yn ystod 2016 i 2017 nid oeddech yn preswylio yn y DU at ddibenion treth (os nad ydych yn siŵr yna cysylltwch â Chyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) neu eich ymgynghorydd treth)

Os ydych yn ymddiriedolwr neu'n ddeifar neu'n oruchwyliwr mae'n bosib y byddwch hefyd wedi eich eithrio, cysylltwch â CThEM os ydych yn credu bod hyn yn gymwys.

English Content:
You can deduct certain disposal costs as long as they are directly referable to the disposal of the asset. These costs are:

  • fees, commission or payment for professional advice for establishing relevant valuations or apportionments required for the purpose of the computation of the gains (but not any cost of calculating the gains or capital gains tax liability)
  • the cost of transfer or conveyance
  • Stamp Duty and Stamp Duty Land Tax
  • advertising costs

  • cost trosglwyddo neu drawsgludiad
  • Treth Stamp a Threth Dir y Tollau Stamp
  • costau hysbysebu

English Content:
Don't include questions in this box as we cannot answer specific questions from your tax return.

Please enter any additional information you feel is needed to support your entries. You should only enter alpha, numeric and the following special characters ‘()*,-./£@&.

In certain circumstances you may have to pay capital gains tax on gains made by a non-UK resident Trust or a non-UK-resident company in which you have an interest. You may also have to pay capital gains tax on gains which arose in earlier years but become taxable in this tax year.

You should include in the section 'property and other assets and gains', gains attributed to you from a non-UK resident Trust or company in which you have an interest, gains of earlier years becoming taxable in this, and gains on the recovery of certain loans and guarantee payments. Enter in this field or in an attachment (online), full details of the gain or loss and of the Trust, company or recovery concerned.

For further information is available in:

  • Capital Gains Summary Notes
  • Help Sheet 296 - Debts and Capital Gains Tax

If you're amending your Return and you've made a change to your capital gains or allowable losses which are not exempt from Capital gains Tax, then you must provide a separate computation for each gain or loss.

If you do not attach a computation (online), you must give details in the additional information page in order for your return to be accepted.

You will need to enter details of computations and adjustments and the reference number of each Non-resident Capital Gains Tax return made.
Welsh Content:
Peidiwch â chynnwys cwestiynau yn y blwch hwn gan na allwn ateb unrhyw gwestiynau penodol o'ch ffurflen dreth.

Nodwch unrhyw wybodaeth ychwanegol y credwch sydd ei hangen i ategu'r hyn a gofnodwyd gennych. Dylech ond nodi nodau alffa, rhifol a'r nodau arbennig canlynol '()*,-./£@&.

Mewn rhai amgylchiadau efallai y bydd rhaid i chi dalu treth enillion cyfalaf ar enillion a wnaed gan Ymddiriedolaeth nad yw wedi ei sefydlu yn y DU neu gwmni nad yw wedi ei sefydlu yn y DU ac y mae gennych fuddiant ynddo. Efallai y bydd rhaid i chi dalu treth enillion cyfalaf ar enillion a gododd mewn blynyddoedd cynharach ond a ddaeth yn drethadwy yn y flwyddyn hon.

Dylech gynnwys yn yr adran 'eiddo ac asedion ac enillion eraill': enillion a briodolir i chi o Ymddiriedolaeth nad yw wedi ei sefydlu yn y DU neu gwmni y mae gennych fuddiant ynddo, enillion o flynyddoedd cynharach sy'n dod yn drethadwy yn y flwyddyn hon, ac enillion pan gaiff rhai benthyciadau a thaliadau gwarant penodol eu hadfer. Dylech nodi yn y blwch hwn neu mewn atodiad (ar-lein), manylion llawn yr ennill neu'r golled, yr Ymddiriedolaeth, y cwmni neu fanylion yr hyn a gafodd ei adfer.

Am ragor o wybodaeth gweler:

  • Nodiadau Crynhoi Enillion Cyfalaf
  • Taflen Gymorth 296 – Debts and Capital Gains Tax

Os ydych yn diwygio eich Ffurflen Dreth ac rydych wedi newid eich enillion cyfalaf neu eich colledion caniataol sydd heb eu heithrio o Dreth Enillion Cyfalaf, yna rhaid i chi ddarparu cyfrifiant ar wahân ar gyfer pob ennill neu golled.

Os nad ydych yn atodi cyfrifiant (ar-lein), mae rhaid i chi ddarparu manylion ar y dudalen gwybodaeth ychwanegol er mwyn i'ch Ffurflen Dreth gael ei dderbyn.

Bydd rhaid i chi nodi manylion cyfrifiannau ac addasiadau a chyfeirnod pob Ffurflen Dreth Enillion Cyfalaf ar gyfer person nad yw'n breswyl a gyflwynir.

Nodwch yn y blwch hwn swm y dreth dramor a ddidynnwyd o'r incwm a gynhwyswyd yn 'Cyfran o'r incwm arall a drethwyd' nad ydych yn hawlio rhyddhad credyd treth ar ei chyfer.

English Content:
If the partnership's accounting date is a date other than 5 April, overlaps in your basis periods may occur:

  • in the first 3 years after you become a partner
  • in a year in which there is a change in the partnership's accounting date

Since you are taxed on your share of the partnership profits for a particular basis period, overlaps in your basis periods would mean that you may be taxed more than once on the same profits. To avoid this, you may be able to claim overlap relief for the profit (the overlap profit) in any overlap period.

Overlap relief may be due for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 if:

  • you ceased to be a partner in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017
  • the partnership's business ceased in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017
  • the partnership changed its accounting date in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 and your basis period, is more than 12 months

Help Sheet - 222 How to calculate your taxable profits tells you how to work out overlap profits and how to claim overlap relief.

Please enter the amount of any overlap relief used in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017. Enter in the 'overlap profit carried forward' box the amount of any unused overlap profit carried forward to the tax year 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018.
Welsh Content:
Os yw dyddiad cyfrifyddu'r bartneriaeth yn ddyddiad ar wahân i 5 Ebrill, gall gorgyffwrdd yn eich cyfnodau sail ddigwydd:

  • yn y tair blynedd gyntaf ar ôl i chi ddod yn bartner
  • mewn blwyddyn y mae newid yn nyddiad cyfrifyddu'r bartneriaeth.

Gan fod eich cyfran chi o elw'r bartneriaeth ar gyfer cyfnod sail penodol yn cael ei threthu, byddai gorgyffwrdd yn eich cyfnodau sail yn golygu y gellir trethu'r un elw fwy nag unwaith. I osgoi hyn, efallai y gallwch hawlio rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd ar gyfer yr elw (yr elw gorgyffwrdd) mewn unrhyw gyfnod gorgyffwrdd.

Gall rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd fod yn ddyledus ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 os:

  • rhoesoch y gorau i fod yn bartner yn 2016 i 2017
  • daeth busnes y bartneriaeth i ben yn 2016 i 2017
  • newidiodd y bartneriaeth ei dyddiad cyfrifyddu yn 2016 i 2017 ac mae'ch cyfnod sail yn fwy na 12 mis.

English Content:
Multiple chargeable events occur when life insurance, life annuity or capital redemption policies are redeemed or partially redeemed. The cash received is strictly a gain, but it is taxed as income as must be reported. You may have a number of chargeable events from one policy.

If you've made gains from several, non-identical policies, you will not be able to use HMRC’s software to file online and will need to use an alternative. You can find a list of alternative software providers at www.gov.uk/software-tax-returns.

English Content:
Turnover consists of your total sales, takings, fees or money earned by your business for the period up to the date your books and accounts are made up to.

Turnover includes:

  • cash or cheques
  • fees, tips and commissions
  • the value of any payments 'in kind' (that is not payment by cheque or cash) for work done or goods sold

It is the money due to you up to your end of the tax year (5 April 2017) - whether or not you have actually been paid.

Cash Basis Accounting

You can start using cash basis from 6 April 2014 and if you:

  • run a small business e.g. sole traders and partnerships
  • have an income of £83,000 or less a year (this is the threshold to register for VAT)

You can also decide not to use cash basis if it's not suited to tour business.

Income and expenses under cash basis

In cash basis accounting you only count the money you've actually received and expenses you've paid up to your end of tax year (5 April 2017) - money you're owed isn't counted until you receive it.

Capital allowances

If you use cash basis accounting and buy a car for your business, you can claim this as a capital allowance. However, all other items you buy and keep for your business should be claimed as allowable expenses in the normal way.

Losses

  • any losses you make can't be set off against your other income
  • terminal loss must be set against any profits (after deducting losses brought forward) from the same business taxed in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017
  • any remaining terminal losses must be set against the profits of the same business taxed in the 3 prior years. Starting with the latest year

Other considerations

  • businesses using traditional accounting (accruals basis) might have to make some adjustments if they switch to cash basis
  • you can choose how you record when you receive or pay money (e.g. the date the money enters or leaves your account or the date a cheque is written) but you must use the same method each tax year
  • a loss incurred by a business adopting 'Cash basis' can only carry forward. No sideways or earlier year's tax relief can be claimed
  • your business grows during the tax year you can stay in the scheme up to an income of £164,000. Above that you'll need to use traditional accounting for your Income Tax return for the next tax year, unless your income drops back below the VAT threshold in place at the end of that tax year

For further guidance on cash basis check the help on the question 'Did you use the cash basis, money actually received and paid out, to calculate your income and expense?'
Welsh Content:
Cyfrifo traddodiadol (ar sail croniadau)

Mae trosiant yn cynnwys cyfanswm eich gwerthiannau, derbyniadau, ffioedd neu arian a enillwyd gan eich busnes, am y cyfnod hyd at ddyddiad cau eich cofnodion a'ch cyfrifon.

Mae hyn yn cynnwys:

  • arian parod neu sieciau (gan gynnwys incwm o adeiladu)
  • ffioedd, cildyrnau a chomisiwn
  • gwerth unrhyw daliadau 'ar ffurf nwyddau' (hynny yw, nid taliadau ar ffurf siec neu arian) am waith a wnaed neu nwyddau a werthwyd

Hwn yw'r arian sy'n ddyledus i chi hyd at ddiwedd y flwyddyn dreth (5 Ebrill 2016) - p'un ai eich bod wedi cael eich talu neu beidio. Nid yw'n cynnwys Lwfans Dechrau Busnes.

Cyfrifyddu ar Sail Arian Parod

Gallwch ddechrau defnyddio sail arian parod o 6 Ebrill 2014 os:

  • ydych yn rhedeg busnes bach e.e. unig fasnachwyr a phartneriaethau
  • oes gennych incwm o £83,000 neu'n llai'r flwyddyn (dyma'r trothwy ar gyfer cofrestru ar gyfer TAW)

Gallwch, hefyd, benderfynu peidio â defnyddio sail arian parod os nad yw'n gweddu ar gyfer eich busnes.

Incwm a threuliau o dan sail arian parod

Wrth ddefnyddio cyfrifo ar sail arian parod, rydych ond yn cyfri'r arian a gawsoch mewn gwirionedd a'r treuliau a daloch hyd at ddiwedd y flwyddyn dreth (5 Ebrill 2017) - ni chaff arian sy'n ddyledus i chi ei gyfrifo hyd nes eich bod wedi ei dderbyn.

Lwfansau cyfalaf

Os ydych yn defnyddio cyfrifo ar sail arian parod ac yn prynu car ar gyfer eich busnes, gallwch hawlio hwnnw fel lwfans cyfalaf. Fodd bynnag, dylid hawlio pob eitem arall a brynwch ac a gadwch ar gyfer eich busnes fel treuliau a ganiateir, yn y modd arferol.

Colledion

  • ni all colledion a wneir gennych gael eu gosod yn erbyn eich incwm arall
  • mae'n rhaid gosod colled derfynol yn erbyn elw (ar ôl didynnu colledion a ddygwyd ymlaen) o'r un busnes a drethwyd yn 2016 i 2017
  • mae'n rhaid gosod colledion terfynol sy'n weddill yn erbyn elw'r un busnes a drethwyd yn y 3 blynedd cyn hynny. Dylech ddechrau gyda'r flwyddyn fwyaf diweddar

Pethau eraill i'w hystyried

  • mae'n bosibl y bydd yn rhaid i fusnesau sy'n defnyddio cyfrifyddu traddodiadol (ar sail croniadau) wneud rhai addasiadau os ydynt yn newid i sail arian parod
  • gallwch ddewis sut y byddwch yn cofnodi pan fyddwch yn derbyn neu'n talu arian (e.e. y dyddiad pan fydd yr arian yn cyrraedd neu'n gadael eich cyfrif neu'r dyddiad pan gaiff siec ei hysgrifennu) ond mae'n rhaid i chi ddefnyddio'r un dull bob blwyddyn dreth
  • gall colled yr aed iddi gan fusnes sy'n gweithredu 'sail arian parod' ond cael ei chario ymlaen. Ni ellir hawlio rhyddhad i'r ochr neu ryddhad blwyddyn gynharach
  • os yw eich busnes yn tyfu yn ystod y flwyddyn dreth gallwch barhau'n rhan o'r cynllun hyd at incwm o £164,000. Os yw'n uwch na hynny, bydd yn rhaid i chi ddefnyddio cyfrifyddu traddodiadol ar gyfer eich Ffurflen Dreth Hunanasesiad am y flwyddyn dreth nesaf, heblaw bod eich incwm yn syrthio'n ôl islaw'r trothwy TAW ar ddiwedd y flwyddyn dreth honno.

I gael gwybodaeth bellach ynghylch sail arian parod, dylech fwrw golwg ar y cymorth ynghylch y cwestiwn 'A wnaethoch ddefnyddio'r sail arian parod, arian a gafwyd ac a dalwyd allan mewn gwirionedd, i gyfrifo eich incwm a'ch treuliau?'

English Content:
If you are a farmer or market gardener you may be able to claim a special relief ('averaging') to help even out fluctuating profits providing certain conditions are met. Further details about how the relief works, who can claim, and the conditions for the relief are given in Help Sheet 224 - Farmers and market gardeners (Opens new window).

If you are an author or an artist who has fluctuating profits, and:

  • you are in business, either alone or in partnership, and
  • your profits are wholly or mainly derived from literary, dramatic, musical or artistic works or designs, and
  • the works were created by you personally (or one of your partners if you are in a partnership)

you can claim to average your profits for two successive tax years. Further details about who can claim, the conditions that must be satisfied and how the claim works are given in Help Sheet 234 - Averaging for creators of literary or artistic works (Opens new window).

Select this check box if you are a farmer, market gardener or a creator of literary or artistic works and you want to claim averaging.
Welsh Content:
Os ydych yn ffermwr neu yn arddwr masnachol efallai gallwch hawlio rhyddhad arbennig (ar gyfartaledd) lle medrwch ychwanegu at ei gilydd yr elw o'r ffermio neu arddio masnachol am 2 flynedd a bod yn drethadwy ar hanner y cyfanswm am y 2 flynedd i helpu gwastatau canlyniadau anwadal os ydy amodau penodol yn cael eu cwrdd. Gellir cael gafael ar fanylion pellach am sut mae'r rhyddhad yn gweithio, pwy all hawlio, a'r amodau am y rhyddhad, yn Taflen Gymorth 224 - Farmers and market gardeners.

Os ydych yn awdur neu yn artist sydd ag elw anwadal, ac:

  • eich bod mewn busnes, nail ai ar eich pen eich hun neu mewn partneriaeth, ac
  • mae'r rhan fwyaf, neu'r cyfan, o'ch elw yn deillio o weithiau dylunio, artistig, cerddorol neu ddramatig, ac
  • mae'r gwaith wedi ei greu gennych chi yn bersonol (neu un o'ch partneriaid os ydych mewn partneriaeth

yna gallwch hawlio cyfartalu eich elw am 2 flynedd dreth yn olynol. Gallwch gael mwy o wybodaeth ar bwy all hawlio, yr amodau sydd rhaid cwrdd â nhw, a sut mae'r cais yn gweithio yn Taflen Gymorth 234 - Averaging for creators of literary or artistic works.

Dewiswch y blwch gwirio hwn os ydych yn ffermwr, garddwr masnachol neu grëwr gweithiau llenyddol neu artistig ac rydych am hawlio cyfartalu.

English Content:
Personal expenses are not allowable as a deduction so if you have included any amounts that were not wholly for the business previously enter the private (non-business) proportion here.

For example, if you let a property for only eight months in a year and you use it yourself for the other four months, you could put the full annual cost of insuring the property in 'Rent paid, repairs, insurance and costs of services provided'. If you do, you should include the four months non business cost here.

Ni chaniateir treuliau personol fel didyniad, felly os ydych wedi cynnwys unrhyw symiau nad oeddent yn gyfan gwbl ar gyfer y busnes yn flaenorol, nodwch y gyfran breifat (nad ydynt yn ymwneud â'r busnes) yma.

Er enghraifft, os ydych yn gosod eiddo am ddim ond wyth mis mewn blwyddyn ac yn ei ddefnyddio eich hunan am y pedwar mis arall, gallech roi'r gost flynyddol lawn o yswirio'r eiddo yn 'Rhent a dalwyd, atgyweiriadau, yswiriant a chostau gwasanaethau a ddarparwyd'. Os gwnewch hynny, dylech gynnwys cost y pedwar mis di-fusnes yma.

If you made a loss in any other property business that is not an FHL business you can add the loss here (up to the amount of your FHL profit for this year).

English Content:
If you pay tax on the arising basis and you've any income from outside the UK that you were unable to bring to the UK, because of exchange controls or a shortage of foreign currency in the overseas country, then you can claim that the un-remittable income should not be taxable in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017. This doesn't apply for income or a benefit arising as a result of a transfer of assets (you'll know if this applies to you).

If you're claiming that you've un-remittable income choose 'Yes - all' or 'Yes - some' from the drop-down menu and give full details of the country the income arose in, the amount in foreign currency and any foreign tax paid, in the space provided.

Income becoming remittable

If you've previously claimed that foreign income was un-remittable because it couldn't be remitted at the time and it became possible for it to be brought to the UK for the first time in the year to 5 April 2017 because, for example, exchange controls were lifted, it's treated as arising (and taxable) in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017. You must include in your return any income to which this applies even if it's not actually remitted to the UK. The amount of the income and any foreign tax charged should be converted to sterling using the exchange rate in force at the time when it became possible to remit the amount. Enter the details and amounts in the appropriate section for the type of income.
Welsh Content:
Os ydych yn talu treth ar y sail sy'n codi a bod gennych unrhyw incwm o'r tu allan i'r DU yr oeddech yn methu â'i ddwyn i'r DU oherwydd rheolaethau cyfnewid neu brinder arian cyfred tramor yn y wlad dramor, yna gallwch hawlio na ddylid trethu'r incwm na ellir ei drosglwyddo yn 2016 i 2017. Nid yw hyn yn gymwys mewn perthynas ag incwm/buddiant sy'n codi o ganlyniad i drosglwyddo asedion (byddwch yn gwybod os ydy hyn yn gymwys i chi).

Os ydych yn hawlio fod gennych incwm na ellir ei drosglwyddo, dewiswch 'Iawn - y cyfan' neu 'Iawn - rhywfaint' o'r ddewislen a rhowch fanylion llawn am y wlad lle deilliodd yr incwm, y swm yn yr arian tramor ac unrhyw dreth dramor a dalwyd, yn y blwch a ddarparwyd.

Incwm sy'n dod yn drosglwyddadwy

Os ydych yn flaenorol wedi hawlio nad oeddech yn gallu trosglwyddo incwm tramor, oherwydd nad oedd modd ei drosglwyddo ar y pryd, a daeth yn bosbil i'w drosglwyddo i'r DU am y tro cyntaf yn y flwyddyn hyd at Ebrill 2016, oherwydd bod rheolaethau cyfnewid wedi eu codi er enghraifft, caiff ei drin fel incwm sy'n codi yn 2016 i 2017. Mae'n rhaid i chi gynnwys yn eich ffurflen dreth unrhyw incwm o'r fath hyd yn oed os na chaiff ei drosglwyddo i'r DU. Dylid trosi swm yr incwm ac unrhyw dreth dramor a godir i sterling trwy ddefnyddio'r gyfradd gyfnewid mewn grym ar yr adeg pan ddaeth yn bosibl i drosglwyddo'r swm. Nodwch y manylion a'r symiau yn yr adran briodol ar gyfer y math o incwm.

English Content:
If you run your business commercially for profit you can claim relief for the loss by reducing your income for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017. If the allowable loss is more than your income, you can claim the balance of the loss against your capital gains for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017(you do this on your capital gains page), or against your income or your income and capital gains of the tax year 6 April 2015 to 5 April 2016.

The time limit for this claim is 31 January 2019.

The amount of loss that you can claim may be restricted.

Don't make this claim if you used cash basis.

For more information see Help Sheet 227 - Losses.
Welsh Content:
Os ydych yn rhedeg eich busnes yn fasnachol ar gyfer elw, gallwch hawlio rhyddhad ar gyfer y golled drwy ostwng eich incwm ar gyfer 2016 i 2017. Os yw'r golled ganiataol yn fwy na'ch incwm, gallwch hawlio gweddill y golled yn erbyn eich enillion cyfalaf ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 (rydych yn gwneud hyn ar eich tudalen enillion cyfalaf), neu yn erbyn eich incwm neu'ch incwm ac enillion cyfalaf ar gyfer 2014 i 2016.

Y dyddiad cau ar gyfer y cais hwn yw 31 Ionawr 2018.

Gellir cyfyngu ar swm y golled y gallwch ei hawlio.

Peidiwch â gwneud y cais hwn os gwnaethoch ddefnyddio sail arian parod.

Am ragor o wybodaeth, gweler Taflen Gymorth 227 - Losses.

English Content:
You may be entitled to claim blind person's allowance.

If you or your spouse or civil partner are registered blind, the local authority will enter your name(s) on its register of blind people on the production of an ophthalmologist's certificate. If you live in Scotland or Northern Ireland, local authorities aren't obliged to keep registers of blind people, although some do. But you can claim the allowance if your eyesight, or that of your spouse or civil partner, is so bad you can't do any work for which eyesight is essential. Your eye specialist will normally certify you blind before you're entitled to this allowance.

If you were registered for the first time after 5 April 2017 you may still be entitled to claim on this Tax Return if you have evidence that your sight condition existed in the year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017.

If our records show you're registered blind, and this is correct choose 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, choose 'No'.
Welsh Content:
Os ydych wedi eich cofrestru'n ddall, bydd yr awdurdod lleol yn nodi eich enw ar eu cofrestr ar gyfer pobl ddall pan fyddwch yn cyflwyno tystysgrif offthalmolegydd. Os ydych yn byw yn yr Alban neu yng Ngogledd Iwerddon, does dim rhaid i awdurdodau lleol gadw cofrestr o bobl ddall, er bod rhai yn gwneud hynny, ond gallwch hawlio'r lwfans os ydy'ch golwg mor wael fel na allwch gyflawni unrhyw waith lle mae'r golwg yn hanfodol. Fel arfer bydd eich arbenigwr llygaid yn ardystio eich bod yn ddall cyn y gallwch hawlio'r lwfans hwn.

Os cawsoch eich cofrestru am y tro cyntaf ar ôl 5 Ebrill 2016, efallai y gallwch wneud cais ar y Ffurflen Dreth hon os oes gennych dystiolaeth i ddangos bod y cyflwr eisoes yn bodoli yn y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017.

Os ydych wedi cofrestru'n ddall, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen. Fel arall, dewiswch 'Na'.

Ar sail yr hyn a gofnodwyd gennych dyma gyfanswm yr holl enillion trethadwy wrth waredu cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau a restrwyd. Dylai'r ffigur hwn gynrychioli enillion ar ôl didynnu unrhyw ryddhad, ceisiadau neu ddewisiadau ond cyn rhoi ystyriaeth i ddidynnu unrhyw golledion.

English Content:
You can claim a capital allowance called an Annual Investment Allowance (AIA), if you bought equipment (but not cars) during the year. The annual amount has increased to £500,000 from 1 April 2014 for corporation tax (CT) and 6 April 2014 for income tax (IT) to 31 December 2015, after which it will return to £25,000.

If your accounting period is different, longer or shorter than 12 months, or you have a different year end, more information can be found in Helpsheet 252 - Capital allowances and balancing charges.

Where you use an item of equipment for both business and private purposes, you must reduce the AIA claimed by the private use proportion.

Example

Gordon buys some tools for £5,000 and a van costing £10,000. As the total cost is less than Gordon's maximum AIA entitlement for the year, he might have been able to claim the full amount as AIA. However, although the tools are used only for the business, the van is used 60% for business and 40% for private motoring.

Because the van is used for private purposes, Gordon must restrict the amount of AIA that he claims on the van to reflect his private use. This means that the AIA he can claim for the van is £6,000 (£10,000 less 40% private use).

His total AIA claim is £11,000 (£5,000 for the tools plus £6,000 for the van).
Welsh Content:
Gallwch hawlio lwfans cyfalaf o'r enw Lwfans Buddsoddi Blynyddol os gwnaethoch brynu offer (ond nid ceir) yn ystod y flwyddyn. Mae'r swm blynyddol wedi codi i £500,000 o 1 Ebrill 2014 ar gyfer treth gorfforaeth, ac o 6 Ebrill 2014 ar gyfer treth incwm. Mae hyn hyd at 31 Rhagfyr 2016 ac, yn dilyn hynny, bydd yn dychwelyd i £25,000. Hefyd, cafodd y swm blynyddol ei godi dros dro o £25,000 i £250,000 am 2 flynedd o 1 Ionawr 2013.

Os yw eich cyfnod cyfrifyddu yn wahanol, yn hirach neu'n fyrrach na 12 mis, neu os yw diwedd eich blwyddyn yn wahanol, cliciwch y ddolen Taflen Gymorth 252 - Capital allowances and balancing charges i gael rhagor o wybodaeth.

Os byddwch yn defnyddio eitem o offer at ddibenion busnes yn ogystal â phreifat, mae'n rhaid i chi ostwng y Lwfans Buddsoddi Blynyddol sy'n cael ei hawlio gan y gyfran ar gyfer defnydd preifat.

Enghraifft

Mae Gwilym yn prynu offer am £5,000 a fan sy'n costio £10,000. Gan fod cyfanswm y gost yn llai nag uchafswm hawl Gwilym i'r Lwfans Buddsoddi Blynyddol am y flwyddyn, gallai fod wedi hawlio'r swm llawn fel Lwfans Buddsoddi Blynyddol. Fodd bynnag, er bod yr offer yn cael ei ddefnyddio at ddibenion busnes yn unig, defnyddir y fan 60% o'r amser at ddibenion busnes a 40% o'r amser at ddibenion preifat.

Gan fod y fan yn cael ei defnyddio at ddibenion preifat, mae'n rhaid i Gwilym gyfyngu swm y Lwfans Buddsoddi Blynyddol y mae'n ei hawlio ar gyfer y fan i adlewyrchu'r defnydd preifat. Mae hyn yn golygu mai £6,000 (£10,000 llai 40% am ddefnydd preifat) yw'r Lwfans Buddsoddi Blynyddol y gall hawlio.

Cyfanswm ei hawl i'r Lwfans Buddsoddi Blynyddol yw £11,000 (£5,000 ar gyfer y cyfarpar yn ogystal â £6,000 am y fan).

English Content:
If your property rental business income includes premiums paid for the grant of a lease and other lump sum payments, etc given in connection with the right to possession of a property, these payments are taxable on a special basis.

Broadly, for leases over 50 years we treat the entire premium as a capital receipt and therefore not part of your business income.

For leases up to 50 years we treat the premium as partly capital and partly income; only the income is included in box 22.
If you've assigned a lease without requiring payment there may still be a premium charge.
Welsh Content:
Os yw incwm eich busnes gosod eiddo yn cynnwys premiymau a delir am ganiatáu prydles a chyfandaliadau eraill etc y'u rhoddir mewn cysylltiad â'r hawl i feddiannu eiddo, mae'r taliadau hyn yn drethadwy ar sail arbennig.

Yn fras, ar gyfer prydlesi dros 50 mlynedd rydym yn trin y premiwm cyfan fel derbyniad cyfalaf ac felly ddim yn rhan o'ch incwm busnes.

Ar gyfer prydlesi hyd at 50 mlynedd rydym yn trin y premiwm fel bod yn rhannol yn gyfalaf a'n rhannol yn incwm; yr incwm sydd yn cael ei gynnwys ym mlwch 22 yn unig.

Os ydych wedi neilltuo prydles heb fod angen taliad mae'n bosib fod tâl premiwm o hyd.

English Content: You can use this worksheet to help you calculate the total amount of your income from interest from UK banks and building societies, where tax has been deducted. You may enter up to ten items.

English Content: Please complete 'Account number'.
Welsh Content: Cwblhewch 'Rhif y cyfrif'.

English Content:
Please enter the total figure of all gains on residential property (and carried interest). This figure should be the gains after any reliefs, claims or elections have been taken into account but before any losses are deducted.

You will be asked later to enter your total losses, if any.
Welsh Content:
Ar sail yr hyn a gofnodwyd gennych dyma gyfanswm yr holl enillion sy'n codi ar warediadau o eiddo ac asedion eraill (ac eithrio cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau a waredwyd) yn ogystal ag unrhyw enillion eraill. Nid yw'n cynnwys enillion priodoledig pan na ellir didynnu colledion personol ohonynt. Dangosir y rhain, ar wahân, os oes rhai.

Dylai'r ffigur a ddangosir fod yr enillion ar ôl i'r rhyddhad, hawliadau neu ddewisiadau gael eu hystyried ond cyn didynnu unrhyw golledion .

Y ffigur a ddangosir yw cyfanswm yr enillion trethadwy a gynhwyswyd ar y taflenni gwaith ar gyfer cyfrifo enillion cyfalaf a gwblhawyd gennych ar gyfer gwarediadau o eiddo ac asedion eraill (ac eithrio gwarediadau o gyfranddaliadau a gwarantau) yn ogystal ag enillion trethadwy a nodwyd gennych ar wahân.

Gofynnir i chi nodi cyfanswm eich colledion caniataol yn nes ymlaen.

Mewn rhai amgylchiadau efallai y bydd rhaid i chi dalu treth enillion cyfalaf ar enillion a wnaed gan gwmni dibreswyl neu ymddiriedolaeth nad yw wedi ei sefydlu yn y DU y mae gennych fuddiant ynddo. Efallai y bydd yn rhaid i chi hefyd dalu treth enillion cyfalaf ar enillion sy'n deillio o flynyddoedd cynharach ond a ddaeth yn drethadwy yn y flwyddyn hon.

Dylai eich cyfanswm ar gyfer enillion yma gynnwys unrhyw:

  • enillion a briodolir i chi o Ymddiriedolaeth neu gwmni y mae gennych fuddiant ynddo pan ellir gwrthbwyso colledion personol (gweler Nodiadau Crynhoi Enillion Cyfalaf (PDF) tudalen CGN 2 am fwy o wybodaeth)
  • enillion o flynyddoedd cynharach sy'n dod yn drethadwy yn y flwyddyn hon (gweler Nodiadau Crynhoi Enillion Cyfalaf (PDF) tudalen CGN 17 am fwy o wybodaeth), ac
  • enillion o ganlyniad i adfer benthyciadau a thaliadau gwarant penodol (gweler Taflen Cymorth 296 - Debts and Capital Gains Tax (PDF)

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
You cannot deduct the cost of buying, altering, building, installing or improving fixed assets. Nor can you claim depreciation or losses when such assets are disposed of. Instead you can claim capital allowances, which reduce your profits (or increase a loss).

You cannot claim capital allowances for any furnished residential lettings (please see the field level help for '10% wear and tear allowance (for furnished residential lettings only)').

English Content:
These will be exceptional circumstances.

The law allows an executor to sign a Tax return for the period from 6 April up to the date of the deceased's death.

The following persons are authorised to complete a Tax return on behalf of someone who is not mentally capable of understanding it:

  • a receiver appointed by the Court of Protection (England and Wales)
  • a curator bonis appointed by the Office of the Accountant of Court (Scotland)
  • a controller appointed by the Office of Care and Protection (Northern Ireland)
  • an attorney appointed under an Enduring Power, registered in the appropriate court
  • any person so authorised by any of the above courts

  • Rheolwr a benodir gan y Swyddfa Gofal a Nawdd (Gogledd Iwerddon)

English Content:
The number of years is the number of complete periods of 12 months since the policy or life annuity was made.

However, if a gain is reduced for periods of non-residence, the number of years should also be reduced. It's reduced by the number of complete periods of 12 months since the policy or annuity was made during which you (or, if you were not the policyholder when the gain arose, the policyholder) were not resident in the UK.

To 31 December 2010, 1 January 2011 to 31 December 2011, 1 January 2012 to 31 December 2012 and so on. The full surrender of your policy ends the final insurance year and this means that the final insurance year may be longer or shorter than 12 months. For example, if you take out your policy on 1 January 2009 and fully surrender it on 6 March 2013, the final insurance year will be the period 1 January 2012 to 6 March 2013 because 31 December 2012 and 6 March 2013 are in the same tax year.

or

Example 1
On maturity a benefit of £10,000 arises (X).
The premiums paid total is £4,000 (Z).
(In this example, both Y and A = 0, and as with the other zeros in the following examples,
are not shown in the calculations below.)
The gain is £10,000 minus £4,000 = £6,000.

The gain is reduced where:

  • the policy is not an Overseas Life Assurance Business policy
  • the policy was taken out after 17 November 1983
  • the policy is not held in trust
  • the policyholder was resident outside the UK for any part of the period since the policy was taken out

For example, if the policy matures at the end of a term of 3,000 days and the policy holder was UK resident for 2,200 days the gain entered on the Foreign pages is reduced to £6,000 x 2,200/3,000 = £4,400. £4,400 is the gain to be entered in box 43. However no reduction is due if at any time the policy has been held by:

  • a non-UK resident trustee or trustees, and the policy was taken out or enhanced after 19 March 1985
  • a non-UK resident company or other entity and the policy was taken out or enhanced after 16 March 1998

The number of complete years in box 44 is calculated as follows:

Number of complete years to maturity 8 minus number of complete years not resident in the UK (3,000 minus 2,200 = 800 days which is 2 complete years) 2 Number of years 6.

The gain will not be treated as having been taxed at the basic rate because the policy was taken out after 17 November 1983 unless a claim can be made, as explained in 'Basic rate tax treated as paid' on page 14 of this helpsheet, or unless the policy is from the UK branch of a foreign insurer.
Welsh Content:
Nifer y blynyddoedd yw nifer y cyfnodau cyflawn o 12 mis ers trefnu'r polisi neu'r blwydd-dal.

Er hynny, os caiff ennill ei ostwng oherwydd cyfnodau dibreswyl, dylid gostwng nifer y blynyddoedd yn ogystal. Caiff ei ostwng gan nifer y cyfnodau cyflawn o 12 mis ers trefnu'r polisi neu'r blwydd-dal, ac yn ystod y rhain nid oeddech (neu, os nad chi oedd deliad y polisi pan gododd yr ennill, deiliad y polisi) yn preswylio yn y DU.

Hyd at 31 Rhagfyr 2010, 1 Ionawr 2011 hyd at 31 Rhagfyr 2011, 1 Ionawr 2012 hyd at 31 Rhagfyr 2012 ac yn y blaen. Mae ildiad llwyr o'ch polisi yn dod â'r flwyddyn yswiriant terfynol i ben a golyga hyn ei fod yn bosib i'r flwyddyn yswiriant terfynol fod yn hirach neu'n fyrrach na 12 mis. Er enghraifft, os rydych yn codi'ch polisi ar 1 Ionawr 2009 a'n ei ildio'n llwyr ar 6 Mawrth 2013, y flwyddyn yswiriant terfynol bydd y cyfnod 1 Ionawr 2012 hyd at 6 Mawrth 2013 gan fod 31 Rhagfyr 2012 a 6 Mawrth 2013 yn yr un flwyddyn dreth.

neu

Enghraifft 1

Ar adeg aeddfedu mae buddiant o £10,000 yn codi (X).

Cyfanswm y premiymau a delir yw £4,000 (Z).

(Yn yr enghraifft hon, mae Y ac A = 0, ac fel gyda'r seroau eraill yn yr esiampl ganlynol,

ni chânt eu dangos yn y cyfrifiadau isod.)

Yr ennill yw £10,000 llai £4,000 = £6,000.

Caiff yr ennill ei ostwng pan:

  • nad yw'r polisi yn bolisi Busnes Aswiriant Bywyd Tramor
  • trefnwyd y polisi ar ôl 17 Tachwedd 1983
  • ni chedwir y polisi mewn ymddiriedolaeth
  • roedd deiliad y polisi wedi bod yn preswylio y tu allan i'r DU am unrhyw ran o'r cyfnod ers i'r polisi gael ei drefnu

Er enghraifft, os yw'r polisi'n aeddfedu ar ddiwedd y cyfnod o 3,000 o ddiwrnodau ac roedd deiliad y polisi yn breswylydd yn y DU am 2,200 o ddiwrnodau, fe ostyngir yr ennill a nodwyd ar y tudalennau Tramor i £6,000 x 2,200/3,000 = £4,400. £4,400 yw'r ennill i'w nodi ym mlwch 43 Fodd bynnag, nid oes unrhyw ostyngiad i'w wneud os daliwyd y polisi ar unrhyw adeg gan:

  • ymddiriedolwr neu ymddiriedolwyr nad yw/ydynt yn breswyl yn y DU, a threfnwyd neu bu wella'r polisi ar ôl 19 Mawrth 1985
  • cwmni neu unrhyw endid arall nad yw'n breswyl yn y DU , a threfnwyd neu bu wella'r polisi ar ôl 16 Mawrth 1998.

Cyfrifir y nifer o flynyddoedd cyflawn ym mlwch 44 fel a ganlyn:

Nifer o flynyddoedd cyflawn hyd at aeddfedrwydd 8 llai y nifer o flynyddoedd cyflawn heb fod yn breswyl yn y DU (3,000 llai 2,200 = 800 diwrnod sy'n 2 flynedd gyflawn) 2 Nifer o flynyddoedd 6

Ni fydd yr ennill yn cael ei drin fel petai wedi ei drethu ar y gyfradd sylfaenol gan fod y polisi wedi ei drefnu ar ôl 17 Tachwedd 1983, oni bai bod cais yn medru cael ei wneud, fel yr esbonnir yn 'Treth gyfradd sylfaenol a chaiff ei thrin fel petai wedi'i thalu' ar dudalen 14 y daflen wybodaeth hon, neu oni bai fod y polisi o gangen y DU o yswiriwr dramor.

English Content:
If your taxable gains are more than £10,600 please select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.

You must fill in the capital gains pages and attach your computations if in the tax year no losses are deducted from your chargeable gains but your total chargeable gains are more than £10,600.

In working out your total chargeable gains include any gains attributed to you (for example, because you are a settlor or beneficiary of a non-UK resident Trust, or in certain cases where you are a member of a non-UK resident company) and any gains of earlier years becoming taxable in this tax year.

For further guidance and information, please see the Capital Gains Summary Notes (PDF 207K)

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com

Rhaid i chi gwblhau tudalennau enillion cyfalaf ac atodi eich cyfrifiannau os, yn y flwyddyn dreth, didynnir colledion o'ch enillion trethadwy ond mae cyfanswm eich enillion trethadwy cyn didynnu colledion yn fwy na £10,900.

Wrth gyfrifo cyfanswm yr enillion trethadwy a briodolir i chi (er enghraifft, oherwydd eich bod yn setlwr neu'n fuddiolwr Ymddiriedolaeth nad yw wedi ei sefydlu yn y DU, neu mewn rhai achosion lle rydych yn aelod o gwmni dibreswyl yn y DU) ac mae unrhyw enillion yn dod yn drethadwy yn y flwyddyn hon.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach gweler Nodiadau Crynhoi Enillion Cyfalaf (PDF 207K)

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
Based upon your entries this is the total number of your disposals of listed shares and securities in the year to 5 April 2017.

The figure shown here is the number of capital gains computation worksheets you've completed for disposals of listed shares and securities plus the number of such disposals that you've entered separately.

Details from your computations are grouped and summarised in 3 categories. For the purpose of this grouping only, 'listed shares and securities' means any of the following:

  • shares or securities of a company listed on a recognised stock exchange throughout the period you owned them - ignoring any period when the listing or quotation was temporarily suspended - see the Capital Gains Tax area of the GOV.UK website for more details on
    • shares in a company that was a UK Open-Ended Investment Company throughout your period of ownership
    • units in a unit Trust that was an authorised unit trust throughout your period of ownership

Ar sail yr hyn a gofnodwyd gennych dyma gyfanswm nifer eich gwarediadau o gyfranddaliadau neu warantau a restrwyd yn y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017.

Y ffigur a ddangosir yma yw nifer y taflenni gwaith ar gyfer cyfrifo enillion cyfalaf a gwblhawyd gennych ar gyfer gwarediadau cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau a restrwyd yn ogystal â nifer y gwarediadau o'r fath a nodwyd gennych ar wahân.

Mae manylion eich cyfrifiannau wedi eu casglu a'u crynhoi mewn tri chategori. At ddibenion y dosbarthiad hwn yn unig, mae 'cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau a restrwyd' yn golygu unrhyw un o'r canlynol:

  • cyfranddaliadau neu warantau cwmni a restrwyd ar gyfnewidfa stoc gydnabyddedig trwy gydol y cyfnod yr oeddech yn berchen arnynt - gan anwybyddu unrhyw gyfnod pan gafodd y cwmni ei atal dros dro rhag cael ei restru neu ei ddyfynnu gweler adran Treth Enillion Cyfalaf gwefan GOV.UK am fwy o fanylion ar y canlynol

  • cyfranddaliadau mewn cwmni a oedd yn gwmni Buddsoddi Pen agored yn y DU ('OEIC') trwy gydol eich cyfnod o berchnogaeth

  • unedau mewn Ymddiriedolaeth uned a oedd yn ymddiriedolaeth uned awdurdodedig trwy gydol eich cyfnod o berchnogaeth

English Content:
Include any other expenses of the holiday property rental business you've previously not included, such as stationery, telephone, business travelling and other miscellaneous costs.

Where you're subletting the property and you (or an earlier tenant) paid a premium to your landlord when the lease was granted you may be able to claim for part of the premium paid if the payment is taxable on your landlord as income. If so, include the cost here. Any foreign tax taken off your European Economic Area (EEA) Furnished Holiday Lettings (FHL) income (unless you are claiming Foreign Tax Credit Relief for it on the ‘Foreign pages’.

If you are a non-resident FHL landlord, enter the UK tax taken off in ‘UK tax taken off total rents and other income from property’ instead.
Welsh Content:
Cynhwyswch unrhyw dreuliau eraill y busnes rhentu llety gwyliau nas cynhwyswyd eisoes, megis costau deunyddiau ysgrifennu, ffôn, teithiau busnes a chostau amrywiol eraill.

Os ydych yn isosod yr eiddo a thaloch chi (neu denant cynharach) bremiwm i'ch landlord pan ganiatawyd y brydles efallai y byddwch yn gallu hawlio rhan o'r premiwm a dalwyd os yw'ch landlord yn rhwymedig i dalu treth ar y taliad fel incwm. Os felly, dylech gynnwys y gost yn y fan hon. Treth dramor a didynnwyd oddi ar eich incwm Llety Gwyliau wedi'i Ddodrefnu (FHL) yn yr Ardal Economaidd Ewropeaidd (EEA) (oni bai eich bod yn gwneud cais am Ryddhad Credyd Treth Dramor arno ar dudalennau 'Tramor'.

Os ydych yn landlord dibreswyl llety gwyliau wedi'i ddodrefnu, rhowch dreth y DU a ddidynnwyd yn y blwch 'Treth DU a ddidynnwyd o gyfanswm y rhenti ac incwm arall drwy osod eiddo' yn lle hynny.

English Content:
Enter the total amount of all your allowable losses of the year, if any, taken from your computations including losses entered in 'Income losses of 2016 to 2017 set against gains' and any clogged losses. This total should include all your allowable losses whether or not you used the capital gains computation worksheet in their computation.

If you've disposed of a number of individual assets which are taken together for an entrepreneurs' relief claim, and any of those assets were sold at a loss, those losses should not be included in your total losses of the year. They will have been taken into account in arriving at the chargeable gain on which the claim is made and the net chargeable gain included in the totals entered in either 'Total gains' or 'Gains qualifying for Entrepreneurs' Relief' (but excluding gains deferred from before 23 June 2010).

A loss arising on a disposal of an asset which is exempt from Capital Gains Tax will not usually be an allowable loss.

The most common type of clogged loss is a loss on a disposal to a connected person. The other clogged loss is a loss transferred to you by trustees when you become absolutely entitled to settled property.

If you do have any clogged losses please keep a separate record of each unused clogged loss carried forward to later years to ensure that it's deducted correctly from future gains. You should also identify in your computations any losses which are clogged and say why they are clogged.
Welsh Content:
Nodwch gyfanswm eich holl golledion a ganiateir yn y flwyddyn, os o gwbl, a gymerwyd o'ch cyfrifiannau, gan gynnwys colledion a nodwyd yn 'Colledion incwm 2016 i 2017 wedi eu gosod yn erbyn enillion' ac unrhyw golledion rhwystredig. Dylai'r cyfanswm gynnwys eich holl golledion a ganiateir, p'un a ydych wedi defnyddio'r daflen waith cyfrifiannau enillion cyfalaf wrth eu cyfrifo ai peidio.

Os ydych wedi gwaredu ar nifer o asedau unigol sy'n cael eu cymryd gyda'i gilydd ar gyfer cais am ryddhad mentrwr, ac os gwerthir unrhyw o'r asedau hynny am golled, ni ddylid cynnwys y colledion hynny yn eich cyfanswm colledion ar gyfer y flwyddyn. Byddant wedi cael eu hystyried wrth gyrraedd yr ennill trethadwy y gwneir y cais arno a'r ennill trethadwy net a gynhwysir yn y cyfansymiau a nodir yn naill ai 'Cyfanswm enillion cyn 23 Mehefin 2010' neu 'Enillion o 23 Mehefin 2010 sy'n gymwys ar gyfer Rhyddhad Mentrwr'.

Ni fydd colled sy'n codi ar ased sydd wedi'i eithrio rhag Treth Enillion Cyfalaf fel arfer yn golled a ganiateir.

Y math mwyaf cyffredin o golled rhwystredig yw colled ar warediad i berson cysylltiedig. Y colled rhwystredig arall yw colled a drosglwyddwyd i chi gan ymddiriedolwyr pan chewch hawl yn gyfan gwbl i eiddo sefydlog.

Os oes gennych unrhyw golledion rhwystredig cadwch gofnod ar wahân o bob colled rhwystredig a gariwyd ymlaen i flynyddoedd diweddarach i sicrhau ei fod wedi ei ddidynnu'n gywir o enillion yn y dyfodol. Dylech hefyd nodi yn eich cyfrifiannau unrhyw golledion sydd yn rhwystredig a dywedwch pam eu bod yn rhwystredig.

English Content:
If you are registered blind, the local authority will enter your name on their register of blind people on the production of an ophthalmologist's certificate. If you live in Scotland or Northern Ireland, local authorities are not obliged to keep registers of blind people, although some do, but you can claim the allowance if your eyesight is so bad you cannot do any work for which eyesight is essential. Your eye specialist will normally certify you blind before you are entitled to this allowance.

If you were registered for the first time after 5 April 2016 you may still be entitled to claim on this Tax Return if you have evidence that your sight condition existed in the year to 5 April 2016.

If you are registered blind, please select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.
Welsh Content:
Efallai y gallwch hawlio lwfans person dall.

Os ydych chi neu eich priod neu bartner sifil wedi eich cofrestru'n ddall, bydd yr awdurdod lleol yn nodi eich enw(au) ar eu cofrestr ar gyfer pobl ddall pan fyddwch yn cyflwyno tystysgrif gan offthalmolegydd.

Os ydych yn byw yn Yr Alban neu yng Ngogledd Iwerddon, does dim rhaid i awdurdodau lleol gadw cofrestr o bobl ddall, er bod rhai yn gwneud hynny. Serch hynny, gallwch hawlio'r lwfans os yw eich golwg mor wael fel na allwch gyflawni gwaith y mae golwg yn hanfodol ar ei gyfer.

Fel arfer bydd eich arbenigwr llygaid yn ardystio eich bod yn ddall cyn y gallwch hawlio'r lwfans hwn.

Os cawsoch eich cofrestru am y tro cyntaf ar ôôl 5 Ebrill 2017, efallai y gallwch wneud cais ar y ffurflen dreth hon os oes gennych dystiolaeth i ddangos bod y cyflwr eisoes yn bodoli yn y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017.

Os yw ein cofnodion yn dangos eich bod wedi'ch cofrestru'n ddall, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen. Fel arall, dewiswch 'Na'.

English Content: If you are chargeable to non-resident Capital Gains Tax (NRCGT) for the disposal of a UK residential property or properties during 2016-17, enter the total gain chargeable to NRCGT after losses, or loss
Welsh Content: Ennill neu golled sy'n ymwneud a Threth Enillion Cyfalaf ar gyfer Person nad yw'n Breswyl (NRCGT)

English Content:
Include:

  • any rents you pay under a lease of a property that you let as a furnished holiday letting
  • business rates
  • Council Tax
  • water rates
  • ground rents
  • insurance for both the property and its contents
  • costs of services you provide such as gardening, porterage, cleaning, communal hot water etc

Repairs include expenses that prevent the property from deteriorating such as:

  • exterior and interior painting
  • damp treatment
  • stone cleaning
  • roof repairs
  • furniture repairs
  • repairs to any kind of machinery supplied with the property

Renewals

You can include the costs of renewing small items such as cutlery, but if you do, you can't claim the original costs. If you received any money for the items being replaced you should take that amount off the replacement costs. Don't claim for any element of improvement compared with the original item.

The renewals allowance for the cost of replacing furniture or furnishings is no longer available. For more information read PIM 3230 in the Property Income Manual.

Dylech gynnwys:

  • unrhyw renti a dalwch dan brydles eiddo rydych yn ei osod fel llety gwyliau wedi'i ddodrefnu
  • trethi busnes
  • Treth Gyngor
  • trethi dŵr
  • rhenti tir
  • yswiriant ar gyfer yr eiddo yn ogystal â'i gynnwys
  • costau gwasanaethau a ddarparwch megis garddio, cludo, glanhau, dŵr poeth cymunedol ac ati.

Mae atgyweiriadau yn cynnwys treuliau sy'n atal yr eiddo rhag dirywio, er enghraifft:

  • paentio allanol a mewnol
  • trin lleithder
  • glanhau cerrig
  • atgyweirio'r to
  • atgyweirio dodrefn
  • atgyweirio unrhyw fath o beirianwaith a ddarparwyd gyda'r eiddo

Adnewyddiadau

Gallwch gynnwys y gost o adnewyddu eitemau bach hefyd fel cyllyll a ffyrc, ond os gwnewch hynny, ni allwch hawlio'r costau gwreiddiol. Os cawsoch unrhyw arian am yr eitemau a gafodd eu hamnewid, dylech dynnu'r swm hwnnw o'r gostau amnewid yr eitemau. Peidiwch â hawlio costau ar gyfer unrhyw elfen o welliant o'i gymharu â'r eitem wreiddiol.

Nid yw'r lwfans adnewyddu ar gyfer y gost o amnewid dodrefn neu ddodrefnu bellach ar gael. Am ragor o wybodaeth darllenwch PIM 3230 yn y 'Llawlyfr Incwm Eiddo.
