English Content:
If your overseas income and gains have had foreign tax deducted it may be possible to obtain relief from double taxation. Foreign tax credit relief is normally the best way to obtain such relief, but if you do not want to or cannot claim it, you can deduct the foreign tax when calculating the amount of income and gains chargeable to UK tax. You cannot do both.

Foreign tax credit relief is not always available or available on the full amount of foreign tax you have paid. Relief is subject to the following rules:

  • you must be a UK resident
  • the income must arise in the foreign country and be properly chargeable under the foreign country's law
  • the amount of foreign tax credit relief must not exceed the UK tax on the same item of income or gains
  • where a Double Taxation Agreement exists between the UK and the other country the amount of foreign tax available for the relief is restricted to the minimum foreign tax payable under the terms of the Agreement. To check if the UK has entered into a double taxation agreement with the foreign territory you should follow the link DT Digest
  • if no Double Taxation Agreement exists, or the Agreement does not cover that particular foreign tax, relief is only available if the tax corresponds to UK Income Tax or Capital Gains Tax.

If a Double Taxation Agreement is in force between the UK and the country or territory where your foreign income has been taxed, you must check what that agreement says and how its terms apply to you.

You cannot claim Foreign Tax Relief unless the Double Taxation Agreement gives the other country or territory the right to tax the income. Instead you must claim relief from the tax in that other country or territory.

Double Taxation Agreements

A Double Taxation Agreement is an arrangement between two territories which is designed to avoid the situation where same item of income or gains might be taxable in both places - for example, in both the UK and in the territory where the income or gain arose.

Tax deducted from dividends of the countries listed below is not eligible for foreign tax credit relief.

Antigua & Barbuda, Barbados, Belize, Brunei, Cyprus, Grenada, Guernsey, Isle of Man, Jamaica, Jersey, Kiribati, Luxembourg, Malaysia, Malawi, Malta, Montserrat, St Kitts & Nevis, Sierra Leone, Soloman Islands, Tuvalu.

Although the tax is not available for credit relief, it can be deducted in calculating the amount of the dividend chargeable to UK tax. For more information follow the link Get your tax right if you retire abroad or return to the UK.
Welsh Content:
Os yw treth dramor wedi ei didynnu o'ch incwm ac enillion o dramor gall fod yn bosibl i gael rhyddhad oddi wrth drethiant dwbl. Rhyddhad credyd treth dramor yw fel arfer y ffordd gorau i gael y fath rhyddhad, ond os nad ydych eisiau ei hawlio, gallwch ddidynnu'r dreth dramor wrth gyfrifo swm yr incwm ac enillion sy'n agored i dreth y DU. Ni allwch wneud y ddau.

Nid yw rhyddhad credyd treth dramor ar gael bob tro, neu efallai na fydd ar gael ar y swm llawn o dreth dramor rydych wedi'i thalu. Mae rhyddhad yn amodol ar y rheolau canlynol:

  • mae'n rhaid eich bod yn preswylio yn y DU
  • mae'n rhaid i'r incwm godi yn y wlad dramor a bod yn briodol i'w drethu o dan gyfraith y wlad dramor
  • ni ddylai swm y rhyddhad credyd treth dramor fod yn uwch na threth y DU ar yr un eitem, o incwm neu enillion
  • pan fod Cytundeb Trethiant Dwbl yn bodoli rhwng y DU a'r wlad arall, mae swm y dreth dramor sydd ar gael ar gyfer y rhyddhad yn cael ei gyfyngu i isafswm y dreth dramor sy'n daladwy o dan amodau'r Cytundeb - i wirio p'un a yw'r DU wedi arwyddo Cytundeb Trethiant Dwbl gyda'r diriogaeth tramor gweler DT Digest
  • Os nad oes Cytundeb Trethiant Dwbl yn bodoli, neu os nad yw'r Cytundeb yn cwmpasu'r dreth dramor benodol honno, mae rhyddhad dim ond ar gael os yw'r dreth yn cyfateb â Threth Incwm neu Dreth Enillion Cyfalaf y DU

Os oes Cytundeb Trethiant Dwbl mewn grym rhwng y DU a'r wlad neu'r diriogaeth lle mae eich incwm tramor wedi'i drethu, mae'n rhaid i chi wirio beth mae'r cytundeb yn ei ddweud a sut mae ei dermau'n berthnasol i chi.

Cytundebau Trethiant Dwbl

Cytundeb Trethiant Dwbl yw cytundeb rhwng dwy diriogaeth sydd wedi'i gynllunio er mwyn osgoi'r sefyllfa pan fo'r un eitem o incwm neu enillion yn gallu bod yn drethadwy yn y ddau le, yn y DU a'r diriogaeth lle gododd yr incwm neu'r ennill.

Nid yw'r dreth a didynnwyd o ddifidendau o'r gwledydd a rhestrir isod yn gymwys ar gyfer rhyddhad teth credyd.

Antigua & Barbuda, Barbados, Belize, Brunei, Cyprus, Grenada, Guernsey, Isle of Man, Jamacia, Jersey, Kiribati, Luxenbourg, Malaysia, Malawi, Malta, Montserrst, St Kitts & Nevis, Sierra Leone, Soloman Islands, Tuvalu.

Er nad yw rhyddhad credyd ar gael ar gyfer y dreth, gellir ei didynnu wrth gyfrifo swm y difidend sy'n agored i dreth y DU. Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach ewch i'r Get your tax right if you retire abroad or return to the UK

English Content:
If you're a barrister (advocate in Scotland) and previously used the 'cash' or 'conventional' basis to work out your profits you (or your tax adviser) will have worked out the necessary adjustment to bring you onto 'Generally Accepted Accounting Practice' (GAAP) (also known as 'true and fair' basis). Include the instalment taxable in the year to 5 April 2017 in this field.

If you were in business before the start of the accounting period which covers 22 June 2005, and you receive income from contracts for professional or other services and which span your accounting date, you'll have had to change the way you work out your turnover in your accounts. You'll have worked out the necessary adjustment which arises on a change from the old to the new method. Include the instalment taxable in the year to 5 April 2017 in this field.

Os ydych yn fargyfreithiwr (adfocad yn yr Alban) ac wedi defnyddio'r sail 'arian parod' neu 'gonfensiynol' yn flaenorol i gyfrifo eich elw byddwch (neu bydd eich cynghorydd treth) wedi cyfrifo'r addasiad angenrheidiol i ddod a chi i 'Arfer Cyfrifyddu a dderbynnir yn Gyffredinol' (a elwir hefyd yn sail 'gwir a theg'). Dylech gynnwys yn y blwch hwn hefyd y rhandaliad sy'n drethadwy yn y flwyddyn i 5 Ebrill 2017.

Os oeddech mewn busnes cyn dechrau'r cyfnod cyfrifyddu sy'n cynnwys 22 Mehefin 2005, ac rydych yn derbyn incwm o gytundebau am wasanaethau proffesiynol neu wasanaethau eraill ac sy'n pontio dros eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu, byddwch wedi gorfod newid y ffordd rydych yn cyfrifo'ch trosiant yn eich cyfrifon. Byddwch wedi cyfrifo'r addasiad angenrheidiol sy'n codi wrth symud o'r hen ddull i'r dull newydd. Dylech gynnwys yn y blwch hwn hefyd y rhandaliad sy'n drethadwy yn y flwyddyn i 5 Ebrill 2016.

English Content:
If the adjustment is negative, put a minus sign (-) before the figure.

If the partnership did not carry on a trade or profession in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017, that is, it carried on a pure investment business, the basis period is the tax year from 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017. No adjustments for basis period will be required.

For full details of the rules for working out your basis period and any adjustments for basis period please see Help Sheet 222 - How to calculate your taxable profits.

English Content:
Generally, you can claim the running costs of your letting business but you can't claim, as property expenses, any capital costs such as expenses relating to the purchase or sale of, or improvements, additions and alterations to, land or property or the costs of purchasing machinery, furnishings or furniture. But you may be able to claim capital allowances or a renewals deduction.

Include all your allowable property expenses. Allowable expenses may include:

  • rents, rates, insurance, ground rents etc
  • property repairs and maintenance
  • interest and other finance charges
  • legal, management and other professional fees
  • costs of services provided, including wages
  • other property expenses

You can't deduct:

  • for more than one year, expenses incurred in connection with the first letting or subletting of a property. These include legal expenses such as the cost of drawing up a lease, agents' and surveyors' fees and commission
  • any costs of agreeing and paying a premium on renewal of a lease
  • fees for planning permission or registration of title on property purchase
  • renewals - renewals allowance fo the cost of replacing furniture or furnishings is no longer available

Don't include the cost of buying or selling, improving or altering, land or property, equipment, furnishings or furniture. These are capital allowances.

For further information can be found in UK property notes and Property Income Manual.
Welsh Content:
Yn gyffredinol, gallwch hawlio costau cynnal eich busnes gosod, ond na allwch hawlio unrhyw gostau cyfalaf fel treuliau'r eiddo, megis treuliau sy'n gysylltiedig â phrynu neu werthu tir neu eiddo, neu welliannau, ychwanegiadau a newidiadau iddynt, neu gostau prynu peiriannau, deunyddiau neu gelfi. Fodd bynnag, efallai y gallech hawlio lwfansau cyfalaf neu ddidyniad am adnewyddu.

Dylech gynnwys eich holl dreuliau eiddo a ganiateir. Gallai treuliau a ganiateir gynnwys:

  • rhenti, trethi'r cyngor, yswiriant, rhent tir ac ati
  • atgyweirio a chynnal eiddo
  • llog a thaliadau ariannol eraill
  • ffioedd cyfreithiol, rheoli a rhai proffesiynol eraill
  • costau gwasanaethau a ddarperir, gan gynnwys cyflogau
  • treuliau eraill yr eiddo

Ni allwch ddidynnu:

  • treuliau a dalwyd mewn perthynas â gosod neu isosod eiddo am y tro cyntaf am fwy na blwyddyn. Mae'r rhain yn cynnwys treuliau cyfreithiol megis llunio prydlesi, ffioedd a chomisiynau asiantau a thirfesurwyr
  • unrhyw gostau cytuno a thalu premiwm wrth adnewyddu prydles
  • ffioedd am ganiatâd cynllunio neu gofrestru teitl wrth brynu eiddo
  • adnewyddu – nid yw'r lwfans adnewyddu ar gyfer costau ailosod deunyddiau neu gelfi ar gael mwyach

Peidiwch â chynnwys costau prynu, gwerthu, gwella neu newid tir, eiddo, offer, deunyddiau neu gelfi. Lwfansau cyfalaf yw'r rhain.

I gael rhagor o wybodaeth, ewch i'r Nodiadau ar Eiddo yn y DU a darllen the Property Income Manual.

English Content:
You can only set-off the loss displayed in 'Adjusted loss for the year' against total income if:

  • the loss is due to certain agricultural expenses and your property rental business includes land used for agricultural purpose
  • the loss arose as a result of claims to capital allowances (and your capital allowances exceed your balancing charges)

The loss that may be set-off is limited to the lowest of:

  • net capital allowances
  • adjusted loss for the year
  • the amount of your other income

Enter the amount you wish to set-off together with the amount of any similar loss brought forward from last year.
The amount of tax relief you claim against your income each year is limited to the greater of £50,000 or 25% of your adjusted total income.
Welsh Content:
Dim ond y golled a ddangosir yn 'Colled wedi'i addasu ar gyfer y flwyddyn' y gallwch ei gwrthbwyso yn erbyn cyfanswm yr incwm os:

  • yw'r golled o ganlyniad i dreuliau amaethyddol penodol, a bod eich busnes rhentu eiddo yn cynnwys tir a ddefnyddir at ddibenion amaethyddol
  • yw'r golled wedi codi o ganlyniad i gais am lwfansau cyfalaf (ac mae swm eich lwfansau cyfalaf yn uwch na swm eich taliadau mantoli)

Mae'r golled y gellir ei gwrthbwyso yn cael ei chyfyngu i'r isaf o:

  • lwfansau cyfalaf net
  • colled wedi'i haddasu ar gyfer y flwyddyn
  • swm eich incwm arall

Nodwch y swm yr ydych am ei wrthbwyso ynghyd â swm colled tebyg a ddygwyd ymlaen o llynedd.
Mae swm y rhyddhad treth yr ydych yn ei hawlio yn erbyn eich incwm bob blwyddyn wedi ei gyfyngu i'r uchaf o £50,000 neu 25% o gyfanswm eich incwm wedi'i addasu.

English Content:
If your 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 tax code was reduced during the year because of a change in circumstances, you may not have paid enough tax.

Look at your 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 PAYE Coding Notice. If it includes the message 'our estimate of the underpayment for the earlier part of the year is £xxxxx' then this amount is automatically shown on your return.

If this section does not apply to you and there is a zero present, select 'Yes', only select 'no' if the amount shown above is not correct to proceed.

Os yw'n cynnwys y neges 'ein hamcangyfrif o'r dandaliad ar gyfer rhan gynharach y flwyddyn yw £xxxx' yna dangosir y swm ar eich ffurflen yn awtomatig.

Nodwch '0' os nad oes cofnod wedi ei gynnwys.

English Content: When you dispose of (for example, sell) an item that you have claimed capital allowances on, deduct the sale proceeds (up to the cost of the item) from the pool value brought forward or cost. Similarly, if you no longer use an item for business purposes, deduct its current market value (up to original cost) from the pool value. If the sale proceeds or the value of the item is more than the pool value or cost, the difference (a 'balancing charge') is taxable. Include any balancing charges here (do not include any that relate to Business Premises Renovation Allowance).
Welsh Content: Pan fyddwch yn gwaredu ar (er enghraifft, gwerthu) eitem rydych wedi hawlio lwfansau cyfalaf yn ei chylch, didynnwch dderbyniadau'r gwerthiant (hyd at gost yr eitem) o werth neu gost y gronfa a ddygwyd ymlaen. Yn yr un modd, os nad ydych bellach yn defnyddio eitem at ddibenion busnes, didynnwch ei gwerth marchnadol cyfredol (hyd at y gost wreiddiol) o werth y gronfa. Os bydd derbyniadau'r gwerthiant neu werth yr eitem yn fwy na werth neu gost y gronfa, mae'r gwahaniaeth 'tâl mantoli' yn agored i dreth. Dylech gynnwys unrhyw daliadau mantoli (ac eithrio rhai BPRA) yma.

English Content:
Car, van and travel expenses
Drawings and items you take for private use from the business
Purchase of new equipment
Telephone (mobile & landline)
Rent, rates, power and insurance costs
Training costs
Clothing costs
Accountancy/legal & professional fees

Car, van and travel expenses

For car, van and travel expenses you can claim:

  • car/van insurance
  • repairs & servicing
  • fuel
  • parking
  • hire charges
  • vehicle license fees & breakdown membership
  • train bus, air and taxi fares

Alternatively you can claim a mileage allowance to cover these costs. For overnight business trips you can claim hotel room costs and evening meals.

You can claim a mileage allowance for journeys wholly and exclusively for business purposes. If a vehicle is used for both business and private purposes you can claim the business percentage only and you should keep mileage records in support of your claim

But you can't claim for:

  • non-business motoring costs (private use proportions)
  • fines
  • costs of buying vehicles
  • travel costs between home and business
  • other meals

Return to top

Drawings and items you take for private use from the business

For drawings and items you take for private use from the business you can claim for wages paid to employees

But you can't claim for:

  • any deduction for your own wages
  • or any other money taken from your business for private use or purchases

Keep a record of any money you take for your own personal use from your:

  • business cash
  • business bank account
  • personal bank account if you don't have a separate business account

Return to top

Purchase of new equipment

For purchases of new equipment you can claim tax relief for capital expenditure called an Annual Investment Allowance (AIA), if you bought equipment (but not cars) during the year. The annual amount has increased to £500,000 from 1 April 2014 for corporation tax (CT) and 6 April 2014 for income tax (IT) to 31 December 2015, after which it will return to £25,000. The annual amount was also temporarily increased from £25,000 to £250,000 for 2 years from 1 January 2013.

But you can't claim AIA for cars

Cars are eligible for capital allowances, but capital allowances can be complex. If you are making a significant purchase consider taking advice over what costs are eligible for tax relief.

Return to top

Telephone (mobile & landline)

For telephone (mobile & landline) you can claim for:

  • business calls
  • the business proportion of line rental
  • the business proportion of monthly contracts in the case of mobile phone

But you can't claim for private calls

You can only claim the cost of the business calls, so if you use the same phone for business & private calls, you should use itemised bills to work out the business use

Return to top

Rent, rates, power and insurance costs

For rent, rates, power and insurance costs you can claim for:

  • rent for business premises
  • business & water rates
  • light
  • heat
  • power
  • property insurance
  • security
  • use of home as office (business proportion only)

But you can't claim for:

  • costs of any non-business part of premises
  • costs of buying business premises

If you work from home you should keep details of the time spent, how much electricity, gas for example has been used and the area of your home used for business. We can accept reasonable estimates where it is minor use

Return to top

Training costs you can claim for:

You can claim for the cost of training, if the purpose of the training is to update business skills or expertise.

But you can't claim for costs if the training is for a business related new skill or qualification.

Training undertaken for academic qualifications such as GCSE, A level and PhD is not allowable.

Return to top

Clothing costs you can claim for:

  • protective overalls
  • protective headgear
  • protective gloves
  • other specialised clothing

But you can't claim for the cost of ordinary everyday clothing, even if purchased for work.

Any expenditure you claim has to be made wholly and exclusively for your business.

Return to top

Accountancy/legal & professional fees you can claim for:

  • accountant
  • solicitors
  • surveyors
  • architects
  • other professional indemnity insurance premiums
  • Trade Body membership provided it is related to your business

But you can't claim for:

  • legal costs of buying property and large items of equipment
  • costs of settling tax disputes
  • fines for breaking the law
Welsh Content:
Gwariant busnes a'r rhyddhad treth sydd ar gael

Treuliau car, fan a theithio
Tyniadau ac eitemau yr ydych yn cymryd o'r busnes at ddibenion preifat 
Prynu cyfarpar newydd
Ffôn (symudol a llinell dir)
Costau rhent, cyfraddau, pŵer ac yswiriant
Costau hyfforddi
Costau dillad 
Ffioedd cyfrifeg/cyfreithiol a phroffesiynol

Treuliau car, fan a theithio

Ar gyfer treuliau car, fan a theithio gallwch hawlio:

  • yswiriant car/fan
  • cynnal a chadw
  • tanwydd
  • parcio
  • costau hurio
  • ffioedd trwyddedu cerbyd ac aelodaeth mudiad moduro
  • prisiau trên, bws, awyren a thacsi

Neu gallwch hawlio lwfans milltiredd er mwyn cwmpasu'r costau hyn. Gallwch hawlio costau ystafell mewn gwesty a phrydau hwyr ar gyfer tripiau busnes dros nos.

Gallwch hawlio cais am lwfans milltiredd ar gyfer siwrneiau sy'n gyfan gwbl a'n unig at ddibenion busnes. Os defnyddir cerbyd at ddibenion busnes yn ogystal â rhai personol gallwch hawlio'r canran busnes yn unig a dylech gadw cofnodion milltiredd i ategu eich cais.

Ond ni allwch hawlio:

  • costau moduro nad ydynt yn rhai busnes (cyfrannau ddefnydd preifat)
  • dirwyon
  • costau prynu cerbydau
  • costau teithio rhwng cartref a busnes
  • prydau eraill

Return to top

Tyniadau ac eitemau rydych yn cymryd o'r busnes at ddibenion preifat

Ar gyfer tyniadau ac eitemau rydych yn eu cymryd o'r busnes at ddibenion preifat gallwch hawlio ar gyfer cyflogau a delir i gyflogeion.

Ond ni allwch hawlio ar gyfer:

  • didyniadau ar gyfer eich cyflog eich hun
  • arian arall a gymerwyd o'ch busnes at ddibenion neu bryniadau preifat

Cadwch gofnod o arian rydych yn cymryd ar gyfer eich defnydd personol o:

  • arian parod y busnes
  • cyfrif banc y busnes
  • cyfrif banc personol os nad oes gennych gyfrif busnes ar wahân

Return to top

Prynu cyfarpar newydd

Ar gyfer prynu cyfarpar newydd gallwch hawlio rhyddhad treth ar gyfer gwariant cyfalaf o'r enw Lwfans Buddsoddi Blynyddol (LBB), os gwnaethoch brynu offer (ond nid ceir) yn ystod y flwyddyn. Mae'r swm blynyddol wedi codi i £500,000 o 1 Ebrill 2014 ar gyfer Treth Gorfforaeth (CT) a 6 Ebrill 2014 ar gyfer Treth Incwm, i 31 Rhagfyr 2016. Ar ôl y dyddiad hwnnw, bydd yn dychwelyd i £25,000. Yn ogystal, cafodd y swm blynyddol ei gynyddu dros dro o £25,000 i £250,000 am 2 flynedd o 1 Ionawr 2013.

Ond ni allwch hawlio LBB ar gyfer ceir

Mae ceir yn gymwys ar gyfer Lwfansau Cyfalaf, ond mae Lwfansau Cyfalaf yn gallu bod yn gymleth. Os ydych yn gwneud pryniant sylweddol dylech ystyried cymryd cyngor ynglŷn â pha gostau sy'n gymwys ar gyfer rhyddhad treth.

Return to top

Ffôn (symudol a llinell dir)

Ar gyfer ffôn (symudol a llinell dir) gallwch hawlio:

  • galwadau busnes
  • cyfran y busnes o rent y llinell ffôn
  • cyfran y busnes o gytundebau misol yn achos ffôn symudol

Ond ni allwch hawlio ar gyfer galwadau preifat

Gallwch ond hawlio cost y galwadau busnes, felly os ydych yn defnyddio'r un ffôn ar gyfer galwadau busnes a preifat, dylech ddefnyddio biliau eitemedig er mwyn cyfrifo'r defnydd busnes.

Return to top

Costau rhent, trethi, pŵer ac yswiriant.

Ar gyfer costau rhent, trethi, pŵer ac yswiriant gallwch hawlio:

  • rhent ar gyfer safle busnes
  • trethi busnes a dŵr
  • golau
  • gwres
  • pŵer
  • yswiriant eiddo
  • diogelwch
  • defnyddio'r cartref fel swyddfa (cyfran fusnes yn unig)

Ond ni allwch hawlio:

  • costau unrhyw ran o'r safle sydd ddim yn ymwneud â'r busnes
  • costau prynu safle busnes

Os ydych yn gweithio o gartref dylech gadw manylion o'r amser a dreuliwyd, faint o drydan, nwy er enghraifft sydd wedi ei defnyddio a faint o'ch cartref a ddefnyddir ar gyfer busnes. Gallwn dderbyn amcangyfrif rhesymol pan fo'n ddefnydd mân.

Return to top

Costau hyfforddi y gallwch hawlio:

Gallwch hawlio am y gost o hyfforddi, os mai pwrpas yr hyfforddi yw diweddaru sgiliau busnes neu arbenigedd.

Ond ni allwch hawlio'r costau os yw'r hyfforddiant ar gyfer sgil neu gymhwyster newydd sy'n ymwneud â'r busnes.

Ni chaniateir hyfforddiant yr ymgymerir ag ef ar gyfer cymhwyster academaidd megis TGAU, lefel A a PhD.

Return to top

Costau dillad y gallwch hawlio amdanynt:

  • oferôls gwarchod
  • penwisgoedd gwarchod
  • menig gwarchod
  • dillad arbenigol arall

Ond ni allwch hawlio'r gost ar gyfer dillad cyffredin pob dydd, hyd yn oed cânt eu prynu ar gyfer gwaith.

Rhaid i unrhyw wariant rydych yn ei hawlio fod yn gyfan gwbl ac yn unig ar gyfer eich busnes.

Return to top

Ffioedd cyfrifeg/cyfreithiol a proffesiynol y gallwch eu hawlio:

  • cyfrifwyr
  • cyfreithwyr
  • syrfewyr
  • penseiri
  • premiymau yswiriant indemniad proffesiynol eraill
  • aelodaeth Corff Masnachol cyn belled â'i fod yn perthyn i'ch busnes

Ond ni allwch hawlio:

  • costau cyfreithiol o brynu eiddo ac eitemau mawr o gyfarpar
  • costau datrys anghydfod treth
  • dirwyon am dorri'r gyfraith

English Content:
If you're a subcontractor in the construction industry enter the total deductions made by your contractors from payments you received in the year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017. The deductions are shown on the payment and deduction statements that your contractors should have given you. Do not send these with your tax return. Even if you have already claimed a repayment of your Construction Industry Scheme (CIS) deductions, you should include the total deductions during the year here.

(Enter in the field 'Income Tax refunded or set-off' in the 'Tax refunded or set-off' section of the return, the amount of repayment received or set off against other tax due.)

If you make an entry here, don't forget to include in your 'turnover' your gross receipts from all contractors (that is, the full amount of the payments you received before taking off the CIS deductions).
Welsh Content:
Os ydych yn isgontractiwr yn y diwydiant adeiladu, nodwch gyfanswm y didyniadau a wnaed gan eich contractwyr o'r taliadau a gawsoch yn y flwyddyn 6 Ebrill 2016 i 5 Ebrill 2017 Dangosir y didyniadau ar y cyfriflenni taliadau a didyniadau y dylai eich contractwyr wedi eu rhoi i chi. Peidiwch anfon y rhain gyda'ch ffurflen dreth. Hyd yn oed os ydych eisoes wedi hawlio ad-daliad o ddidyniadau Cynllun y Diwydiant Adeiladu (CIS) dylech gynnwys cyfanswm y didyniadau yn ystod y flwyddyn hon.

(Nodwch yn y blwch 'Treth Incwm a ad-dalwyd neu a wrthbwyswyd' yn adran 'Treth a ad-dalwyd neu a wrthbwyswyd' y ffurflen dreth, swm yr ad-daliad a dderbyniwyd neu a wrthbwyswyd yn erbyn treth arall sy'n ddyledus)

Os ydych yn gwneud cofnod yma, peidiwch ag anghofio i gynnwys yn eich 'trosiant' eich derbynebau gros oddi wrth bob contractwr (hynny yw, swm llawn y taliadau y derbyniwyd gennych cyn tynnu’r didyniadau CIS).

English Content:
There is a list of figures, that you can print, that will help you complete the foreign tax credit relief working sheet.

You can also print the foreign tax credit relief working sheet, and you will need to print 1 copy for every item of foreign income, that has had foreign tax deducted, for which you want to claim relief.

Read the instructions on the working sheet before you begin.

Use the figures provided instead of the tax calculation 'A' numbers on the 1st foreign tax credit relief working sheet.

For example, on the working sheet box TC1 (Total non-savings income) has the instruction 'from tax calculation box A27'. The value of box A27 appears on the list as 'Total non-savings income (use in Box TC1)'. Use this figure in box TC1. If you need to complete a 2nd foreign tax credit relief working sheet, or more, you will be directed to take some figures from the previous tax credit relief working sheet. (e.g. Box TC1 will come from box TC11 of the last working sheet you completed.) Other boxes continue to use figures from the tax calculation. (e.g. Box TC34 is always from A109.) Continue to use the figures from the list for box TC34 and other boxes that don't use figures from the previous working sheet.

Once you have completed a foreign tax credit relief working sheet for every item of foreign tax claimed add together the foreign tax credit relief you have calculated (box TC123) on each item and enter the result on the next foreign tax credit relief screen.
Welsh Content:
Mae rhestr o ffigurau y gallwch eu hargraffu a fydd yn eich cynorthwyo i gwblhau'r daflen waith ar gyfer rhyddhad credyd treth dramor.

Gallwch argraffu'r daflen waith ar gyfer rhyddhad credyd treth dramor hefyd, a bydd angen argraffu un copi ar gyfer pob eitem o incwm tramor pan ddidynnwyd treth dramor ac rydych am wneud cais am ryddhad.

Darllenwch y cyfarwyddiadau ar y daflen waith cyn dechrau.

Defnyddiwch y ffigurau a ddarparwyd ar gyfer y cyfrifiad treth yn lle'r rhifau cyfrifo 'A' ar y daflen waith gyntaf ar gyfer rhyddhad credyd treth dramor.

Er enghraifft, mae blwch TC1 (Cyfanswm yr incwm nad yw'n deillio o gynilion) ar y daflen waith yn cynnwys y cyfarwyddyd 'o flwch cyfrifo treth A27'. Mae'r ffigur ym mlwch A27 yn ymddangos ar y rhestr fel 'Cyfanswm yr incwm nad yw'n deillio o gynilion (defnyddiwch ym mlwch TC1)'. Defnyddiwch y ffigur hwn ym mlwch TC1.

Os bydd angen i chi gwblhau 2nd daflen waith neu ragor ar gyfer rhyddhad credyd treth dramor, rhoddir cyfarwyddyd i chi gymryd rhai ffigurau o'r daflen waith flaenorol ar gyfer rhyddhad credyd treth dramor (e.e. bydd Blwch TC1 yn dod o flwch TC11 o'r daflen waith diwethaf i chi ei chwblhau). Bydd blychau eraill yn parhau i ddefnyddio ffigurau o'r cyfrifiad treth. (e.e. bydd Blwch 34 bob amser yn dod o flwch A109). Dylech barhau i ddefnyddio ffigurau o'r rhestr ar gyfer blwch TC34 a blychau eraill nad ydynt yn defnyddio ffigurau o'r daflen waith blaenorol.

Unwaith y byddwch wedi cwblhau taflen waith ar gyfer rhyddhad credyd treth dramor ar gyfer pob eitem o dreth dramor a hawliwyd, dylech ychwanegu'r rhyddhad credyd treth dramor rydych wedi ei gyfrifo (blwch TC123) ar bob eitem at ei gilydd, a nodi'r canlyniad ar y sgrin nesaf ar gyfer rhyddhad credyd treth dramor.

English Content:
This field will not apply to many people. The amount to enter is the amount of the adjustment needed to increase or reduce the amount of Capital Gains Tax HM Revenue and Customs will calculate, based on your entries on the capital gains summary pages.

You must explain in your computations how any adjustment has been calculated. If your adjustment reduces the amount of Capital Gains Tax payable, please put a minus sign in the box provided before the adjustment figure.

You may need to enter a net adjustment figure here if:

  • your capital gains has Foreign Tax Credit Relief
  • your capital gain includes liability for non-resident or dual resident trusts
  • you've claimed the remittance basis in an earlier tax year and made an election for foreign losses
  • you've clogged losses
  • you're chargeable to Income Tax on disguised interest and wish to avoid double taxation
  • your gain is chargeable to Non-resident Capital Gains Tax
  • if you made a payment to Non-resident Capital Gains Tax at the time of notification, enter the amount paid minus any adjustment to capital gains tax. Then enter the charge reference under which the payment was made in the 'Any other information' at the end of this section.
Welsh Content:
Ni fydd y blwch hwn yn gymwys i nifer o bobl a'r swm i'w nodi yw swm yr addasiad sydd ei angen i gynyddu neu i leihau swm y Dreth Enillion Cyfalaf y bydd Cyllid a Thollau EM yn cyfrifo yn seiliedig ar eich cofnodion ar y tudalennau crynodeb enillion cyfalaf.

Mae'n rhaid i chi egluro yn eich cyfrifiannau sut y cyfrifwyd unrhyw addasiad. Os yw eich addasiad yn lleihau swm y Dreth Enillion Cyfalaf sy'n daladwy, rhowch arwydd minws yn y blwch a ddarperir cyn ffigur yr addasiad.

Efallai bydd rhaid i chi nodi ffigur net addasedig yn y fan hon os:

  • oes Rhyddhad Credyd Treth Dramor ar eich enillion cyfalaf
  • yw eich enillion cyfalaf yn cynnwys atebolrwydd ar gyfer ymddiriedolaethau sy'n ddibreswyl neu'n breswylydd deublyg
  • ydych wedi hawlio'r sail drosglwyddo mewn blwyddyn dreth flaenorol ac wedi gwneud dewis ar gyfer colledion dramor
  • oes gennych golledion rhwystredig
  • ydych yn agored i dalu Dreth Incwm ar log wedi ei guddio ac am osgoi trethiant dwbl
  • yw eich ennill yn agored i'w drethu gan Dreth Enillion Cyfalaf ar gyfer person nad yw'n breswyl
  • os gwnaethoch daliad i Dreth Enillion Cyfalaf ar gyfer person nad yw'n breswyl ar adeg yr hysbysiad, nodwch y swm a dalwyd llai addasiad i dreth enillion cyfalaf. Yna nodwch y cyfeirnod tâl a ddefnyddiwyd ar gyfer gwneud y taliad yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' ar ddiwedd yr adran hon.

English Content:
Include business income that doesn't form part of your business turnover, such as:

  • rental income from letting part of your business accommodation that has become temporarily surplus
  • payments you receive for a right to cross your land (wayleaves)

Don't include income for example, business bank interest received, if you are planning to include it elsewhere on your return.

  • taliadau a gewch am hawl i groesi eich tir (fforddfraint).

Peidiwch â chynnwys incwm os ydych yn bwriadu ei gynnwys mewn man arall ar y ffurflen dreth, er enghraifft incwm rhent sydd wedi ei gynnwys yn yr adran eiddo DU neu log banc busnes a dderbyniwyd.

Dylid cofnodi incwm o fasnach neu fusnes arall ar adran hunangyflogaeth ar wahân.

English Content:
Some reliefs have to be claimed and you must make your claim by clearly stating it in your attached computation. Some claims have to be made on a separate claim form which you complete and attach to your tax return along with your computation. Others, such as private residence relief, are due without needing to make a claim. You should state the amount of any relief or allowance you are claiming.

In some cases, you may wish to make an election, such as for an 'earn out right' not to be treated as a security. You must make your election by clearly stating it in your attached computation.

You can enter a maximum of 240 characters, including spaces. You can only enter letters and numbers and the special characters '()*,-./£@&.

Please don't use the 'Enter' (or 'Return') key on the keyboard when entering information into, or moving away from, this field. Use the spacebar on the keyboard if you need to make more than one entry.

If there is not enough space here, include details in the 'Any other information' page or in an attachment to your tax return.
Welsh Content:
Rhaid gwneud cais am ryddhad a rhaid i chi wneud eich cais drwy wneud datgan clir yn y cyfrifiant a atodir gennych. Rhaid gwneud rhai ceisiadau ar ffurflen gais ar wahân y byddwch yn ei chwblhau a'i hatodi i'ch Ffurflen Dreth ynghyd â'ch cyfrifiant.

Bydd eraill, er enghraifft rhyddhad am breswylfa breifat, yn ddyledus heb fod angen i chi wneud cais. Dylech ddatgan swm unrhyw ryddhad neu lwfans a hawliwch.

Mewn rhai achosion efallai y byddwch am wneud dewis, er enghraifft ar gyfer fel nad yw enilliad llwyr (earn out right) yn cael ei drin fel gwarant. Rhaid i chi wneud eich dewis drwy ei ddatgan yn glir yn y cyfrifiant a atodir gennych.

Os nad oes digon p le yma, dylech gynnwys manylion ar y dudalen 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' neu mewn atodiad i'ch Ffurflen Dreth.

Gallwch nodi hyd at 240 nod, gan gynnwys bylchau Gallwch nodi llythrennau a rhifau a'r nodau arbennig '()*,-./£@& yn unig.

Peidiwch â defnyddio'r botwm 'Enter' (neu 'Return')ar y bysellfwrdd wrth nodi gwybodaeth yn y blwch hwn, neu wrth symud oddi yno. Defnyddiwch y bylchwr ar y bysellfwrdd os oes angen i chi wneud mwy nag un cofnod

English Content:
The calculator will work out indexation allowance, if any, for each separate item of expenditure, and the total to include in your computation of a gain.

Indexation allowance gives you an allowance equal to the amount by which the cost of your asset would have risen if its value had kept pace with inflation between the time you acquired it or, if later, 31 March 1982, and April 1998. Any accumulated allowance, up to April 1998, may be taken into account for disposals after that date. There is no indexation allowance on assets acquired after 31 March 1998.

Indexation allowance is calculated separately for each item of cost or improvement expenditure (excluding the incidental costs of disposal) and the total allowance deducted in the computation of your gain.

Indexation allowance can reduce your gain to nil but cannot create or increase the amount of a loss.
Welsh Content:
Bydd y gyfrifiannell yn cyfrifo'r lwfans mynegeio, os yw'n ddyledus, ar gyfer pob eitem ar wahânyn ogystal â'r cyfanswm i'w gynnwys yng nghyfrifiant eich ennill.

Mae lwfans mynegeio yn rhoi lwfans sydd gyfwerth â'r swm y byddai cost eich ased wedi codi petai ei werth wedi cadw i fyny â chwyddiant rhwng yr adeg y caffaeloch ef neu, os yn hwyrach, 31 Mawrth 1982, a mis Ebrill 1998. Gellir cymryd i ystyriaeth unrhyw lwfans a gronnodd hyd at Ebrill 1998 ar gyfer gwarediadau ar ôl y dyddiad hwnnw. Does dim lwfans mynegeio ar asedion a gafaelwyd ar ôl 31 Mawrth 1998.

Cyfrifir lwfans mynegeio ar wahân ar gyfer pob eitem o gost neu wariant ar welliannau (ac eithrio mân gostau gwaredu) a chyfanswm y lwfans a ddidynnwyd yng nghyfrifiant eich ennill.

Gall lwfans mynegeio leihau eich ennill i lawr i ddim ond ni all greu neu gynyddu swm eich colled.

English Content:
You can carry your loss, or the amount of loss remaining unused, forward to set against future profits from the same business. The loss is deducted from your profits in that business in the first and each subsequent year until it is used up.

The time limit for a claim is 5 April 2021.

Enter the amount of your losses in this business for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 and earlier years which you have not yet used.

Y dyddiad cau ar gyfer cais yw 5 Ebrill 2020.

English Content:
If at some time during your employment you were 'not resident and ordinarily resident in the UK' or you qualified for the Seafarers' Earnings Deduction (or before 6 April 1998 the Foreign Earnings Deduction) work out your foreign service exemption to go in box F.

If:

  • 75% of your service was foreign service (that is, you were not resident and ordinarily resident in the UK), or
  • your last 10 years were foreign service and overall your service was longer than 10 years, or

  • your total service was more than 20 years and half was foreign service (including any ten of the last 20 years) you get full foreign service exemption.

Please enter in box F the amount included in box D, that relates to the job in which you had foreign service.

Os oedd:

  • 75% o'ch gwasanaeth yn wasanaeth tramor (hynny yw, nid oeddech yn preswylio neu fel arfer yn preswylio yn y DU), neu
  • eich 10 mlynedd olaf yn wasanaeth tramor a drwyddi draw roedd eich gwasanaeth yn hwy na 10 mlynedd, neu
  • cyfanswm eich gwasanaeth yn 20 mlynedd neu'n hwy ac roedd ei hanner yn wasanaeth tramor (gan gynnwys unrhyw ddeg o'r 20 mlynedd diwethaf)

English Content:
The provisions described at the foreign sections are:

  • dividend income received by a person abroad
  • all other income received by a person abroad

and any remitted:

  • ring fenced foreign income
  • payment or value of benefit received from a person abroad

don't apply if you can show from all the circumstances that none of the purposes of the transfer and any associated operations was to avoid tax.

But an exemption is only due if actual income would otherwise be chargeable. If you omit income for this reason from the taxable amount in the foreign sections 'Dividend income received by a person abroad' and 'All other income received by a person abroad and any remitted 'ring fenced' foreign income' and from 'Payment or value of benefit received from a person abroad', you must enter the total amount of income you have omitted here. 

You must also provide relevant details and an explanation in the 'Any other information' field at the end of the 'Fill in your return' section, including details of the assets transferred and any associated operations, the person abroad concerned, the circumstances of the relevant transactions and the basis for your claim to exclusion.
Welsh Content:
Nid yw'r darpariaethau a ddisgrifir yn yr adrannau tramor:

  • Incwm difidend a dderbyniwyd gan berson sydd dramor
  • Holl incwm arall a dderbyniwyd gan berson sydd dramor

ac unrhyw taliad

  • incwm tramor a 'ddiogelwyd'
  • neu werth budd a dderbyniwyd oddi wrth berson sydd dramor'

yn gymwys os gallwch ddangos o'r holl amgylchiadau mai nad diben y trosglwyddiad ac unrhyw weithrediadau cysylltiol oedd arbed treth.

Mae eithriad, fodd bynnag, ond yn ddyledus pe bai incwm gwirioneddol fel arall yn drethadwy. Os byddwch yn hepgor incwm am y rheswm hwn o'r swm trethadwy yn yr adrannau tramor 'Incwm difidend a dderbyniwyd gan berson sydd dramor', a 'Holl incwm arall a dderbyniwyd gan berson sydd dramor a holl incwm dramor a 'ddiogelwyd' ac o 'Taliad neu werth budd a dderbyniwyd o berson sydd dramor', rhaid i chi nodi cyfanswm yr incwm rydych wedi'i wedi'i hepgor yn y fan yma. Rhaid i chi hefyd rhoi manylion perthnasol ac esboniad yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' ar ddiwedd yr adran 'Llenwi eich Ffurflen' gan gynnwys manylion o'r asedau a drosglwyddwyd ac unrhyw gydweithrediadau, y person dramor ymglymedig, amgylchiadau'r trosglwyddiadau perthnasol a'r sail i'r cais am waharddiad.

English Content:
If you need to complete the Capital Gains section , select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.

You must report your capital gains and attach your computations if in the tax year:

  • you disposed of chargeable assets which were worth more than £44,400

or

  • your chargeable gains (before the deduction of any losses) are more than £11,100

or

  • you want to claim an allowable capital loss or make any other capital gains claim or election for the year

In working out if the assets you disposed of were worth more than £44,400 use the market value of any assets you gave away or sold for less than full value and ignore disposals of:

  • exempt assets such as private cars, shares held within Individual Savings Accounts
  • assets to your spouse or civil partner (if you were living together at some time during the tax year)
  • your own home where:
    • it's been your only home during your ownership and wasn't used for any other purposes, for example, in your business
    • the house has been used as your home throughout your ownership (but you can ignore the last 18 months of ownership)
    • the garden and grounds disposed of at the same time don't exceed half a hectare

In working out your total chargeable gains include any gains attributed to you (for example, because you're a settlor or beneficiary of a trust, or in certain cases where you're a member of a non-resident company).
Welsh Content:
Os oes angen i chi cwblhau'r adran Enillion Cyfalaf, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen fel arall, dewiswch 'Na'

Rhaid i chi adrodd eich enillion cyfalaf ac atodi eich cyfrifiannau os yn ystod y flwyddyn dreth:

  • gwnaethoch waredu asedion trethadwy a oedd yn werth mwy na £44,400

  • neu
  • mae eich enillion trethadwy (cyn didynnu unrhyw golledion) yn fwy na £11,100

  • neu
  • rydych am hawlio colled cyfalaf caniataol neu hawlio unrhyw enillion cyfalaf neu wneud dewis arall am y flwyddyn.

Wrth gyfrifo p'un a oedd yr asedion a waredwyd gennych yn werth fwy na £44,400, defnyddiwch werth marchnad unrhyw asedion a roddwyd neu a werthwyd gennych am lai na'u gwerth llawn ac anwybyddwch y canlynol:

  • pan fyddwch yn gwaredu asedion a eithrir, fel ceir preifat, cyfranddaliadau a gedwir o fewn Cyfrif Cynilo Unigolyn (ISA)
  • pan fyddwch yn gwaredu asedion i'ch priod neu eich partner sifil (os oeddech yn byw gyda'ch gilydd ar ryw adeg yn ystod y flwyddyn dreth)
  • pan fyddwch yn gwaredu eich cartref eich hun, lle:
    • dyma eich unig gartref yn ystod eich perchenogaeth ac ni chafodd ei ddefnyddio at unrhyw ddibenion eraill, er enghraifft, yn eich busnes
    • defnyddiwyd eich tŷ fel eich cartref trwy gydol eich perchenogaeth ohono (ond gallwch anwybyddu 18 mis olaf eich perchenogaeth)
    • nid oedd yr ardd a'r tir, a waredwyd ar yr un pryd, yn fwy na hanner hectar.

Wrth gyfrifo cyfanswm eich enillion trethadwy dylech gynnwys unrhyw enillion a briodolir i chi (er enghraifft, oherwydd eich bod yn setlwr neu'n fuddiolwr ymddiriedolaeth, neu mewn rhai achosion pan ydych yn aelod o gwmni dibreswyl).

This field applies only to gains made before 23 June 2010 qualifying for Entrepreneurs' Relief that were deferred. Enter here the amount of qualifying gains on which entrepreneurs' relief is claimed and before the 4/9 reduction. The lifetime limit for claims on qualifying gains is £2 million for gains made on or after 6 April 2010 and before 23 June 2010.

Further guidance and information is available in Help Sheet 275 Entrepreneurs' relief.

English Content: Other untaxed foreign income

English Content:
There are many kinds of income that could be included. Here are just a few examples:

  • casual earnings
  • commission
  • freelance income
  • income received, or treated as received, from unauthorised unit trusts
  • taxable annual payments
  • Property Income Distributions (PIDs) from Real Estate Investment Trusts (UK-REITs) and Property Authorised Investment Funds (PAIFs) including PIDs paid by the issue of a stock dividend
  • business receipts where your business has ceased, such as bad debts recovered, royalties for contracts made while the business was still running, or receipts to be taken into account following a change in accounting practice which would not otherwise be taxed over the life of your business
  • payments under a personal insurance policy for sickness or disability benefits if you continue to be covered by a former employer’s permanent health insurance scheme. (If you contributed to the premiums paid by your former employer, the benefits arising from your contributions will be exempt)

Generally, if you are not sure what income may be included here, please contact your HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) office. This section must not be used for income (or gains) that should be returned in any other section of the return.

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 or 6 April 2018 to 5 April 2019 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HMRC know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.
Welsh Content:
Mae yna sawl fath o incwm a allai gael eu cynnwys. Dyma ychydig o enghreifftiau:

  • enillion achlysurol
  • comisiwn
  • incwm llawrydd
  • incwm a gafwyd, neu sy’n cael ei drin fel incwm a gafwyd, o ymddiriedolaethau unedol heb eu hawdurdodi
  • taliadau blynyddol trethadwy
  • dosbarthiadau Incwm o Eiddo (PIDs) sy'n deillio o Ymddiriedolaethau Buddsoddi mewn Eiddo Diriaethol yn y DU (UK-REITs) a Chronfeydd Buddsoddi mewn Eiddo Awdurdodedig (PAIFs) gan gynnwys PIDs a dalwyd drwy ddyroddi difidendau stoc
  • derbyniadau busnes pan fo'ch busnes wedi dod i ben, er enghraifft dyledion drwg a adenillwyd, breindaliadau ar gyfer cytundebau a wnaed tra roedd y busnes yn dal i gael ei gynnal, neu dderbyniadau i'w cyfrif yn dilyn newid mewn arfer cyfrifyddu na fyddai fel arall yn cael eu trethu yn ystod oes eich busnes
  • taliadau o dan bolisi yswiriant personol ar gyfer budd-daliadau salwch neu anabledd os ydych yn parhau i gael eich cynnwys o dan gynllun yswiriant iechyd parhaol cyn gyflogwr - os gwnaethoch gyfrannu at y premiymau a dalwyd gan eich cyn gyflogwr, caiff y buddiannau sy'n deillio o'ch cyfraniadau eu heithrio

Yn gyffredinol, os nad ydych yn siwr pa incwm y gellir ei gynnwys yma, yna cysylltwch â'ch swyddfa Cyllid a Thollau EM. Ni ddylai'r adran hon gael ei defnyddio ar gyfer incwm (neu enillion) y dylid eu dychwelyd yn unrhyw ran arall o'r ffurflen dreth.

The 2008 Finance Act implemented the previously announced withdrawal of agricultural buildings allowances. You can no longer claim agricultural buildings allowances. The allowance of 4% was phased out by giving only part of the allowance each year.

Agricultural and Industrial Buildings Allowances for 2016 to 2017 is nil.

English Content:
An entry will only be required in a limited circumstance. This is where you are claiming relief now for 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 trading losses.

To calculate the amount to enter here you will first need to look at your tax liability for 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 without this adjustment. You need to view your Tax Calculation, which the Online Tax Return has done for you, by selecting the 'Tax Calculation' option in the left hand navigation panel. Then work out what your liability would be if you include the 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 relief you have claimed.

The difference between the original and recalculated figures is the amount you should enter.
Welsh Content:
Bydd angen cofnod dim ond mewn amgylchiadau prin. Bydd hyn pan fyddwch yn hawlio rhyddhad nawr ar gyfer colledion masnachu 2017 i 2017. I gyfrifo'r swm i'w nodi yma bydd angen i chi edrych ar eich rhwymedigaeth treth ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 heb yr addasiad hwn yn gyntaf. Mae angen i chi edrych ar eich Cyfrifiad Treth a baratowyd ar eich cyfer gan y Ffurflen Dreth Ar-lein drwy ddewis y 'Cyfrifiad Treth' o'r opsiynau a gynigir yn y panel tywys ar y chwith. Wedyn cyfrifwch eich rhwymedigaeth treth petaech yn cynnwys y rhyddhad ar gyfer 2017 i 2017 rydych wedi hawlio.

Y swm dylech ei nodi yw'r gwahaniaeth rhwng y swm gwreiddiol a'r swm a ail-gyfrifir.

English Content:
Enter the actual amounts given.

Don't add on any:

  • tax relief that you think the charity will obtain
  • payments under Payroll Giving - those payments are taken off your salary before your employer taxes it

If you asked HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) to give any tax repayment to charity (through your Tax Return) and you ticked the box for Gift Aid to apply, that payment should be included here.

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 or 6 April 2018 to 5 April 2019 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HMRC know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.

  • taliadau o dan Rhoi Trwy'r Gyflogres - caiff y taliadau hynny eu didynnu o'ch cyflog cyn bod eich cyflogwr yn ei drethu

Os gofynnoch i Gyllid a Thollau EM roi unrhyw ad-daliad treth i elusen (drwy gyfrwng eich Ffurflen Dreth) ac roeddech wedi rhoi tic yn y blwch er mwyn i Rodd Cymorth fod yn gymwys, dylid cynnwys y taliad hwnnw yn y fan hon.

English Content:
If you are exempt from paying Class 4 National Insurance contributions (NICs) select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu. Otherwise, select 'No'.

Specific exemptions

  • State Pension age
    You are exempt from paying Class 4 NICs if on 6 April 2015 you were at or over State Pension age (including if you reach state pension age on 6 April 2015).
  • Under 16
    You are exempt from paying Class 4 NICs if on 6 April 2015 you were under 16.
  • Residence
    You are exempt from paying Class 4 NICs if during the tax year ending 5 April 2016 you were not resident in the UK for tax purposes. Residence for Class 4 NICs follows the same rules as for income tax. For further information go to www.gov.uk and search for ‘Residence, Domicile and Remittance Basis Manual’. If you are still unsure, contact HMRC.
  • Trustee, executor or administrator
    If you are a trustee, guardian, or administrator of an incapacitated person and are liable to tax under TMA70/S72, you are exempted from Class 4 NICs on that income.
  • Diver or diving supervisor
    You are exempt from paying Class 4 NICs on earnings from employment from operations as a diver or diving supervisor in the United Kingdom or a designated area which are concerned with the exploration or exploitation of the seabed, subsoil and their natural resources.
    'Designated area' means any area designated under S1(7) Continental Shelf Act 1964 and includes, for example, the United Kingdom sector in the North Sea.

If you are still unsure whether you are exempt or not, contact HMRC.
Welsh Content:
Os ydych wedi eich eithrio rhag talu cyfraniadau Yswiriant Gwladol (CYG) Dosbarth 4, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen. Fel arall, dewiswch 'Na'.

Eithriadau penodol

  • Oedran Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth
    Rydych wedi eich eithrio rhag talu CYG Dosbarth 4 os oeddech wedi cyrraedd, neu dros, oedran Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth ar 6 Ebrill 2016 (gan gynnwys os ydych yn cyrraedd oedran Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth ar 6 Ebrill 2016).
  • O dan 16 oed
    Rydych wedi eich eithrio rhag talu CYG Dosbarth 4 os oeddech o dan 16 oed ar 6 Ebrill 2016.
  • Preswylio
    Rydych wedi eich eithrio rhag talu CYG Dosbarth 4 os nad oeddech yn preswylio yn y DU at ddibenion treth yn ystod y flwyddyn dreth a ddaeth i ben ar 5 Ebrill 2017. Mae preswylio yn dilyn yr un rheolau ar gyfer CYG Dosbarth 4 ag y mae ar gyfer Treth Incwm. Am ragor o wybodaeth, ewch i www.gov.uk a chwilio am 'Residence, Domicile and Remittance Basis Manual'. Os ydych yn dal i fod yn ansicr, cysylltwch â CThEM.
  • Ymddiriedolwr, ysgutor neu weinyddwr
    Os ydych yn ymddiriedolwr, gwarcheidwad, neu weinyddwr ar ran berson analluog ac yn agored i dreth o dan TMA70/S72, rydych wedi eich eithrio rhag CYG Dosbarth 4 ar yr incwm hwnnw.
  • Deifar neu goruchwyliwr deifio
    Rydych wedi eich eithrio rhag talu CYG Dosbarth 4 ar enillion o gyflogaeth o weithrediadau fel deifiwr neu oruchwyliwr deifio yn y Deyrnas Unedig, neu ardal ddynodedig, sydd yn ymwneud ag archwilio neu ddatblygu gwely'r môr, isbridd a'u hadnoddau naturiol.
    Mae 'ardal ddynodedig' yn golygu ardal a ddynodwyd o dan Ddeddf S1 (7) Sgafell Gyfandirol 1964, ac mae'n cynnwys, er enghraifft, sector y Deyrnas Unedig o Fôr y Gogledd.

Os ydych yn dal i fod yn ansicr p'un a ydych wedi eich eithrio neu beidio, cysylltwch â CThEM.

English Content:
Management fees paid to an agent to cover rent collection, advertising and similar administrative expenses can be deducted.

The normal legal and professional fees for renewing a lease (if the lease is for less than 50 years) can be deducted. You can also deduct the professional fees incurred in evicting an unsatisfactory tenant, with a view to re-letting, or in appealing against a compulsory purchase order.

You can't deduct:

  • expenses incurred in connection with the first letting or subletting of a property for more than a year (these include legal expenses such as the cost of drawing up a lease, Agents' and surveyors' fees and commission)
  • any costs of agreeing and paying a premium on renewal of a lease
  • fees for planning permission or registration of title on property purchase

English Content:
You are exempt from paying Class 4 NICs if on 6 April 2016 you were:

  • at or over State Pension age, at the beginning of the year of assessment (including if you reach State Pension age on 6 April 2016)
  • under 16 and the National Insurance Contributions and Employer Office (NIC&EO) had granted you an 'exception'
  • during the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 you were not resident in the UK for tax purposes (if you are not sure whether this applies to you please contact HM Revenue and Customs)

If one of these conditions applies, please select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, please select 'No'.

English Content:
Repairs

Expenses you paid to maintain your property such as:

  • exterior and interior painting
  • damp treatment
  • stone cleaning
  • roof repairs
  • furniture repairs
  • repairs to any kind of machinery supplied with the property

Renewals

You can include the costs of renewing small items such as cutlery but, if you do, you can't claim the original costs or the wear and tear allowance. If you received any money for the items being replaced you should take that amount off the replacement costs. Don't claim for any element of improvement compared with the original item.

The renewals allowance for the cost of replacing furniture or furnishings is no longer available. For more information read PIM 3230 in the Property Income Manual.

Gallwch gynnwys y gost o adnewyddu eitemau bach hefyd, fel cyllyll a ffyrc, ond os gwnewch hynny, ni allwch hawlio'r costau gwreiddiol na'r lwfans traul. English Content:
The following guidance only applies if you've a 'standard' 12 month accounting period and summarises the allowances available. If your accounting period is shorter or longer than a year, or began before 6 April 2015, or if you want to know more about capital allowances, refer to Help Sheet 252 - Capital allowances and balancing charges (which includes worked examples) or contact HM Revenue and Customs, or your tax adviser.

The Business Premises Renovation Allowance (BPRA) scheme took effect from 11 April 2007 and is due to run until April 2017. You can claim 100% BPRA for the capital costs of converting or renovating or repairs to unused business premises to bring them back into business use, you're entitled to claim a 100% allowance against the costs incurred, subject to the following rules.

To qualify for BPRA, premises must:

  • have been unused for at least 1 year before the works began
  • have last been used for a business purpose
  • be in an Assisted Area that is, an area that is considered to be disadvantaged and eligible for regional aid. The whole of Northern Ireland qualifies as an Assisted Area. To see whether an area in England, Wales, or Scotland qualifies go to www.stats1.bis.gov.uk/regional-aa/aa2007.asp
  • be in use or ready and available for use for business or commercial purposes after the works are complete (but must not be used for farming, fisheries and aquaculture, the manufacture of substitute milk products or synthetic fibres, shipbuilding, steel or coal industries; or where the person undertaking the renovation is involved in any of these areas).

BPRA cannot be claimed:

  • if the renovation expenditure has been incurred on any residential property
  • on the costs of acquiring the land or building, extending the building, or developing land next to the business premises
  • from April 2014, to the extent that the expenditure that can qualify for relief under the scheme exceeds a cap of €20 million per project

Further information about BPRA
Welsh Content:
Mae'r arweiniad isod yn gymwys dim ond os oes gennych gyfnod cyfrifyddu 'safonol' o 12 mis a bod crynodeb o'r lwfansau ar gael. Os yw eich cyfnod cyfrifyddu'n fyrrach neu'n hwy na blwyddyn, neu os dechreuodd cyn 6 Ebrill 2014, neu os ydych am wybod rhagor am lwfansau cyfalaf, cyfeiriwch at Daflen Gymorth 252 - Capital allowances and balancing charges (sy'n cynnwys enghreifftiau), neu cysylltwch â Chyllid a Thollau EM neu eich cynghorydd treth.

Daeth y cynllun Lwfans Adnewyddu Eiddo Busnes (LAEB) i rym ar 11 Ebrill 2007 a disgwylir iddo redeg tan Ebrill 2017. Gallwch hawlio 100% LAEB ar gyfer y costau cyfalaf o drosi neu adnewyddu neu atgyweirio adeiladau busnes sydd heb eu defnyddio i'w gwneud yn addas at ddefnydd busnes eto, mae'r hawl gennych i hawlio lwfans o 100% yn erbyn y costau, yn amodol ar y rheolau canlynol.

I fod yn gymwys ar gyfer LAEB, mae'n rhaid bod eiddo:

  • wedi bod yn segur am o leiaf un flwyddyn cyn i'r gwaith ddechrau
  • wedi'i ddefnyddio ddiwethaf at ddibenion
  • mewn Ardal a Gynorthwyir, hynny yw ardal a ystyrir ei bod dan anfantais ac yn gymwys ar gyfer derbyn cymorth rhanbarthol. Mae Gogledd Iwerddon gyfan yn gymwys fel Ardal a Gynorthwyir ac er mwyn gweld p'un a yw Cymru, Lloegr neu'r Alban yn gymwys ewch i www.stats1.bis.gov.uk/regional-aa/aa2007.asp
  • yn cael ei ddefnyddio, neu'n barod ac ar gael at ddibenion busnes neu fasnachol ar ôl cwblhau'r gwaith (ond ni ellir ei ddefnyddio ar gyfer ffermio, pysgodfeydd ac acwafeithrin, gwneuthuriad cynnyrch amnewidyn llefrith neu ffibrau synthetig, adeiladu llongau, , diwydiannau dur neu glo; neu pan fod y person sy'n ymgymryd â'r adnewyddiad ynghlwm wrth unrhyw un o'r meysydd hyn).

Ni ellir hawlio LAEB:

  • os aed i'r gwariant adnewyddu ar unryw eiddo preswyl, neu
  • ar y gost o atafaelu'r tir neu adeilad, ymestyn yr adeilad, neu ddatblygu tir wrth ymyl yr eiddo busnes
  • o fis Ebrill 2013 ymlaen, i'r graddau bod y gwariant a all fod yn gymwys ar gyfer rhyddhad o dan y cynllun yn fwy nag uchafswm o €20 miliwn y prosiect

Mae rhagor o wybodaeth am LAEB

English Content:
If you want to claim married couple's allowance, select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.

Married couple's allowance can only be claimed if either you, your spouse or civil partner (following the introduction of the Civil Partnership Act 2004) were born before 6 April 1935, and you are:

  • a married man or married woman who married before 5 December 2005
  • a married man, married woman or civil partner who married or formed a civil partnership on or after 5 December 2005

The allowance is made up of 2 amounts, a minimum amount (worth up to £314) plus an amount dependent on the income of the husband (for marriages before 5 December 2005), or the person with the higher income (for marriages and civil partnerships formed on or after 5 December 2005).

A married couple or civil partners may share the minimum amount of the allowance. But you must have already asked HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) to do this (either before 5 April 2015 or, if you married or formed a civil partnership during the year to 5 April 2016, by that date).

If you want to change the way the allowance is given for tax year 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 contact HMRC (it's already too late to make any change for tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017).
Welsh Content:
Os ydych am hawlio lwfans pâr priod, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen fel arall, dewiswch 'Na'.

Gellir ond hawlio lwfans pâr priod os ganed chi, eich priod neu eich partner sifil (yn sgil cyflwyno Deddf Partneriaeth Sifil 2004) cyn 6 Ebrill 1935, ac:

  • rydych yn ŵr priod neu'n wraig briod a briododd cyn 5 Rhagfyr 2005, neu
  • rydych yn ŵr priod, yn wraig briod neu'n bartner sifil a briododd neu a ffurfiodd bartneriaeth sifil ar neu ar ôl 5 Rhagfyr 2005

Mae'r lwfans yn cynnwys 2 swm, isafswm (sy'n werth hyd at £314), yn ogystal â swm sy'n dibynnu ar incwm y gŵr (ar gyfer priodasau cyn 5 Rhagfyr 2005), neu'r person gyda'r incwm uchaf (ar gyfer priodasau a phartneriaethau sifil a ffurfiwyd ar neu ar ôl 5 Rhagfyr 2005).

Gall pâr priod neu bartneriaid sifil rannu isafswm y lwfans. Ond rhaid eich bod eisoes wedi gofyn i Gyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) wneud hyn (naill ai cyn 5 Ebrill 2014 neu, os gwnaethoch briodi neu ffurfio partneriaeth sifil yn ystod y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2016, erbyn y dyddiad hwnnw).

Os ydych am newid y ffordd y rhoddir y lwfans ar gyfer 2017 i 2017, cysylltwch â CThEM (mae'n barod yn rhy hwyr i wneud unrhyw newid ar gyfer 2016 i 2017).

English Content:
If you invested in shares that were issued during the year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 or during the year to 5 April 2018 if you're carrying back relief you may be able to claim Income Tax relief under the Enterprise Investment Scheme. Further information can be found in Helpsheet 341 Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief.

The amount by which your tax liability will be reduced will be the smaller of:

  • the amount you subscribed (up to a maximum of £1 million) at 30%
  • the amount that reduces your tax bill to zero for the year

To qualify for relief you must have received either form EIS3 Seed Enterprise Investment Scheme Certificate and claim to relief from the company you invested in, or form EIS5 Enterprise Investment Scheme from the fund manager of an approved investment fund. Further information can be found in Helpsheet 341 Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief.

Enter the total amount of the subscription on which you're claiming relief (up to a maximum of £1 million) for the year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017, and in the 'additional information' field enter:

  • the name of the company invested in
  • the total amount of the subscription on which you're claiming relief for the year to 5 April 2016 (if you've subscribed more than £1 million Helpsheet 341 Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief explains how relief can be allocated to the shares)
  • the date of issue of the shares
  • address of the office authorising the issue of the EIS3 and its reference
Welsh Content:
Os gwnaethoch fuddsoddi mewn cyfranddaliadau a ddyroddwyd yn ystod y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017 (neu yn ystod y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017 os ydych yn cario rhyddhad yn ôl - darllenwch Daflen Gymorth 341 Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief), mae'n bosib y gallwch hawlio rhyddhad Treth Incwm o dan y Cynllun Buddsoddiad Menter.

Y swm y bydd eich atebolrwydd treth yn cael ei leihau ganddo bydd y lleiaf or:

  • swm a danysgrifiwyd gennych (hyd at uchafswm o £1,000,000) ar gyfradd o 30%
  • swm sy'n lleihau eich bil treth i sero am y flwyddyn

Er mwyn bod yn gymwys ar gyfer rhyddhad rhaid eich bod wedi derbyn naill ai ffurflen EIS3 Cynllun Buddsoddiad Menter (EIS) - Tystysgrif a chais am ryddhad gan y cwmni y gwnaethoch fuddsoddi ynddo, neu ffurflen EIS5 Enterprise Investment Scheme gan reolwr cronfa fuddsoddi gymeradwy. Mae Taflen Gymorth 341 Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief yn esbonio'r amodau cymwys ar gyfer rhyddhad treth.

Nodwch gyfanswm y tanysgrifiad rydych yn hawlio rhyddhad arno (hyd at uchafswm o £1,000,000) ar gyfer y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017, a nodwch yn y blwch 'gwybodaeth ychwanegol':

  • enw'r cwmni y buddsoddwyd yndd
  • cyfanswm y tanysgrifiad rydych yn hawlio rhyddhad arno ar gyfer y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017 (os ydych wedi tanysgrifio mwy na £1,000,000 mae Taflen Gymorth 341 Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief yn esbonio sut y gellir dyrannu rhyddhad i'r cyfranddaliadau)
  • dyddiad dyroddi'r cyfranddaliadau
  • enw a chyfeirnod y swyddfa sy'n awdurdodi anfon yr EIS3

  • P60 or P45 (Part 1A)

  • Records of business receipts and business expenses
  • Records of property receipts and property expenses
  • Profit or loss accounts
  • Your partnership statement
  • Investment brokers schedules
  • Formal valuations
  • Capital gains and losses computations
  • Foreign bank statements etc
  • Foreign property letting accounts etc
  • Bank, building society, unit trust, etc statements and certificates or passbooks
  • Dividend counterfoils or investment brokers schedules
  • Correspondence from the Department for Work and Pensions
  • Personal pension contribution certificates or receipts
  • Bank statements or any receipts from the charity
  • Correspondence from HM Revenue & Customs or Jobcentre Plus
  • 2008-09 and 2009-10 Notices of Coding
  • Correspondence from adviser
  • VCT certificates
  • Bank statements
  • Details of any surplus allowance available from your spouse or civil partner
  • Business records etc
  • Correspondence from the pension scheme trustees etc

English Content:
Work out your net income for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 by following steps 1 to 4 below. If your net income is over £50,000 select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu, otherwise select 'No''

Step 1 - work out your 'net income'

Add up your taxable income, include things such as:

  • income from employment including any company benefits
  • profits from self-employment
  • taxable social security benefits
  • pensions including the State Pension
  • savings, dividend and rental income

then take off any tax reliefs that apply such as:

  • payments made gross to pension schemes - those have been made without tax relief
  • trading losses, for example trade loss relief or property loss relief

This is your 'net income'.

Your net income is then adjusted - follow steps 2 to 4 below.

Step 2 - take off Gift Aid donations

If you made a Gift Aid donation, take off the 'grossed-up' amount - what you paid plus the basic rate of tax.

Step 3 - take off pension contributions

If you made a contribution to a pension scheme where your pension provider has already given you tax relief at basic rate, take off the 'grossed-up' amount - what you paid plus the basic rate of tax.

Step 4 - add back tax relief for payments to trade unions or police organisations

Tax relief of up to £100 is available if you make payments to a trade union or police organisation for superannuation, life insurance or funeral benefits.

If you took off an amount for this type of payment at step 1, add it back.

This is your 'adjusted net income' which determines if your income is over £50,000 for Child Benefit purposes.

If your income was higher than your partners income for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu, otherwise select 'No' or 'Not a couple'.
Welsh Content:
Gweithiwch allan eich incwm net ar gyfer y flwyddyn dreth 6 Ebrill 2016 i 5 Ebrill 2017 drwy ddilyn camau 1 i 4. Os yw eich incwm net dros £50,0000, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall atebwch 'Na'.

Cam 1 - gweithiwch allan eich 'incwm net'

Cyfrifwch eich incwm trethadwy- dylech gynnwys pethau fel:

  • incwm o gyflogaeth gan gynnwys unrhyw fuddiannau cwmni
  • elw o hunangyflogaeth
  • buddiannau nawdd cymdeithasol trethadwy
  • pensiynau gan gynnwys Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth
  • cynilion, difidendau ac incwm rhentu

yna didynnwchunrhyw ryddhad treth sy'n gymwys, fel

  • taliadau a wnaed yn gros i gynlluniau pensiwn - maent wedi'u gwneud heb ryddhad treth
  • colledion masnachu, er enghraifft, rhyddhad colled masnach neu ryddhad colled eiddo

Dyma yw eich 'incwm net'

Caiff eich incwm net ei addasu wedyn – dilynwch gamau 2 i 4 isod.

Cam 2 - didynnwch gyfraniadau Rhodd Cymorth

Os gwnaethoch gyfraniad Rhodd Cymorth, didynnwch y swm wedi ei grosio i fyny - yr hyn a dalwyd gennych ynghyd â chyfradd sylfaenol y dreth.

Cam 3 - didynnwch gyfraniadau pensiwn

Os gwnaethoch gyfraniad i gynllun pensiwn pan fod eich darparwr pensiwn eisoes wedi rhoi rhyddhad treth i chi ar y gyfradd sylfaenol, didynnwch y swm wedi ei grosio i fyny - yr hyn a dalwyd gennych ynghyd â chyfradd sylfaenol y dreth.

Cam 4 - ychwanegwch yn ôl rhyddhad treth ar gyfer taliadau i undebau llafar neu sefydliadau'r heddlu

Mae rhyddhad treth o hyd at £100 ar gael os ydych yn gwneud taliadau i undeb llafur neu sefydliad yr heddlu ar gyfer blwydd-dal, yswiriant bywyd neu fuddiannau angladd. Os gwnaethoch ddidynnu swm ar gyfer y math hwn o daliad yng ngham 1, ychwanegwch y swm yn ôl.

Dyma eich 'incwm net wedi'i addasu' sy'n pennu a yw eich incwm dros £50,000 at ddibenion Budd-dal Plant.

Os oedd eich incwm yn fwy nag incwm eich partner ar gyfer y flwyddyn dreth 6 Ebrill 2016 i 5 Ebrill 2017, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r gwymplen, fel arall dewiswch 'Na' neu 'Nid yn gwpl'.

English Content:
Seafarers' Earnings Deduction

Seafarers are entitled to a 100% deduction from their seafaring earnings if they meet certain conditions:

  • they must work on a ship - offshore installations are not treated as ships - see EIM33103 and EIM33106
  • the names of the ships on which the employee has worked will be needed for the SA return
  • the claim must cover at least 365 days and they must be absent from the UK for a minimum of half of those days
  • the absence can be continuous or made up of a number of periods - details are included at EIM33004 and EIM33005 as well as in the Help Sheet 205 - Seafarers' Earnings Deduction, which will take you through the 'eligible' period calculation and work out the deduction to be entered in this field
  • their duties must be performed wholly or partly abroad Claims can be made by UK residents via SA or EEA residents via R43M(SED) process.

Foreign earnings not taxable in the UK

You will need Helpsheet 211, 'Employment – residence and domicile issues' to work out the amount to put in if you:

  • are, will be or have been, non-resident or claiming split-year treatment
  • have been non-domiciled
  • are, or will be, non-domiciled and the remittance basis rules apply to some or all of your earnings
  • received income in a foreign country that you could not bring to the UK because of exchange controls or a shortage of foreign currency in that country

You may also need to fill in the ‘Residence, remittance basis, etc' pages.
Welsh Content:
Didyniad Enillion Morwyr

Mae gan morwyr hawl i ddidyniad o 100% o'u henillion ar y môr os ydynt yn bodloni amodau penodol:

  • rhaid iddynt weithio ar long - ni chaiff gosodiadau alltraeth eu trin fel llong - gweler EIM33103 a EIM33106
  • bydd angen enwau'r llongau y mae'r cyflogai wedi gweithio arni ar gyfer y Ffurflen Dreth Hunanasesiad
  • rhaid i'r cais cwmpasu o leiaf 365 diwrnod, arhaid iddynt fod i ffwrdd o'r DU am o leiaf hanner y diwrnodau hynny
  • gall absenoldeb fod yn barhaus neu'n cynnwys nifer o gyfnodau - mae manylion ar gael yn EIM33004 a EIM33005, yn ogystal ag yn Daflen Gymorth 205 - Seafarers' Earnings Deduction, a fydd yn mynd â chi drwy gyfrifiad y cyfnod 'cymwys' ac yn cyfrifo'r didyniad sydd i gael ei nodi yn y blwch hwn
  • rhaid bod eu dyletswyddau'n cael eu cyflawni dramor - naill ai yn gyfan gwbl neu'n rhannolGall ceisiadau cael eu gwneud gan breswylwyr y DU drwy Hunanasesiad, neu gan breswylwyr yr AEE drwy'r broses R43M(SED)

Enillion tramor nad ydynt yn drethadwy yn y DU

Bydd angen Taflen Gymorth 211 'Employment – residence and domicile issues' arnoch i gyfrifo'r swm i'w roi:

  • os ydych, os byddwch neu os buoch, yn ddibreswyl neu'n hawlio triniaeth blwyddyn ranedig
  • os yw eich domisil tu allan i'r DU
  • os yw eich domisil tu allan i'r DU, neu fe fydd eich domisil tu allan i'r DU, ac mae rheolau sail trosglwyddo yn gymwys i rai o'ch enillion neu i'ch holl enillion
  • os ydych wedi derbyn incwm mewn gwlad dramor nad oeddech yn gallu dod i'r DU oherwydd rheolau cyfnewid neu oherwydd prinder arian cyfred yn y wlad honno

Efallai y bydd yn rhaid i chi lenwi'r tudalennau Residence, remittance basis, etc hefyd.

English Content:
Enter the amount of this item of expenditure.

However, if you held the asset at March 1982 and are entering expenditure, enter the higher of the acquisition cost (to include any incidental costs of acquisition and any improvement expenditure before 31 March 1982) and the 31 March 1982 value (see Help Sheet 280).

Indexation allowance is not due on the incidental costs of disposal.

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com
Welsh Content:
Nodwch swm yr eitem hon o wariant.

Fodd bynnag os oedd yr ased yn eich meddiant ym mis Mawrth 1982, ac os ydych yn cofnodi gwariant caffael yr ased, nodwch yr uchaf o'r gost caffael (i gynnwys unrhyw fan gostau caffael a gwariant ar welliannau cyn 31 Mawrth 1982 ar werth ar 31 Mawrth 1982 (gweler Taflen Cymorth 280).

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
Select the checkbox if you received any income from land and property abroad.

This includes any rents or other receipts from land and property situated overseas that you may have.

Furnished Holiday Lettings in the European Economic Area (EEA)

From 22 April 2009 there has been a change in the treatment for furnished holiday lettings in the EEA. If you've income from the commercial letting of furnished holiday accommodation in the EEA you can claim the same reliefs that apply to commercially let furnished holiday accommodation in the UK. If you let qualifying holiday accommodation in the EEA and want to claim reliefs currently available under the furnished holiday lettings (FHL) rules, complete the UK Property section in respect of that accommodation.

If you want to claim foreign tax credit relief for any foreign tax paid on income from Furnished Holiday Lettings in the EEA you should complete the section headed 'Foreign tax paid on employment, self employment and other income' in the Foreign section.

Remittance Basis

The instruction to use the UK property section to report income from Furnished Holiday Lettings in the EEA doesn'tapply if you make a claim to be taxed on the remittance basis.

If you want to pay tax on the remittance basis Helpsheet 264 - Remittance basis provides further information. Download and complete the Residence, Remittance Basis etc pages (SA109) and send a paper copy of those pages to HMRC. You can't file these supplementary pages online. If you want to file online, you will need to use commercial software.
Welsh Content:
Ticiwch y blwch gwirio os cawsoch unrhyw incwm o dir ac eiddo dramor.

Mae hyn yn cynnwys unrhyw renti neu dderbyniadau eraill o dir ac eiddo a leolir dramor a allai fod gennych.

Llety Gwyliau wedi ei Ddodrefnu (FHL) mewn Ardal Ewropiaidd Economeg

O'r 22 Ebrill 2009 mae yna newid wedi bod yn y driniaeth am lety gwyliau wedi ei ddodrefnu yn yr Ardal Economaidd Ewropiaidd. Os oes gennych incwm o osodiad masnachol o lety gwyliau wedi ei ddodrefnu yn yr EEA gallwch hawlio yr un rhyddhad sy'n gymwys i lety gwyliau wedi ei ddodrefnu sydd wedi ei osod yn fasnacholyn y DU.Os ydych yn gosod llety gwyliau sy'n gymwys yn yr EEA ac am hawlio rhyddhad sydd ar gael o dan rheolau FHL yna cwblhewch yr adran Eiddo DU mewn perthynas â'r llety hynny.

Os ydych am hawlio rhyddhad credyd treth dramor am unrhyw dreth tramor a delir ar incwm o Lety Gwyliau wedi'i Ddodrefnu yn yr Ardal Economaidd Ewropeaidd (EEA), yna dylech gwblhau yr adran incwm arall yn yr adran dramor.

Sail Drosglwyddo

Nid yw'r cyfarwyddyd i ddefnyddio'r adran eiddo'r DU i nodi incwm o Lety Gwyliau wedi'i ddodrefnu yn yr EEA yn gymwys os ydych yn gwneud cais i gael eich trethu ar y sail drosglwyddo. Dylai trethdalwyr Sail Drosglwyddo nodi symiau wedi'u trosglwyddo o incwm o dir ac eiddo tramor yn adran Tramor eu ffurflen dreth.

Os ydych yn penderfynu eich bod am dalu treth ar y sail drosglwyddo bydd Ffurflen Gymorth 264 - Remittance basis yn rhoi gwybodaeth bellach i chi. Bydd angen i chi lawrlwytho a chwblhau'r tudalennau Residence, Remittance Basis etc (SA109) ac anfon copi bapur o'r tudalennau hyn at CThEM. Ni allwch gyflwyno'r tudalennau atodol hyn ar-lein. Os ydych am gyflwyno ar-lein, bydd angen i chi ddefnyddio meddalwedd masnachol.

English Content:
Enter a brief description of the expenditure. This description will be used to identify the expenditure and associated indexation allowance in the summary table.

Please note: if you held the asset at 31 March 1982, indexation allowance is calculated on the higher of the acquisition cost and 31 March 1982 value - unless you have made a rebasing election when it is based on the 31 March 1982 value (see Help Sheet 280). Indexation allowance is then calculated on any subsequent items of improvement expenditure.
Welsh Content:
Nodwch ddisgrifiad byr o'r gwariant. Defnyddir y disgrifiad hwn i adnabod y gwariant a'r lwfans mynegeio sydd ynghlwm wrtho yn y tabl crynhoi.

Sylwer: Os oedd yr ased yn eich meddiant ym mis Mawrth 1982, cyfrifir y lwfans mynegeio ar yr uchaf o'r gost caffael a'r gwerth ar 31 Mawrth 1982 - oni bai eich bod wedi dewis adseilio, pan gaiff ei seilio ar ei werth ar 31 Mawrth 1982 (gweler Taflen Cymorth 280). Cyfrifir lwfans mynegeio wedyn ar unrhyw eitemau dilynol o wariant ar welliannau.

English Content:
Annual Allowance tax paid or payable by your pension scheme

The amount of your pension savings that benefits from tax relief is limited to an annual allowance is £40,000. Schemes that qualify are:

  • a registered pension scheme
  • an overseas pension scheme - as long as either you or your employer qualify for UK tax relief on those pension savings

If you save more than this amount you may have to pay a tax charge on the excess.

Enter the amount of Annual Allowance excess tax charge paid or payable by the scheme administrator, who will have told you how much tax has been paid.

Where more than one pension scheme has paid such a tax charge, enter the total.

More information

There are Annual Allowance Calculators to help you work out whether you have any unused Annual Allowance to carry forward and to help you with pension input amounts. However the calculators can't be used for all types of pension arrangements.

The calculators are at www.hmrc.gov.uk/tools/pension-allowance/index.htm
Welsh Content:
Treth Lwfans Blynyddol a dalwyd neu sy'n daladwy gan eich cynllun pensiwn

£40,000 yw swm eich cynilion pensiwn sy'n elwa o ryddhad treth sydd wedi'i gyfyngu i lwfans blynyddol. Mae cynlluniau sy'n gymwys fel a ganlyn:

  • cynllun pensiwn cofrestredig
  • cynllun pensiwn tramor - cyn belled â bod naill ai chi neu eich cyflogwr yn gymwys ar gyfer rhyddhad treth y DU ar y cynilion pensiwn hynny

Os ydych yn cynilo mwy na'r swm hwn mae'n bosib y bydd yn rhaid i chi dalu treth ar y swm gormodol.

Nodwch swm y dreth ormodol Lwfans Blynyddol a dalwyd neu sy'n daladwy gan weinyddwr y cynllun y byddwch wedi dweud wrtho/wrthi faint o dreth sydd wedi ei thalu.

Pan mae mwy nag un cynllun pensiwn wedi talu'r fath tâl treth, nodwch y cyfanswm.

Mwy o wybodaeth

Mae yna Gyfrifianellau Lwfans Blynyddol ar ein gwefan i'ch helpu i gyfrifo a oes gennych unrhyw Lwfans Blynyddol nas defnyddiwyd i'w gario ymlaen ac i'ch helpu â symiau talu mewn i bensiwn. Fodd bynnag, ni ellir defnyddio'r cyfrifiannellau ar gyfer pob math o drefniant pensiwn.

Mae'r cyfrifianellau ar gael yn www.hmrc.gov.uk/tools/pension-allowance/index.htm
