English Content:
If your employer contributes to your overseas pension scheme and you don't pay tax on these contributions. You may get an annual statement that shows you the information you need, if you don't get one, contact your pension provider. If your scheme is a money purchase scheme, enter your employer's annual contributions. If it's a defined benefits scheme put the increase in the value of your lump sum (cash) plus 16 times the increase in your promised annual pension, minus any personal contributions to the scheme.

Information about these reliefs
Welsh Content:
Os yw eich cyflogwr yn cyfrannau at eich cynllun pensiwn tramor ac nid ydych yn talu treth ar y cyfraniadau hyn. Mae'n bosibl y cewch ddatganiad blynyddol sy'n dangos yr wybodaeth sydd ei hangen arnoch. Os na chewch un, cysylltwch â'ch darparwr pensiwn. Os yw eich cynllun yn gynllun prynu arian, rhowch gyfraniadau blynyddol eich cyflogwr. Os yw'n gynllun budd-dal diffiniedig, rhowch y cynnydd yng ngwerth eich cyfandaliad (swm arian parod) plws 16 gwaith y cynnydd yn y pensiwn blynyddol a addawyd i chi, llai cyfraniadau personol i'r cynllun.

Ceir gwybodaeth am y rhyddhad hyn yn Llawlyfr Treth Pensiynau.

English Content:
The information to complete this field can be found on your P11D form section F and G box 10, provided by your employer.

Enter the amount of fuel benefit from the P11D to the relevant employment page.

No benefit charges will arise if:

  • fuel was provided solely for business travel
  • the director/employee was required to make good the whole of the cost of the fuel used for private motoring (including travel between home and work) and actually did so
  • a mileage allowance was paid covering no more than the cost of fuel used on business travel.

If an allowance was paid which covered fuel costs for private travel, for example between home and work, a car fuel benefit charge will arise. If the provision of free fuel is withdrawn, the benefit charge is reduced in proportion to the number of days the car is available after the date of withdrawal. There is no reduction if free fuel is reinstated later in the tax year. Enter the total car fuel benefit charge for all cars available. Remember that the type of fuel/power used must be entered whether or not a car fuel benefit charge applies.
Welsh Content:
Mae'r wybodaeth i lenwi'r blwch hwn ar gael ar eich ffurflen P11D, adrannau F a G, blwch 2, a ddarperir gan eich cyflogwr.

Rhowch swm y buddiant tanwydd o'r P11D ar y dudalen gyflogaeth berthnasol.

Ni fydd tâl buddiannau yn codi os:

  • cafodd tanwydd ei ddarparu ar gyfer teithio busnes yn unig
  • oedd yn ofynnol ar y cyfarwyddwr/cyflogai i dalu holl gost y tanwydd a ddefnyddiwyd ar gyfer moduro preifat (gan gynnwys teithio rhwng y cartref a’r gwaith) ac iddo/iddi wneud hynny mewn gwirionedd, neu
  • talwyd lwfans cyflogaeth am swm heb fod yn fwy na chost y tanwydd a ddefnyddiwyd ar gyfer teithio busnes

Pe talwyd lwfans ar gyfer costau tanwydd am deithio preifat, er enghraifft rhwng y cartref a'r gwaith, bydd tâl buddiant tanwydd car yn codi. Os yw darpariaeth y tanwydd rhad ac am ddim yn dod i ben, gostyngir y tâl buddiant yn gyfrannol â nifer y dyddiau mae'r car ar gael wedi'r dyddiad y daw'r ddarpariaeth i ben. Ni cheir gostyngiad os yw tanwydd rhad ac am ddim yn cael ei adfer yn hwyrach yn y flwyddyn dreth. Rhowch gyfanswm y tâl buddiant tanwydd car ar gyfer pob car sydd ar gael. Cofiwch fod yn rhaid rhoi math y tanwydd/pŵer a ddefnyddir p'un a bod tâl buddiant tanwydd car yn gymwys neu beidio.

English Content:
If part of your trade union subscription entitles you to a pension, life assurance or funeral benefits, then you're entitled to tax relief on an amount equal to one half of the part of your union subscription (up to a maximum £100) which provides the benefits. Enter this amount. Your union representative will be able to tell you how much, if any, of your subscription was for these benefits.

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 or 6 April 2018 to 5 April 2019 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HMRC know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.
Welsh Content: Os bydd rhan o'ch tanysgrifiad i undeb llafur yn rhoi hawl i chi gael pensiwn, yswiriant bywyd neu fudd-daliadau angladd yna mae gennych hawl i ryddhad treth. Mae'r rhyddhad hwn gyfwerth ag un hanner y rhan honno o'ch tanysgrifiadau undeb (hyd at uchafswm o £100) sy'n darparu'r budd-daliadau. Nodwch y swm hwn. Bydd cynrychiolydd yr undeb yn gallu dweud wrthych faint o'ch tanysgrifiad, os o gwbl, oedd ar gyfer y buddiannau hyn.

English Content:
If the adjustment is negative, put a minus sign (-) before the figure.

If the partnership did not carry on a trade or profession in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 that is, it carried on a pure investment business, the basis period is the tax year from 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017. No adjustments for basis period will be required.

For more information about the rules for working out your basis period and any adjustments for basis period, follow the link Help Sheet 222 - How to calculate your taxable profits

For further guidance and information follow the link Partnership (full) notes

English Content:
The attachments feature is not intended for you to send general correspondence or information about issues unrelated to your Tax Return.

You should not normally need to send an attachment with your return. All of your tax liability must be declared within the fields on the Tax Return.

If HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) needs you to send an attachment with your return, this will be clear from the return itself or from the additional guidance given in Help Sheets.

HMRC will reject any attachment that is not in PDF format or if it contains a virus.

To safeguard HMRC services to customers, there are limits on the size and number of attachments that can be accepted. To send an attachment with your Tax Return, please complete the following steps:

  • click the browse button
  • browse for the file to be attached, choose the file and then select the 'Open' button
  • enter a description if you need to
  • click the 'Upload' button to add the attachment to your return
  • repeat for additional attachments

Remember, if you do not successfully submit your Tax Return, with or without attachments, by the 31st January deadline, a late filing penalty will be charged.
Welsh Content:
Ni fwriedir i'r nodwedd ar gyfer atodiadau gael ei defnyddio er mwyn i chi anfon gohebiaeth gyffredinol atom ynglŷn â materion nad ydynt yn ymwneud â'ch Ffurflen Dreth.

Fel arfer ni ddylai fod angen i chi anfon atodiad gyda'ch Ffurflen Dreth. Rhaid datgelu eich rhwymedigaeth treth gyfan o fewn y meysydd ar y Ffurflen Dreth.

Os yw Cyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) angen i chi anfon atodiad gyda'ch ffurflen dreth, bydd hyn yn glir o'r ffurflen dreth ei hun neu o'r arweiniad pellach a roddir yn y Taflenni Cymorth.

Bydd CThEM yn gwrthod unrhyw atodiad nad yw mewn fformat PDF neu os yw'n cynnwys firws.

Er mwyn diogelu gwasanaethau CThEM i gwsmeriaid, mae yna derfynau ar faint a nifer yr atodiadau y gellir eu derbyn. Er mwyn anfon atodyn gyda’ch Ffurflen Dreth cwblhewch y camau canlynol:

  • cliciwch y botwm pori
  • porwch am y ffeil sydd i'w hatodi, dewiswch y ffeil ac yna cliciwch y botwm 'Agor'
  • nodwch ddisgrifiad os oes angen i chi wneud
  • cliciwch y botwm 'Uwchlwytho' i ychwanegu'r atodiad i'ch ffurflen
  • ailadroddwch ar gyfer atodiadau ychwanegol

Cofiwch, os nad ydych yn cyflwyno eich Ffurflen Dreth yn llwyddiannus, gan gynnwys atodiadau neu beidio, erbyn y dyddiad cau sef 31 Ionawr, codir cosb am gyflwyno'n hwyr arnoch.

English Content:
You should only fill in the 'Lloyd's underwriters' pages if you were trading as an underwriting member of Lloyd's (or a Name) in the year ending 31 December 2016. You will usually be treated as a Name until your Lloyd's deposit is released. However, there may be circumstances where you are still treated as a Name after your deposit is released. Please check with the High Net Worth Unit if you think this may apply.

You will not be able to use HM Revenue and Customs software to file online and will need to use an alternative. You can find a list of alternative software providers at https://www.gov.uk/software-tax-returns.

Fel arfer, cewch eich trin fel Enw tan i'ch adnau yn Lloyds gael ei ryddhau. Fodd bynnag, efallai y bydd amgylchiadau pan fyddwch yn dal i gael eich trin fel Enw ar ôl i'ch adnau gael ei ryddhau. Dylech ofyn i'r Uned Gwerth Net Uchel os credwch fod hyn yn gymwys.

Ni fyddwch yn gallu defnyddio meddalwedd CThEM i gyflwyno ar-lein, a bydd rhaid i chi ddefnyddio meddalwedd gwahanol. Ceir rhestr o ddarparwyr meddalwedd gwahanol yn www.gov.uk/software-tax-returns.

English Content:
Enter the amount you paid to acquire the asset excluding any allowable costs of acquisition. If you created the asset yourself, (such as goodwill in a business), enter the costs of creating the asset, if any.

Use the market value in place of the price you gave if you received the asset as a gift, if it was deliberately sold to you for less than its full value, or if you acquired it from a connected person.

The market value is the price an asset might reasonably make on the open market on the date of its disposal. For shares and securities quoted on the Stock Exchange Daily Official List, the market value in all normal circumstances is the lower of:

  • the figure one-quarter up from the lower of the 2 prices in the quotation for the relevant day
  • the figure halfway between the highest and lowest prices of recorded bargains for that day

Further guidance and information, can be found in Capital gains summary notes.

More information about using the market value
Welsh Content:
Nodwch y swm a daloch i gaffael yr ased ac eithrio unrhyw gostau caffael caniataol. Os gwnaethoch greu'r ased eich hun, (er enghraifft ewyllys da mewn busnes), nodwch gostau o greu'r ased, os oedd costau.

Defnyddiwch werth marchnad yr ased yn lle'r pris a roddoch os cawsoch yr ased fel anrheg, os cafodd ei werthu i chi yn fwriadol am lai na'i werth llawn, neu os gwnaethoch ei gaffael oddi wrth berson cysylltiol.

Gwerth marchnad yw'r pris y gallai ased yn rhesymol gyrraedd ar y farchnad agored ar ddyddiad ei waredu. Ar gyfer cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau a ddyfynnir ar Restr Ddyddiol Swyddogol y Gyfnewidfa Stoc, mewn amgylchiadau arferol y gwerth marchnad yw'r isaf o:

  • y ffigur un chwarter i fyny o'r isaf o'r 2 bris yn y dyfyniad ar gyfer y diwrnod perthnasol
  • y ffigur hanner ffordd rhwng y prisiau uchaf a'r isaf o'r bargeinion a gofnodwyd am y diwrnod hwnnw

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach ewch i Nodiadau Crynhoi Enillion Cyfalaf

Am ragor o wybodaeth am ddefnyddio gwerth marchnad, ewch i www.gov.uk.capital-gains-tax/market-value

English Content:
You may want to reduce your payments on account (including reducing to nil) if you expect:

  • your 2016-17 income to be lower than 2016 to 2017
  • your allowances or reliefs to be higher

or more of your income will be taxed at source, because

  • it will be taxed under PAYE
  • it will be covered by subcontractor deductions
  • you will have more savings income

Choose 'Yes' from the drop-down menu if you're claiming to reduce your Payment on Account otherwise, select 'No'.

If you want to reduce your payments on account, you must make a reasonable estimate of the difference between the Income Tax you expect to pay in 2017 to 2018 and your Income Tax on this return. You can reduce each of your payments by half of this difference. If you decide later that your reduced payments are still too high you can make a claim to reduce your payments on account online or you can write to HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) saying why you're claiming to reduce again. Make sure the payments you make, by 31 January 2018 and 31 July 2018, will add up to your best estimate of your tax bill for 2017 to 2018.

If your 2 payments on account turn out to be different from your 2017 to 2018 tax bill HMRC will:

  • credit you with interest if you've paid more than you needed to
  • charge interest if you've paid less than you needed to

Your 2 payments on account should be the smaller of the actual tax, Student Loan repayments and Class 4 NICs due (net of tax deducted at source and tax credits on dividends) for 2016 to 2017 or 2017 to 2018. If you've been careless or fraudulent in claiming to reduce your payments on account, HMRC may charge a penalty. If you decide later that you've reduced too much, you can revise your claim upwards and/or pay more in line with your revised estimate. But if you don't make a claim, HMRC may allocate additional amounts paid to other outstanding liabilities.
Welsh Content:
Efallai yr hoffech ostwng eich taliadau ar gyfrif (gan gynnwys eu gostwng i ddim) os ydych yn disgwyl:

  • i'ch incwm 2017 i 2017 fod yn is na 2016 i 2017
  • i'ch lwfansau neu ryddhad i fod yn uwch

neu y bydd mwy o'ch incwm yn cael ei drethu wrth y ffynhonnell, oherwydd

  • bydd yn cael ei drethu o dan TWE
  • bydd yn cael ei gwmpasu gan ddidyniadau isgontractwr
  • bydd gennych fwy o incwm o gynilion

Dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen os ydych yn gwneud cais i ostwng eich Taliad ar Gyfrif, fel arall, dewiswch 'Na'.

Os ydych am ostwng eich taliadau ar gyfrif, mae'n rhaid i chi wneud amcangyfrif rhesymol o'r gwahaniaeth rhwng y Dreth Incwm y disgwyliwch ei thalu yn 2017 i 2017 a'ch Treth Incwm ar y ffurflen dreth hon. Gallwch ostwng bob un o'ch taliadau gan hanner y gwahaniaeth hwn. Os ydych yn penderfynu'n hwyrach bod eich taliadau gostyngol yn dal i fod yn rhy uchel, gallwch wneud cais i ostwng eich taliadau ar gyfrif ar-lein neu gallwch ysgrifennu at Gyllid a Thollau EM i ddweud pam eich bod yn gwneud cais i ostwng eto. Sicrhewch fod y taliadau rydych yn eu gwneud, erbyn 31 Ionawr 2017 a 31 Gorffennaf 2017, yn gyfwerth â'ch amcangyfrif gorau o'ch bil treth ar gyfer 2017 i 2017.

Os bydd eich 2 daliad ar gyfrif yn wahanol i'ch bil treth ar gyfer 2017 i 2017, bydd Cyllid a Thollau EM yn:

  • eich credydu â llog os ydych wedi talu mwy nag yr oedd angen i chi
  • codi llog os ydych wedi talu llai nag yr oedd angen i chi

Dylai eich 2 daliad ar gyfrif fod y lleiaf o'r dreth wirioneddol, ad-daliadau Benthyciad Myfyrwyr a CYG Dosbarth 4 sy'n ddyledus (ar ôl didynnu treth wrth y ffynhonnell a chredydau treth ar ddifidendau) ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 neu 2017 i 2017. Os ydych wedi bod yn esgeulus neu'n dwyllodrus wrth wneud cais i ostwng eich taliadau ar gyfrif, efallai y bydd CThEM yn codi cosb arnoch. Os ydych yn penderfynu yn hwyrach eich bod wedi gofyn am ostyngiad gormodol, gallwch ddiwygio eich cais i fyny a/neu dalu mwy yn unol â'ch amcangyfrif diwygiedig. Ond os nad ydych yn gwneud cais, gall CThEM ddyrannu symiau ychwanegol a delir i rwymedigaethau eraill sy'n ddyledus.

English Content:
Enter your reference (for example, a number or brief description) for the gain. This will be used to identify the gain and associated taper rate in the summary table and in the summary of gains after applying taper relief.

If the gain arises on an asset which was not wholly a business asset or a non-business asset during the period you held it from 6 April 1998, the gain must be appropriately apportioned between the business and non-business elements. Part of the gain will qualify for the business asset rate of taper relief and the other part for the non-business asset rate of taper relief (see Help Sheet 279).

If you have to apportion a gain between business and non-business elements, treat the two parts as separate gains for the purposes of this calculator, one gain attracting business taper relief and the other non-business taper relief.

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com
Welsh Content:
Nodwch eich cyfeirnod (er enghraifft, rhif neu ddisgrifiad byr) ar gyfer yr ennill. Defnyddir hwn i adnabod yr ennill a'r rhyddhad meinhau sydd ynghlwm wrtho yn y tabl crynhoi a chrynodeb o'r enillion ar ôl cymhwyso'r rhyddhad meinhau.

Os cododd yr ennill ar ased nad oedd yn gyfan gwbl yn ased busnes neu'r tu allan i'r busnes yn ystod y cyfnod yr oedd yn eich meddiant o 6 Ebrill 1998, rhaid dosrannu'r ennill fel y bo'n briodol rhwng y busnes a'r elfennau nad ydynt yn ymwneud â'r busnes. Bydd rhan o'r ennill yn gymwys am ryddhad meinhau ar gyfradd ased busnes a bydd y rhan arall ar gyfer rhyddhad meinhau ar gyfradd ased nad yw'n ymwneud â'r busnes (gweler Taflen Gymorth 279).

Welsh Content:
Ar sail yr hyn a gofnodwyd gennych dyma gyfanswm eich derbyniadau gwaredu ar gyfer yr holl gyfranddaliadau a gwarantau a restrir cyn i ryddhad, ceisiadau neu ddewisiadau gael eu gwneud.

Y ffigur a ddangosir yma yw cyfanswm y derbyniadau gwaredu a gynhwyswyd yn y taflenni gwaith ar gyfer cyfrifo enillion cyfalaf a gwblhawyd gennych ar gyfer cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau a restrwyd yn ogystal â derbyniadau gwaredu gwarediadau o'r fath a nodwyd gennych ar wahân

Sylwer, mewn rhai amgylchiadau dylai'r swm a gewch gael ei ddisodli yn eich cyfrifiad gan werth marchnad yr ased rydych yn ei waredu. Dylech ddefnyddio gwerth marchnad yr ased yn lle'r pris a gawsoch os rhoddwyd yr ased gennych, os gwerthwyd yr ased am lai na'i werth llawn yn fwriadol, neu os gwaredwyd yr ased i berson cysylltiol.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach gweler Nodiadau Crynhoi Enillion Cyfalaf (PDF)

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

Welsh Content: Mae hwn yn grynodeb o'r lwfansau cyfalaf ar gyfer eich ffurflen dreth 2008-09 o'ch holl daflenni gwaith. Bydd 'Defnyddiwch y ffigurau hyn' yn disodli unrhyw ffigurau' y gallech fod wedi eu nodi'n uniongyrchol yn y blychau enillion cyfalaf ar eich ffurflen dreth.

English Content:
Enter the total of all unused allowable losses you have available from the year and earlier years, to be carried forward to later years. Include any unused clogged losses. To ensure they're correctly used in future years keep a separate record of each of your unused clogged losses. You should also keep separate records of both unused losses claimed for 1996 to 1997 and later years and for 1995 to 1996 and earlier years. Losses for 1996 to 1997 and later years must be used first.

A loss arising on a disposal of an asset which is exempt from Capital Gains Tax will not usually be an allowable loss.

Clogged losses can only be set against gains of certain types. The most common type of clogged loss is a loss on a disposal to a connected person. The other clogged loss is a loss transferred to you after 15 June 1999 by trustees when you become absolutely entitled to settled property.
Welsh Content:
Nodwch gyfanswm yr holl golledion caniataol sydd ar gael gennych o'r flwyddyn a blynyddoedd cynharach nas defnyddiwyd, i'w cario ymlaen i flynyddoedd diweddarach. Cynhwyswch unrhyw golledion rhwystredig nas defnyddiwyd. I sicrhau eu bod yn cael eu defnyddio'n gywir mewn blynyddoedd i ddod, dylech gadw cofnod ar wahân o'r colledion rhwystredig nas defnyddiwyd. Dylech gadw cofnodion ar wahân hefyd o'r colledion nas defnyddiwyd a hawliwyd ar gyfer 1996-97 a blynyddoedd diweddarach yn ogystal â'r rhai a hawliwyd ar gyfer 1995-96 a blynyddoedd cynharach. Rhaid defnyddio colledion 1996-97 a blynyddoedd diweddarach yn gyntaf.

Fel arfer ni fydd colled sy'n codi wrth waredu ased sydd wedi ei eithrio rhag Treth Enillion Cyfalaf yn golled caniataol.

Gellir gwrthbwyso colledion rhwystredig yn erbyn mathau penodol o enillion yn unig. Y math mwyaf cyffredin o golled rhwystredig yw colled sy'n codi wrth waredu i berson cysylltiedig. Colled rwystredig arall yw colled a drosglwyddwyd i chi ar ôl 15 Mehefin 1999 gan ymddiriedolwyr pan gawsoch hawl absoliwt i eiddo setledig.

English Content:
Based upon your entries this is the total of all your allowable costs and for your disposals of property and other assets (other than disposals of shares and securities). Allowable costs will usually include the purchase price, any improvement expenditure, any incidental costs of acquisition, and any incidental costs of disposal.

The figure shown here is the total of allowable costs included in capital gains computation worksheets you have completed for disposals of property and other assets (other than disposals of shares and securities) plus the allowable costs for such disposals that you have entered separately.

Fel arfer bydd costau caniataol yn cynnwys y pris prynu, unrhyw wariant ar welliannau, unrhyw fân gostau caffael, ac unrhyw fân gostau gwaredu.

Y ffigur a ddangosir yma yw cyfanswm y costau caniataol a gynhwyswyd ar y taflenni gwaith ar gyfer cyfrifo enillion cyfalaf a gwblhawyd gennych ar gyfer gwarediadau o eiddo ac asedion eraill (ac eithrio gwarediadau o gyfranddaliadau a gwarantau) yn ogystal â'r costau caniataol ar gyfer gwarediadau o'r fath a nodwyd gennych ar wahân.

The notional income tax relates to stock dividends the partnership has received from UK companies, non-qualifying distributions, and to loans made to the partnership by a company which are written off.

You will find this figure in box 27 on your partnership return.

Mae'r dreth incwm dybiannol mewn perthynas â difidendau stoc a dderbyniwyd gan y bartneriaeth o gwmnïau, dosbarthiadau anghymwysol, a benthyciadau y DU a wnaed i'r bartneriaeth gan gwmni ac sydd wedi eu dileu.

English Content:
If you want to claim to deduct losses from chargeable gains of an earlier year, to claim capital losses against your income of this tax year or the previous year or to deduct income losses of this tax year from capital gains of this tax year please choose 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, choose 'No'.

Most people will need to choose 'No' because you can't usually set-off capital losses against income or against gains of an earlier year or income losses against capital gains.

For further information please view the:

  • Capital Gains Summary Notes
  • Help Sheet 282 - Death, personal representatives and legatees
  • Help Sheet 286 - Negligible value claims and Income Tax losses on disposals of shares you have subscribed for in qualifying trading companies
  • Help Sheet 297 - Enterprise Investment Scheme and Capital Gains Tax
  • Help Sheet 227 - Losses
Welsh Content:
Os ydych am wneud cais i ddidynnu colledion o enillion trethadwy o flwyddyn gynharach, i hawlio colledion cyfalaf yn erbyn eich incwm am y flwyddyn dreth hon neu'r flwyddyn flaenorol neu i ddidynnu colledion incwm y flwyddyn dreth hon o enillion cyfalaf o'r flwyddyn dreth hon, dewiswch 'Ydw' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Nac ydw'.

Bydd yn rhaid i'r rhan fwyaf o bobl ddewis 'Nac ydw' oherwydd ni allwch fel arfer osod colledion cyfalaf yn erbyn incwm nac yn erbyn enillion o flwyddyn gynharach na cholledion incwm yn erbyn enillion cyfalaf.

Am ragor o wybodaeth gweler:

  • Nodiadau Crynhoi Enillion Cyfalaf (PDF 127K)
  • Taflen Gymorth 282 - Death, personal representatives and legatees (PDF 62K)
  • Taflen Gymorth 286 - Negligible value claims and Income Tax losses on disposals of shares you have subscribed for in qualifying trading companies (PDF 75K)
  • Taflen Gymorth 297 - Enterprise Investment Scheme and Capital Gains Tax (PDF 80K)
  • Taflen Gymorth 227 - Losses (PDF 74K)

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
As the tax charges on short service refunds of contributions, serious ill-health lump sums paid after reaching age 75 and lump sum death benefit payments aren't charges on income, they aren't exempted by any of the UK's Double Taxation Arrangements.

If a payment gives rise to such a charge, however, you can receive credit for foreign tax paid on the payment that can be set against the charge.

If you've paid foreign tax on any payments you've entered in fields:

  • 'Taxable short service refund of contributions (overseas pension schemes only)' and/or
  • 'Taxable lump sum death benefit payment and serious ill-health lump sums (overseas pension schemes only)' enter the sterling equivalent of the tax paid in this field.

Add the amounts together where foreign tax has been paid on each type of payment. Convert the foreign tax paid into sterling at the rate of exchange prevailing on the date of each tax payment.
Welsh Content:
Gan fod y taliadau treth ar ad-daliadau trethadwy o gyfraniadau am wasanaeth byr, cyfandaliadau afiechyd difrifol a delir ar ôl cyrraedd 75 mlwydd oed a chyfandaliadau budd-dal marwolaeth yn daliadau ar incwm, nid ydynt wedi'u heithrio gan unrhyw un o Drefniadau Trethiant Dwbl y DU.

Fodd bynnag, os bydd taliad yn achosi codiant, gallwch dderbyn credyd am dreth dramor a dalwyd ar y taliad a gellir ei osod yn erbyn y codiant (a'r gordal).

Os ydych wedi talu treth dramor ar unryw daliadau rydych wedi'u nodi mewn blychau:

  • 'Ad-daliad trethadwy o gyfraniadau am wasanaeth byr (cynlluniau pensiwn tramor yn unig):' a/neu
  • 'Cyfandaliad budd-dal marwolaeth trethadwy a chyfandaliadau afiechyd difrifol (cynlluniau pensiwn tramor yn unig)'

nodwch gyfwerth y dreth a dalwyd mewn sterling yn y blwch hwn.

Ychwanegwch y symiau at ei gilydd pan fo treth dramor wedi'i thalu ar bob math o daliad. Troswch y dreth tramor a dalwyd mewn i sterling ar y gyfradd gyfnewid ar ddyddiad bob taliad treth.

English Content: You can use this worksheet to help you calculate the total amount of your interest from UK banks and building societies, where no tax has been deducted. You may enter up to ten items.
Welsh Content: Gallwch ddefnyddio'r daflen waith hon i'ch helpu i gyfrifo cyfanswm y llog a gawsoch o fanciau a chymdeithasau adeiladu'r DU, pan fo treth heb ei didynnu. Gallwch nodi hyd at ddeg eitem. Mae'r daflen waith hon at eich defnydd chi yn unig ac ni chaiff ei hanfon at Gyllid a Thollau EM pan gyflwynir eich ffurflen dreth. Fodd bynnag, caiff copi ei chynnwys pan fyddwch yn argraffu eich ffurflen dreth, at ddibenion eich cofnodion. Cyngor ar gyfer deiliaid cyfrifon ar y cyd.Dylech gynnwys ceiniogau. Talgrynnir cyfanswm eich incwm i lawr i'r bunt agosaf ar eich ffurflen dreth - bydd hyn yn fanteisiol i chi.

English Content: There are worksheets that will help calculate these allowances - but they cannot be used in all circumstances. Please read circumstances when you cannot use the worksheets first. If you cannot use them, or if you want to work out the allowances yourself, read the help about entering your own figures before completing the boxes below.
Welsh Content: Mae taflenni gwaith ar gael a fydd yn eich helpu i gyfrifo'r lwfansau hyn ond ni ellir eu defnyddio yn yr holl amgylchiadau sy'n codi. Darllenwch amgylchiadau pan na allwch ddefnyddio'r taflenni gwaith yn gyntaf. Os na allwch eu defnyddio, neu os ydych am gyfrifo'r lwfansau eich hun, darllenwch y 'cymorth' ynglyn â nodi eich ffigurau eich hun cyn cwblhau'r blychau isod. Defnyddiwch y taflenni gwaith ar gyfer lwfansau cyfalaf

English Content: Submission receipt
Welsh Content: Derbynneb gyflwyno

English Content:
You should receive a certificate (a 'chargeable event' certificate) from:

  • a UK insurance company
  • a UK friendly society
  • trustees of a trust you've set up or contributed to telling you about a chargeable event gain made in connection with a life insurance policy, capital redemption policy or life annuity. If you own the policy or annuity jointly with your spouse or civil partner, only enter your half share of the gain

UK insurers are required by law to issue a certificate if they know a gain has been made. HM Revenue and Customs may also have received a copy of the certificate. In some cases, the insurer may have sent you more than one certificate relating to a particular gain, with the later certificate showing a revised figure of benefits paid or amount of chargeable event gain. In this case, you should enter the details of the later certificate.

For all events other than sales or assignments, the certificate will show:

  • details of the policy
  • the type of event and the date it occurred - if there is one date make sure it falls in the year ended 5 April 2017, if there are two dates, make sure the later one falls in the year ended 5 April 2017
  • the number of years since you took out the policy, or since the last event
  • the amount of the gain
  • whether tax is treated as paid on the gain and, if so, how much

Tick this check box if you received income from Life insurance gains.
Welsh Content:
Dylech dderbyn tystysgrif (tystysgrif 'digwyddiad trethadwy') gan:

  • Cwmni yswiriant yn y DU
  • Cymdeithas gyfeillgar yn y DU
  • Ymddiriedolwyr ymddiriedolaeth a sefydlwyd gennych neu a wnaethoch gyfrannu ati yn sôn am ddigwyddiad trethadwy a wnaed mewn cysylltiad â pholisi yswiriant bywyd, polisi adbrynu cyfalaf neu flwydd-dal bywyd. Os ydych yn berchen y polisi neu'r blwydd-dal ar y cyd gyda'ch priod neu eich partner sifil, dylech nodi eich hanner chi o'r ennill yn unig.

Rhaid i yswirwyr yn y DU roi tystysgrif yn unol â'r gyfraith os yw'n hysbys iddynt fod ennill wedi codi. Efallai y bydd CThEM wedi derbyn copi o'r dystysgrif hefyd. Mewn rhai achosion, gall yr yswiriwr fod wedi anfon mwy na un dystysgrif yn ymwneud ag ennill penodol atoch, gyda'r dystysgrif ddiweddarach yn dangos ffigur diwygiedig o fudd-daliadau a dalwyd neu swm ennill y digwyddiad trethadwy. Yn yr achos hwn, dylech nodi manylion y dystysgrif ddiweddarach.

Bydd y dystysgrif yn dangos y canlynol ar gyfer pob digwyddiad ac eithrio gwerthiannau ac aseiniadau:

  • Manylion y polisi
  • Math o ddigwyddiad a'r dyddiad y digwyddodd. Os oes un dyddiad gwnewch yn sicr ei fod yn disgyn yn y flwyddyn sy'n dod i ben 5 Ebrill 2017. Os oes dau ddyddiad, gwnewch yn sicr bod yr un diweddaraf yn disgyn yn y flwyddyn a ddaeth i ben 5 Ebrill 2017
  • Nifer y blynyddoedd ers i chi drefnu'r polisi, neu er y digwyddiad diwethaf Swm yr ennill
  • P'un a ystyrir bod treth wedi ei thalu ar yr ennill, ac os felly, faint.

Dewiswch y blwch gwirio hwn os cawsoch incwm o enillion yswiriant bywyd.

English Content:
If all you have is a redundancy payment up to £30,000 against which your employer has allowed an exemption, please just enter the amount of the payment in the 'Compensation and lump sum £30,000 exception' field.

For example, if you received a redundancy payment of £10,000 it would be covered by the £30,000 exemption so do not make an entry in the 'Redundancy and other lump sum and compensation payments' field and enter £10,000 in the 'Compensation and lump sum £30,000 exception' field.

If your redundancy payment is more than the £30,000 exemption limit, enter the amount over the limit in the 'Redundancy and other lump sum and compensation payments' field, the tax deducted in the 'Tax taken off boxes above' field and the £30,000 limit in the 'Compensation and lump sum £30,000 exception' field.
Welsh Content:
Os mai'r unig beth sydd gennych yw taliad colli swydd o hyd at £30,000 y mae'ch cyflogwr wedi caniatáu eithriad yn ei erbyn, nodwch swm y taliad yn y maes 'Eithriad iawndal a chyfandaliad o £30,000'.

Er enghraifft, os cawsoch daliad colli swydd o £10,000 byddai wedi'i gwmpasu gan yr eithriad o £30,000 felly peidiwch â nodi dim yn y maes 'Taliadau colli swydd a mathau eraill o gyfandaliadau ac iawndal' a nodwch £10,000 yn y maes 'Eithriad iawndal a chyfandaliad o £30,000'.

Os bydd eich taliad colli swydd yn fwy na therfyn yr eithriad sef £30,000, nodwch y swm sydd dros y terfyn yn y maes 'Taliadau colli swydd a mathau eraill o gyfandaliadau ac iawndal', y dreth a ddidynnwyd yn y maes 'Treth a ddidynnwyd o'r blychau isod' a'r terfyn o £30,000 yn y maes 'Eithriad iawndal a chyfandaliad o £30,000'.

Er enghraifft, os cawsoch £40,000 byddech yn nodi £10,000 yn y maes 'Taliadau colli swydd a mathau eraill o gyfandaliadau ac iawndal', y dreth a ddidynnwyd yn y maes 'Treth a ddidynnwyd o'r blychau isod', a £30,000 yn y maes 'Eithriad iawndal a chyfandaliad o £30,000'.

Ar sail yr hyn a gofnodwyd gennych dyma gyfanswm derbyniadau gwaredu ar gyfer eich holl warediadau o gyfranddaliadau a gwarantau nas rhestrwyd cyn i unrhyw ryddhad, ceisiadau neu ddewisiadaugael eu gwneud

Y ffigur a ddangosir yma yw cyfanswm y derbyniadau gwaredu a gynhwyswyd yn y taflenni gwaith ar gyfer cyfrifo enillion cyfalaf a gwblhawyd gennych ar gyfer cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau nas rhestrwyd yn ogystal â derbyniadau gwaredu gwarediadau o'r fath a nodwyd gennych ar wahân.

Sylwer mewn rhai amgylchiadau dylai'r swm a gewch gael ei ddisodli yn eich cyfrifiad gan werth marchnad yr ased rydych yn ei waredu. Dylech ddefnyddio gwerth werth marchnad yr ased yn lle'r pris a gawsoch os rhoddwyd yr ased gennych, os gwerthwyd yr ased am lai na'i werth llawn yn fwriadol, neu os gwaredwyd yr ased i berson cysylltiol.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach gweler Nodiadau Crynhoi Enillion Cyfalaf.

Am ragor o wybodaeth am ddefnyddio gwerth marchnad, ewch i www.gov.uk.capital-gains-tax/market-value

English Content:
Special arrangements may apply to:

  • foster carers and shared lives carers. Help Sheet 236 Qualifying care relief: Foster carers, adult placement carers, kinship carers and staying put carers has more information.
  • farmers and market gardeners, and creators of literary or artistic works (you may be able to claim averaging). Help Sheets 224, 232 and 234 may be useful.
  • trades and professions wholly carried on abroad. If the remittance basis applies to you refer to Help Sheet 264
  • barristers (or advocates in Scotland). In the first 7 years of your practice you can work out your profits on a cash or fee notes delivered basis. Subsequent profits must be calculated in accordance with GAAP (also known as the 'true and fair basis') and you must work out the adjustment to move you onto that basis.

There is more information in the guidance notes issued by the Bar Council of England and Wales, the Faculty of Advocates and the Northern Ireland Bar Library.

For more information view the:

  • Help Sheet 224 - Farmers and market gardeners
  • Help Sheet 232 - Farm stock valuation
  • Help Sheet 234 - Averaging for creators of literary or artistic works
  • Help Sheet 236 - Qualifying care relief. Foster carers, adult placement carers, kinship carers and staying put carers
  • Help Sheet 264 - Remittance Basis

If special arrangements apply select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.
Welsh Content:
Gall trefniadau arbennig fod yn gymwys ar gyfer:

  • gofalwyr maeth a gofalwyr bywydau ar y cyd. Gweler Taflen Gymorth 236 am fwy o wybodaeth Cymwys rhyddhad gofal: Gofalwyr maeth, gofalwyr lleoliadau oedolion, gofalwyr a gofalwyr carennydd Rhowch Aros, am ragor o wybodaeth.
  • ffermwyr a garddwyr masnachol, crewyr gweithiau llenyddol neu artistig (efallai y gallech hawlio cyfartalu). Gallai Taflenni Cymorth 224,232 a 234 fod yn ddefnyddiol.
  • masnachau a phroffesiynau a gynhelir yn gyfan gwbl dramor. Os ydy'r sail trosglwyddo yn gymwys i chi, darllenwch yr arweiniad ar wefan CThEM.
  • y rheiny sy'n darparu gwasanaethau o dan gytundebau ac os ydy'r cytundebau hynny'n pontio dros y dyddiad cyfrifyddu. Cyhoeddwyd yr arweiniad 'Urgent Issues Task Force Abstract 40 (UITF 40)' gan y Bwrdd Safonau Cyfrifyddu ac efallai y bu rhaid i chi gyfrifo eich trosiant mewn ffordd wahanol, gan arwain at addasiad.
  • bargyfreithwyr (neu adfocadau yn yr Alban - yn y saith mlynedd gyntaf pan fyddwch yn arfer eich crefft gallwch gyfrifo eich elw ar sail arian neu nodiadau ffioedd a roddwyd. Rhaid cyfrifo'r elw dilynol yn unol â GAAP (a elwir y sail 'gwir a theg' hefyd) a rhaid i chi gyfrifo'r addasiad i'ch trosglwyddo i'r sail honno. Ceir fwy o wybodaeth yn y nodiadau arweiniad a gyhoeddir gan Gyngor y Bar Cymru a Lloegr, y Faculty of Advocates a'r Northern Ireland Bar Library.

Am fwy o fanylion gweler:

  • Taflen Gymorth 224 - Farmers and market gardeners
  • Taflen Gymorth 232 - Farm stock valuation
  • Taflen Gymorth 234 - Averaging for creators of literary or artistic works
  • Taflen Gymorth 236 - Qualifying care relief: foster carers, adult placement carers, kinship carers and staying put carers
  • Taflen Gymorth 238 - Revenue recognition in service contracts
  • Taflen Gymorth 264 - Remittance basis

Os bydd trefniadau arbennig yn gymwys, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'.

English Content:
Repairs

Include expenses that prevent the property from deteriorating such as:

  • exterior and interior painting
  • damp treatment
  • stone cleaning
  • roof repairs
  • furniture repairs
  • repairs to any kind of machinery supplied with the property

Renewals

You can include the costs of renewing small items such as cutlery but, if you do, you can't claim the original costs or the wear and tear allowance. If you received any money for the items being replaced you should take that amount off the replacement costs. Don't claim for any element of improvement compared with the original item.
Welsh Content:
Atgyweirio
Dylech gynnwys treuliau sy'n atal yr eiddo rhag dirywio, er enghraifft:

  • paentio allanol a mewnol
  • trin lleithder
  • glanhau cerrig
  • atgyweirio'r to
  • atgyweirio dodrefn
  • atgyweirio unrhyw fath o beirianwaith a ddarparwyd gyda'r eiddo

Adnewyddu
Gallwch gynnwys y gost o adnewyddu eitemau bach hefyd, fel cyllyll a ffyrc, ond os gwnewch hynny, ni allwch hawlio'r costau gwreiddiol na'r lwfans traul. Os cawsoch unrhyw arian am yr eitemau a gafodd eu hamnewid, dylech dynnu'r swm hwnnw o gostau amnewid yr eitemau. Peidiwch â hawlio costau ar gyfer unrhyw elfen o welliant o'i gymharu â'r eitem wreiddiol.

English Content: Please enter your bank or building society account details so that we can send you any repayment due. Alternatively please tick the box 'I do not have a bank or building society account' and we will send you a cheque.
Welsh Content: Nodwch fanylion eich cyfrif banc neu gymdeithas adeiladu er mwyn i ni allu anfon atoch unrhyw ad-daliad dyledus.  Fel arall ticiwch y blwch 'Nid oes gennyf gyfrif banc na chymdeithas adeiladu' ac anfonwn siec atoch.

English Content:
If this company was a close company, select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.

A close company is, broadly, one that is controlled by:

  • 5 or fewer participators - those who have a share or an interest in the income or capital of the company, such as shareholders or some loan creditors
  • any number of participators if they are directors.
Welsh Content:
Os oedd hwn yn gwmni caeëdig, dewiswch 'Oedd' o'r gwymplen. Fel arall, dewiswch 'Nac oedd'.

Yn fras, mae cwmni caeëdig yn un a gaiff ei reoli gan:

  • bump neu lai o gyfranogwyr - y rheiny sydd â chyfran neu fudd yn incwm neu gyfalaf y cwmni, fel cyfranddalwyr neu rhai credydwyr benthyciad
  • unrhyw nifer o gyfranddalwyr os ydynt yn gyfarwyddwyr

English Content: The amount entered for 'Foreign tax for which tax credit relief not claimed' exceeds the maximum amount allowable based upon the information you have provided in the employment section of your Tax Return. Please amend.
Welsh Content: Mae'r swm a nodwyd ar gyfer 'Treth dramor na hawliwyd rhyddhad credyd treth ar ei chyfer' yn fwy na'r uchafswm caniataol, yn seiliedig ar yr wybodaeth yr ydych wedi'i rhoi yn adran cyflogaeth eich Ffurflen Dreth. Dylech ei ddiwygio.

English Content:
Choose the relevant code from the drop-down box. If you're making more than one claim enter 'MUL' or, if the claim or election is not listed, enter 'OTH'.

PRR - Private Residence Relief where Lettings Relief does not apply
LET - Private Residence Relief where Lettings Relief applies
GHO - Gift Hold-Over Relief
ROR - Rollover Relief
NVC - Negligible Value Claims
OTH - Other claims
MUL - If more than 1 code applies

You must make a claim or election by clearly stating it in your attached computation. Some claims have to be made on a separate claim form which you complete and attach to your Tax Return along with your computation.

You should state the amount of any relief or allowance you're claiming and if you're claiming that any listed shares or securities have become of negligible value you should include as disposal proceeds for the shares the value specified in your claim.

Private Residence Relief (PRR) where a dwelling house which can include:

  • a house
  • a flat
  • a houseboat or fixed caravan

Which is your:

  • only or main residence throughout your period of ownership
  • you have not been absent, other than an allowable period of absence or because you have been living in ‘job-related accommodation’ during your ‘period of ownership’
  • the garden or grounds including the buildings on them are not greater than the permitted area (5,000 square metres)

and no part of your home has been used exclusively for business purposes during your period of ownership.

Lettings Relief (LET) cannot be given if the dwelling house has been your only or main residence at some time in your period of ownership and has been let as residential accommodation.
Welsh Content: Os effeithir ar unrhyw warediadau gan gais neu ddewis Treth Enillion Cyfalaf a wnaed yn y Ffurflen Dreth hon, dewiswch 'Ydw' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Nac ydw'.

English Content:
The indexation allowance is worked out by multiplying the expenditure by the indexation factor for the month and year in which you incurred it.

The total indexation allowance for all items of expenditure (excluding the incidental costs of disposal) is deducted in calculating a gain on disposal of the asset.
Welsh Content:
Cyfrifir y lwfans mynegeio drwy luosi'r gwariant gyda'r ffactor mynegeio am y mis a'r flwyddyn cododd y gwariant.

Didynnir cyfanswm y lwfans mynegeio ar gyfer yr holl eitemau (ac eithrio'r mân gostau gwaredu) pan gyfrifir yr ennill wrth waredu'r ased.

Ni chaiff y swm a gyfrifir ei ddidynnu'n awtomatig. Nodwch y cyfanswm er mwyn ei ddefnyddio yng nghyfrifiant yr ennill ar yr ased hwn.

English Content: Have you already agreed that some of the minimum allowance is to go to your spouse or civil partner?
Welsh Content: A ydych eisoes wedi cytuno bod rhan o isafswm y lwfans i'w roi i'ch priod neu eich partner sifil?

English Content:
A married couple or civil partners may share the minimum amount of the allowance, but you must have asked HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) already to do this (either before 5 April 2016 or, if you married or formed a civil partnership during the year to 5 April 2017, by that date).

If you want to change the way the allowance is given for 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 please contact your HMRC office (it is already too late to make any change for 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017).

Please select 'Yes - All' or 'Yes - Half' from the drop-down menu if you have already agreed that some of the minimum allowance is to go to your spouse or civil partner otherwise, select 'No'.
Welsh Content:
Gall cwpl priod neu bartneriaid sifil rannu lleiafswm y lwfans, ond mae rhaid eich bod wedi gofyn i Gyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) eisoes i wneud hyn (naill ai cyn 5 Ebrill 2014 neu, os gwnaethoch briodi neu ffurfio partneriaeth sifil yn ystod y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2016, erbyn y dyddiad hwnnw).

Os ydych am newid y ffordd y rhoddir lwfans ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 cysylltwch â'ch swyddfa CThEM (mae eisoes yn rhy hwyr i wneud unrhyw newid ar gyfer 2014 i 2016).

Dewiswch 'Iawn - I Gyd' neu 'Iawn - Hanner' o'r ddewislen os ydych wedi cytuno eisoes bod peth o isafswm y lwfans i fynd i'ch priod neu bartner sifil, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'.

English Content:
Do not include questions in this box as we cannot answer specific questions about your tax return.

Please enter a description if you have made entries in either or both 'Other taxable income (before tax and expenses taken off)' and 'Benefit from pre-owned assets'.

You can enter a maximum of 240 characters, including spaces. You can only enter letters and numbers and the special characters '()*,-./£@&.

Please do not use the 'Enter' (or 'Return') key on the keyboard when entering information into, or moving away from, this field. Use the spacebar on the keyboard if you need to make more than one entry.

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 or 6 April 2018 to 5 April 2019 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HMRC know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.
Welsh Content:
Peidiwch â chynnwys cwestiynau yn y blwch hwn gan na allwn ateb unrhyw gwestiynau penodol o'ch ffurflen dreth.

Rhowch ddisgrifiad os ydych wedi cofnodi rhywbeth yn naill ai 'Incwm trethadwy arall (cyn didynnu treth a threuliau)' neu 'Buddiant o asedion yr oeddech yn berchen arnynt eisoes' neu'r ddau.

Gallwch nodi hyd at 240 nod, gan gynnwys bylchau Gallwch nodi llythrennau a rhifau a'r nodau arbennig '()*,-./£@& yn unig.

Peidiwch â gwasgu'r botwm 'Enter' (neu 'Return') wrth nodi gwybodaeth yn y maes hwn, neu wrth symud oddi yno.

English Content: The date entered for 'If you left the partnership after 5 April 2016 and before 6 April 2017, enter the date you left' cannot be before the date entered for 'If you became a partner after 5 April 2016, enter the date you joined the partnership'. Please amend.

English Content:
When basis periods overlap (for example in the first 2 years of business or following a change in accounting date) you should keep a record of both the overlap profit and the overlap period. The overlap profit is carried forward each year until you are able to claim overlap relief.

Overlap relief used this year

You may be entitled to overlap relief if you:

  • sold or closed down your business, and your basis period this year does not begin on 6 April
  • changed your accounting date resulting in a change of basis period, and your basis period this year is more than 12 months long

For help on working out the overlap follow the link Help Sheet 222 - How to calculate your profits.
Welsh Content:
Pan fydd cyfnodau sail yn gorgyffwrdd (er engraifft yn nwy flynedd gyntaf y busnes neu'n dilyn newid mewn dyddiad cyfrifyddu) dylech gadw cofnod o'r elw gorgyffwrdd yn ogystal â'r cyfnod gorgyffwrdd. Caiff yr elw gorgyffwrdd ei gario ymlaen bob blwyddyn tan eich bod yn gallu hawlio rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd.

Rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd a ddefnyddiwyd eleni

Efallai bod hawl gennych i ryddhad gorgyffwrdd:

  • Os gwnaethoch werthu neu gau eich busnes, ac nid yw eich cyfnod sail y flwyddyn hon yn cychwyn ar 6 Ebrill

  • neu os gwnaethoch newidioch eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu eleni gan arwain at newid y cyfnod sail, efallai y gallech hawlio rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd os ydy'r ac mae eich cyfnod sail eleni hwnnw bellach yn hwy na 12 mis o hyd.

Mae Taflen Gymorth 222 - How to calculate your taxable profits yn esbonio sut i gyfrifo'r rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd i'w nodi yma.

English Content:
Traditional accounting (accruals basis)

Turnover consists of your total sales, takings, fees or money earned by your business for the period up to the date your books and accounts are made up to.

Turnover includes:

  • cash or cheque
  • fees, tips and commissions
  • the value of any payments 'in kind' (that is not payment by cheque or cash) for work done or goods sold

It's the money due to you up to your end of the tax year (5 April 2017) - whether or not you have actually been paid. It doesn't include Business Start-up Allowance.

Cash Basis Accounting

You can start using cash basis from 6 April 2014 and if you:

  • run a small business e.g sole traders and partnerships
  • have an income of £83,000 or less a year (this is the threshold to register for VAT)

You can also decide not to use cash basis if it's not suited to tour business.

Income and expenses under cash basis

In cash basis accounting you only count the money you've actually received and expenses you’ve paid up to your end of tax year (5 April 2017) – money you're owed isn't counted until you receive it.

Capital allowances

If you use cash basis accounting and buy a car for your business, you can claim this as a capital allowance. However, all other items you buy and keep for your business should be claimed as allowable expenses in the normal way.

Losses

  • any losses you make can't be set off against your other income
  • terminal loss must be set against any profits (after deducting losses brought forward) from the same business taxed in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017
  • any remaining terminal losses must be set against the profits of the same business taxed in the 3 prior years. Starting with the latest year

Other considerations

  • businesses using traditional accounting (accruals basis) might have to make some adjustments if they switch to cash basis
  • you can choose how you record when you receive or pay money (e.g. the date the money enters or leaves your account or the date a cheque is written) but you must use the same method each tax year
  • a loss incurred by a business adopting 'Cash basis' can only carry forward. No sideways or earlier year's tax relief can be claimed
  • your business grows during the tax year you can stay in the scheme up to an income of £166,000. Above that you'll need to use traditional accounting for your Income Tax return for the next tax year, unless your income drops back below the VAT threshold in place at the end of that tax year

For further guidance on cash basis check the help on the question 'Did you use the cash basis, money actually received and paid out, to calculate your income and expense?'
Welsh Content:
Mae trosiant yn cynnwys eich holl werthiannau, derbyniadau, ffioedd neu arian a enillwyd gan eich busnes, am y cyfnod hyd at ddyddiad cau eich llyfrau a'ch cyfrifon.

Mae trosiant yn cynnwys:

  • arian neu sieciau
  • ffioedd, cildyrnau a chomisiynau
  • gwerth unrhyw daliadau 'mewn nwyddau'(hynny yw nid taliad ar ffurf siec neu arian)am waith a wnaed neu nwyddau a werthwyd
  • os ydych yn defnyddio sail arian parod dylech gynnwys dim ond yr arian y gwnaethoch ei dderbyn mewn gwirionedd yn y flwyddyn dreth

Dyma'r arian sy'n ddyledus i chi hyd at ddiwedd eich blwyddyn (5 Ebrill 2017) - p'un a ydych wedi cael eich talu ai peidio.

Cyfrifyddu ar Sail Arian Parod

Gallwch ddechrau defnyddio sail arian parod o 6 Ebrill 2014 ac os:

  • ydych yn rhedeg busnes bach e.e. unig fasnachwyr a phartneriaethau
  • oes gennych incwm o £83,000 neu'n llai'r flwyddyn (dyma'r trothwy ar gyfer cofrestru ar gyfer TAW)

Gallwch, hefyd, benderfynu peidio â defnyddio sail arian parod os nad yw'n gweddu ar gyfer eich busnes.

Incwm a threuliau o dan sail arian parod

Wrth ddefnyddio cyfrifo ar sail arian parod, rydych ond yn cyfri'r arian a dderbyniwyd gennych mewn gwirionedd a'r treuliau a daloch hyd at ddiwedd y flwyddyn dreth (5 Ebrill 2017) - ni chaff arian sy'n ddyledus i chi ei gyfrifo hyd nes eich bod wedi ei dderbyn.

Lwfansau cyfalaf

Os ydych yn defnyddio cyfrifo ar sail arian parod ac yn prynu car ar gyfer eich busnes, gallwch hawlio hwnnw fel lwfans cyfalaf. Fodd bynnag, dylid hawlio pob eitem arall a brynwch ac a gadwch ar gyfer eich busnes fel treuliau a ganiateir, yn y modd arferol.

Colledion

  • ni all colledion a wneir gennych gael eu gosod yn erbyn eich incwm arall
  • mae'n rhaid gosod colled derfynol yn erbyn elw (ar ôl didynnu colledion a ddygwyd ymlaen) o'r un busnes a drethwyd yn 2016 i 2017
  • mae'n rhaid gosod colledion terfynol sy'n weddill yn erbyn elw'r un busnes a drethwyd yn y 3 blynedd cyn hynny. Dylech ddechrau gyda'r flwyddyn fwyaf diweddar

English Content: Please enter the tax credit deducted as shown on your dividend voucher. You will get this information even if your dividends are paid direct into your bank or through your investment broker.
Welsh Content: Nodwch y credyd treth a ddidynnwyd fel y mae'n ymddangos ar eich taleb ddifidend. Byddwch yn cael yr wybodaeth hon hyd yn oed os telir eich difidend yn uniongyrchol i'ch cyfrif banc neu drwy eich brocer buddsoddiadau.

English Content:
You pay tax for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 according to the profits of your basis period. Once your business has been running for a couple of years, and your accounting period is established, your basis period is your accounting period.

If your business began in the year ending 5 April 2017 your basis period begins on the date you started in business and ends on 5 April 2017.

If your business began in the year ending 5 April 2016 and:

  • you have an accounting date in the year to 5 April 2016 and
    • it's more than 12 months after the date your business began, your basis period is the 12 months to that accounting date
    • it's less than 12 months after the date you started in business, your basis period is the 12 months beginning on the date you started
  • you don't have an accounting period ending in the year to 5 April 2017, your basis period is the year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017

If you don't have an accounting date ending in the year to 5 April 2017 your basis period is the year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017.

If your business ceased in the year to 5 April 2017, your basis period begins on the day following your last accounting date and ends on the day your business ceased.

If you've more than one set of accounts for your basis period complete separate Self-employment pages for each set of accounts, but only make entries in fields 'Date your basis period began' to 'Total taxable profits from this business' once, on the Self-employment pages for the most recent set of accounts.

Enter the date your basis period began here.
Welsh Content:
Rydych yn talu treth ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 yn unol ag elw eich cyfnod sail. Unwaith y byddwch wedi bod mewn busnes am tua dwy flynedd, ac mae eich cyfnod cyfrifyddu wedi ei sefydlu, eich cyfnod sail bydd eich cyfnod cyfrifyddu

Os dechreuodd eich busnes yn y flwyddyn yn dod i ben 5 Ebrill 2017, bydd eich cyfnod sail yn dechrau ar y dyddiad y dechreuodd eich busnes ac yn dod i ben ar 5 Ebrill 2017.

Os dechreuodd eich busnes yn y flwyddyn a ddaeth i ben 5 Ebrill 2016 ac:

  • mae gennych ddyddiad cyfrifyddu yn y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2016 ac
    • o mae'n hwy na 12 mis ar ôl y dyddiad y dechreuodd eich busnes, eich cyfnod sail yw'r 12 mis hyd at y dyddiad cyfrifyddu hwnnw
    • o mae'n llai na 12 mis ar ôl y dyddiad y dechreuodd eich busnes, eich cyfnod sail yw'r 12 mis yn dechrau ar y dyddiad y dechreuoch
  • nid oes gennych gyfnod cyfrifyddu sy'n dod i ben yn y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017, eich cyfnod sail yw'r flwyddyn 6 Ebrill 2016 hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017

Os nad oes gennych ddyddiad cyfrifyddu sy'n dod i ben yn y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017 eich cyfnod sail yw'r flwyddyn 6 Ebrill 2016 hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017.

Os daeth eich busnes i ben yn y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017, mae eich cyfnod sail yn dechrau ar y diwrnod sy'n dilyn eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu diwethaf ac yn dod i ben ar y diwrnod y daeth eich busnes i ben.

Os oes gennych fwy nag un set o gyfrifon ar gyfer eich cyfnod sail, llenwch dudalennau Hunangyflogaeth ar wahân ar gyfer pob un set o gyfrifon, ond gwnewch gofnodion dim ond unwaith ym mlychau 'Dyddiad y dechreuodd eich cyfnod sail' hyd at 'Cyfanswm elw trethadwy'r busnes hwn', ar y tudalennau Hunangyflogaeth ar gyfer y set o gyfrifon diweddaraf.

Nodwch y dyddiad y dechreuodd eich cyfnod sail.

English Content:
Seafarers are entitled to a 100% deduction from their seafaring earnings if they meet certain conditions:

  • they must work on a ship - offshore installations are not treated as ships - see EIM33103 and EIM33106
  • the names of the ships on which the employee has worked will be needed for the SA return
  • the claim must cover at least 365 days and they must be absent from the UK for a minimum of half of those days
  • the absence can be continuous or made up of a number of periods - details are included at EIM33004 and EIM33005 as well as in the Help Sheet 205 - Seafarers' Earnings Deduction, which will take you through the 'eligible' period calculation and work out the deduction to be entered in this field
  • their duties must be performed wholly or partly abroad

Claims can be made by UK residents via SA or EEA residents via R43M(SED) process.
Welsh Content:
Mae gan forwyr yr hawl i ddidyniad o 100% o'u henillion mordwyol cyn belled â'u bod yn bodloni amodau penodol:

  • mae'n rhaid eu bod yn gweithio ar long - ni chaiff safleoedd alltraeth eu trin fel llongau - gweler EIM33103 ac EIM33106
  • bydd angen enwau'r llongau mae'r cyflogai wedi gweithio arnynt ar gyfer y ffurflen dreth Hunanasesiad
  • mae'n rhaid bod y cais yn cwmpasu o leiaf 365 diwrnod ac mae'n rhaid eu bod yn absennol o'r DU am isafswm o hanner y diwrnodau hynny
  • gall yr absenoldeb fod yn un di-dor neu'n cynnwys nifer o gyfnodau wedi eu hychwanegu at ei gilydd - mae'r manylion yn EIM33004 ac EIM33005 yn ogystal â Thaflen Gymorth 205- 'Seafarers' earnings Deduction.' Bydd y daflen wybodaeth hon yn eich tywys drwy'r broses o gyfrifo'r cyfnod 'cymwys' a chyfrifo'r didyniad i'w roi yn y maes hwn
  • mae'n rhaid eu bod yn cyflawni eu dyletswyddau yn rhannol neu'n gyfan gwbl dramor

Gall preswylwyr y DU wneud ceisiadau drwy gyfrwng Hunanasesiad a phreswylwyr yr Ardal Economaidd Ewropeaidd drwy gyfrwng y broses R43M(SED).

English Content:
An entry will only be required in limited circumstances. These are:

  • If you've entered a positive figure in 'Averaging adjustment (only for farmers, market gardeners and creators of literacy or artistic works)' in the Self-employment or Partnership sections - relating to fluctuating profits from farming, market gardening & gardening

  • or

  • literary/artistic activities

  • or

  • claimed to carry back a loss in the Self-Employment, Partnership, Property or Capital Gains sections

  • AND

  • you've not already made a claim for losses to be carried back before you completed this Tax Return.

To calculate the amount to decrease the tax due, you need your Tax Calculation from the earlier year. (If you don't have this, ask HM Revenue & Customs for a copy.) Then recalculate your liability for that year taking into account the amounts you entered into the appropriate fields in the return.

The difference between the original and recalculated figures is the amount you should enter.
Welsh Content:
Bydd angen cofnod mewn amgylchiadau cyfyngedig yn unig Mae'r rhain yn cynnwys:

  • Os ydych wedi nodi ffigur positif yn 'Addasiad cyfartalu (ar gyfer ffermwyr, masnach-arddwyr a chrewyr gweithiau llenyddol neu artistig yn unig)' yn yr adrannau Hunangyflogaeth neu Bartneriaeth - yn ymwneud ag elw sy'n amrywio o ffermio, masnach-arddio
    neu
  • weithgareddau llenyddol/artistig
    neu
  • wedi gwneud cais i gario nôl colled yn yr adrannau Hunangyflogaeth, Partneriaeth, Eiddo neu Enillion Cyfalaf
    AC
  • nid ydych eisoes wedi gwneud cais ar gyfer colledion a gariwyd yn ôl cyn i chi gwblhau'r Ffurflen Dreth hon.

Er mwyn cyfrifo'r swm i ostwng y dreth sy'n ddyledus mae arnoch angen eich Cyfrifiad Treth o'r flwyddyn gynharach. (Os nad yw gennych gofynnwch i'ch swyddfa Cyllid a Thollau EM am gopi.) Yna ail-gyfrifwch eich rhwymedigaeth am y flwyddyn honno gan ystyried y symiau yr ydych wedi eu nodi yn y blychau priodol yn y ffurflen dreth.

Y gwahaniaeth rhwng y ffigur gwreiddiol a'r ffigur sydd wedi ei ail-gyfrifo yw'r swm y dylech ei nodi.

English Content:
If you owe less than £3,000 (Values from £1 to £2999) for the tax year 2016-2017 and want us to try collect the tax and Class 4 NICs through your 2018-2019 PAYE tax code, you must file and submit your 2016-2017 online Tax Return by 30 December 2017.

If you file and submit your 2016-2017 online Tax Return after the 30 December 2017 we cannot collect this tax through your 2018-2019 PAYE tax code as this option will no longer be available.
Welsh Content:

Os ydych yn cyflwyno eich Ffurflen Dreth ar-lein ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 ar ôl 30 Rhagfyr 2017, ni fyddwn yn gallu casglu'r dreth hon drwy eich cod treth TWE ar gyfer 2018 i 2019, gan na fydd yr opsiwn hwn ar gael o hynny ymlaen.

English Content: To calculate the amount to be entered you will need to estimate the difference between the Income Tax you expect to pay in 2016 to 2017 and your Income Tax due as shown on this Tax Return. You can reduce each of your payments by half this difference. You will need to enter the amount of each reduced Payment on Account (including the pence), or, 0, if appropriate. You will then need to enter the reason why you are reducing your Payments on Account in the 'Please explain why are you making the claim?' field.

English Content:
Overlap relief may be due for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 on your share of untaxed investment income if:

  • you ceased to be a partner in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017
  • the partnership changed its accounting date in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 and your basis period, is more than 12 months
  • the partnership's business ceased in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017

In such circumstances the relief is to be given first against your total untaxed income. If there is an excess, this can be set off against your total income for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017. For more information on how this relief is calculated follow the link Help Sheet 222 - How to calculate your taxable profits. This tells you how to work out overlap profits and how to claim overlap relief.

If you have any overlap relief to claim please enter it in this field.
Welsh Content:
Efallai bydd rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd yn ddyledus ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 ar eich cyfran o incwm heb ei drethu o fuddsoddi os:

  • rhoesoch y gorau i fod yn bartner yn 2016 i 2017
  • newidiodd y bartneriaeth ei dyddiad cyfrifo yn 2016 i 2017 ac mae eich cyfnod sail yn fwy na 12 mis
  • daeth busnes y bartneriaeth i ben yn 2016 i 2017

Yn y fath amgylchiadau, bydd y rhyddhad i'w rhoi'n gyntaf yn erbyn cyfanswm eich incwm sydd heb ei drethu. Os oes gormod, gall hyn gael ei wrthbwyso yn erbyn cyfanswm eich incwm ar gyfer 2016 i 2017. Am fwy o wybodaeth ar sut y cyfrifir y rhyddhad hwn, dilynwch y cysylltiad Tafen Gymorth 222 - How to calculate your taxable profits. Mae'n dweud wrthych sut i gyfrifo elw gorgyffwrdd a sut i hawlio rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd.

Os oes gennych unrhyw ryddhad gorgyffwrdd nodwch ef yn y blwch hwn.

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniol, mae'n rhaid i chi ddefnyddio gwyliwr ffeil PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com.

English Content:
You can claim relief for the the tax year 6 April 2015 to 5 April 2016 loss by reducing your other taxable income for 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017. Enter the amount you are claiming to offset in this field. The loss you claim will usually be the whole of the loss, but your total income minus deductions cannot be reduced below zero. So, the figure you put in this field should be no higher than your total income minus deductions. If you have already made a claim for relief against income of 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017, you should still include the loss in this field and provide details in the 'Any other information' field.

If you want, you may claim any remaining loss (or if your taxable income is nil, the loss) by reducing your capital gain for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017. Enter the loss you are claiming to offset in the 'Income losses of 2016 to 2017 set against gains' field in the Capital gains summary of losses section of the return.
Welsh Content:
Gallwch hawlio rhyddhad ar gyfer y golled 2013-14 drwy ostwng eich incwm trethadwy arall ar gyfer 2014-15. Nodwch yn y blwch hwn y swm yr ydych yn hawlio ei wrthbwyso. Y golled yr hawliwch ar ei chyfer fydd y golled gyfan fel arfer, ond ni ellir gostwng cyfanswm eich incwm llai didyniadau yn is na sero. Felly, ni ddylai'r ffigur a nodwch yn y blwch hwn fod yn uwch na chyfanswm eich incwm llai didyniadau. Os ydych eisoes wedi gwneud cais am ryddhad yn erbyn incwm 2014-15, dylech dal i gynnwys y golled yn y blwch hwn a rhoi manylion yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall'.

Os ydych yn dymuno, gallwch hawlio unrhyw golled sy'n weddill (neu os yw eich incwm trethadwy yn sero, y golled) trwy ostwng eich ennill cyfalaf ar gyfer 2014-15. Nodwch y golled rydych yn hawlio ei gwrthbwyso yn y blwch 'Colledion incwm 2014-15 wedi'u gosod yn erbyn enillion' yn adran Crynodeb colledion enillion cyfalaf y ffurflen dreth.

Am fwy o wybodaeth gweler Taflen Gymorth 227 - Losses (PDF 78K)

English Content: Deductions

English Content:
You can claim tax relief for any qualifying shares and securities gifted, or sold at less than their market value, to charities.

Qualifying shares and securities are:

  • those listed on a recognised stock exchange
  • dealt in on any designated market in the UK
  • units in an authorised unit trust
  • shares in an open-ended investment company
  • an interest in an offshore fund

Enter the value of the net benefit to the charity of the shares or securities minus any amounts or benefits received from the charity. Add to that value any incidental costs you bear in connection with the transfer, such as brokers' fees or legal fees.

The net benefit to the charity is usually the market value of the qualifying investment, but special rules apply if the charity is placed under any obligation in connection with the transfer to it of the investment, or if the investment was acquired as part of a scheme to obtain tax relief or an increased amount of tax relief.

Help Sheet 342 - Charitable giving explains in more detail how to complete this section.
Welsh Content:
Gallwch hawlio rhyddhad treth ar gyfer unrhyw gyfranddaliadau a gwarantau cymwys a roddwyd neu a werthwyd i elusen am lai na’u gwerth marchnad.

Mae cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau cymwys yn cynnwys:

  • y rheiny a restrwyd ar gyfnewidfa stoc gydnabyddiedig
  • rhai sy'n cael eu masnachu mewn unrhyw farchnad yn y DU
  • unedau mewn ymddiriedolaeth unedol awdurdodedig
  • cyfranddaliadau mewn cwmni buddsoddi penagored
  • buddiant mewn cronfa alltraeth

Nodwch gwerth net y budd sy'n deillio o'r cyfranddaliadau neu'r gwarantau i'r elusen, llai unrhyw symiau neu fuddiannau a gafwyd oddi wrth yr elusen. Ychwanegwch unrhyw fân gostau a dalwch mewn cysylltiad â'r trosglwyddiad at y gwerth hwnnw, er enghraifft ffioedd broceriaid neu ffioedd cyfreithiol.

Fel arfer y budd net i'r elusen yw gwerth marchnad y buddsoddiad sy'n cymhwyso ond mae rheolau arbennig yn berthnasol os gosodir yr elusen o dan ymrwymiad mewn cysylltiad â throsglwyddo'r buddsoddiad iddi, neu os caffaeliwyd y buddsoddiad fel rhan o gynllun er mwyn cael rhyddhad treth neu swm cynyddol o ryddhad treth.

Am ragor o wybodaeth ynghylch sut i gwblhau'r adran hon dilynwch y cysylltiad Taflen Gymorth 342 - Charitable giving

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
If you owe less than £3,000 tax for 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 and you want us to try and collect the tax you owe through your 6 April 2018 to 5 April 2019 PAYE tax code, you must file and submit your 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 online Tax Return by 30 December 2017.

Check point - Choose 'Yes' if you're filing and submitting:

  • before 30 December
  • the tax due is less than £3,000
  • you want us to try and collect the tax due through your PAYE tax code

Important:

If you start to complete your online return before 30 December but don't submit until after 30 December, then we won't be able to collect any tax owing under £3000 in your next PAYE tax code as you will have missed the deadline.

You'll also have to pay any tax outstanding by 31 January 2018.

Submit after deadline

If you submit your online return after the 30 December deadline, we won't be able to collect the tax you owe for 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 through your PAYE tax code and you'll have to pay any tax outstanding by 31 January 2018.

If you don't want any tax owing for 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 to be collected through your tax code for 6 April 2018 to 5 April 2019, choose 'No' and make your payment by 31 January 2018.

We cannot collect any class 2 NICs for this tax year through your tax code as the delay may impact your claim to certain benefits. More information is available in the 'National Insurance' guidance.
Welsh Content:
Os oes arnoch lai na £3,000 o dreth ar gyfer 2016 i 2017, ac eich bod am i ni geisio casglu'r dreth sydd arnoch drwy eich cod treth TWE ar gyfer 2017 i 2018, rhaid i chi gyflwyno eich Ffurflen Dreth ar-lein ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 erbyn 30 Rhagfyr 2017.

Man gwirio - Dewiswch 'Iawn' os ydych yn cyflwyno:

  • cyn 30 Rhagfyr
  • mae'r dreth sy'n ddyledus yn llai na £3,000
  • rydych am i ni geisio casglu'r dreth sy'n ddyledus drwy eich cod treth TWE

Pwysig:

Os ydych yn dechrau llenwi eich Ffurflen Dreth ar-lein cyn 30 Rhagfyr ond ddim yn ei chyflwyno tan ar ôl 30 Rhagfyr, ni fyddwn yn gallu casglu unrhyw dreth sy'n ddyledus, o dan £3,000, yn eich cod treth TWE nesaf, gan y byddwch wedi methu'r dyddiad cau.

Bydd yn rhaid i chi hefyd dalu unrhyw dreth sy'n ddyledus erbyn 31 Ionawr 2017.

Cyflwyno ar ôl y Dyddiad Cau

Os ydych yn cyflwyno eich Ffurflen Dreth ar-lein ar ôl y dyddiad cau, sef 30 Rhagfyr, ni fyddwn yn gallu casglu'r dreth sydd arnoch ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 drwy eich cod treth TWE, a bydd yn rhaid i chi dalu unrhyw dreth sy'n ddyledus erbyn 31 Ionawr 2017.

Os nad ydych am i ni gasglu unrhyw dreth sy'n ddyledus ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 drwy eich cod treth ar gyfer 2017 i 2018, dewiswch 'Na' a gwnewch eich taliad erbyn 31 Ionawr 2017.

Ni allwn gasglu CYG Dosbarth 2 ar gyfer y flwyddyn dreth hon drwy eich cod treth gan y gallai'r oedi effeithio ar eich cais am fuddiannau penodol. Mae rhagor o wybodaeth ar gael yn yr arweiniad Yswiriant Gwladol.

English Content:
You can claim 100% BPRA for the cost of renovating or repairing unused business premises if they:

  • were unused for one year before the work began
  • were last used for a business purpose
  • are in an Assisted Area
  • are used or ready for business after the work finished

More information about BPRA

  • cawsant eu defnyddio ddiwethaf at ddibenion busnes
  • ydynt mewn Ardal Gynorthwyedig
  • cânt eu defnyddio neu eu bod yn barod ar gyfer cynnal busnes ar ôl i'r gwaith ddod i ben

English Content:
If the adjustment is negative, put a minus sign (-) before the figure.

If the partnership did not carry on a trade or profession in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017, that is, it carried on a pure investment business, the basis period is the tax year from 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017. No adjustments for basis period will be required.

For full details of the rules for working out your basis period and any adjustments for basis period please see Help Sheet 222 - How to calculate your taxable profits.

English Content:
Please enter the dividends as shown on your dividend voucher; do not add on the tax credit. If you have accumulation units or shares the dividend is automatically re-invested but you must still include the dividend. Do not include any amount shown as 'equalisation'; it is a repayment of capital (and should be deducted from the cost of the units or shares when calculating capital gains).

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 or 6 April 2018 to 5 April 2019 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HMRC know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.
Welsh Content: Nodwch y difidendau fel y maent yn ymddangos ar eich taleb ddifidend; peidiwch ag ychwanegu'r credyd treth. Os oes gennych unedau neu gyfranddaliadau cronni caiff y difidend ei ail-fuddsoddi'n awtomatig ond mae'n rhaid i chi gynnwys y difidend o hyd. Peidiwch â chynnwys unrhyw swm a nodwyd 'cyfartaliad' (equalisation). Mae'r swm hwn yn ad-daliad cyfalaf (a dylid ei ddidynnu o gost yr unedau neu'r cyfranddaliadau pan fyddwch yn cyfrifo enillion cyfalaf).

English Content:
You can't claim any allowances for plant or machinery provided for use in a dwelling house.

The following guidance only applies if you have a 'standard' 12 month accounting period and summarise the allowances available. If your accounting period is shorter or longer than a year, or began before 6 April 2016, or if you want to know more about capital allowances, refer to Helpsheet HS252 - Capital allowances and balancing charges (which includes worked examples), or contact HM Revenue and Customs, or your tax adviser.

You can claim a capital allowance called an Annual Investment Allowance (AIA), if you bought equipment (but not cars) during the year. The annual amount has increased to £500,000 from 1 April 2014 for corporation tax (CT) and 6 April 2014 for income tax (IT) to 31 December 2015, after which it will return to £25,000. The annual amount was also temporarily increased from £25,000 to £250,000 for 2 years from 1 January 2013. Enter the total amount of AIA claimed here.
Welsh Content:
Ni allwch wneud cais am unrhyw lwfansau ar gyfer offer neu beiriannau a roddir at ddefnydd mewn tŷ sy'n annedd.

Mae'r arweiniad isod yn gymwys dim ond os oes gennych gyfnod cyfrifyddu 'safonol' o 12 mis ac mae crynodeb o'r lwfansau ar gael. Os ydy'ch cyfnod cyfrifyddu'n fyrrach neu'n hwy na blwyddyn, neu os dechreuodd cyn 6 Ebrill 2016, neu os ydych am wybod rhagor am lwfansau cyfalaf, dilynwch y cysylltiad Taflen Gymorth 252 - Capital allowances and balancing charges (sy'n cynnwys enghreifftiau), neu cysylltwch â Chyllid a Thollau EM neu eich ymgynghorydd treth.

Gallwch hawlio lwfans cyfalaf o'r enw Lwfans Buddsoddi Blynyddol (LBB) os oeddech wedi prynu offer (ond nid ceir) yn ystod y flwyddyn. Mae'r swm blynyddol wedi codi i £500,000 o 1 Ebrill 2014 ar gyfer treth gorfforaeth (CT) a 6 Ebrill 2014 ar gyfer treth incwm (IT). Mae hyn hyd at 31 Rhagfyr 2016, ac yn dilyn hynny, bydd yn dychwelyd i £25,000. Yn ogystal, cynyddwyd y swm blynyddol o £25,000 i £250,000 dros dro am 2 flynedd o 1 Ionawr 2013. Nodwch yma gyfanswm yr LBB a hawliwyd.

English Content:
If your taxable gains after taper relief are more than £11,100 choose 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, choose 'No'.

You must fill in the capital gains pages and attach your computations if in the tax year no losses are deducted from your chargeable gains but your total chargeable gains after applying taper relief are more than £11,100.

In working out your total chargeable gains include any gains attributed to you (for example, because you're a settlor or beneficiary of a Trust, or in certain cases where you're a member of a non-resident company) and any gains of earlier years becoming taxable in this tax year.

For further guidance and information, see the Capital gains summary notes.
Welsh Content:
Os ydy eich enillion trethadwy ar ôl rhyddhad meinhau yn fwy na £11,000 dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch Na'.

Rhaid i chi gwblhau tudalennau enillion cyfalaf ac atodi eich cyfrifiannau os, yn y flwyddyn dreth, didynnir colledion o'ch enillion cyfalaf ac mae cyfanswm eich enillion trethadwy cyn didynnu colledion a chymhwyso'r rhyddhad meinhau yn fwy na £11,000.

Wrth gyfrifo cyfanswm yr enillion trethadwy a briodolir i chi (er enghraifft, oherwydd eich bod yn setlwr neu'n fuddiolwr Ymddiriedolaeth, neu mewn rhai achosion lle rydych yn aelod o gwmni dibreswyl) ac mae unrhyw enillion yn dod yn drethadwy yn y flwyddyn hon.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach gweler Nodiadau Crynodeb o enillion cyfalaf (PDF 127K)

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content: Please enter the total disposal proceeds for all interests in residential property assets and gains (before taking into account any reliefs or claims).
Welsh Content:
Ar sail yr hyn a gofnodwyd gennych dyma gyfanswm derbyniadau gwaredu ar gyfer eich holl warediadau o gyfranddaliadau a gwarantau nas rhestrwyd cyn i unrhyw ryddhad, ceisiadau neu ddewisiadaugael eu gwneud.

Y ffigur a ddangosir yma yw cyfanswm y derbyniadau gwaredu a gynhwyswyd yn y taflenni gwaith ar gyfer cyfrifo enillion cyfalaf a gwblhawyd gennych ar gyfer cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau nas rhestrwyd yn ogystal â derbyniadau gwaredu gwarediadau o'r fath a nodwyd gennych ar wahân.

Sylwer mewn rhai amgylchiadau dylai'r swm a gewch gael ei ddisodli yn eich cyfrifiad gan werth marchnad yr ased rydych yn ei waredu. Dylech ddefnyddio gwerth werth marchnad yr ased yn lle'r pris a gawsoch os rhoddwyd yr ased gennych, os gwerthwyd yr ased am lai na'i werth llawn yn fwriadol, neu os gwaredwyd yr ased i berson cysylltiol.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach ewch i'r Nodiadau Crynhoi Enillion Cyfalaf (PDF 316K).

Ceir arweiniad ynglŷn ag ystyr 'gwerth marchnad' a 'derbyniadau gwaredu' ar dudalen CGN 17 a CGN 18, ar 'cost caffael' ar dudalen CGN 18 ac ar 'person cysylltiol' ar dudalen CGN 4.

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com
