English Content:
Understanding the lifetime allowance for pension schemes

You can save as much as you like towards your pension but there is a limit on the amount of tax relief you can get. The lifetime allowance is the maximum amount of pension saving you can build up over your life that benefits from tax relief. If you build up pension savings worth more than your available lifetime allowance you'll pay a tax charge on the excess when you decide to take your benefits, turn 75 or transfer your pension overseas.

Check if your pension savings exceed the lifetime allowance

The lifetime allowance applies to any pension savings you have in:

  • a registered pension scheme
  • an overseas pension scheme that qualifies for UK tax relief for either you or your employer on or after 5 April 2006

The lifetime allowance is currently £1.5 million, unless you have some form of protection giving you a higher lifetime allowance.

The lifetime allowance applies even if you're in a pension scheme that you don't make payments into - for example if you're in a workplace pension that only your employer makes payments into.

Value of pension benefits in excess of your Available Lifetime Allowance, taken by you as a lump sum

If all or any part of the benefits which formed part of the excess over your Available Lifetime Allowance were taken as a lump sum, enter the total of the lump sum, or sums, including any tax paid by the scheme administrator.

Don't include tax-free lump sums paid with a pension which are payable within your Lifetime Allowance. Include lump sums paid for serious ill-health before age 75, but only enter the amount by which you exceed the Lifetime Allowance. Don't include a serious ill-health lump sum if it was paid to you when you had reached age 75. These lump sums are taxed separately and the tax will have been paid by the scheme administrator. Do include lump sums expressly paid as lump sums because you exceeded your Lifetime Allowance.

You can find the figures on the statement of tax you received from your scheme. The statement will show how the tax was worked out.
Welsh Content:
Deall y lwfans oes ar gyfer cynlluniau pensiwn

Gallwch gynilo cymaint ag y dymunwch tuag at eich pensiwn ond mae yna derfyn ar swm y rhyddhad treth y gallech ei dderbyn. Y lwfans oes yw uchafswm y pensiwn y gallwch ei gronni yn ystod eich bywyd sy'n elwa o ryddhad treth. Os ydych yn cronni cynilion pensiwn sy'n werth mwy na'ch lwfans oes sydd ar gael, byddwch yn talu treth ar y swm gormodol pan fyddwch yn penderfynu cymryd eich buddiannau, yn troi'n 75 neu'n trosglwyddo eich pensiwn dramor.

Gwirio a yw eich enillion pensiwn yn fwy na'r lwfans oes

Mae'r lwfans oes yn gymwys ar gyfer unrhyw gynilion pensiwn sydd gennych mewn:

  • cynllun pensiwn cofrestredig
  • cynllun pensiwn tramor sy'n gymwys ar gyfer rhyddhad treth y DU ar gyfer naill ai chi neu eich cyflogwr ar neu ar ôl 5 Ebrill 2006

£1.5 miliwn yw'r lwfans oes ar hyn o bryd , oni bai bod gennych ryw fath o ddiogelwch sy'n rhoi lwfans oes uwch i chi.

Mae'r lwfans oes yn gymwys hyd yn oed os ydych yn rhan o gynllun pensiwn nad ydych yn talu mewn iddo - er enghraifft, os ydych yn rhan o gynllun pensiwn y gweithle y mae eich cyflogwr yn unig yn talu mewn iddo.

Gwerth y buddiannau pensiwn sy'n fwy na'ch Lwfans Oes sydd ar gael, a gymerwyd gennych ar ffurf cyfandaliad

Os cymerwyd yr holl fuddiannau, neu ran o'r buddiannau wnaeth ffurfio rhan o'r swm gormodol dros eich Lwfans Oes sydd ar gael, fel cyfandaliad, nodwch gyfanswm y cyfandaliad neu'r cyfandaliadau, gan gynnwys unrhyw dreth a dalwyd gan weinyddwr y cynllun.

Peidiwch â chynnwys cyfandaliadau rhydd o dreth a dalwyd â phensiwn sy'n daladwy o fewn eich Lwfans Oes. Dylech gynnwys cyfandaliadau a dalwyd ar gyfer afiechyd difrifol cyn 75 mlwydd oed, ond dylech ond nodi'r swm yr ydych yn mynd dros y Lwfans Oes. Peidiwch â chynnwys cyfandaliadau afiechyd difrifol os cawsant eu talu i chi pan gyrhaeddoch 75 mlwydd oed. Caiff y cyfandaliadau hyn eu trethi ar wahân a bydd y dreth wedi'i thalu gan weinyddwr y cynllun. Dylech gynnwys cyfandaliadau a dalwyd yn benodol fel cyfandaliadau am eich bod wedi mynd dros eich Lwfans Oes.

Gallwch ddod o hyd i'r ffigurau ar y datganiad o dreth a dderbynioch o'ch cynllun. Bydd y datganiad yn dangos sut y cyfrifwyd y dreth.

English Content:
Income tax refunded

What refunds to include

Include the following in the refunded box. If you have received a tax refund (rebate) because you:

  • stopped working and made an in-year repayment claim from tax paid on your
    • employment
    • self employment in the construction industry scheme (CIS)
  • claimed the tax you paid on trivial pension income
  • sent an in-year tax return to claim a refund on tax paid
  • received a repayment from the job center after the 6 April

What refunds not to include

If you amend your return after receiving a refund do not include the original refund in this box.

Do not include any repayment you have already received after you filed the original return including any refunds from payments on Account.

Example: If you have completed your return and received a repayment and you then amend your return with new information.
Welsh Content:
Treth incwm a ad-dalwyd

Pa ad-daliadau i'w cynnwys

Dylech gynnwys y canlynol yn y blwch ad-dalwyd. Os ydych wedi derbyn ad-daliad treth am eich bod:

  • wedi rhoi'r gorau i weithio ac wedi gwneud cais yn ystod y flwyddyn ar gyfer treth a dalwyd ar eich
    • Cyflogaeth
    • Hunangyflogaeth yng Nghynllun y Diwydiant Adeiladu (CIS)
  • Hawlio'r dreth a daloch ar incwm pensiwn cymudiad pitw
  • wedi anfon Ffurflen Dreth yn ystod y flwyddyn er mwyn hawlio ad-daliad ar y dreth adalwyd
  • wedi derbyn ad-daliad gan y Ganolfan Byd Gwaith ar ôl 6 Ebrill

Ad-daliadau na ddylid eu cynnwys

Os ydych yn diwygio eich Ffurflen Dreth ar ôl derbyn ad-daliad, peidiwch â chynnwys yr ad-daliad gwreiddiol yn y blwch hwn.

Peidiwch â chynnwys ad-daliad a dderbyniwyd gennych eisoes ar ôl i chi gyflwyno'r Ffurflen Dreth wreiddiol gan gynnwys ad-daliadau o Daliadau ar Gyfrif.

Enghraifft: Os ydych wedi llenwi eich Ffurflen Dreth ac wedi cael ad-daliad a'ch bod wedyn yn diwygio eich Ffurflen Dreth â'r wybodaeth newydd.

English Content:
Select the checkbox if:

  • you received income from gains from a foreign country where you've had foreign tax deducted and you want to claim foreign tax credit relief
  • the proceeds of a transaction, (which if a gain were to accrue on it would be a chargeable gain and chargeable to Capital Gains Tax) has had Special Withholding Tax (SWT) deducted

Note - 'SWT' is an amount of tax withheld on certain payments to UK residents by some European Member States and other related and third party territories under the terms of the European Savings Directive and equivalent third party agreements. This tax will be in addition to any foreign tax deducted by the country of origin of the payment.

The countries that may deduct SWT are:

Andorra, Austria, Curacao, Gibraltar, Jersey, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Monaco, San Marino, St Maarten and Switzerland.
Welsh Content:
Ticiwch y blwch gwirio os:

  • os cawsoch incwm o enillion (gains) o wlad dramor pan fydd treth dramor wedi'i didynnu ac rydych am hawlio rhyddhad credyd treth dramor
  • os bydd yr arian a ddeilliodd o drafodyn, (pe bai ennill yn cronni arno, byddai'n ennill trethadwy ac yn drethadwy i Dreth Enillion Cyfalaf) wedi cael Treth Ataliedig Arbennig wedi'i didynnu ohono

Sylwer – Mae 'Treth Ataliedig Arbennig' yn swm o dreth a gaiff ei atal ar daliadau penodol i breswylwyr y DU gan rai Aelod-wladwriaethau Ewrop a thiriogaethau perthynol a thrydydd parti eraill o dan delerau'r Gyfarwyddeb Cynilion Ewropeaidd a chytundebau trydydd parti cyfatebol. Bydd y dreth hon yn ychwanegol at unrhyw dreth dramor a ddidynnir gan y wlad y tarddodd y taliad ohoni.

Y gwledydd a allai ddidynnu'r Dreth Ataliedig Arbennig yw:

Andorra, Awstria, Curacao, Gibraltar, Jersey, Liechtenstein, Lwcsembwrg, Monaco, San Marino, y Swistir ac Ynys St Maarten

English Content:
Overview

You can start using cash basis from 6 April 2015 and if you:

  • run a small business e.g. sole traders and partnerships
  • have an income of £83,000 or less a year (this is the threshold to register for VAT)

You can also decide not to use cash basis if it's not suited to your business.

Why use cash basis

If you

  • run a small business, cash basis accounting may be better than traditional accounting
  • you only need to declare money when it comes in and out of your business
  • at the end of the tax year, you won't have to pay Income Tax on money you didn't receive in your accounting period.

When cash basis might not suit your business

If you:

  • want to claim interest or bank charges of more than £500 as an expense
  • run a business that's more complex, eg you have high levels of stock
  • need to get finance for your business - a bank could ask to see accounts drawn up using traditional accounting to see what you owe and are due before agreeing a loan
  • have losses that you want to offset against other taxable income ('sideways loss relief')

Income and expenses under cash basis

  • you only count the money you've actually received and expenses you've actually paid in a tax year
  • money you're owed isn't counted until you receive it
  • payments count - cash, by card, cheque, payment in kind or any other method

Examples of allowable business expenses:

  • office costs, eg stationery
  • travel costs, eg fuel, parking, train or bus fares
  • clothing expenses, eg uniforms
  • staff costs, eg salaries or subcontractor costs
  • things you buy to sell on, eg stock or raw materials
  • financial costs, eg insurance or bank charges
  • costs of your business premises, eg heating, lighting, business rates
  • advertising or marketing, eg website costs

Capital allowances

If you use cash basis accounting and buy a car for your business, you can claim this as a capital allowance. However, all other items you buy and keep for your business should be claimed as allowable expenses in the normal way.

Other considerations

  • businesses using traditional accounting (accruals basis) might have to make some adjustments if they switch to cash basis
  • you can choose how you record when you receive or pay money (e.g. the date the money enters or leaves your account or the date a cheque is written) but you must use the same method each tax year
  • cash basis might suit smaller businesses because, at the end of the tax year, you won't have to pay Income Tax on money you didn't receive in your accounting period
  • a loss incurred by a business adopting 'Cash basis' can only carry forward. No sideways or earlier year's tax relief can be claimed
  • your business grows during the tax year you can stay in the scheme up to an income of £166,000. Above that you'll need to use traditional accounting for your Income Tax return for the next tax year, unless your income drops back below the VAT threshold in place at the end of that tax year

Losses

  • any losses you make can't be set off against your other income
  • terminal loss must be set against any profits (after deducting losses brought forward) from the same business taxed in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017
  • any remaining terminal losses must be set against the profits of the same business taxed in the 3 prior years. Starting with the latest year

Who can't use the scheme

  • Lloyd's underwriters
  • farming businesses with a current herd basis election
  • farming and creative businesses with a section 221 ITTOIA profit averaging election
  • businesses that have claimed business premises renovation allowance
  • businesses that carry on a mineral extraction trade
  • businesses that have claimed research and development allowance
  • limited companies
  • limited liability partnerships
  • dealers in securities
  • relief for mineral royalties
  • lease premiums
  • ministers of religion
  • pool betting duty
  • intermediaries treated as making employment payments
  • managed service companies
  • waste disposal
  • cemeteries and crematoria

If you can't use cash basis, you'll need to use traditional accounting to work out your taxable profits.
Welsh Content:
Arolwg

Sail arian parod yw dull o weithio allan elw neu golled eich busnes ar gyfer eich Ffurflen DrethHunanasesiad.

Gallwch ddefnyddio'r sail arian parod ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 os:

  • ydych yn fusnes hunangyflogedig e.e unig fasnachwyr a phartneriaid.
  • oes gennych incwm o £81,000 neu lai'r flwyddyn (dyma'r trothwy pan fo raid cofrestru ar gyfer TAW)

Gallwch ddechrau defnyddio sail arian parod o'r 6ed Ebrill 2016. Fodd bynnag, gallwch benderfynu nad ydych am ddefnyddio sail arian parod gan nad yw yn addas i'ch busnes.

Sut mae sail arian parod yn gweithio?

Gallwch ddewis cofnodi eich incwm busnes a threuliau dros y flwyddyn dreth mewn un o'r ffyrdd canlynol:

  • Defnyddio sail arian parod - cofnodi arian pan mae'n dod mewn ac yn mynd allan o'ch busnes (mae pob arian yn cyfrif - arian parod, taliadau cerdyn, siec ac unrhyw ddull arall)
  • Gan ddefnyddio cyfrifo traddodiadol ( ar sail croniadau) - cofnodwch incwm a threuliau pan fyddwch yn rhoi anfoneb i gwsmeriaid neu dderbyn bil.

Incwm a threuliau sail arian parod

Incwm

  • rydych ond yn cyfrif yr arian yr ydych wedi ei dderbyn mewn blwyddyn dreth.
  • ni ddylid cyfrif arian sy'n ddyledus i chi nes eich bod yn ei dderbyn .
  • cyfrif arian - arian parod, drwy gerdyn, siec, taliad mewn nwyddau neu unrhyw ddull arall.

Treuliau

Treuliau yw costau busnes y gallwch, efallai, eu didynnu o'ch incwm i gyfrifo eich elw trethadwy.

Os ydych yn defnyddio sail arian parod rydych ond yn cyfrif y treuliau yr ydych wedi eu talu. Nid yw arian sydd arnoch yn cael ei gyfrif hyd nes eich bod wedi ei dalu

Esiamplau o dreuliau busnes sy'n ganiataol pan rydych yn defnyddio'r sail arian parod yw:

  • costau rhedeg o ddydd i ddydd, e.e trydan, tanwydd
  • costau gweinyddol, e.e deunydd ysgrifennu,
  • pethau y byddwch yn eu prynu i'w gwerthu ymlaen e.e. stoc
  • pethau y byddwch yn defnyddio yn eich busnes e.e peiriannau, cyfrifiaduron, faniau
  • llog a chodiadau i fyny at £500, e.e llog ar orddrafftiau banc

Os ydych yn defnyddio'r sail arian parod ni allwch hawlio lwfansau cyfalaf ar unrhyw beth oni bai am geir.

Ystyriaethau eraill

  • efallai bydd rhaid i fusnesau sydd yn cyfrifo'n draddodiadol (ar sail croniadau) wneud rhai addasiadau os byddant yn newid i sail arian parod.
  • dewis sut byddwch yn cofnodi pan fyddwch yn derbyn neu'n talu arian (e.e. y dyddiad mae'r arian yn dod i mewn neu yn gadael eich cyfrif neu'r dyddiad yr ysgrifennir y siec ) ond rhaid i chi ddefnyddio'r un dull bob blwyddyn dreth.
  • efallai bydd arian parod yn addas i fusnesau bach oherwydd, ar ddiwedd y flwyddyn dreth, ni fydd rhaid i chi dalu Treth Incwm ar arian na wnaethoch dderbyn yn eich cyfnod cyfrifyddu.

Os ydych yn defnyddio sail arian parod ac mae eich busnes yn tyfu yn ystod y flwyddyn gallwch aros yn y cynllun i fyny at incwm o £162,000 Yn uwch na hynny, bydd angen i chi ddefnyddio cyfrifo traddodiadol ar gyfer eich ffurflen Dreth Incwm am y flwyddyn dreth nesaf, oni bai bod eich incwm yn cwympo'n is na'r trothwy TAW sy'n bodoli ar ddiwedd y flwyddyn dreth honno.

1.3 Pwy na all ddefnyddio'r cynllun?

Busnesau na allant ddefnyddio'r cynllun

  • tanysgrifenwyr Lloyd's
  • busnesau ffermio gyda sail dewis diadell gyfredol
  • busnesau ffermio a chreadigol gyda dewis elw ar gyfartaledd adran 221ITTOIA
  • busnesau sydd wedi hawlio lwfans adnewyddu safle busnes
  • busnesau sy'n cynnal masnach tynnu mwynau
  • busnesau sydd wedi hawlio lwfans ymchwil a datblygu.
  • Cwmnïau cyfyngedig
  • Partneriaethau Atebolrwydd Cyfyngedig

English Content:
Foster care exemption applies to people who receive income for providing foster care to children and young people placed with them either by local authorities (Health and Social Services (HSS) trusts in Northern Ireland), or voluntary fostering organisations. If you receive this income HM Revenue and Customs treat you as being self-employed. It does not include private fostering arrangements.

Select this check box if you are a foster carer or shared lives carer.
Welsh Content:
Mae rhyddhad gofal maeth yn gymwys i bobl sy'n cael incwm am ddarparu gofal maeth i blant a phobl ifanc sydd wedi eu lleoli gyda nhw naill ai gan awdurdodau lleol (ymddiriedolaethau Iechyd a Gwasanaethau Cymdeithasol (HSS) yng Ngogledd Iwerddon), neu sefydliadau gofal maeth gwirfoddol. Os ydych chi'n cael yr incwm hwn cewch eich trin gan Gyllid a Thollau EM fel rhywun sy'n hunangyflogedig. Nid yw'n cynnwys trefniadau maethu preifat.

Dewiswch y blwch hwn os ydych yn ofalwr maeth neu'n ofalwr cysylltu bywydau.

English Content:
If you invested in shares that were issued during the year to 5 April 2017 (or during the year to 5 April 2018 if you're carrying back relief - read Helpsheet 393 Seed Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax and Capital Gains reliefs) you may be able to claim Income Tax relief under the Seed Enterprise Investment Scheme.

The amount by which your tax liability will be reduced will be the smaller of:

  • the amount you subscribed (up to a maximum of £100,000) at 50%
  • the amount that reduces your tax bill to zero for the year

To qualify for relief you must have received both form EIS3 Seed Enterprise Investment Scheme Certificate and claim to relief from the company you invested in, or form EIS5 Enterprise Investment Scheme from the fund manager of an approved investment fund. Helpsheet 393 Seed Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax and Capital Gains reliefs explains the qualifying conditions for tax relief.

Enter the total amount of the subscription on which you're claiming relief (up to a maximum of £100,000) for the year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017, and in the 'additional information' field enter:

  • the name of the company invested in
  • the total amount of the subscription on which you're claiming relief for the year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 (if you've subscribed more than £100,000, Helpsheet 393 Seed Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax and Capital Gains reliefs explains how relief can be allocated to the shares)
  • the date of issue of the shares
  • the office authorising the issue of the EIS3 and its reference
Welsh Content:
Os gwnaethoch fuddsoddi mewn cyfranddaliadau a ddyroddwyd yn ystod y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017 (neu yn ystod y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017 os ydych yn cario rhyddhad yn ôl - darllenwch Daflen Gymorth 393 Seed Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax and Capital Gains reliefs), mae'n bosib y gallwch hawlio rhyddhad Treth Incwm o dan y Cynllun Buddsoddiad Menter.

Y swm y bydd eich atebolrwydd treth yn cael ei leihau ganddo bydd y lleiaf o'r:

  • swm a danysgrifiwyd gennych (hyd at uchafswm o £100,000) ar gyfradd o 50%
  • swm sy'n lleihau eich bil treth i sero am y flwyddyn

Er mwyn bod yn gymwys ar gyfer rhyddhad rhaid eich bod wedi derbyn naill ai ffurflen EIS3 Cynllun Buddsoddiad Menter (EIS) - Tystysgrif a chais am ryddhad gan y cwmni y gwnaethoch fuddsoddi ynddo, neu ffurflen EIS5 Enterprise Investment Scheme gan reolwr cronfa fuddsoddi gymeradwy. Mae Taflen Gymorth 393 Seed Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax and Capital Gains reliefs yn esbonio'r amodau cymwys ar gyfer rhyddhad treth.

Nodwch gyfanswm y tanysgrifiad rydych yn hawlio rhyddhad arno (hyd at uchafswm o £100,000) ar gyfer y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017, a nodwch yn y blwch 'gwybodaeth ychwanegol':

  • enw'r cwmni y buddsoddwyd ynddo
  • cyfanswm y tanysgrifiad rydych yn hawlio rhyddhad arno ar gyfer y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017 (os ydych wedi tanysgrifio mwy na £100,000 mae Taflen Gymorth 393 Seed Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax and Capital Gains reliefs yn esbonio sut y gellir dyrannu rhyddhad i'r cyfranddaliadau)
  • dyddiad dyroddi'r cyfranddaliadau
  • enw a chyfeirnod y swyddfa sy'n awdurdodi anfon yr SEIS3.

English Content:
This relief may be due if a life insurance policy, capital redemption policy or life annuity came to an end in the year to 5 April 2017 and:

  • you have made one or more chargeable event gains in a previous tax year(s), because you have made part withdrawals or part assignments of an amount higher than 5% of the premium
  • you pay tax at the higher rate

For more information view the:

  • Help Sheet 320 - Gains on UK life insurance policies
  • Help Sheet 321 - Gains on foreign life insurance policies

For help working out deficiency relief use IPTM3860 - Deficiency relief: entitlement and calculation.
Welsh Content:
Gall y rhyddhad hwn fod yn ddyledus os daeth polisi yswiriant bywyd, polisi adbrynu cyfalaf neu flwydd-dal bywyd i ben yn y flwyddyn i 5 Ebrill 2017 ac:

  • rydych wedi achosi un neu ragor o enillion trethadwy ddigwydd, oherwydd eich bod wedi codi'n rhannol neu wedi aseinio'n rhannol symiau sy'n uwch na 5 y cant o'r premiwm
  • rydych yn talu treth ar y gyfradd uwc

Am fwy o wybodaeth gweler:

  • Taflen Gymorth HS320: Gains on UK life insurance policies
  • Daflen Gymorth HS321:Gains on foreign life insurance policies

Mae cymorth ar gyfer cyfrifo rhyddhad diffyg i'w gael yn www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/iptm/iptm3860.htm

English Content:
The amount shown is the amount HMRC believes is due based on your National Insurance record if:

  • you have profits equal to or greater than £5965 or
  • your profits are below this amount and you want to pay Class 2 NICs voluntarily.

Please check view full calculation when you have completed all the sections of your return, as this will show the breakdown of Class 2 NICS due.

You still have to pay during a temporary break if you intend to continue being self-employed. This includes:

  • writers undertaking research
  • on holiday
  • short term employment
  • on jury service

If you are filing your own return

If the Class 2 amount shows 'Not Available, check help' this may be because:

  • you’re not registered to pay Class 2 NICs go to Register for HMRC taxes
  • you’re trying to complete your return between 2am-5am when the facility is unavailable
  • you’re completing your return outside of these hours click the ‘Recalculate’ button to show the amount due

If the Class 2 amount shows ‘£0.00’ this may because of one of the following reasons:

  • you’re not registered to pay Class 2 NICs go to Register for HMRC taxes
  • you may have paid the maximum NICs due
  • you may have received certain benefits meaning no Class 2 NICs are due
  • you may be paying your Class 2 in a different way, e.g. you were abroad

To check if any of these apply contact the National Insurance helpline.

If you think the Class 2 amount is incorrect, this maybe because you started working for yourself after 6 April or stopped before 5 April of the tax year. Select the 'Update your self-employment details' link to update your record.

After making changes click the 'Recalculate' button to recalculate your Class 2 NICs if you have changed the dates you started or stopped working for yourself.

If you are an Agent filing on behalf of your client

If the Class 2 amount shows 'Not Available, check help' this may be because:

  • your client has not registered to pay Class 2 NICs. Go to Register for HMRC taxes
  • you’re trying to complete your clients return between 2am – 5am when this facility is unavailable

If the Class 2 amount show ‘£0.00’ this may because of one of the following reasons:

  • your client has not registered to pay Class 2 NICs go to Register for HMRC taxes
  • your client may have paid the maximum NICs due
  • your client may have received certain benefits meaning no Class 2 NICs are due
  • your client may be paying Class 2 in a different way, e.g. they were abroad

To check if any of these apply contact the National Insurance helpline.

If you think the Class 2 amount is incorrect. This maybe because your client started working for themselves after 6 April or stopped before 5 April of the tax year. Your client will need to update their self-employment details. Go to the National Insurance helpline.

Note: Where the Class 2 NIC amount has been updated allow 72hrs for this to be displayed.
Welsh Content:
Mae dal yn rhaid i chi dalu CYG Dosbarth 2 yn ystod seibiant dros dro os ydych yn bwriadu parhau i fod yn hunangyflogedig. Mae hyn yn cynnwys:

  • ysgrifenwyr sy’n cynnal gwaith ymchwil
  • ar wyliau
  • cyflogaeth dymor byr
  • yn cynnig gwasanaeth ar reithgor

Os yw’r swm CYG Dosbarth 2 yn dangos ‘Ddim ar gael. Edrychwch ar yr ‘Help’’, gall hyn fod oherwydd eich bod yn ceisio llenwi eich Ffurflen Dreth rhwng 02:00 a 05:00 pan nad yw’r cyfleuster hwn ar gael.

Os ydych yn llenwi eich Ffurflen Dreth y tu allan i’r oriau hyn, cliciwch y botwm ‘Ail-gyfrifo’ i ddangos y swm sy’n ddyledus.

Pan fo hyn yn dal i ddangos ‘Ddim ar gael. Edrychwch ar yr ‘Help’’, ewch i’r dudalen Yswiriant Gwladol

Os ydych o’r farn fod y swm a ddangosir yn anghywir, gall hyn fod oherwydd gwnaethoch ddechrau gweithio ar liwt eich hun ar ôl 6 Ebrill neu roi’r gorau i wneud hynny cyn 5 Ebrill yn ystod y flwyddyn dreth. Cliciwch ar y cysylltiad ‘Diweddaru eich manylion hunangyflogaeth’ i ddiweddaru eich cofnod.

Ar ôl gwneud y newidiadau, cliciwch ar y botwm ‘Ail-gyfrifo’ i ail-gyfrifo eich CYG Dosbarth 2.

English Content:
If you do not claim relief from UK tax for foreign tax that you have paid on this income, the amount on which you are liable to UK tax is reduced to the amount you received.

Foreign Tax Credit Relief is not always available, or may not be available on the full amount of foreign tax you have paid. Relief is subject to the following rules:

  • you must be a UK resident
  • the income must arise in the foreign country and be properly chargeable under the foreign country's law
  • the amount of Foreign Tax Credit Relief must not exceed the UK tax on the same item of income or gains
  • where a Double Taxation Agreement exists between the UK and the other country, the amount of foreign tax available for the relief is restricted to the minimum foreign tax payable under the terms of the Agreement.

To check if the UK has entered into a Double Taxation Agreement with the foreign territory you should go to Double Taxation Treaties which provides further information.

If a double taxation agreement does exist you must check what it says and how it applies to you. If foreign tax credit relief cannot be claimed for some or all of the foreign tax you will have to consider making a claim to the tax authority of the other country. You can find information about this claims process by accessing the Double Taxation Relief Manual

If no Double Taxation Agreement exists, or the Agreement does not cover that particular foreign tax, relief is only available if the tax corresponds to UK Income or Capital Gains Tax.

See Help Sheet 263 - Foreign Tax Credit Relief (PDF 110K) for further information about foreign tax credit relief.

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com
Welsh Content:
Dewiswch 'Ydw' o'r ddewislen os ydych yn hawlio rhyddhad credyd treth dramor ar gyfer yr incwm hwn (fel arfer bydd yn fanteisiol i chi), fel arall dewiswch 'Nac ydw'.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach gweler y Nodiadau Tramor (PDF 128K).

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
You can use the online return service to report any UK property rental income and furnished holiday letting (FHL) income from properties in the UK or European Economic Area (EEA). Fill in one property page for all UK FHL properties and a separate page for all EEA FHL properties.

You can also report any income received from letting furnished rooms in your own home in the year to 5 April 2017. But if that letting amounted to a trade, for example, because you provided meals and other services, you can report them in the Self-employment section of this service.
Welsh Content:

Llenwch un dudalen eiddo ar gyfer yr holl eiddo FHL yn y DU ac un ar wahân ar gyfer yr holl eiddo FHL yn yr AEE.

Gallwch hefyd nodi unrhyw incwm a dderbyniwyd o osod ystafelloedd wedi eu dodrefnu yn eich cartref eich hun yn y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017. Ond os oedd gosod yr eiddo hwn yn cyfrif fel masnach, er enghraifft, oherwydd eich bod yn darparu prydau bwyd a gwasanaethau eraill, gallwch eu nodi yn y rhan Hunangyflogaeth o'r gwasanaeth hwn.

English Content:
Based upon your entries this is your total disposal proceeds for all your disposals of property and other assets (other than disposals of shares and securities) before any deductions for allowable expenditure and before any relief's, claims or elections are taken into account.

The figure shown here is the total of disposal proceeds included in capital gains computation worksheets you have completed for disposals of property and other assets plus the disposal proceeds for such disposals that you have entered separately.

Note that in some circumstances the amount you receive should be replaced in your calculation by the market value of the asset you disposed of. Use the market value in place of the price you received if you gave an asset away, deliberately sold it for less than its full value, or disposed of it to a connected person.

For further guidance and information, please see the Capital Gains Summary Notes (PDF 127K).

Guidance on the meaning of 'market value' and 'disposal proceeds' may be found at page CGN 17 and CGN 18, on 'acquisition cost' at page CGN 18 and on the meaning of 'connected persons' at page CGN 4.

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com
Welsh Content:
Ar sail yr hyn a gofnodwyd gennych dyma gyfanswm derbyniadau gwaredu ar gyfer eich holl eiddo a waredwyd ac asedion eraill (ac eithrio cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau a waredwyd) cyn ystyried unrhyw ddidyniadau ar gyfer gwariant caniataol a chyn cymryd unrhyw ryddhad, ceisiadau neu ddewisiadau i ystyriaeth.

Y ffigur a ddangosir yma yw cyfanswm y derbyniadau gwaredu a gynhwyswyd ar y taflenni gwaith ar gyfer cyfrifo enillion cyfalaf a gwblhawyd gennych ar gyfer gwarediadau o eiddo ac asedion eraill yn ogystal â derbyniadau gwaredu gwarediadau o'r fath a nodwyd gennych ar wahân.

Sylwer mewn rhai amgylchiadau dylai'r swm a gewch gael ei ddisodli yn eich cyfrifiad gan werth marchnad yr ased rydych yn ei waredu. Defnyddiwch werth marchnad yr ased yn lle'r pris a gawsoch os rhoddwyd yr ased gennych, os gwerthwyd yr ased am lai na'i werth llawn yn fwriadol, neu os gwaredwyd yr ased i berson cysylltiol.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach gweler Nodiadau Crynhoi Enillion Cyfalaf (PDF 127K)

Ceir arweiniad ynglŷn ag ystyr 'gwerth marchnad' a 'derbyniadau gwaredu' ar dudalen CGN 17 a CGN 18, ar 'cost caffael' ar dudalen CGN 18 ac ar 'person cysylltiol' ar dudalen CGN 4.

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content: Warning: You have selected 'Yes' to Cash Basis, you can only claim capital allowances on cars which are used in your business.

Gofynnir i chi nodi cyfanswm eich colledion, os oes rhai, yn nes ymlaen.

English Content:
As the unauthorised payments charge and surcharge aren't charges on income, they aren't exempted from any of the UK's Double Taxation Arrangements.

However, if a payment gives rise to a charge (and a surcharge) you can receive credit for foreign tax paid on the payment that can be set against the charge (and the surcharge).

Enter in this field the sterling equivalent of the amount of any foreign tax you've paid on a payment entered in either 'Amount of unauthorised payment from a pension scheme, not subject to Surcharge' or 'Amount of unauthorised payment from a pension scheme, subject to Surcharge'.

You can convert the amount into sterling using the 'spot rate' for the date of the tax payment.
Welsh Content:
Gan nad yw'r codiant a'r gordal ar daliadau anawdurdodedig yn godiannau ar incwm, nid ydynt wedi eu heithrio gan unrhyw Drefniadau Trethiant Dwbl y DU.

Fodd bynnag, os bydd taliad yn achosi codiant (a gordal), gallwch dderbyn credyd am dreth dramor a dalwyd ar y taliad a gellir ei osod yn erbyn y codiant (a'r gordal).

Yn y blwch hwn nodwch y gyfwerth mewn sterling o'r dreth dramor a dalwyd gennych ar daliad a nodwyd yn naill ai 'Swm y taliad nas awdurdodwyd gan gynllun pensiwn, nad yw'n agored i Ordal' neu 'Swm y taliad nas awdurdodwyd gan gynllun pensiwn, sy'n agored i Ordal'.

Gallwch drosi'r swm i sterling gan ddefnyddio'r 'gyfradd ar y pryd' ar gyfer dyddiad talu'r dreth.

English Content: Did you receive any dividends, for example, UK companies, authorised unit trusts, open-ended investment companies, foreign companies (up to £300)?

English Content:
If you pay tax under PAYE, your 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 tax code may have been adjusted to collect tax you owe for earlier years. Look at your 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 PAYE Coding Notice. If it includes an 'amount of underpaid tax for earlier years' then this amount is also automatically shown on your return.

Please enter '0' only if there is nothing shown.
Welsh Content: Os ydych yn talu treth o dan TWE, efallai bod eich cod treth 2016 i 2017 wedi ei addasu er mwyn casglu teth sy'n ddyledus gennych ar gyfer blynyddoedd cynharach. Edrychwch ar eich Hysbysiad Cod TWE 2016 i 2017. Os yw'n cynnwys 'swm o dreth a dandalwyd ar gyfer blynyddoedd cynharach' yna dangosir y swm ar eich ffurflen yn awtomatig hefyd. Nodwch '0' os dangosir dim byd yn unig.

English Content:
The information to complete this field can be found on your P11D form, provided by your employer.

Enter the total cash equivalent of any private medical or other health treatment or insurance you get by reason of your employment. Generally, it's the cost to the person who provided it to you (minus any amount you paid to that person)

Enter the figure from section 1 box 11, on your P11D.
Welsh Content:
Mae'r wybodaeth i lenwi'r blwch hwn i'w chael ar eich ffurflen P11D, a roddir i chi gan eich cyflogwr.

Nodwch y cywerth mewn arian unrhyw driniaeth feddygol neu iechyd arall preifat neu yswiriant rydych yn ei dderbyn oherwydd eich cyflogaeth. Yn gyffredinol, dyma'r gost i'r person sy'n ei ddarparu ar eich cyfer (llai unrhyw swm a daloch chi i'r person hwnnw).

Nodwch y ffigur o adran I, blwch 11, ar eich P11D.

English Content: The total amount of Child Benefit you and your partner were entitled to receive for the year to 5th April 2017:
Welsh Content: Cyfanswm y Budd-dal Plant yr oedd gennych chi a'ch partner yr hawl i'w dderbyn am y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017:

English Content:
The information to complete this field can be found on your P11D form, provided by your employer.

As a reference, this figure will usually be the market value of any goods given to you by your employer but it may be a higher figure if the cost to the employer of creating the item was more than its market value.

Goods and other assets provided by your employer

Enter the sum of the figures from sections A and L in boxes 13 of the P11D. Usually this figure will be the market value of any goods given to you by your employer but it may be a higher figure if the cost to the employer of creating the item was more than its market value.
Welsh Content:
Mae'r wybodaeth i gwblhau'r blwch hwn i'w chael ar eich ffurflen P11D, a roddir i chi gan eich cyflogwr.

Fel arfer, y ffigur hwn fydd gwerth y farchnad o unrhyw nwyddau a roddwyd i chi gan eich cyflogwr, ond gall fod yn ffigur uwch os yw'r gost i'r cyflogwr o greu'r eitem yn fwy na'i werth marchnad.

Nwyddau ac asedion eraill a ddarparwyd gan eich cyflogwr

Nodwch swm y ffigurau o adrannau A ac L ym mlychau 13 y P11D. Fel arfer y ffigur hwn fydd y gwerth marchnad o unrhyw nwyddau a rhoddir i chi gan eich cyflogwr ond gall fod yn ffigur uwch os yw'r gost i'r cyflogwr o greu'r eitem yn fwy na'i werth marchnadol.

English Content: This figure has been automatically calculated for you, and is the amount of any overall loss this year in the 'Total adjusted profit or loss' field plus any losses brought forward from earlier years, minus any amount set off against total income entered in the 'Loss offset against total income' field. You'll  need this figure for next year's Tax Return. If you have set any of your loss against your EEA Furnished Holiday Lettings reduce this figure by the amount used.

Dyma'r golled gyflawn am y flwyddyn yn y blwch 'Cyfanswm yr elw neu'r golled wedi'i addasu'yn ogystal ag unrhyw golledion a ddygwyd ymlaen i o flynyddoedd cynharach, llai unrhyw swm a wrthbwyswyd yn erbyn cyfanswm yr incwm a nodwyd yn y blwch 'Colled a wrthbwyswyd yn erbyn cyfanswm yr incwm'. English Content:
You pay tax for 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 on the profits and claim relief for the losses of your 'basis period'. After the first one or two years as a partner, your basis period will be the same as the partnership's accounting period, unless the partnership changes its accounting date.

For example, if the partnership's accounting date is 31 December and you became a partner on 1 January 2016, your basis period for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 is the 12 months from 1 January 2016 to 31 December 2016.

However, in the first year or two as a partner, or when you leave the partnership, your basis period may not be the same as the partnership's accounting period.

Full details of the rules used to work out your basis period are in Help Sheet 222 - How to calculate your taxable profits.

Enter the date on which your basis period for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 ended in this field.
Welsh Content:
Rydych yn talu treth ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 ar yr elw ac yn gwneud cais am ryddhad parthed colledion eich 'cyfnod sail'. Ar ôl y flwyddyn gyntaf neu'r 2 flynedd gyntaf fel partner, bydd eich cyfnod sail yr un peth â chyfnod cyfrifyddu'r bartneriaeth, oni fydd y bartneriaeth yn newid ei dyddiad cyfrifyddu.

Er enghraifft, os yw dyddiad cyfrifyddu'r bartneriaeth ar 31 Rhagfyr a daethoch yn bartner ar 1 Ionawr 2016, eich cyfnod sail ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 yw'r 12 mis o 1 Ionawr 2016 i 31 Rhagfyr 2016.

Fodd bynnag, yn y flwyddyn gyntaf neu'r ddwy flynedd gyntaf fel partner, neu pan fyddwch yn gadael y bartneriaeth, efallai na fydd eich cyfnod sail yr un peth â chyfnod cyfrifyddu'r bartneriaeth.

Ceir manylion llawn o'r rheolau a ddefnyddir i gyfrifo'ch cyfnod sail yn Nhaflen Gymorth 222 How to calculate your taxable profits.

Nodwch y dyddiad y daeth eich cyfnod sail ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 i ben yn y blwch hwn.

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
Your employer has to tell us, on a Form P11D, about all taxable benefits and expenses provided or paid to you. They may either give you a copy of the P11D, or give you the same information, and they must do this by 6 July 2017. If you have not had it by then, speak to your employer or phone HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC).

If your employer has a dispensation (an arrangement with HMRC that saves you having to return income and then ask HMRC to give you tax relief for the same amount) some benefits or expenses may not appear on the P11D. Do not worry about this - and do not enter them on your 'Employment' page.

If exceptionally you do not receive a copy of form P11D or need to calculate the benefit yourself, the following Help Sheets provide further information:

  • Help Sheet 202 - Living accommodation
  • Help Sheet 207 - Non-taxable payments or benefits for employees
Welsh Content:
Mae'n rhaid i'ch cyflogwr ddweud wrth Gyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM), ar Ffurflen P11D, am yr holl fuddiannau a threuliau trethadwy a rhoddwyd neu a dalwyd i chi. Fe allant naill ai roi copi o'r P11D neu'r un wybodaeth i chi, ac mae'n rhaid iddynt wneud hynny erbyn 6 Gorffennaf 2017. Os na fyddwch wedi ei derbyn erbyn hynny dylech gael gair â'ch cyflogwr neu ffoniwch Cyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM).

Os oes goddefeb gan eich cyflogwr (trefniant gyda CThEM sy'n arbed i chi orfod datgan incwm ac yna gofyn i CThEM roi rhyddhad treth i chi am yr un swm), efallai na fydd rhai buddiannau a threuliau'n ymddangos ar y P11D. Peidiwch â phoeni am hyn - a pheidiwch â'u dangos ar eich tudalen Cyflogaeth.

Os, yn eithriadol, nad ydych yn derbyn copi o ffurflen P11D nac angen cyfrifo'r buddiant eich hun, mae'r Taflenni Cymorth yn rhoi fwy o wybodaeth:

  • Taflen Gymorth 202 - Living accommodation
  • Taflen Gymorth 207 - Non-taxable payments or benefits for employees

  • your spouse or civil partner's income was less than £43,000

English Content:
If you've changed your accounting date and still want the change to count for tax purposes, select 'Yes' from the drop down menu, otherwise select 'No'.

Changes of accounting date

There is a change of accounting date if any of the following reasons apply:

  • you've drawn up your accounts to a date which is not the same as the date used for tax purposes last year
  • you intend to draw up accounts for more than 12 months and no accounting date falls in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017
  • you changed your accounting date last year, this was not accepted by HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) and you've drawn up your accounts to the same date this year. (But if you have changed back to your old date this is not treated as a change of accounting date.)

You will usually want your new accounting date to count for tax, otherwise your basis period won't end on the same date as your accounts. If you intend this to be only a temporary change, you may want to ignore it for tax purposes. You can then work out your tax using the same basis period as last year.

Changes of basis period

Special rules which apply if you change your accounting date:

  • if your accounting date in 2016 to 2017 is more than 12 months after the end of the basis period for 2015 to 2016, your basis period is the period between the end of the basis period for 2014 to 2015 and the new accounting date. For example, the basis period for 2015 to 2016 ended on 31 May 2015 and the new accounting date is 31 August 2016. Your basis period is the 15-month period 1 June 2015 to 31 August 2016
  • if your accounting date in 2016 to 2017 is less than 12 months after the end of the basis period for 2015 to 2016, your basis period is the 12 months ending on the new accounting date. For example, the basis period for 2015 to 2016 ended on 31 December 2015 and the new accounting date is 31 July 2016. Your basis period is the 12-month period 1 August 2015 to 31 July 2016
Welsh Content:
Os ydych wedi newid y dyddiad cyfrifyddu ac os ydych am i'r newid gael ei ystyried at ddibenion treth, dewiswch 'Ydy' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Nac ydy'.

Mae Taflen Gymorth 222 How to calculate your taxable profits yn esbonio canlyniadau newid eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu.

English Content:
When basis periods overlap (for example in the first 2 years of business or following a change in accounting date) you should keep a record of both the overlap profit and the overlap period. The overlap profit is carried forward each year until you are able to claim overlap relief.

Overlap relief used this year
You may be entitled to overlap relief if you:

  • sold or closed down your business, and your basis period this year does not begin on 6 April
  • changed your accounting date resulting in a change of basis period, and your basis period this year is more than 12 months long

For help on working out the overlap follow the link Help Sheet 222 - How to calculate your profits.
If you've stopped working for yourself, you're taxable on any profits for the period beginning on the day after your last accounting period and the date your business ceased. You may be entitled to a tax relief called 'overlap relief'.
You must also tell us the date you stopped working for yourself. If you no longer need to pay Class 2 National Insurance contributions, we will arrange for your bills to stop.
Complete the online form here Stopping self-employment
If you've changed your accounting date and still want the change to count for tax purposes, select 'Yes' from the drop down menu, otherwise select 'No'.

Changes of accounting date
There is a change of accounting date if any of the following reasons apply:

  • you've drawn up your accounts to a date which is not the same as the date used for tax purposes last year
  • you intend to draw up accounts for more than 12 months and no accounting date falls in the 2015 to 2016 tax year
  • you changed your accounting date last year, this was not accepted by HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) and you've drawn up your accounts to the same date this year. (But if you have changed back to your old date this is not treated as a change of accounting date.)

You will usually want your new accounting date to count for tax, otherwise your basis period won't end on the same date as your accounts. If you intend this to be only a temporary change, you may want to ignore it for tax purposes. You can then work out your tax using the same basis period as last year.

Changes of basis period
Special rules which apply if you change your accounting date:

  • if your accounting date in 2015 to 2016 is more than 12 months after the end of the basis period for 2014 to 2015, your basis period is the period between the end of the basis period for 2013 to 2014 and the new accounting date. For example, the basis period for 2014 to 2015 ended on 31 May 2014 and the new accounting date is 31 August 2015. Your basis period is the 15-month period 1 June 2014 to 31 August 2015
  • if your accounting date in 2015 to 2016 is less than 12 months after the end of the basis period for 2014 to 2015, your basis period is the 12 months ending on the new accounting date. For example, the basis period for 2014 to 2015 ended on 31 December 2014 and the new accounting date is 31 July 2015. Your basis period is the 12-month period 1 August 2014 to 31 July 2015
Welsh Content:
Pan fydd cyfnodau sail yn gorgyffwrdd (er enghraifft yn ystod 2 flynedd gyntaf y busnes neu'n dilyn newid mewn dyddiad cyfrifyddu), dylech gadw cofnod o'r elw gorgyffwrdd yn ogystal â'r cyfnod gorgyffwrdd. Caiff yr elw gorgyffwrdd ei gario ymlaen bob blwyddyn tan eich bod yn gallu hawlio rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd.

Rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd a ddefnyddiwyd yn y flwyddyn hon
Efallai y bydd gennych hawl i gael rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd os:

  • gwnaethoch werthu neu gau eich busnes, ac nid yw eich cyfnod sail y flwyddyn hon yn cychwyn ar 6 Ebrill
  • gwnaethoch newid eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu, gan arwain at newid yn y cyfnod sail, ac mae eich cyfnod sail y flwyddyn hon bellach yn hwy na 12 mis o hyd

Am help ar gyfrifo'r gorgyffwrdd, dilynwch y cysylltiad Taflen Gymorth 222 - How to calculate your profits.
Os ydych wedi peidio â gweithio i chi eich hun, byddwch yn agored i dreth ar unrhyw elw ar gyfer y cyfnod sy'n dechrau ar y diwrnod ar ôl eich cyfnod cyfrifyddu diwethaf a'r dyddiad y daeth eich busnes i ben. Efallai y bydd hawl gennych gael rhyddhad treth a elwir yn 'rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd'.
Mae'n rhaid i chi hefyd rhoi gwybod i ni'r dyddiad y gwnaethoch roi'r gorau i weithio i chi'ch hun. Os nad oes rhaid i chi dalu Cyfraniadau Yswiriant Gwladol Dosbarth 2 bellach, byddwnyn trefnu bod eich biliau'n stopio.
Llenwch y ffurflen ar-lein hon, Rhoi'r gorau i hunangyflogaeth
Os ydych wedi newid eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu ac am i'r newid gyfrif tuag at ddibenion treth o hyd, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'.

Newid y dyddiad cyfrifyddu
Mae yna newid i'r dyddiad cyfrifyddu os yw un o'r canlynol yn gymwys:

  • rydych wedi llunio'ch cyfrifon i ddyddiad nad yw'r un peth â'r dyddiad a ddefnyddir at ddibenion treth blwyddyn ddiwethaf
  • rydych yn bwriadu llunio cyfrifon am fwy na 12 mis ac nid oes yr un dyddiad cyfrifyddu yn disgyn ym mlwyddyn dreth 2016 i 2017
  • newidiwyd eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu gennych flwyddyn ddiwethaf – ni dderbyniwyd hyn gan Gyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) ac rydych wedi llunio eich cyfrifon i'r un dyddiad y flwyddyn hon. (Fodd bynnag, os ydych wedi newid yn ôl i'ch hen ddyddiad, nid yw hyn yn cael ei drin fel newid yn y dyddiad cyfrifyddu.)

Fel arfer, byddwch am i'ch dyddiad cyfrifyddu newydd i gyfrif ar gyfer treth – fel arall ni fydd eich cyfnod sail yn dod i ben ar yr un dyddiad â'ch cyfrifon. Os ydych yn bwriadu i hyn fod yn newid dros dro yn unig, efallai y byddwch am ei anwybyddu at ddibenion treth. Yna gallwch gyfrifo eich treth gan ddefnyddio'r un cyfnod sail â llynedd.

Newid i'r cyfnod sail
Rheolau arbennig sy'n gymwys os ydych yn newid eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu:

  • os yw eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu yn 2016 i 2017 yn fwy na 12 mis ar ôl diwedd y cyfnod sail ar gyfer 2014 i 2016, eich cyfnod sail yw'r cyfnod rhwng diwedd y cyfnod sail ar gyfer 2013 i 2014, a'r dyddiad cyfrifyddu newydd. Er enghraifft, daeth y cyfnod sail ar gyfer 2014 i 2016 i ben ar 31 Mai 2014, a'r dyddiad cyfrifyddu newydd yw 31 Awst 2016. Eich cyfnod sail yw'r cyfnod 15-mis o 1 Mehefin 2014 hyd at 31 Awst 2016
  • os yw eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu yn 2016 i 2017 yn llai na 12 mis ar ôl diwedd y cyfnod sail ar gyfer 2014 i 2016, eich cyfnod sail yw'r 12 mis sy'n dod i ben ar y dyddiad cyfrifyddu newydd. Er enghraifft, daeth y cyfnod sail ar gyfer 2014 i 2016 i ben ar 31 Rhagfyr 2014, a'r dyddiad cyfrifyddu newydd yw 31 Gorffennaf 2016. Eich cyfnod sail yw'r cyfnod 12-mis o 1 Awst 2014 hyd at 31 Gorffennaf 2016

English Content:
Enter the date which your books or accounts are made up to.

The last day of your trading or business year will be the date you make your books up to, or your accounting date (that is, the end of your accounting period). You usually pay tax on the profits of the accounting period ending in the tax year covered by the tax return. The rules are different for the first 2 or 3 years of trading, dependent on when your first accounting period ended.

Help Sheet 222 - How to calculate your taxable profits explains this in detail.

If you've been working for yourself for less than 12 months you must choose an accounting date to go in this field. If you've a date later than 5 April 2017 and you've made up your first set of books, use those figures for these pages. HM Revenue and Customs will tax you on the part of your profit that falls into the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017.

If you've stopped working for yourself, and the date in 'If your business ceased after 5 April 2016 but before 6 April 2017 enter the final date of trading' on the Business details page is not the same as the date in this field, you should complete the self-employment section of the return for the final period of trading.
Welsh Content:
Nodwch ddyddiad cau eich llyfrau neu eich cyfrifon.

Diwrnod olaf eich blwyddyn fasnachu neu eich blwyddyn fusnes bydd dyddiad cau eich llyfrau, neu eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu (hynny yw, diwedd eich cyfnod cyfrifyddu). Fel arfer byddwch yn talu treth ar elw'r cyfnod cyfrifyddu a ddaw i ben yn y flwyddyn dreth a gwmpesir gan y ffurflen dreth. Mae'r rheolau yn wahanol ar gyfer y ddwy neu dair blynedd pan fyddwch yn masnachu, yn dibynnu ar pryd fydd eich cyfnod cyfrifyddu cyntaf yn dod i ben.

Mae Taflen Gymorth 222 How to calculate your taxable profits yn esbonio hyn yn fanylach.

Os buoch yn gweithio i chi eich hun am lai na 12 mis, bydd yn rhaid i chi ddewis dyddiad cyfrifyddu i'w roi yn y blwch hwn. Os ydy'r dyddiad ar ôl 5 Ebrill 2017 ac rydych wedi paratoi eich llyfrau cyntaf, defnyddiwch y ffigurau hynny ar gyfer y tudalennau hyn. Bydd CThEM yn eich trethu ar y rhan honno o'ch elw sy'n disgyn yn y flwyddyn dreth 6 Ebrill 2016 i 5 Ebrill 2017.

Os ydych wedi peidio â gweithio i chi eich hun, ac os nad yw'r dyddiad yn y blwch 'Os daeth eich busnes i ben ar ol 5 Ebrill 2016 ond cyn 6 Ebrill 2017 nodwch y dyddiad masnachu olaf' ar y dudalen Manylion busnes yr un peth â'r dyddiad yn y blwch hwn, dylech gwblhau adran hunangyflogaeth y ffurflen dreth ar gyfer y cyfnod masnachu olaf.

English Content:
This is an amount of tax withheld on certain payments to UK residents by some European Member States and other related and 3rd party territories under the terms of the European Savings Directive and equivalent 3rd party agreements. This tax will be in addition to any foreign tax deducted by the country of origin of the payment.

The countries that may deduct Special Withholding Tax (SWT) are:

Andorra, Austria, Bonaire, St Eustatius and Saba, British Virgin Islands, Curacao, Gibraltar, Guernsey (up to 30/6/2011), Isle of Man (up to 30/6/2011), Jersey, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Monaco, San Marino, St Maarten, Switzerland and Turks and Caicos Islands.

Where SWT is deducted you are treated as having paid in the year of deduction an equivalent amount of Income Tax in the UK, which can be set against your UK tax liability of that year or repaid to you if the amount exceeds that liability.

Please enter the amount of any Special Withholding Tax deducted from the income. If any UK Income Tax has been deducted from the income this should also be included here and please give further details in the 'Any other information' field at the end of the 'Fill in your return' section.
Welsh Content:
Dyma swm y dreth a gaiff ei atal ar daliadau penodol i breswylwyr y DU gan rai Gwladwriaethau sy'n Aelodau o'r Undeb Ewropeaidd a thiriogaethau cysylltiedig a thiriogaethau trydydd parti eraill o dan amodau Cyfarwyddeb Cynilion Ewrop a chytundebau trydydd parti cyfwerth. Bydd y dreth hon yn ychwanegol at unrhyw dreth dramor a ddidynnir gan wlad wreiddiol y taliad.

Y gwledydd all didynnu'r Treth Ataliedig Arbennig (TAA) yw:

Andorra, Awstria, Bonaire, Cwrasao, Gibraltar, Guernsey (hyd at 30/6/2011), Jersey, Liechtenstein, Lucsembwrg, Monaco, San Marino, Y Swistir, Ynys Manaw (hyd at 30/6/2011), Ynys St Maarten, Ynysoedd St Eustatius a Saba, Ynysoedd y Turks a Caicos ac Ynysoedd y Wyryf Prydeinig.

Lle didynnir TAA rydych yn cael eich trin fel pe baech wedi, ym mlwyddyn y didyniad, wedi talu swm cyfwerth o Dreth Incwm yn y DU. Gall y swm hwn gael ei osod yn erbyn eich rhwymedigaeth Treth y DU ar gyfer y flwyddyn honno neu ei ad-dalu i chi os yw'r swm yn fwy na'r rhwymedigaeth.

Nodwch swm unrhyw Dreth Ataliedig Arbennig a ddidynnwyd o'r incwm. Os didynnwyd Treth Incwm y DU o'r incwm dylid cynnwys hwn yma hefyd. Dylech roi manylion pellach yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' ar ddiwedd yr adran 'Cwblhau eich ffurflen dreth'

English Content:
Don't include questions in this box as we can't answer specific questions from your tax return.

Please enter:

  • the name of the company invested in
  • the date of issue of the shares
  • the name of the HM Revenue and Customs office authorising the issue of the EIS3 or EIS5 and their reference
  • the total amount of the subscription on which you are claiming relief for the year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017. (If you've subscribed more than £1,000,000, refer to Help Sheet 341 - Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief)

Help Sheet 341- Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief explains how relief can be allocated to the shares.

You can enter a maximum of 240 characters, including spaces. You can only enter letters and numbers and the special characters '()*,-./£@&.

Do not use the 'Enter' (or 'Return') key on the keyboard when entering information into, or moving away from, this field. Use the spacebar on the keyboard if you need to make more than one entry.
Welsh Content:
Peidiwch â chynnwys cwestiynau yn y blwch hwn gan na allwn ateb unrhyw gwestiynau penodol o'ch ffurflen dreth.

Nodwch:

  • Enw'r cwmni y gwnaethoch fuddsoddi yndd
  • Dyddiad cyhoeddi'r cyfranddaliadau
  • Enw swyddfa Cyllid a Thollau EM sy'n awdurdodi dosbarthu'r EIS3 neu'r EIS5, a'u cyfeirnod.
  • cyfanswm y tanysgrifiad rydych yn hawlio rhyddhad ar ei gyfer am y flwyddyn hyd 5 Ebrill 2017. (Os ydych wedi tanysgrifio mwy na 100,000 darllenwch Taflen Gymorth 341 - Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief )

Mae Taflen Gymorth 341 Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief yn esbonio sut y gellir dyrannu'r rhyddhad i'r cyfranddaliadau.

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

Gallwch nodi hyd at 240 nod, gan gynnwys bylchau Gallwch nodi llythrennau a rhifau a’r nodau arbennig '()*,-./£@& yn unig.

Peidiwch â defnyddio'r botwm 'Enter' (neu 'Return')ar y bysellfwrdd wrth nodi gwybodaeth yn y blwch hwn, neu wrth symud oddi yno. Defnyddiwch y bylchwr ar y bysellfwrdd os oes angen i chi wneud mwy nag un cofnod.

English Content:
Total gains after taper relief and total losses brought forward and used, if any, should be entered in the capital gains summary.

Please note that this is a stand-alone calculator. The calculation will not be saved so you may wish to print a copy for your records.

Losses are set against gains in the most beneficial way to you. They are deducted first from gains that will have the highest percentage rate remaining chargeable after applying taper relief (but losses are set against your gains before applying taper relief).

Losses of the current year are deducted before losses brought forward from earlier years. Losses brought forward are used only to the extent necessary to reduce the total of all gains to the annual exempt amount for the year, £9,200. Unused losses may be carried forward to later years.

The totals in the columns headed 'Losses brought forward and used' and 'Gain after taper relief' are those which you should enter the capital gains summary page.
Welsh Content:
Dylid nodi cyfanswm yr enillion ar ôl rhyddhad meinhau a chyfanswm y colledion a ddygwyd ymlaen ac a ddefnyddiwyd, os o gwbl, yng nghrynodeb yr enillion cyfalaf.

Sylwer mai cyfrifiannell arunig yw hon. Ni chaiff y cyfrifiad ei gadw felly efallai y byddwch am argraffu copi ar gyfer eich cofnodion.

Gosodir y colledion yn erbyn enillion yn y ffordd fwyaf buddiol i chi. Fe'i didynnir yn gyntaf o'r enillion hynny sy'n dal yn agored i dreth ar y gyfradd ganrannol uchaf ar ôl caniatáu rhyddhad meinhau (ond gosodir colledion yn erbyn eich enillion cyn rhoi rhyddhad meinhau).

Ddidynnir colledion am y flwyddyn gyfredol cyn y colledion a ddygir ymlaen o flynyddoedd cynharach. Defnyddir colledion a ddygwyd ymlaen cyn belled ag y mae angen i leihau cyfanswm yr enillion i'r swm blynyddol a eithrir, sef £9,200. Gellir cario colledion nas defnyddiwyd ymlaen i flynyddoedd diweddarach.

Y cyfansymiau yn y colofnau o dan y penawdau 'Colledion a ddygwyd ymlaen ac a ddefnyddiwyd' ac 'Ennill ar ôl rhyddhad meinhau' yw'r rhai y dylech eu nodi ar y dudalen crynhoi enillion cyfalaf.

English Content:
Enter the total income from all furnished holiday lettings in the European Economic Area - that is the rents for the year to 5 April 2017 and any income from services you provided.

Generally, you can claim any costs incurred in earning your furnished holiday letting business profits. If your total property income in the year, including furnished holiday letting income, before expenses is less than £83,000, you do not have to list expenses separately.

Although you cannot claim any capital costs (such as expenses relating to the purchase of, or improvements, additions and alterations to land, property, equipment, furnishings or furniture) you may be able to claim capital allowances.

For further guidance and information please follow the link Notes on UK property.

Yn gyffredinol, gallwch hawlio unrhyw gostau a dalwyd gennych er mwyn ennill elw o'ch busnes llety gwyliau wedi'i dodrefnu. Os yw cyfanswm eich incwm o osod eiddo yn y flwyddyn, gan gynnwys incwm o osod llety gwyliau wedi'i ddodrefnu, cyn treuliau yn llai na £83,000 y flwyddyn, does dim rhaid i chi restru treuliau ar wahân.

  • has income from selling or allowing others to reproduce literary or artistic works which were created by one or more of the partners

you may be able to claim an adjustment for 'averaging'.

For more information please view the:

  • Help Sheet 224 - Farmers and market gardeners
  • Help Sheet 234 - Averaging for creators of literary or artistic works

Enter in this field the amount by which your profit is changed by the averaging claim. Put a minus sign (-) in if the adjustment reduces your profit. This entry does not change the amount of any loss to be included later in the return.

English Content:
You can claim to have the loss relieved by reference to income of an earlier year.

There are two ways of doing this:

  • if your business was set up and commenced trading on or after 6 April 2013, you can claim relief for the loss calculated by reference to your income (but not capital gains) of the three years 2013 to 2014 to 2015 to 2016. The loss is first relieved by reference to your 2013 to 2014 income. If there is any balance of loss left, this is relieved by reference to your 2014 to 2015 income. Finally, any remainder is relieved by reference to your 2015 to 2016 income
  • you can claim relief for the loss to be calculated by reference to your income for 2015 to 2016. If the loss is more than your 2015 to 2016 income, you can, if you wish, claim relief for the balance of the loss to be calculated by reference to your capital gains for 2015 to 2016, or against your income or your income and capital gains of 2016 to 2017. This option is available to any business

The amount of loss that you can claim may be restricted.

Don't make these claims if you used cash basis.

The time limit for claims is 31 January 2019.

If your business ceased in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 you can claim relief for losses in the final 12 months against profit in the same business in the 3 previous years. Start with the latest year.

The time limit for claims is 5 April 2021.

These claims relate to 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 even though they're calculated by reference to your income or capital gains and circumstances of the earlier years.

If you want to claim relief enter the total loss to be relieved by reference to earlier years' income and gains and provide details of the amount for each year in the 'Any other information' field at the end of this section.

For more information see Help Sheet 227 - Losses.
Welsh Content:
Gallwch hawlio rhyddhad am y golled drwy gyfeirio at incwm blwyddyn flaenorol.

Mae dwy ffordd o wneud hyn:

  • os sefydlwyd eich busnes ac os dechreuodd fasnachu ar neu ar ôl 6 Ebrill 2012, gallwch hawlio rhyddhad am y golled sydd i'w gyfrifo drwy gyfeirio at eich incwm (ond nid enillion cyfalaf) o'r tair blynedd 2012 i 2013 hyd at 2014 i 2016. Ceir rhyddhad gyntaf am y golled drwy gyfeirio at eich incwm ar gyfer 2012 i 2013. Os oes unrhyw golled yn weddill, ceir rhyddhad drwy gyfeirio at eich incwm ar gyfer 2014 i 2016. Yn olaf, ceir rhyddhad am unrhyw golled sy'n weddill drwy gyfeirio at eich incwm yn 2014 i 2016, neu
  • gallwch hawlio rhyddhad am y golled sydd i'w gyfrifo drwy gyfeirio at eich incwm ar gyfer 2014 i 2016. Os bydd y golled yn fwy na'ch incwm yn 2014 i 2016, gallwch hawlio rhyddhad am y golled sy'n weddill, os dymunwch, sydd i'w gyfrifo drwy gyfeirio at eich enillion cyfalaf ar gyfer 2014 i 2016, neu yn erbyn eich incwm neu'ch incwm ac enillion cyfalaf ar gyfer 2016 i 2017. Mae'r opsiwn hwn ar gael i unrhyw fusnes

Gellir cyfyngu ar swm y golled y gallwch ei hawlio.

Peidiwch â gwneud y ceisiadau hyn os gwnaethoch ddefnyddio sail arian parod.

Y dyddiad cau ar gyfer y ceisiadau hyn yw 31 Ionawr 2018.

Os daeth eich busnes i ben yn 2016 i 2017, gallwch hawlio rhyddhad am golledion yn y 12 mis olaf yn erbyn elw yn yr un busnes yn y 3 blynedd flaenorol. Dechreuwch gyda'r flwyddyn ddiweddaraf.

Y dyddiad cau ar gyfer y cais hwn yw 5 Ebrill 2020.

Mae'r ceisiadau hyn yn ymwneud â 2016 i 2017, hyd yn oed eu bod yn cael eu cyfrifo drwy gyfeirio at eich incwm neu'ch enillion cyfalaf a'ch amgylchiadau mewn blynyddoedd blaenorol.

Os ydych am hawlio rhyddhad, nodwch gyfanswm y golled sydd i dderbyn rhyddhad drwy gyfeirio at incwm ac enillion neu elw blynyddoedd cynharach yma, a rhowch fanylion y swm ar gyfer pob blwyddyn yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' ar ddiwedd yr adran hon.

Am ragor o wybodaeth, gweler Taflen Gymorth 227 - Losses.

English Content:
Some people are able to claim an alternative basis of calculating the amount of tax due. This is known as the remittance basis.

The remittance basis is an alternative tax treatment that is available to people who are a resident (a person who lives somewhere permanently or on a long-term basis) in the UK and who are:

  • not domiciled (treat a specified country as a permanent home) in the UK, or
  • not ordinarily resident in the UK

Remittance basis taxpayers are liable to UK tax in the ordinary way on their UK source income and gains. But they are only liable to UK tax on any amounts of foreign income and gains that are remitted to the UK.

Note 1: You can claim to be taxed on the remittance basis on your foreign gains only if you are a resident but not domiciled in the UK.

Note 2: If you used the remittance basis in an earlier tax year, any foreign income or gains of that year that you later remit are taxable in the year that you remit them regardless of whether you use the arising basis or the remittance basis for that tax year.

Note 3: The remittance basis does not apply to chargeable event gains under a policy of life insurance, life annuity or on a capital redemption policy. These are taxable on the full amount arising in the year irrespective of whether they are remitted to the UK or not.

Information about residence, domicile and the remittance basis of taxation can be found in booklet RDR1 Guidance Notes: Residence, Domicile and Remittance Basis.

HM Revenue and Customs strongly recommends that you read booklet RDR1, in particular Chapter 9, before you make any decision about claiming the remittance basis of taxation.

For more information about paying tax on the remittance basis, follow the link Helpsheet 264 - Remittance basis. You will need to complete the Residence, Remittance Basis etc pages (SA109). You cannot however file these supplementary pages online using this free HMRC service. Instead if you want to file your tax return online, you will need to exit this service and purchase alternative software.

Choosing a commercial supplier

  • nad yw eu domisil (yn trin gwlad benodedig fel cartref parhaol) yn y DU, neu
  • nad ydynt fel arfer yn preswylio yn y DU

Mae trethdalwyr y sail drosglwyddo yn agored i dreth y DU ar eu hincwm ac enillion o ffynonellau'r DU, a hynny yn y ffordd arferol. Fodd bynnag, dim ond ar symiau o incwm ac enillion a drosglwyddir i'r DU y maent yn agored i dreth.

Nodyn 1: Dim ond os ydych yn preswylio yn y DU ac nad yw eich domisil yno y gallwch hawlio i gael eich trethu ar y sail drosglwyddo.

Nodyn 2: Os gwnaethoch ddefnyddio'r sail drosglwyddo mewn blwyddyn dreth gynharach, mae unrhyw incwm neu enillion dramor o'r flwyddyn honno sy'n cael eu trosglwyddo gennych yn hwyrach yn drethadwy yn y flwyddyn yr ydych yn eu trosglwyddo, p'un a ydych yn defnyddio'r sail godi neu'r sail drosglwyddo ar gyfer y flwyddyn dreth honno neu beidio.

Nodyn 3: Nid yw'r sail drosglwyddo yn gymwys i enillion digwyddiad trethadwy o dan bolisi yswiriant bywyd, blwydd-dal bywyd neu bolisi adbryniant cyfalaf. Mae'r rhain yn drethadwy ar y cyfanswm sy'n codi yn y flwyddyn, p'un a ydynt i'w trosglwyddo i'r DU neu beidio.

Ceir gwybodaeth am breswylio, domisil a'r sail drosglwyddo trethiant yn llyfryn RDR1 – Nodiadau Arweiniad: Residence, Domicile and Remittance Basis. Ewch i www.gov.uk a theipio 'RDR1' yn y bar chwilio.

Bydd angen i chi gwblhau'r tudalennau Residence, Remittance Basis etc (SA109). Fodd bynnag, ni allwch gyflwyno'r tudalennau atodol hyn ar-lein gan ddefnyddio gwasanaeth rhad ac am ddim CThEM. Yn lle hynny, os ydych am gyflwyno eich Ffurflen Dreth ar-lein, bydd angen i chi adael y gwasanaeth hwn. English Content:
Because you selected 'yes' from the drop down menu, you must now say what percentage rate of relief (the foreign tax deducted) that you want to set against your liability to UK tax on that same income.

Foreign Tax Credit Relief isn't always available, or may not be available on the full amount of foreign tax you've paid. Relief is subject to the following rules:

  1. You must be a UK resident.
  2. The income must arise in the foreign country and be properly chargeable under the foreign country's law.
  3. The amount of Foreign Tax Credit Relief must not exceed the UK tax on the same item of income or gains.
  4. Where a Double Taxation Agreement exists between the UK and the other country, the amount of foreign tax available for the relief is restricted to the minimum foreign tax payable under the terms of the Agreement.

To check if the UK has entered into a Double Taxation Agreement with the foreign territory you should go to Double Taxation Treaties which provides further information.

If a double taxation agreement does exist you must check what it says and how it applies to you. If you can claim foreign tax credit relief, use the list to look up the maximum percentage rate of tax for the income that you have and select that rate from the drop-down list.

The automatic calculation of foreign tax credit relief will use this figure to make any necessary adjustments to the amount of foreign tax for which you are claiming a credit against your liability to UK tax on that same income.

If no Double Taxation Agreement exists, or the Agreement does not cover that particular foreign tax, relief is only available if the tax corresponds to UK Income or Capital Gains Tax.

Help Sheet 263 - Foreign Tax Credit Relief provides further information about foreign tax credit relief.

Oherwydd dewiswch 'iawn' o'r gwymplen gofynnir i chi ddewis cyfradd ganrannol o ryddhad, hynny yw, y dreth dramor a ddidynnwyd rydych am ei gwrthgyfrifo yn erbyn eich rhwymedigaeth i dreth y DU ar yr un incwm.

Nid yw Rhyddhad Credyd Treth Dramor ar gael bob tro, neu efallai na fydd ar gael ar y swm llawn o'r dreth dramor rydych wedi'i thalu. Mae rhyddhad yn amodol ar y rheolau canlynol:

  • mae'n rhaid eich bod yn preswylio yn y DU
  • mae'n rhaid i'r incwm godi yn y wlad dramor a bod yn briodol i'w drethu o dan gyfraith y wlad dramor
  • ni ddylai swm y Rhyddhad Credyd Treth Dramor fod yn uwch na threth y DU ar yr un eitem o incwm neu enillion
  • pan fod Cytundeb Trethiant Dwbl yn bodoli rhwng y DU a'r wlad arall, mae swm y dreth dramor sydd ar gael ar gyfer y rhyddhad yn cael ei gyfyngu i isafswm y dreth dramor sy'n daladwy o dan amodau'r Cytundeb

Os oes cytundeb trethiant dwbl yn bodoli rhaid i chi wirio'r hyn y mae'n ei ddweud a sut y mae'n berthnasol i chi. Os gallwch hawlio rhyddhad credyd treth tramor, defnyddiwch y rhestr i edrych ar uchafswm y gyfradd ganrannol o dreth ar gyfer yr incwm sydd gennych a dewiswch y gyfradd honno o'r gwymplen.

Bydd cyfrifiad awtomatig y rhyddhad credyd treth dramor yn defnyddio'r ffigwr hwn er mwyn gwneud unrhyw addasiadau angenrheidiol i swm y dreth dramor rydych yn hawlio credyd yn erbyn eich rhwymedigaeth i dreth y DU ar yr un incwm.

English Content:
Lifetime allowance for pension schemes

You may be provided with benefits up to any level under your registered pension scheme or schemes. But where your benefit entitlement uses up more than your available lifetime allowance when you decide to take your benefits, turn 75 years old or transfer your pension overseas, there will be a tax charge on the excess.

Check if your pension savings exceed the lifetime allowance

The lifetime allowance applies to any pension savings you have in:

  • a registered pension scheme
  • an overseas pension scheme that qualifies for UK tax relief for either you or your employer on or after 5 April 2006

The lifetime allowance is currently £1.5 million, unless you have some form of protection giving you a higher lifetime allowance.

The lifetime allowance applies even if you're in a pension scheme that you don't make payments into - for example if you're in a workplace pension that only your employer makes payments into.

Annual allowance charge for pension schemes

If your total pension savings for a 'pension input period' ending in a tax year are more than the annual allowance, which is £40,000 for tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017, you'll be liable to pay an annual allowance tax charge on the excess amount above the annual allowance and you must complete a Self Assessment tax return. You can reduce the charge if you've any unused annual allowance from the previous 3 tax years.

Pension savings tax charges

Based on the above information - if you're liable to pension savings tax charges or have received payments from overseas pension schemes, select 'Yes' otherwise, select 'No'.

If your pension scheme is a UK-registered pension scheme, the pension scheme administrator should tell you if any pension savings tax charges apply.
Welsh Content:
Lwfans Oes ar gyfer cynlluniau pensiwn

Mae'n bosib y rhoddir buddiannau i chi hyd at unrhyw lefel o dan eich cynllun neu gynlluniau pensiwn cofrestredig. Ond pan fod eich hawl i fuddiant yn defnyddio mwy na'ch lwfans oes sydd ar gael pan fyddwch yn penderfynu cymryd eich buddiannau, yn troi'n 75 neu'n trosglwyddo eich pensiwn dramor, bydd tâl treth ar y swm gormodol.

Gwirio a yw eich enillion pensiwn yn fwy na'r lwfans oes

Mae'r lwfans oes yn gymwys ar gyfer unrhyw gynilion pensiwn sydd gennych mewn:

  • cynllun pensiwn cofrestredig
  • cynllun pensiwn tramor sy'n gymwys ar gyfer rhyddhad treth y DU ar gyfer naill ai chi neu eich cyflogwr ar neu ar ôl 5 Ebrill 2006

£1.5 miliwn yw'r lwfans oes ar hyn o bryd , oni bai bod gennych ryw fath o ddiogelwch sy'n rhoi lwfans oes uwch i chi. Mae'r lwfans oes yn gymwys hyd yn oed os ydych yn rhan o gynllun pensiwn nad ydych yn talu mewn iddo - er enghraifft, os ydych yn rhan o gynllun pensiwn y gweithle y mae eich cyflogwr yn unig yn talu mewn iddo.

Tâl lwfans blynyddol ar gyfer cynlluniau pensiwn

Os yw cyfanswm eich cynilion pensiwn ar gyfer 'cyfnod talu i mewn i bensiwn' sy'n dod i ben mewn blwyddyn dreth yn fwy na'r lwfans blynyddol, sef £40,000 ar gyfer 2016 i 2017, byddwch yn agored i dalu tâl treth lwfans blynyddol ar y swm gormodol sydd dros y lwfans blynyddol a bydd yn rhaid i chi lenwi ffurflen dreth Hunanasesiad. Gallwch ostwng y tâl os oes gennych unrhyw lwfans blynyddol nas defnyddiwyd o'r 3 blynedd dreth flaenorol.

Taliadau treth ar gynilion pensiwn

Yn seiliedig ar yr wybodaeth uchod - os ydych yn agored i daliadau treth ar gynilion pensiwn neu os cawsoch daliadau o gynlluniau pensiwn tramor, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'.

Os yw eich cynllun pensiwn yn un a gofrestrwyd yn y DU, dylai gweinyddwr y cynllun pensiwn ddweud wrthych a oes unrhyw daliadau treth ar gynilion pensiwn yn gymwys.

English Content:
Include any:

  • car and van insurance
  • repairs
  • servicing
  • fuel
  • parking
  • hire charges
  • vehicle licence fees
  • breakdown membership
  • train, bus, air and taxi fares
  • hotel room costs and meals on overnight business trips

You can claim a mileage allowance for journeys wholly and exclusively for business purposes. If a vehicle is used for both business and private purposes you can claim the business percentage only and you should keep mileage records in support of your claim.

Don't include:

  • non-business motoring costs (private use proportions)
  • fines
  • costs of buying vehicles
  • lease rental expenses for cars with CO2 emissions over 160g/km (15% of the amount paid)
  • travel costs between home and business
  • other meals

English Content:
Unauthorised payments are payments by registered pension schemes which are made either to you or in respect of you and which:

  • are specifically described in the pensions tax legislation as being unauthorised payments
  • don't fit within the pensions tax legislation as being an authorised payment

'Payments' aren't always monetary amounts but may include, for example, a transfer of assets.

The scheme administrator should have told you if a payment was an unauthorised payment.

If you received an unauthorised payment, and the payment is subject to the unauthorised payments surcharge, enter the amount of the unauthorised payment in this field.

An unauthorised payment from a registered pension scheme paid to or in respect of you, might have a deduction made from it to cover a tax liability that the scheme administrator of the pension scheme also has in respect of the same payment. When such a deduction is made, the amount of the unauthorised payment you must enter in this field or in 'Amount of unauthorised payment from a pension scheme, subject to Surcharge' as appropriate, is the amount before the deduction. For example, if the unauthorised payment would have been £100 but £85 is paid instead because an amount of £15 has been deducted to cover the scheme administrator's tax liability, you must enter £100 in the appropriate box. The scheme administrator of the pension scheme should tell you if such a deduction has been made.
Welsh Content:
Mae taliadau anawdurdodedig yn daliadau gan gynlluniau pensiwn cofrestredig a wneir naill ai gennych chi neu mewn perthynas â chi ac sydd:

  • yn benodol wedi'u disgrifio yn y ddeddfwriaeth treth pensiynau fel bod yn daliadau anawdurdodedig
  • ddim yn cyd-fynd â'r hyn a nodir yn y ddeddfwriaeth treth pensiynau fel bod yn daliad awdurdodedig

Nid yw 'taliadau' bob tro yn symiau ariannol, gallant, er enghraifft, gynnwys trosglwyddiad o asedion.

Dylai gweinyddwr y cynllun fod wedi dweud wrthych os oedd taliad yn daliad anawdurdodedig.

Os gwnaethoch dderbyn taliad anawdurdodedig, ac mae'r taliad yn agored i'r gordal taliadau anawdurdodedig, nodwch swm y taliad anawdurdodedig yn y blwch hwn.

Mae'n bosib y gwneir didyniad o daliad anawdurdodedig o gynllun pensiwn cofrestredig a dalwyd i chi, neu mewn perthynas â chi, er mwyn talu rhwymedigaeth treth sydd gan weinyddwr y cynllun pensiwn hefyd mewn perthynas â'r un taliad. Pan wneir didyniad o'r fath, swm y taliad anawdurdodedig y mae'n rhaid i chi ei nodi yn y blwch hwn, neu yn y blwch 'Swm y taliad nas awdurdodwyd o gynllun pensiwn, sy'n destun Gordal' fel yn briodol, yw'r swm cyn y didyniad. Er enghraifft, pe byddai'r taliad anawdurdodedig yn £100 ond talwyd £85 yn lle hynny, gan fod swm o £15 wedi'i ddidynnu er mwyn cwmpasu rhwymedigaeth treth gweinyddwr y cynllun, mae'n rhaid i chi nodi £100 yn y blwch priodol. Dylai gweinyddwr y cynllun pensiwn ddweud wrthych pe gwnaed didyniad tebyg.
