English Content:
The worksheet is for simple calculations of gains or losses and can be used for the disposal of land or other assets. You can also use it for the disposal of shares but only if it is the disposal of the whole of your holding of a particular class of shares.

You'll not be able to use the worksheet in all cases. For example, you'll not be able to use it if the asset has been acquired by the exercise of an option or if the disposal is a part disposal. You'll also not be able to use it where you've disposed of a number of individual assets, and the gains and losses on those assets are taken together for an entrepreneurs' relief claim.

You should also not use the worksheet if you have to pay capital gains tax on gains made by a non-UK resident Trust or a non-UK resident company in which you have an interest, or on gains which arose in earlier years but became taxable in 2016 to 2017.
Welsh Content:
Mae'r daflen waith ar gyfer cyfrifiannau syml ar gyfer enillion a cholledion a gellir eu defnyddio pan waredir tir neu asedion eraill. Gallwch ei defnyddio hefyd pan waredir cyfranddaliadau ond dim ond os gwaredir eich daliad cyfan o ddosbarth penodol o gyfranddaliadau.

Ni fyddwch yn gallu defnyddio'r daflen waith ym mhob achos. Er enghraifft, ni allwch ei defnyddio os caffaelwyd yr ased drwy arfer opsiwn neu os yw'r gwarediad yn warediad rhannol. Ni fyddwch ychwaith yn gallu ei ddefnyddio pan fyddwch wedi gwaredu nifer o asedion unigol, a chymerir yr enillion a'r colledion ar yr asedion hynny gyda'i gilydd ar gyfer cais am ryddhad mentrwr neu 'entrepreneur'.

Ni ddylech ychwaith ddefnyddio'r daflen waith os oes rhaid i chi dalu treth enillion cyfalaf ar enillion a wnaed gan Ymddiriedolaeth neu gwmni nad yw wedi ei sefydlu yn y DU y mae gennych fuddiant ynddynt, neu ar enillion a gododd mewn blynyddoedd cynharach ond a ddaeth yn drethadwy yn 2016 i 2017.

English Content:
When completing your Tax Return, you may need the following documents:

  • bank or building society interest details
  • dividend certificates
  • P60 - End of year certificate of pay and tax
  • P45 (Part 1A) - If you have changed jobs
  • P11D -Taxable benefits from your employer
  • P2 - Your PAYE Coding Notice
  • business accounts, please don’t send these in unless we specifically ask you to do so
  • any other documents relevant to your tax affairs

Pan fyddwch yn cwblhau eich ffurflen dreth efallai y bydd angen y dogfennau canlynol arnoch:

  • manylion llog y banc neu gymdeithas adeiladu
  • tystysgrifau difidendau
  • P60 - Tystysgrif diwedd blwyddyn ar gyfer cyflog a threth
  • P45 (Rhan 1A) - Os ydych wedi newid swyddi
  • P11D - Buddiannau trethadwy gan eich cyflogwr
  • P2 - Eich Hysbysiad Cod TWE
  • cyfrifon busnes, peidiwch ag anfon y rhain oni bai bod Cyllid a Thollau EM yn gofyn yn benodol i chi wneud hynny
  • unrhyw ddogfennau eraill sy'n berthnasol i'ch materion treth

English Content:
Box H is for exemptions of amounts included in box D, such as redundancy payments. The maximum exemption is £30,000 for each job but if box D is less than £30,000 you can only enter in box H the amount in box D. Jobs with the same employer, or with employers under the same or common control, count as one job.

For example, if you received redundancy payments from two companies in the same group, you only get one exemption of up to £30,000. If your termination settlement extends to more than one year you can carry forward any unused exemption.
Welsh Content: Mae blwch H ar gyfer rhyddhad symiau a gynhwyswyd ym mlwch D, megis taliadau diswyddo. Uchafswm y rhyddhad yw £30,000 ar gyfer pob swydd ond os ydy blwch D yn llai na £30,000 gallwch nodi ym mlwch H dim ond y swm sydd ym mlwch D. Mae swyddi gyda'r un cyflogwr, neu gyda chyflogwyr o dan yr yn rheolaeth neu reolaeth gyffredin yn cyfrif fel un swydd. Er enghraifft, os cewch daliadau diswyddo o ddau gwmni yn yr un grŵp, cewch un swm o ryddhad o hyd at £30,000 yn unig. Os bydd eich setliad terfynu yn ymestyn dros fwy nag un flwyddyn gallwch gario'r rhyddhad sydd heb ei ddefnyddio ymlaen.

English Content: Partnership reference number:
Welsh Content: Cyfeirnod y bartneriaeth:

English Content:
An entry will only be required in limited circumstances. These are if:

  • you have entered a negative amount in 'Averaging adjustment (only for farmers, market gardeners and creators of literacy or artistic works)' in the Self-employment or Partnership sections
  • in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 you received business receipts taxed as income of an earlier year

To calculate the amount to increase the tax due, you need your Tax Calculation for the year in which the extra income is to be taxed (if you do not have this ask your HM Revenue and Customs office for a copy), then recalculate your liability for that year taking into consideration the additional income. The difference between the original and recalculated amounts is the figure you should enter.
Welsh Content:
Bydd angen cofnod mewn amgylchiadau cyfyngedig yn unig. Dyma nhw:

  • rydych wedi nodi swm negyddol yn 'Addasiad cyfartalu (ar gyfer ffermwyr, masnach-arddwyr a chrewyr gweithiau llenyddol neu artistig yn unig)' yn yr adrannau Hunangyflogaeth neu Bartneriaeth
  • yn y flwyddyn dreth 2016 i 2017 cawsoch dderbyniadau busnes wedi eu trethu fel incwm o flwyddyn gynharach

Er mwyn cyfrifo'r swm i gynyddu'r dreth sy'n ddyledus mae arnoch angen eich Cyfrifiad Treth ar gyfer y flwyddyn y mae'r incwm ychwanegol i'w drethu ynddi (os nad yw hwn gennych gofynnwch i'ch swyddfa Cyllid a Thollau EM am gopi), yna ail-gyfrifwch eich rhwymedigaeth am y flwyddyn honno gan ddwyn yr incwm ychwanegol i ystyriaeth. Y gwahaniaeth rhwng y ffigur gwreiddiol a'r ffigur sydd wedi ei ail-gyfrifo yw'r swm y dylech ei nodi.

English Content: The amount entered for 'Loss from this tax year to be carried back to previous year(s)...' must be greater than 0 (zero) or blank. Please amend.
Welsh Content: Rhaid i'r swm a nodwyd ar gyfer 'Colled i'w chario'n ôl i flynyddoedd blaenorol' fod yn fwy na 0 (sero) neu'n wag. Dylech ei ddiwygio.

English Content:
Enter any additional information you feel is needed to support your entries.

You should only enter alpha, numeric and the following special characters '()*,-./£@&. You cannot enter more than 700 characters (including spaces) here.

Don't use the 'Enter' (or 'Return') key on the keyboard when entering information into, or moving away from, this field. Use the spacebar on the keyboard if you need to make more than one entry.

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 or 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HMRC know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.
Welsh Content:
Dylech nodi unrhyw wybodaeth ychwanegol y credwch sydd ei angen i ategu'r hyn a gofnodwyd gennych.

Dylech nodi nodau alffa, rhifol a'r nodau arbennig canlynol yn unig '()*,-./£@&. Ni allwch nodi mwy na 700 nod (gan gynnwys bylchau) yma.

Peidiwch â defnyddio'r botwm 'Enter' (neu 'Return')ar y bysellfwrdd wrth nodi gwybodaeth yn y blwch hwn, neu wrth symud oddi yno. Defnyddiwch y bylchwr ar y bysellfwrdd os oes angen i chi wneud mwy nag un cofnod

English Content:
Every business must keep records by law.

It's usual to keep your business records year by year and to draw up your accounts to the same date each year.

That date will be your 'end of year date' or your 'accounting date' but as the tax year ends on 5 April, you might find it easier to use 5 April.

English Content:
If you acquired the asset under a contract, the date of acquisition is usually the date of the contract. If, unusually, the contract was conditional, so that one or more conditions had to be met before the contract became binding, the date of acquisition is the date on which the last of the conditions was met.

Where there was no contract, the date of acquisition will be when ownership was transferred.

Now enter the date of acquisition and work out what the asset has cost you over your period of ownership; that is, the acquisition cost (reduced by any earlier claim to tax relief, if applicable) plus any incidental costs of acquisition and improvement costs.

Pan nad oedd cytundeb yn bodoli, y dyddiad caffael bydd y dyddiad pan drosglwyddwyd y berchnogaeth.

Nawr nodwch ddyddiad y caffaeliad a chyfrifwch faint o gost mae'r ased wedi bod i chi dros gyfnod o berchnogaeth; hynny yw, cost caffael (a ostyngwyd gan gais cynharach am ryddhad treth) ynghyd ag unrhyw gostau achlysurol o gafell neu wella.

English Content:
If you made payments to an employer's registered pension scheme and no tax relief was given at the time of payment, you can claim relief for them now by entering the total amount you paid in the tax year.

This may occur when:

  • you paid more contributions than you earned in that job
  • your employer couldn’t take any contributions from your pay before taxing it (if you were paid close to 5 April)
  • you're not an employee but you are a member of a public services pension scheme or a marine pilots' fund

Don't include any personal contributions that had relief at source, such as a group personal pension scheme

English Content:
Stage 1
Telling us about you by checking that the personal details (name, address, phone numbers etc) we hold for you are correct.

Stage 2
Tailoring the tax return to fit you, your circumstances and income types by selecting the relevant guiding questions.

Stage 3
Filling in the return by providing the figures about your various sources of income. Your entries are saved automatically as you move through the pages. You do not need to complete the tax return in one go; you can leave it and come back to it later. Each field that is marked with a red asterisk is a mandatory field and requires an entry. When completing the boxes we would advise you to enter whole pounds however you can enter pence if you wish. For example, if your State Pension was £3500.87, we would advise you to enter £3500. The calculation will always round in your favour.

Stage 4
Checking your return by confirming that all the information you have entered or claimed for in the return is correct and complete. We will automatically check your Tax Return for errors. You will need to correct any mistakes before you can submit your Tax Return.

Stage 5
Submitting the return and getting the acknowledgement of safe receipt from us. You can print a copy of your Tax Return and/or save it on your local drive. You can do this before, or after, you submit your Tax Return.

Nothing is sent to HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) until you choose to submit. On successful submission of your Tax Return we will give you a unique submission receipt reference number, we advise you to save a copy for your records.

Handy features of the Online Tax Return - Self Assessment

Logout

Image of the logout link

The 'logout' link is located in the top banner. You need to follow this link if you wish to leave the tax return. You will be given the choice of completing a feedback form, closing your Tax Return and going to other online services or logging out of the website altogether. Your entries are automatically saved as you progress through the various form pages, so there is no danger of losing your work when logging out.

Personalised bar

An example of the personalised bar is your name and the tax year ending which will appear at the top of each page.

Back and Next buttons

Images of the Back and Next buttons

The 'Back' and 'Next' buttons allow you to navigate through the tax return. The 'Next' button automatically saves your entries automatically as you move through the tax return. If you click the 'Back' button you will be given the opportunity to save your data.

Please note: It is not recommended that you use the browser navigation buttons when navigating through the tax return.

Save button

Image of the Save button

As well as using the 'Next' button to save your data, you can also click 'Save' at any time.

Check your progress button

Image of the Check your progress button

The 'Check your progress' button is located at the bottom left of the page. You need to click this button to see an overview of what pages make up your tailored return.

Progress indicator bar

Image of the progress indicator bar

The progress indicator provides an indication of how far you have progressed through the tax return. The indicator calculates how many pages you have visited within each of the sections you have completed.

Please bear in mind that it cannot know exactly which fields you need to complete, so you will still need to ensure that all your information is entered correctly.

The final 5% of the tax return will always reflect the final activities of checking for errors and submitting your Tax Return.

Amending your Tax Return

You can complete an amended return if you discover that you have made an error or omitted information from your original. There is a limited time period during which you can complete an amended return, this is up to 12 months from 31 January following the year of the tax return.

For example, if the year of the tax return is 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017, the amended tax return can be submitted any time up to midnight (GMT) on 31 January 2018.

If you used the HMRC online tax return to submit the original return (or a previous amendment) then you may submit an amendment using this service from the next day. Otherwise you may similarly submit an amendment using commercial software.

You do not need to complete and submit your amended return in one go but you must ensure that you submit it within the limited time period.

The maximum number of amended returns that can be submitted online is nine. If, in exceptional circumstances further returns are needed, you will need to complete these on paper.

If you have provided an attachment with your original return and this has not changed as part of the amended return there is no need to reattach this. You can however choose to reattach the same attachment or a different one with your amendment. The amendment facility can not be used simply to send in an attachment without an alteration in the content of the return itself.
Welsh Content:
Cam 1
Ein hysbysu amdanoch trwy wirio bod eich manylion personol (enw, cyfeiriad, rhifau ffôn, etc) sydd gennym yn gywir.

Cam 2
Addasu'r Ffurflen Dreth i'ch gweddu chi, eich amgylchiadau a'ch mathau o incwm trwy ddewis y cwestiynau cyfarwyddyd perthnasol.

Cam 3
Llenwi'r Ffurflen Dreth trwy roi'r ffigurau parthed eich gwahanol ffynonellau o incwm. Cedwir eich cofnodion yn awtomatig wrth i chi symud trwy'r tudalennau. Nid oes angen i chi gwblhau'r Ffurflen Dreth mewn un ymgais - gallwch ei gadael a dychwelyd iddi yn ddiweddarach. Mae pob maes a ddynodir gan seren goch yn faes gorfodol sy'n rhaid ei lenwi. Wrth gwblhau'r blychau, awgrymwn eich bod yn nodi punnoedd llawn. Serch hynny, gallwch nodi ceiniogau os dymunwch. Er enghraifft, os mai £3500.87 oedd eich Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth, awgrymwn eich bod yn nodi £3500. Bydd y cyfrifiad bob amser yn talgrynnu o'ch plaid

Cam 4
Gwirio eich Ffurflen Dreth trwy gadarnhau bod yr holl wybodaeth yr ydych wedi'i nodi arni'n gywir ac yn gyflawn. Byddwn yn gwirio eich Ffurflen Dreth yn awtomatig am wallau. Bydd angen i chi gywiro unrhyw wallau cyn y gallwch gyflwyno eich Ffurflen Dreth.

Cam 5
Cyflwyno'r Ffurflen Dreth a chael cydnabyddiaeth ein bod wedi ei derbyn yn ddiogel. Gallwch argraffu copi o'ch Ffurflen Dreth ac/neu ei gadw ar eich gyriant caled. Gallwch wneud hyn cyn, neu ar ôl, i chi gyflwyno eich Ffurflen Dreth.

Ni anfonir dim i Gyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) hyd nes i chi ddewis cyflwyno. Wrth i'ch Ffurflen Dreth gael ei chyflwyno'n llwyddiannus, rhown gyfeirnod derbynneb cyflwyniad llwyddiannus unigryw i chi. Awgrymwn eich bod yn cadw copi at eich cofnodion.

Nodweddion defnyddiol y Ffurflen Dreth Hunanasesiad Ar-lein

Allgofnodi

Llun y cysylltiad allgofnodi

Lleolir y cysylltiad 'allgofnodi' yn y faner uchaf. Bydd angen i chi ddilyn y cysylltiad hwn os ydych am adael y Ffurflen Dreth. Cewch ddewis gwblhau ffurflen atborth, cau eich Ffurflen Dreth a chyrchu gwasanaethau ar-lein eraill, neu allgofnodi o'r wefan yn gyfan gwbl. Cedwir eich cofnodion yn awtomatig wrth i chi symud trwy'r gwahanol dudalennau ar y ffurflen, felly nid oes perygl y byddwch yn colli eich gwaith wrth i chi allgofnodi.

Bar wedi'i bersonoli

Desg gymorth - Ffurflen dreth unigolyn: 2016 i 2017 AR Y GWEILL Enghraifft o'r bar wedi'i bersonoli

Dylai eich enw a'r flwyddyn berthnasol ar gyfer y ffurflen dreth ymddangos ar frig pob tudalen.

Botymau Nôl a Nesaf

Lluniau'r botymau Nôl a Nesaf

Mae'r botymau 'Nôl' a 'Nesaf' yn eich caniatáu i lywio trwy'r Ffurflen Dreth. Mae'r botwm 'Nesaf' yn cadw eich cofnodion yn awtomatig wrth i chi symud trwy'r Ffurflen Dreth. Os cliciwch y botwm 'Nôl' cewch gyfle i gadw eich data.

Sylwer: Niargymhellwyd eich bod yn defnyddio botymau llywio'r porwr wrth lywio trwy'r Ffurflen Dreth.

Botwm Cadw

Llun y botwm Cadw

Yn ogystal â defnyddio'r botwm 'Nesaf' i gadw eich data, gallwch hefyd glicio 'Cadw' unrhyw bryd.

Botwm Gwirio eich cynnydd

Llun y botwm Gwirio eich cynnydd

Lleolir y botwm 'Gwirio eich cynnydd' ar y chwith ar waelod y dudalen. Bydd angen i chi glicio'r botwm hwn i weld trosolwg o ba dudalennau sydd wedi'u cynnwys yn eich Ffurflen Dreth wedi'i haddasu.

Bar mesur cynnydd

Llun y Bar mesur cynnydd

Mae'r mesurydd cynnydd yn dangos yn fras pa mor bell yr ydych wedi symud trwy'r Ffurflen Dreth. Mae'r mesurydd yn cyfrifo sawl tudalen yr ydych wedi'i chyrchu o fewn pob adran yr ydych wedi'i chwblhau.

Cofiwch - ni fydd yn gwybod yn union pa feysydd sydd angen i chi eu cwblhau, felly bydd dal angen i chi sicrhau eich bod yn nodi eich holl wybodaeth yn gywir.

Bydd 5 y cant terfynol y Ffurflen Dreth bob amser yn adlewyrchu'r gweithgareddau terfynol o wirio am wallau a chyflwyno eich Ffurflen Dreth.

Diwygio eich Ffurflen Dreth

Gallwch gwblhau Ffurflen Dreth wedi'i diwygio os ydych yn canfod eich bod wedi gwneud camgymeriad neu wedi hepgor gwybodaeth o'ch ffurflen wreiddiol. Mae cyfnod penodedig ar gael i chi gwblhau Ffurflen Dreth wedi'i diwygio, sef hyd at 12 mis o'r 31 Ionawr sy'n dilyn blwyddyn y Ffurflen Dreth.

Er enghraifft, os mai 2016 i 2017 yw blwyddyn y Ffurflen Dreth, gellir cyflwyno'r Ffurflen Dreth wedi'i diwygio unrhyw bryd hyd at ganol nos (GMT) ar 31 Ionawr 2017.

Os defnyddioch Ffurflen Dreth Ar-lein CThEM i gyflwyno'r Ffurflen Dreth wreiddiol (neu ddiwygiad blaenorol) gallwch gyflwyno diwygiad trwy ddefnyddio'r gwasanaeth hwn trannoeth. Fel arall, gallwch hefyd gyflwyno diwygiad trwy ddefnyddio meddalwedd masnachol.

Nid oes angen i chi gwblhau a chyflwyno eich Ffurflen Dreth wedi'i diwygio mewn un ymgais, ond mae rhaid i chi sicrhau eich bod yn ei chyflwyno o fewn y cyfnod penodedig.

Uchafswm y Ffurflenni Treth wedi'u diwygio y gellir eu cyflwyno ar-lein yw naw. Os, mewn amgylchiadau eithriadol, oes angen Ffurflenni Treth ychwanegol, bydd angen i chi gwblhau'r rhain ar bapur.

Os anfonoch atodyn gyda'ch Ffurflen Dreth wreiddiol, ac os nad ydyw wedi newid yn sgil y diwygiadau i'r Ffurflen Dreth, nid oes angen ei anfon eto. Gallwch, serch hynny, ddewis anfon yr un atodyn eto, neu un gwahanol, gyda'ch diwygiad. Ni ellir defnyddio'r cyfleuster diwygio i anfon atodyn yn unig, heb newid cynnwys y Ffurflen Dreth ei hun.

English Content:
Taxable short service refund of contributions (overseas pension schemes only)

If you haven't received any lump sum payments from overseas pension schemes during 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017, you don't need to complete this field.

If you left pensionable service in an overseas pension scheme and received a refund of UK tax-relieved contributions that you made to that scheme, you're liable to a tax charge on that refund.

The amount of tax due on a refund is:

  • 20% on the first £20,000
  • 50% on any amount over £20,000

You can find more information about short service refunds and liability to tax on them in the Pension Tax Manual.

Enter the amount of your refund of UK tax-relieved contributions in this field. You can convert the refund into sterling using the 'spot rate' for the date of payment.
Welsh Content:
Ad-daliad trethadwy o gyfraniadau am wasanaeth byr (cynlluniau pensiwn tramor yn unig)

Os nad ydych wedi derbyn cyfandaliadau o gynlluniau pensiwn tramor yn ystod 2016 i 2017, does dim angen i chi gwblhau'r blwch hwn.

Os gadawsoch wasanaeth pensiynadwy mewn cynllun pensiwn tramor, a chawsoch ad-daliad o gyfraniadau rhyddhad treth y DU a daloch i'r cynllun hwnnw, byddwch yn agored i dreth ar yr ad-daliad hwnnw.

Swm y dreth sy'n ddyledus ar ad-daliad yw:

  • 20% ar y £20,000 cyntaf
  • 50% ar unrhyw swm dros £20,000

Ceir mwy o wybodaeth ynghylch ad-daliadau am wasanaeth byr a rhwymedigaeth i dreth arnynt yn y Llawlyfr Treth Pensiynau.

Nodwch swm yr ad-daliad a gawsoch o gyfraniadau rhyddhad treth yn y DU yn y blwch hwn.

Gallwch drosi'r ad-daliad i sterling trwy ddefnyddio'r 'gyfradd ar y pryd' ar gyfer dyddiad y taliad.

Include any other expenses of the holiday property rental business you haven't previously included, such as stationery, telephone, business travelling and other miscellaneous costs.

Where you're subletting the property and you (or an earlier tenant) paid a premium to your landlord when the lease was granted you may be able to claim for part of the premium paid if the payment is taxable on your landlord as income. If so, include the cost here.

Further guidance and information about working out your capital allowances.

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 or 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HMRC know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.

English Content:
HM Revenue and Customs will add this amount to your Self Assessment statement of account. It doesn't include any 2016 to 2017 payments on account you may have made or any other amounts outstanding. To help you to decide how much, if anything, to pay by the due date, check your Self Assessment account and use the information above until it transfers over.

Please note: Please carefully check the figures and the amounts due, which are calculated using the amounts you have entered.
Welsh Content:
Bydd Cyllid a Thollau EM yn ychwanegu'r swm hwn at eich datganiad Hunanasesiad o gyfrif. Nid yw'n cynnwys unrhyw daliadau ar gyfrif ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 y gallech fod wedi eu talu eisoes neu unrhyw symiau eraill sy'n ddyledus. Er mwyn eich helpu i benderfynu faint i'w dalu erbyn y dyddiad dyledus, gwiriwch eich cyfrif Hunanasesiad a defnyddiwch yr wybodaeth uchod nes ei fod wedi'i ddiweddaru.

English Content: This is the overlap profit you have from earlier years plus any new overlap profits in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 minus any relief you used this year.
Welsh Content:
Os yw dyddiad cyfrifyddu'r bartneriaeth yn ddyddiad ar wahân i 5 Ebrill, gall gorgyffwrdd yn eich cyfnodau sail ddigwydd:

  • yn y tair blynedd gyntaf ar ôl i chi ddod yn bartner
  • mewn blwyddyn y mae newid yn nyddiad cyfrifyddu'r bartneriaeth.

Gan fod eich cyfran chi o elw'r bartneriaeth ar gyfer cyfnod sail penodol yn cael ei threthu, byddai gorgyffwrdd yn eich cyfnodau sail yn golygu y gellir trethu'r un elw fwy nag unwaith. I osgoi hyn, efallai y gallwch hawlio rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd ar gyfer yr elw (yr elw gorgyffwrdd) mewn unrhyw gyfnod gorgyffwrdd.

Gall rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd fod yn ddyledus ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 os:

  • rhoesoch y gorau i fod yn bartner yn 2016 i 2017
  • daeth busnes y bartneriaeth i ben yn 2016 i 2017
  • newidiodd y bartneriaeth ei dyddiad cyfrifyddu yn 2016 i 2017 ac mae'ch cyfnod sail yn fwy na 12 mis.

Mae Taflen Gymorth 222 - How to calculate your taxable profits yn dweud wrthych sut i gyfrifo elw gorgyffwrdd a sut i hawlio rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd.

Nodwch swm unrhyw elw gorgyffwrdd nas defnyddiwyd a gariwyd ymlaen i 2017 i 2017 yn y blwch hwn.

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
Overview

You can start using cash basis from 6 April 2015 and if you:

  • run a small business e.g. sole traders and partnerships
  • have an income of £82,000 or less a year (this is the threshold to register for VAT)

You can also decide not to use cash basis if it's not suited to your business.

Why use cash basis

If you

  • run a small business, cash basis accounting may be better than traditional accounting
  • you only need to declare money when it comes in and out of your business
  • at the end of the tax year, you won't have to pay Income Tax on money you didn't receive in your accounting period.

When cash basis might not suit your business

If you:

  • want to claim interest or bank charges of more than £500 as an expense
  • run a business that's more complex, eg you have high levels of stock
  • need to get finance for your business - a bank could ask to see accounts drawn up using traditional accounting to see what you owe and are due before agreeing a loan
  • have losses that you want to offset against other taxable income ('sideways loss relief')

Income and expenses under cash basis

  • you only count the money you've actually received and expenses you've actually paid in a tax year
  • money you're owed isn't counted until you receive it
  • payments count - cash, by card, cheque, payment in kind or any other method

Examples of allowable business expenses:

  • office costs, eg stationery
  • travel costs, eg fuel, parking, train or bus fares
  • clothing expenses, eg uniforms
  • staff costs, eg salaries or subcontractor costs
  • things you buy to sell on, eg stock or raw materials
  • financial costs, eg insurance or bank charges
  • costs of your business premises, eg heating, lighting, business rates
  • advertising or marketing, eg website costs

Capital allowances

If you use cash basis accounting and buy a car for your business, you can claim this as a capital allowance. However, all other items you buy and keep for your business should be claimed as allowable expenses in the normal way.

Other considerations

  • businesses using traditional accounting (accruals basis) might have to make some adjustments if they switch to cash basis
  • you can choose how you record when you receive or pay money (e.g. the date the money enters or leaves your account or the date a cheque is written) but you must use the same method each tax year
  • cash basis might suit smaller businesses because, at the end of the tax year, you won't have to pay Income Tax on money you didn't receive in your accounting period
  • a loss incurred by a business adopting 'Cash basis' can only carry forward. No sideways or earlier year's tax relief can be claimed
  • your business grows during the tax year you can stay in the scheme up to an income of £164,000. Above that you'll need to use traditional accounting for your Income Tax return for the next tax year, unless your income drops back below the VAT threshold in place at the end of that tax year

Losses

  • any losses you make can't be set off against your other income
  • terminal loss must be set against any profits (after deducting losses brought forward) from the same business taxed in 2016 to 2017
  • any remaining terminal losses must be set against the profits of the same business taxed in the 3 prior years. Starting with the latest year

Who can't use the scheme

  • Lloyd's underwriters
  • farming businesses with a current herd basis election
  • farming and creative businesses with a section 221 ITTOIA profit averaging election
  • businesses that have claimed business premises renovation allowance
  • businesses that carry on a mineral extraction trade
  • businesses that have claimed research and development allowance
  • limited companies
  • limited liability partnerships
  • dealers in securities
  • relief for mineral royalties
  • lease premiums
  • ministers of religion
  • pool betting duty
  • intermediaries treated as making employment payments
  • managed service companies
  • waste disposal
  • cemeteries and crematoria

If you can't use cash basis, you'll need to use traditional accounting to work out your taxable profits.
Welsh Content:
Arolwg

Sail arian parod yw dull o weithio allan elw neu golled eich busnes ar gyfer eich Ffurflen DrethHunanasesiad.

Gallwch ddefnyddio'r sail arian parod ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 os:

  • ydych yn fusnes hunangyflogedig e.e unig fasnachwyr a phartneriaid.
  • oes gennych incwm o £81,000 neu lai'r flwyddyn (dyma'r trothwy pan fo raid cofrestru ar gyfer TAW)

Gallwch ddechrau defnyddio sail arian parod o'r 6ed Ebrill 2016. Fodd bynnag, gallwch benderfynu nad ydych am ddefnyddio sail arian parod gan nad yw yn addas i'ch busnes.

Sut mae sail arian parod yn gweithio?

Gallwch ddewis cofnodi eich incwm busnes a threuliau dros y flwyddyn dreth mewn un o'r ffyrdd canlynol:

  • Defnyddio sail arian parod - cofnodi arian pan mae'n dod mewn ac yn mynd allan o'ch busnes (mae pob arian yn cyfrif - arian parod, taliadau cerdyn, siec ac unrhyw ddull arall)
  • Gan ddefnyddio cyfrifo traddodiadol ( ar sail croniadau) - cofnodwch incwm a threuliau pan fyddwch yn rhoi anfoneb i gwsmeriaid neu dderbyn bil.

Incwm a threuliau sail arian parod

Incwm

  • rydych ond yn cyfrif yr arian yr ydych wedi ei dderbyn mewn blwyddyn dreth.
  • ni ddylid cyfrif arian sy'n ddyledus i chi nes eich bod yn ei dderbyn .
  • cyfrif arian - arian parod, drwy gerdyn, siec, taliad mewn nwyddau neu unrhyw ddull arall.

Treuliau

Treuliau yw costau busnes y gallwch, efallai, eu didynnu o'ch incwm i gyfrifo eich elw trethadwy.

Os ydych yn defnyddio sail arian parod rydych ond yn cyfrif y treuliau yr ydych wedi eu talu. Nid yw arian sydd arnoch yn cael ei gyfrif hyd nes eich bod wedi ei dalu

Esiamplau o dreuliau busnes sy'n ganiataol pan rydych yn defnyddio'r sail arian parod yw:

  • costau rhedeg o ddydd i ddydd, e.e trydan, tanwydd
  • costau gweinyddol, e.e deunydd ysgrifennu,
  • pethau y byddwch yn eu prynu i'w gwerthu ymlaen e.e. stoc
  • pethau y byddwch yn defnyddio yn eich busnes e.e peiriannau, cyfrifiaduron, faniau
  • llog a chodiadau i fyny at £500, e.e llog ar orddrafftiau banc

Os ydych yn defnyddio'r sail arian parod ni allwch hawlio lwfansau cyfalaf ar unrhyw beth oni bai am geir.

Ystyriaethau eraill

  • efallai bydd rhaid i fusnesau sydd yn cyfrifo'n draddodiadol (ar sail croniadau) wneud rhai addasiadau os byddant yn newid i sail arian parod.
  • dewis sut byddwch yn cofnodi pan fyddwch yn derbyn neu'n talu arian (e.e. y dyddiad mae'r arian yn dod i mewn neu yn gadael eich cyfrif neu'r dyddiad yr ysgrifennir y siec ) ond rhaid i chi ddefnyddio'r un dull bob blwyddyn dreth.
  • efallai bydd arian parod yn addas i fusnesau bach oherwydd, ar ddiwedd y flwyddyn dreth, ni fydd rhaid i chi dalu Treth Incwm ar arian na wnaethoch dderbyn yn eich cyfnod cyfrifyddu.

Os ydych yn defnyddio sail arian parod ac mae eich busnes yn tyfu yn ystod y flwyddyn gallwch aros yn y cynllun i fyny at incwm o £162,000 Yn uwch na hynny, bydd angen i chi ddefnyddio cyfrifo traddodiadol ar gyfer eich ffurflen Dreth Incwm am y flwyddyn dreth nesaf, oni bai bod eich incwm yn cwympo'n is na'r trothwy TAW sy'n bodoli ar ddiwedd y flwyddyn dreth honno.

1.3 Pwy na all ddefnyddio'r cynllun?

Busnesau na allant ddefnyddio'r cynllun

  • tanysgrifenwyr Lloyd's
  • busnesau ffermio gyda sail dewis diadell gyfredol
  • busnesau ffermio a chreadigol gyda dewis elw ar gyfartaledd adran 221ITTOIA
  • busnesau sydd wedi hawlio lwfans adnewyddu safle busnes
  • busnesau sy'n cynnal masnach tynnu mwynau
  • busnesau sydd wedi hawlio lwfans ymchwil a datblygu.
  • Cwmnïau cyfyngedig
  • Partneriaethau Atebolrwydd Cyfyngedig

English Content:
There're adjustments that reduce the amount of Class 4 National Insurance contributions (NICs) payable such as cash basis adjustments, change in accounting adjustments, certain losses from earlier years and earnings as an employee which are included in your profits.

If you made an entry in 'Adjustment for change of accounting practice' on the other tax adjustments page, the same figure is taken off your profits for Class 4 NICs purposes; include that adjustment here.

If your profit in 'Net business profit for tax purposes' on the other tax adjustments page, includes employment earnings, enter those earnings here.

Class 1 NICs are paid on employment earnings.

If you've any brought forward trading losses, of this business, that have not yet been set against profits chargeable to Class 4 NICs, you may also include them. (Losses are allowable for Class 4 NICs in the same way as they are for tax.) If you've incurred interest for the purposes of this business but did not take it off to arrive at your taxable profit, include it in here; it can reduce your Class 4 profit. (Include any such interest for the tax year 6 April 2015 to 5 April 2016 and earlier years if it hasn't already been set against Class 4 profits.)

For further guidance and information see the Notes on Self-employment (Full)
Welsh Content:
Mae addasiadau sy'n lleihau faint o gyfraniadau Yswiriant Gwladol (CYG) Dosbarth 4 sy'n daladwy megis addasiadau ar sail arian parod, newid mewn addasiadau cyfrifyddu, rhai colledion o flynyddoedd blaenorol ac enillion fel cyflogai sydd wedi'u cynnwys yn eich elw.

Os gwnaethoch gofnodi rhywbeth yn 'Addasiad ar gyfer newid mewn arfer cyfrifyddu' ar y dudalen ar gyfer addasiadau treth eraill, didynnir yr un ffigur o'ch elw at ddibenion CYG Dosbarth 4; dylech gynnwys yr addasiad hwnnw yma.

Os ydy eich elw yn 'Elw net y busnes at ddibenion treth' ar y dudalen ar gyfer addasiadau treth eraill, yn cynnwys enillion o gyflogaeth, yna nodwch yr enillion hynny yma.

Telir CYG Dosbarth 1 ar enillion o gyflogaeth.

Os oes gennych unrhyw golledion masnachu'r busnes hwn, a ddygwyd ymlaen, sydd heb eu gosod yn erbyn elw sy'n agored i CYG Dosbarth 4, gallwch eu cynnwys hefyd. (Caniateir colledion ar gyfer CYG Dosbarth 4 yn yr un modd ag a'u caniateir at ddibenion treth.)

Os ydych wedi talu llog at ddibenion y busnes hwn, ond rydych heb ei ddidynnu er mwyn cyfrifo eich elw trethadwy, dylech ei gynnwys yma; gallai ostwng eich elw at ddibenion Dosbarth 4. (Dylech gynnwys llog o'r fath ar gyfer 2012 i 2013 a blynyddoedd cynharach os na chafodd ei wrthbwyso eisoes yn erbyn elw at ddibenion Dosbarth 4.)

English Content:
Please enter the amount, in sterling, of the foreign tax paid on the income entered in the 'Amount of income arising or received before any tax taken off' field.

Please enter the amount in sterling of the foreign tax paid. More information about how to calculate the correct amount foreign tax credit relief is provided in Help Sheet 263 - Foreign Tax Credit Relief (PDF 110K) for further information about foreign tax credit relief.

Please note that if you are not resident in the United Kingdom you cannot claim credit relief for foreign tax paid under a double taxation arrangement and any relief will need to be claimed in the country where you are resident.

If the tax was charged in a country where there is no double taxation arrangement in place, credit relief can only be claimed under the unilateral relief provisions if you are a resident of the United Kingdom, the Channel Islands or the Isle of Man.

If you are a resident of the United Kingdom, you cannot claim credit relief for the foreign tax if you can claim exemption from that tax in the other country under any double taxation arrangements.

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com
Welsh Content: Nodwch mewn sterling, swm y dreth dramor a dalwyd ar yr incwm a nodwyd yn y blwch 'Swm yr incwm sy'n codi neu a dderbyniwyd cyn didynnu unrhyw dreth'

Help Sheet 321 gives details of the policies for which lower rate tax is treated as paid.

Help Sheet 321 - Gains on foreign life insurance policies.

English Content:
You can't claim any allowances for plant or machinery provided for use in a dwelling house.

The following guidance only applies if you've a 'standard' 12 month accounting period and summarises the allowances available. If your accounting period is shorter or longer than a year, or began before 6 April 2016, or if you want to know more about capital allowances, see Capital allowances and balancing charges: HS252 (which includes worked examples). Alternatively, contact HM Revenue and Customs or your tax adviser.

The Business Premises Renovation Allowance (BPRA) scheme took effect from 11 April 2007. From that date, for a period of 10 years, if you carry out conversion, renovation or repairs to business premises in Assisted Areas which have been unused for at least a year before the work starts and which brings them back into business use, you're entitled to claim a 100% allowance against the costs incurred, subject to the certain rules.

Further information about BPRA:

  • BPRA
  • Capital Allowances Manual (CA4500 onwards)

BPRA cannot be claimed:

  • if the renovation expenditure has been incurred on any residential property
  • on the costs of acquiring the land or building, extending the building, or developing land next to the business premises
Welsh Content:
Ni allwch wneud cais am unrhyw lwfansau ar gyfer offer neu beiriannau a roddir at ddefnydd mewn tŷ sy'n annedd.

Mae'r arweiniad isod yn gymwys dim ond os oes gennych gyfnod cyfrifyddu 'safonol' o 12 mis ac mae crynodeb o'r lwfansau ar gael. Os ydy'ch cyfnod cyfrifyddu'n fyrrach neu'n hwy na blwyddyn, neu os dechreuodd cyn 6 Ebrill 2014, neu os ydych am wybod rhagor am lwfansau cyfalaf, dilynwch y cysylltiad Taflen Gymorth 252 - Capital allowances (sy'n cynnwys enghreifftiau), neu cysylltwch â Chyllid a Thollau EM neu eich cynghorydd treth.

Daeth y cynllun Lwfans Adnewyddu Eiddo Busnes (BPRA) i rym o 11 Ebrill 2007. O'r dyddiad hynny, am gyfnod o 5 mlynedd, os ydych yn cynnal gwaith trosi, adnewyddu neu atgyweirio i safleoedd busnes sydd mewn ardaloedd a gynorthwyir sydd heb eu defnyddio am o leiaf blwyddyn cyn i'r gwaith dechrau ac sy'n dod a nhw nol i ddefnydd busnes, mae gennych hawl i wneud cais am lwfans o 100% yn erbyn y costau, yn amodol ar reolau penodol.

Am ragor o wybodaeth ynglŷn â BPRA ewch i neu'r Llawlyfr Lwfansau Cyfalaf (CA45000 ymlaen) yn www.hmrc.gov.uk/manualsa-z

Ni all BPRA cael ei hawlio:

  • os yw'r gwariant adnewyddu wedi ei wario ar eiddo preswyl
  • ar y gost o gaffael y tir neu adeilad, ymestyn yr adeilad, neu ddatblygu'r tir wrth ymyl y safle busnes

English Content: Date of disposal:
Welsh Content: Dyddiad y gwaredu:

English Content:
Under 'Relief at source' arrangements, payments to registered pension schemes are made after tax relief at the basic rate of 20% (in tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017). The pension provider will have claimed basic rate tax relief on your behalf and added it to your pension fund. You will have made a 'net' payment. You should enter the gross amount; which is, the amount you paid plus the tax relief.

These amounts may be on any pension certificate or receipt you get from the administrator, or you can work it out by dividing the amount you actually paid by 80 and multiplying the result by 100.

If you pay tax at 40%, or both 40% and 45%, you are entitled to further tax relief. It will be automatically calculated and the credit included in your tax calculation.

To help HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) get your code right, enter details of any 'one-off' pension payments included here in the 'Any other information' field at the end of the 'Fill in your return' section. One-off payments are payments made in the year to 5 April 2017 that you do not intend to repeat in the year to 5 April 2018.

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 or 6 April 2018 to 5 April 2019 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HMRC know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.
Welsh Content:
O dan drefniadau 'Rhyddhad wrth y ffynhonnell', gwneir taliadau i gynlluniau pensiwn ar ôl rhyddhad treth wrth y ffynhonnell ar y gyfradd sylfaenol (20% yn 2016 i 2017). Bydd darparwr y pensiwn wedi hawlio rhyddhad treth ar y gyfradd sylfaenol ar eich rhan ac wedi ei ychwanegu at eich cronfa bensiwn. Byddwch wedi gwneud taliad 'net'. Dylech nodi'r swm gros;sef y swm a daloch ynghyd â'r rhyddhad treth.

Efallai y bydd y symiau hyn ar y dystysgrif neu'r dderbynneb pensiwn a gewch gan y gweinyddwr, neu gallwch ei gyfrifo eich hun drwy rannu'r swm a dalwch mewn gwirionedd gyda 80 a lluosi'r canlyniad gyda 100.

Os talwch dreth ar 40%, neu ar 40% a 45%, gallwch hawlio rhyddhad treth pellach. Bydd yn cael ei gyfrifo'n awtomatig a bydd y credyd yn cael ei gynnwys yn eich cyfrifiad treth.

Os oes gennych god treth, i gynorthwyo Cyllid a Thollau EM i gael y cod yn gywir nodwch fanylion o unrhyw daliadau pensiwn unigryw sydd wedi eu cynnwys yma yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' ar ddiwedd y rhan 'Llenwch eich ffurflen dreth'. Taliadau unigryw'r taliadau a wnaethpwyd yn y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017 nad ydych yn bwriadu eu hailadrodd yn y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017.

English Content:
You can carry your loss, or the amount of loss remaining unused, forward to set against future profits from the same business. The loss is deducted from your profits in that business in the first and each subsequent year until it is used up.

The time limit for a claim is 5 April 2021.

Enter the amount of your losses in this business for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 and earlier years which you haven't yet used.
Welsh Content:
Gallwch gario eich colled, neu swm y golled sy'n parhau i fod heb ei defnyddio, ymlaen i'w gwrthgyfrifo yn erbyn elw o'r un busnes yn y dyfodol. Didynnir y golled o'ch elw yn y busnes hwnnw yn y flwyddyn gyntaf a phob blwyddyn ddilynol tan fod y golled wedi ei defnyddio'n llwyr.

Y dyddiad cau ar gyfer cais yw 5 Ebrill 2020.

Nodwch swm eich colledion yn y busnes hwn ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 a blynyddoedd cynharach sydd heb eu defnyddio hyd yn hyn.

If the adjustment is negative, put a minus sign (-) before the figure.

If the partnership did not carry on a trade or profession in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017, that is, it carried on a pure investment business, the basis period is the tax year from 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017. No adjustments for basis period will be required.

For full details of the rules for working out your basis period and any adjustments for basis period please see Help Sheet 222 - How to calculate your taxable profits.

English Content:
You qualify for a full foreign service exemption if:

  • 75% of your service was foreign service, or
  • the last 10 years were foreign service and the total service was more than 10 years, or
  • the total service was more than 20 years and 50% was foreign services (including any 10 of the last 20 years)
Welsh Content:

  • roedd y 10 mlynedd olaf yn wasanaeth tramor ac roedd cyfanswm y gwasanaeth yn fwy na 10 mlynedd
  • roedd cyfanswm y gwasanaeth yn fwy na 20 mlynedd ac roedd 50% yn wasanaethau tramor (yn cynnwys unrhyw 10 mlynedd o'r 20 mlynedd olaf)

English Content:
Enter the amount in sterling (pounds and pence) of the foreign tax paid.

More information about how to calculate the correct amount foreign tax credit relief for capital gains is provided in Help Sheet 261 Foreign Tax Credit Relief: capital gains.

Please note: if you're not resident in the United Kingdom you can't claim credit relief for foreign tax paid under a double taxation arrangement and any relief will need to be claimed in the country where you're resident.

If the tax was charged in a country where there is no double taxation arrangement in place, credit relief can only be claimed under the unilateral relief provisions if you're a resident of the United Kingdom, the Channel Islands or the Isle of Man.

If you're a resident of the United Kingdom, you can't claim credit relief for the foreign tax if you can claim exemption from that tax in the other country under any double taxation arrangements.
Welsh Content:
Nodwch mewn sterling (punnoedd a cheiniogau) swm y dreth dramor a dalwyd.

Mae rhagor o wybodaeth ynghylch sut i gyfrifo swm cywir y rhyddhad credyd treth dramor ar gyfer enillion cyfalaf yn Nhaflen Gymorth 261 - Foreign Tax Credit Relief: capital gains.

Sylwer - os nad ydych yn breswylydd y Deyrnas Unedig, ni allwch hawlio rhyddhad credyd ar gyfer treth dramor a delir o dan drefniant trethiant dwbl, a bydd angen hawlio unrhyw ryddhad yn y wlad yr ydych yn breswylydd ynddi.

Os codwyd y dreth mewn gwlad lle nad oes trefniant trethiant dwbl mewn grym, gellir hawlio rhyddhad credyd o dan ddarpariaethau rhyddhad unochrog dim ond os ydych yn breswylydd y Deyrnas Unedig, Ynysoedd y Sianel neu Ynys Manaw.

Os ydych yn breswylydd y Deyrnas Unedig, ni allwch hawlio rhyddhad credyd ar gyfer y dreth dramor os gallwch hawlio eithriad rhag y dreth honno yn y wlad arall o dan unrhyw drefniadau trethiant dwbl.

English Content:
Management fees paid to an Agent to cover rent collection, advertising and similar administrative expenses can be deducted.

The normal legal and professional fees for renewing a lease (if the lease is for less than 50 years) can be deducted. You can also deduct the professional fees incurred in evicting an unsatisfactory tenant, with a view to re-letting, or in appealing against a compulsory purchase order.

You can't claim:

  • expenses incurred in connection with the first letting or subletting of a property for more than a year. These include legal expenses such as the cost of drawing up a lease, Agents' and surveyors' fees and commission.
  • any costs of agreeing and paying a premium on renewal of a lease
  • fees for planning permission or registration of title on property purchase
Welsh Content:
Gellir didynnu allai ffioedd rheolaeth a delir i Asiant ar gyfer gwmpasu treuliau casglu rhent, hysbysebu a threuliau gweinyddol cyffelyb.

Gellir didynnu'r ffioedd cyfreithiol a phroffesiynol arferol ar gyfer adnewyddu prydles (os yw'r brydles am lai na 50 mlynedd). Gallwch hefyd ddidynnu'r ffioedd proffesiynol a dalwch er mwyn troi tenant anfoddhaol allan, gyda'r bwriad o ailosod, neu apelio yn erbyn gorchymyn prynu gorfodol.

Ni allwch hawlio:

  • treuliau a dalwyd mewn cysylltiad â gosod neu isosod eiddo am fwy na blwyddyn am y tro cyntaf. Mae'r rhain yn cynnwys treuliau cyfreithiol megis cost llunio prydles, ffioedd a chomisiwn Asiantau a syrfewyr
  • unrhyw gostau sydd ynghlwm wrth bremiwm wrth adnewyddu prydles
  • ffioedd ar gyfer caniatâd cynllunio neu gofrestru teitl wrth brynu eiddo

English Content:
You can claim 8% Writing Down Allowance (WDA) a year for the cost of:

  • Cars bought on or after 6 April 2013 with CO2 emissions of more than 130g/km
  • Cars bought between 6 April 2009 and 5 April 2013 with CO2 emissions of more than 160g/km
  • integral features of a building or structure (for example, electrical systems such as lighting systems, water systems, lifts, escalators and moving walkways)
  • Insulation that you may have added to an existing building
  • assets or equipment with a life expectancy of more than 25 years from when they were new

You can use your Annual Investment Allowance (AIA) wholly or partly against these costs (not cars), instead of, or as well as, on costs qualifying for the 18% rate. Any balance of expenditure after taking off AIA will go in the 'special rate' pool, which qualifies for allowances at 8%.

You work out the final balance for the 8% pool in the same way as for the 18% pool. If the final balance of the special rate pool is £1,000 or less you can claim the whole amount as small pools allowance instead of 8% WDA.

For more information about Capital allowances and balancing charges see Helpsheet 252 - Capital allowances and balancing charges.
Welsh Content:
Gallwch hawlio Lwfans Ar Bapur (LAB) o 8% y flwyddyn ar gyfer costau'r canlynol:

  • Ceir a brynwyd ar neu ar ôl 6 Ebrill 2013 gydag allyriadau CO2 sy'n fwy na 130g/km
  • Ceir a brynwyd rhwng 6 Ebrill 2009 a 5 Ebrill 2013 gydag allyriadau CO2 sy'n fwy na 160g/km
  • Nodweddion annatod adeilad neu strwythur (er enghraifft, systemau trydanol megis systemau goleuadau, systemau dŵr, lifftiau, grisiau symud a llwybrau symud)
  • Defnydd inswleiddio y mae'n bosib y gwnaethoch ei ychwanegu at adeilad sy'n bodoli eisoes
  • Asedion neu gyfarpar ag iddynt oes arfaethedig sy'n fwy na 25 mlynedd o'r adeg pan oeddynt yn newydd

Gallwch ddefnyddio eich Lwfans Buddsoddi Blynyddol (LBB) yn gyfan gwbl neu'n rhannol yn erbyn y costau hynny (dim ceir), yn hytrach na, neu'n ogystal ag ar gostau sy'n gymwys ar gyfer y gyfradd 18%. Bydd gweddill gwariant ar ôl didynnu LBB yn mynd i gronfa 'cyfradd arbennig', sy'n gymwys ar gyfer lwfansau ar 18%.

Rydych yn cyfrifo'r gweddill terfynol ar gyfer y gronfa 8% yn yr un ffordd ag ar gyfer y gronfa 18%. Os yw gweddill terfynol y gronfa cyfradd arbennig yn £1,000 neu lai, gallwch hawlio'r swm cyfan yn ogystal â lwfans cronfeydd bach, yn hytrach na LAB o 8%.

Mae rhagor o wybodaeth ynghylch Lwfansau cyfalaf a chostau mantoli i'w chael yn Nhaflen Gymorth 252 - Capital allowances and balancing charges

English Content:
Don't include questions in this box as we cannot answer specific questions from your tax return.

Give sufficient information here to enable the asset disposed of to be clearly identified.

You can enter a maximum of 240 characters, including spaces. You can only enter letters and numbers and the special characters '()*,-./£@&.

Please don't use the 'Enter' (or 'Return') key on the keyboard when entering information into, or moving away from, this field. Use the spacebar on the keyboard if you need to make more than one entry.
Welsh Content:
Peidiwch â chynnwys cwestiynau yn y blwch hwn gan na allwn ateb unrhyw gwestiynau penodol oddi ar eich ffurflen dreth.

Rhowch wybodaeth ddigonol yma i alluogi'r ased a waredwyd i gael ei hadnabod yn glir.

Gallwch nodi hyd at 240 nod, gan gynnwys bylchau Gallwch nodi llythrennau a rhifau a'r nodau arbennig '()*,-./£@& yn unig.

Peidiwch â defnyddio'r botwm 'Enter' (neu 'Return')ar y bysellfwrdd wrth nodi gwybodaeth yn y blwch hwn, neu wrth symud oddi yno. Defnyddiwch y bylchwr ar y bysellfwrdd os oes angen i chi wneud mwy nag un cofnod

English Content:
You can claim the cost of replacing domestic items in the residential accommodation where:

  • the cost is incurred on purchasing a replacement domestic item – you can’t claim the initial cost for an item provided for use in the accommodation for the first time
  • the new item is provided solely for the use of the tenants in the accommodation and the old item is no longer available for use - If the new item is an improvement on the old item, you can only claim up to the amount needed to replace the original item

include items such as:

  • moveable furniture for example, beds, free-standing wardrobes
  • furnishings for example, curtains, linens, carpets, floor coverings
  • household appliances for example, televisions, fridges, freezers
  • kitchenware for example, crockery, cutlery
Welsh Content:
Os ydych yn gosod llety preswyl sydd wedi'i ddodrefnu (er enghraifft, tŷ neu fflat), ni allwch hawlio lwfans cyfalaf ar beiriannau, dodrefn neu gelfi a gyflenwyd, neu ar unrhyw osodiadau sy'n rhan o'r adeilad.

Yn lle hynny, gallech hawlio lwfans traul o 10% yn y blwch hwn.

Mae'r lwfans traul yn gyfwerth â 10% o'r rhenti net ar ôl didynnu taliadau neu wasanaethau y byddai tenant fel arfer yn eu talu, ond sy'n cael eu talu gennych chi mewn gwirionedd (er enghraifft, trethi lleol).

Ni allwch hawlio lwfansau cyfalaf ar gyfer unrhyw osodiadau preswyl sydd wedi'u dodrefnu.

English Content:
You can't deduct the cost of buying, altering, building, installing or improving 'fixed' assets such as property, equipment or machinery. Nor can you claim depreciation or losses when such assets are disposed of. Instead you can claim capital allowances, which reduce your profits (or increase a loss).

Expenditure incurred on the provision of plant or machinery for use in a dwelling house is not qualifying expenditure for capital allowances for an ordinary property business, an overseas property business or the special leasing of plant or machinery.

More information can be found in Help Sheet 252 - Capital allowances and balancing charges and Claim capital allowances.
Welsh Content:
Ni allwch ddidynnu costau prynu, newid, adeiladu, gosod neu wella asedion 'sefydlog' megis eiddo, cyfarpar neu beiriannau. Ni allwch ychwaith hawlio dibrisiant neu golledion pan gaiff asedion o'r fath eu gwaredu. Yn lle hynny, gallwch hawlio lwfansau cyfalaf sy'n gostwng eich elw (neu'n cynyddu eich colled).

Nid yw gwariant a delir wrth ddarparu offer neu beiriannau i'w defnyddio mewn annedd-dŷ yn wariant cymwys ar gyfer lwfansau cyfalaf am fusnes eiddo cyffredin, busnes eiddo tramor neu brydlesu offer neu beiriannau.

I gael rhagor o wybodaeth, darllenwch Daflen Wybodaeth 252 - Capital allowances and balancing charges. Fel arall, ewch i https://www.gov.uk/capital-allowances.

English Content:
If you married or formed a civil partnership during the year ended 5 April 2017, you can claim one 12th of the married couple's allowance for each tax month (or part of a tax month) of your marriage or civil partnership (the tax month runs from 6th of one month to 5th of the next).

Occasionally, you may have already established a claim to married couple's allowance for the tax year in which you remarry or form a civil partnership. This can happen when perhaps a spouse or civil partner dies and you decide to remarry or form another civil partnership before the following 5 April.

In these circumstances, it is almost always more advantageous to continue claiming married couple's allowance in 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 for your former spouse or civil partner rather than to make a time-apportioned claim for your new spouse or civil partner. Therefore please select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu then enter the full name of your previous spouse or civil partner and their date of birth in the fields below.
Welsh Content:
Os gwnaethoch briodi neu ffurfio partneriaeth sifil yn ystod y flwyddyn a ddaeth i ben 5 Ebrill 2016, gallwch hawlio un deuddegfed o'r lwfans pâr priod am bob mis treth (neu ran o fis treth) eich priodas neu eich partneriaeth sifil (mae'r misoedd treth yn dechrau ar y 6ed o un mis ac yn dod i ben ar y 5ed o'r mis nesaf).

Yn achlysurol efallai y byddwch eisoes wedi gwneud cais am lwfans pâr priod am y flwyddyn dreth y gwnaethoch ailbriodi neu ailffurfio partneriaeth sifil. Gall hyn ddigwydd efallai pan fydd priod neu bartner sifil yn marw ac rydych yn penderfynu priodi neu ffurfio partneriaeth arall cyn y 5ed o Ebrill dilynol.

Yn yr amgylchiadau hyn, mae hi bron bob amser yn fwy manteisiol i barhau i hawlio'r lwfans pâr priod yn 2014-15 ar gyfer eich cyn briod neu eich cyn bartner sifil yn hytrach na gwneud cais ar sail dosraniad amser ar gyfer eich priod neu eich partner sifil newydd. Felly, dewiswch 'Do ' o'r ddewislen ac yna nodwch enw llawn eich cyn briod neu eich cyn bartner sifil a'i ddyddiad/dyddiad geni ef/hi yn y blychau isod.

English Content:
Qualifying disposals

The loss must have been made on a disposal by way of either:

  • a negligible value claim
  • an arm’s length bargain
  • a distribution made in the course of winding up the company
  • the dissolution of the company

For further information see:

  • Helpsheet 286 - Negligible value claims and Income Tax losses on disposals of shares you have subscribed for in qualifying trading companies (2016)
  • Helpsheet 297 - Enterprise Investment Scheme and Capital Gains Tax (2016)
Welsh Content:
Gwarediadau cymwys

Mae'n rhaid bod y golled wedi'i gwneud ar warediad trwy naill ai:

  • cais am swm pitw
  • fargen hyd fraich
  • dosbarthiad a wnaed wrth ddirwyn y cwmni i ben
  • diddymu'r cwmni

Am ragor o wybodaeth, gweler:

  • Taflen Gymorth 286 - Negligible value claims and Income Tax losses on disposals of shares you have subscribed for in qualifying trading companies (2017)
  • Taflen Gymorth 297 - Enterprise Investment Scheme and Capital Gains Tax (2017)

English Content:
Select Yes if you want to pay Class 2 NICs voluntarily.

The Class 2 NIC amount figure will always be shown even if your profits are below £5965 and don’t want to pay voluntary. The amount shown is what HMRC thinks you need to pay. If your profits are below £5965 and you still want to pay voluntarily select 'Yes'. This amount will then be included in your final calculation. If you don’t want to pay voluntarily select 'No'. This amount will not be included in your final calculation.

(Please note: information on completing this box after 31st January 2018 is shown below)

If you fill in more than 1 'Self-employment' page, you only need to do this once. You can't change your mind after you pay your bill.

If your taxable profits are £5,965 or more, you pay Class 2 NICs (usually £2.80 a week). If your profits are less than £5,965 or you made a loss, you can pay Class 2 NICs voluntarily to protect your State Pension and certain benefits.

More information about benefits

If you're employed and self-employed, you may be able to pay a lower amount of Class 2 NICs depending on the amount of National Insurance you pay from your wages.

More information about 'How much you pay'

If you claim Universal Credit, you'll get National Insurance credits to protect benefits, but you can still pay Class 2 NICs if you want to.

More information about voluntary contributions

Completing this box after 31st January 2018
If you’re filing or making an amendment to your return after the 31st January 2018, you can only select Yes to pay Class 2 NIC’s voluntarily if:

  • we have already included a Class 2 NIC’s amount included in your calculation for this year and
  • you have paid your tax bill
Welsh Content:
Dewiswch Iawn os ydych am dalu CYG Dosbarth 2 yn wirfoddol. Os ydych yn llenwi mwy nag 1 dudalen 'Hunangyflogaeth', unwaith yn unig sy'n rhaid i chi wneud hyn. Ni allwch newid eich meddwl arôl i chi dalu'ch bil.

Os yw eich elw trethadwy'n £5,965 neu'n fwy, mae'n ofynnol arnoch i dalu CYG Dosbarth 2 (fel arfer £2.80 yr wythnos). Os yw eich elw’n llai na £5,965, neu eich bod wedi gwneud colled, gallwch dalu CYG Dosbarth 2 yn wirfoddol er mwyn gwarchod eich Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth a budd-daliadau penodol.

Mwy o wybodaeth ynglŷn â budd-daliadau

Os ydych yn gyflogedig ac yn hunangyflogedig, mae'n bosib y gallwch dalu swm is o CYG Dosbarth 2. Mae hynny'n dibynnu ar swm yr Yswiriant Gwladol rydych yn ei dalu o'ch cyflog.

Mwy o wybodaeth ynglŷn â ''Faint rydych yn ei dalu''

Os ydych yn hawlio Credyd Cynhwysol, byddwch yn derbyn credydau Yswiriant Gwladol i warchod budd-daliadau. Serch hynny, mae’n dal i fod gennych yr hawl i dalu CYG Dosbarth 2, os ydych eisiau.

Mwy o wybodaeth ynglŷn â chyfraniadau gwirfoddol

If you have made your own calculation, and prefer to use your own figure, you can select 'No' and a field will appear for you to record this figure.
Welsh Content:
Cyfrifwyd cyfanswm y credyd treth dramor ar enillion ar eich rhan.

Argymhellwn eich bod yn defnyddio'r ffigur hwn trwy ddewis 'Ydw' yn y blwch 'A ydych yn cytuno swm y rhyddhad credyd treth dramor'.

Os ydych wedi cyfrifo'r swm eich hun, ac mae'n well gennych ddefnyddio eich ffigur eich hun, gallwch ddewis 'Nac ydw' a bydd blwch yn ymddangos i chi gael cofnodi'r ffigur hwn.

English Content:
Joint account holders

If you have a joint account and the other joint account holder has chosen to have their share of the interest paid without tax taken off, but you haven't, show your share of the interest received, and the whole of the tax deducted from that share.

If you're the joint account holder who has chosen to have your share of the interest paid gross, show your share of the interest received in the box for interest that hasn't had tax taken off.
Welsh Content:
Os oes gennych gyfrif ar y cyd, ac os yw deiliad arall y cyfrif ar y cyd wedi dewis cael ei gyfran/chyfran o'r llog heb ddidynnu treth ond dydych chi heb wneud hynny, dylech nodi eich cyfran chi o'r llog a gawsoch, a'r holl dreth a ddidynnwyd o'r gyfran honno.

Os mai chi yw'r deiliad y cyfrif ar y cyd sydd wedi dewis cael eich cyfran o'r llog wedi ei dalu'n gros, dylech ddangos eich cyfran chi o'r llog a gawsoch yn y blwch ar gyfer llog sydd heb ddidynnu treth.

English Content:
If your profits are £5965 or more you must pay Class 2 NICs.

If your profits are less than £5965 you do not have to pay but if you want to pay voluntarily, please see the section below.

For 2016 to 2017, Class 2 NICs are £2.80 a week.

Your self-employment record shows you owe:
Welsh Content:
Os yw eich elw yn £5,965 neu’n fwy, mae’n rhaid i chi dalu CYG Dosbarth 2.

Os yw eich elw'n llai na £5,965 does dim rhaid i chi dalu, ond gweler yr adran isod os ydych am dalu'n wirfoddol.

Ar gyfer 2016-17, £2.80 yr wythnos yw CYG Dosbarth 2.

Mae eich cofnod hunangyflogaeth yn dangos bod arnoch:

English Content:
Include any:

  • telephone and fax running costs
  • postage
  • stationery
  • printing and small office equipment costs
  • computer software costs

Don't include:

  • non-business or private use proportion of expenses
  • new phone, fax, computer hardware or other equipment costs.

You can only claim the cost of the business calls, so if you use the same phone for business and private calls, you should use itemised bills to work out the business use.
Welsh Content:
Dylech gynnwys unrhyw:

  • costau cynnal ffôn a ffacs c
  • costau postio
  • deunyddiau swyddfa
  • costau argraffu a chostau cyfarpar swyddfa bychan
  • costau meddalwedd cyfrifiadur

Peidiwch â chynnwys:

  • cyfran defnydd preifat neu ddefnydd o dreuliau nad oedd at fusnes
  • costau ffôn, ffacs neu feddalwedd cyfrifiadur newydd neu gyfarpar arall

Gallwch ond hawlio cost y galwadau busnes felly os ydych yn defnyddio'r un ffôn ar gyfer galwadau busnes a phreifat, dylech ddefnyddio biliau manwl er mwyn cyfrifo'r defnydd busnes.

English Content:
Please enter any additional information you feel is needed to support the entries you have made.

If you selected 'Yes' to 'Does this return contain provisional/estimated figures' please state why they are provisional and when you expect to have the final figures, in the space provided.

You should only enter alpha, numeric and the following special characters '()*,-./£@&. You cannot enter more than 700 characters (including spaces) here.

Please do not use the 'Enter' (or 'Return') key on the keyboard when entering information into, or moving away from, this field. Use the spacebar on the keyboard if you need to make more than one entry.

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 or 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HMRC know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.
Welsh Content:
Nodwch unrhyw wybodaeth ychwanegol y credwch sydd ei hangen i ategu'r hyn a nodwyd gennych.

Os ydych wedi dewis 'Ydy' i 'A yw'r ffurflen dreth hon yn cynnwys ffigurau dros dro/ a amcangyfrifwyd', nodwch pam eu bod yn rhai dros dro a pha bryd y disgwyliwch y bydd y ffigurau terfynol ar gael yn y lle a ddarparwyd.

Dylech nodi nodau alffa, rhifol a'r nodau arbennig canlynol yn unig '()*,-./£@&. Ni allwch nodi mwy na 700 nod yma (gan gynnwys bylchau).

Peidiwch â defnyddio'r botwm 'Enter' (neu 'Return')ar y bysellfwrdd wrth nodi gwybodaeth yn y blwch hwn, neu wrth symud oddi yno. Defnyddiwch y bylchwr ar y bysellfwrdd os oes angen i chi wneud mwy nag un cofnod

English Content:
The local authority will enter your name on their register of blind people on the production of an ophthalmologist's certificate. If you live in Scotland or Northern Ireland, local authorities are not obliged to keep registers of blind people, although some do, but you can claim the allowance if your eyesight is so bad you cannot do any work for which eyesight is essential. Your eye specialist will normally certify you blind before you are entitled to this allowance.

If you were registered for the 1st time after 5 April 2017 you may still be entitled to claim on this Tax Return if you have evidence that your sight condition existed in the year to 5 April 2017.

English Content:
This is the User ID that was displayed to you on screen when you first signed up for an Online Government Account (also known as a Government Gateway account).

User IDs are made up of 12 randomly-generated numbers, for example, 1234 5678 9123.

Please note:
If you registered after 20 August 2001 but before 20 September 2008 your User ID will be made up of 6 or 12 randomly generated characters; a combination of letters and numbers.

If you registered before 20 August 2001 your User ID will contain 4 letters followed by 4, for example, ABCD1234.

To exchange your current User ID for a new format User ID, please follow the 'Request User ID in the new format' link on the Government Gateway website 'Manage Logins' page.

If you have lost your User ID you can request a replacement by following the 'Lost User ID' link on the HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) 'Welcome to Online Services' page.

English Content:
Please enter the total amount of all your gains made on or after 6 April 2016 (and in the period 23 June 2010 to 5 April 2011 that were deferred gains) that qualify for Entrepreneurs' Relief. This amount will include the gains from the fields:

  • 'Gains in the year, before losses' from the 'Listed shares and securities' section
  • 'Gains in the year, before losses' from the 'Unlisted shares and securities' section
  • 'Gains in the year, before losses' from the 'Property and other assets and gains' section

Entrepreneurs' Relief is subject to a lifetime limit of qualifying capital gains for each individual and you can claim up to £10 million of relief during your lifetime.

If you think relief may be due or a claim for the relief needs to be made, details and examples are given in Help Sheet 275 - Entrepreneurs' Relief.

Please also see the guidance on 'Total losses of the year' where losses are taken into account in working out the aggregate amount on which Entrepreneurs' Relief is claimed.

Further guidance and information can be found in Capital Gains Summary Notes.

  • 'Enillion yn y flwyddyn, cyn colledion' o'r adran' Cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau rhestredig'
  • 'Enillion yn y flwyddyn, cyn colledion' o'r 'Cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau heb eu rhestru'
  • 'Enillion yn y flwyddyn, cyn colledion' o'r adran 'Eiddo ac asedau eraill ac enillion'

Mae Rhyddhad Mentrwr yn amodol ar derfyn oes enillion cyfalaf cymwys ar gyfer pob unigolyn a gallwch hawlio hyd at £10 miliwn o ryddhad yn ystod eich oes.

Os credwch o bosib fod rhyddhad yn ddyledus neu bod angen gwneud cais ar gyfer y rhyddhad, rhoddir manylion ac enghreifftiau yn Taflen Gymorth 275 - Entrepreneurs' Relief.

Gweler hefyd yr arweiniad ar 'Cyfanswm colledion y flwyddyn' lle ystyrir colledion wrth gyfrifo'r swm cronnus yr hawlir y Rhyddhad Mentrwr arno.

English Content:
There are many kinds of income that could be included such as:

  • casual earnings.
  • commission.
  • freelance income.
  • income received, or treated as received, from unauthorised unit trusts.
  • taxable annual payments.
  • Property Income Distributions (PIDs) from Real Estate Investment Trusts (UK-REITs) and Property Authorised Investment Funds (PAIFs) including PIDs paid by the issue of a stock dividend.
  • business receipts where your business has ceased, such as, bad debts recovered, royalties for contracts made while the business was still running, or receipts to be taken into account following a change in accounting practice which would not otherwise be taxed over the life of your business.
  • payments under a personal insurance policy for sickness or disability benefits if you continue to be covered by a former employer's permanent health insurance scheme. (If you contributed to the premiums paid by your former employer, the benefits arising from your contributions will be exempt).

Generally, if you're not sure what income may be included, contact HMRC. This section must not be used for income (or gains) that should be returned in any other section of the return.
Welsh Content:
Mae sawl math o incwm a ellir ei gynnwys. Dyma ychydig o enghreifftiau:

  • enillion achlysurol
  • comisiwn
  • incwm llawrydd
  • incwm a gafwyd, neu sy'n cael ei drin fel incwm a gafwyd, o ymddiriedolaethau unedol heb eu hawdurdodi
  • taliadau blynyddol trethadwy
  • dosbarthiadau Incwm o Eiddo (PIDs) sy'n deillio o Ymddiriedolaethau Buddsoddi mewn Eiddo Diriaethol yn y DU (UK-REITs) a Chronfeydd Buddsoddi mewn Eiddo Awdurdodedig (PAIFs) gan gynnwys PIDs a dalwyd drwy ddyroddi difidendau stoc
  • derbyniadau busnes pan fo'ch busnes wedi dod i ben, er enghraifft dyledion drwg a adenillwyd, breindaliadau ar gyfer cytundebau a wnaed tra roedd y busnes yn dal i gael ei gynnal, neu dderbyniadau i'w cyfrif yn dilyn newid mewn arfer cyfrifyddu na fyddai fel arall yn cael eu trethu yn ystod oes eich busnes
  • taliadau o dan bolisi yswiriant personol ar gyfer budd-daliadau salwch neu anabledd os ydych yn parhau i gael eich cynnwys o dan gynllun yswiriant iechyd parhaol cyn gyflogwr - os gwnaethoch gyfrannu at y premiymau a dalwyd gan eich cyn gyflogwr, caiff y buddiannau sy'n deillio o’ch cyfraniadau eu heithrio

Yn gyffredinol, os nad ydych yn sicr pa incwm y gellir ei gynnwys yma, yna cysylltwch â'ch swyddfa Cyllid a Thollau EM. Ni ddylai'r adran hon gael ei defnyddio ar gyfer incwm (neu enillion) y dylid eu dychwelyd yn unrhyw ran arall o'r ffurflen dreth.

English Content:
Turnover consists of your total sales, takings, fees or money earned by your business for the period up to the date your books and accounts are made up to.

Turnover includes:

  • cash or cheque
  • fees, tips and commissions
  • the value of any payments 'in kind' (that is not payment by cheque or cash) for work done or goods sold
  • money owed to you for work already done
  • if you are using cash basis only include the money you actually received in the tax year

If your annual income was more than £83,000 or if not, you were within the Managing Serious Defaulters (MSD) Programme for any part of the year, select 'Yes' from the drop down menu, otherwise select 'No'.

If you've been told that you are within the MSD Programme you should complete all applicable expenses boxes. If you've been told that you're the subject of the additional reporting requirements you must also complete the balance sheet section and attach the detailed profit and loss account and computations with your tax return. Identify and explain the nature and amount of any figures contained in those accounts that cannot be vouched by physical or electronic records made at the time that the underlying transactions took place, or include confirmation that no such figures are included.

For more information follow the link Notes on Self-employment (Full) and go to page SEFN7.
Welsh Content:
Mae trosiant yn cynnwys eich holl werthiannau, derbyniadau, ffioedd neu arian a enillwyd gan eich busnes, am y cyfnod hyd at ddyddiad cau eich llyfrau a'ch cyfrifon.

Mae trosiant yn cynnwys:

  • arian parod neu siec
  • ffioedd, cildyrnau a chomisiwn
  • gwerth taliadau ar ffurf heblaw arian (hynny yw, nid taliadau ar ffurf siec neu arian) am waith a wnaed neu nwyddau a werthwyd
  • arian sy'n ddyledus i chi am waith a wnaed eisoes
  • os ydych yn defnyddio sail arian parod, dylech gynnwys dim ond yr arian gwnaethoch ei dderbyn mewn gwirionedd yn y flwyddyn dreth

Os oedd eich incwm blynyddol yn fwy na £83,000, neu os nad oedd ac roeddech yn rhan o'r rhaglen Rheoli Diffygdalwyr Bwriadol am unrhyw ran o'r flwyddyn, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r gwymplen, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'.

Os cawsoch wybod eich bod o fewn y rhaglen Rheoli Diffygdalwyr Bwriadol, dylech lenwi'r holl flychau treuliau perthnasol. Os cawsoch wybod eich bod yn destun anghenion hysbysu ychwanegol, rhaid i chi hefyd lenwi adran y fantolen a chysylltu'r cyfrif elw a cholled a chyfrifiannau manwl gyda'ch Ffurflen Dreth. Rhowch ac esboniwch natur a swm ffigurau a gynhwysir yn y cyfrifon hynny na ellir eu gwarantu drwy gofnodion corfforol nac electronig, a wnaethpwyd yr un adeg a wnaethpwyd y trafodion gwaelodol, neu cynhwyswch gadarnhad nad oes ffigyrau o'r fath wedi eu cynnwys.

Am ragor o wybodaeth, dilynwch y cysylltiad Nodiadau ar Hunangyflogaeth (Llawn) ac ewch i dudalen SEFN7.

English Content:
This is an amount of tax withheld on certain payments to UK residents by some European Member States and other related and third party territories under the terms of the European Savings Directive and equivalent third party agreements. This tax will be in addition to any foreign tax deducted by the country of origin of the payment.

The countries that may deduct Special Withholding Tax (SWT) are:

Andorra, Austria, Curacao, Gibraltar, Jersey, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Monaco, San Marino, St Maarten and Switzerland.

Where SWT is deducted you're treated as having paid in the year of deduction an equivalent amount of Income Tax in the UK, which can be set against your UK tax liability of that year or repaid to you if the amount exceeds that liability.

Enter the amount of any SWT deducted from the income. If any UK Income Tax has been deducted from the income this should also be included here.

Give further details in the 'Any other information' field at the end of the 'Fill in your return' section
Welsh Content:
Dyma swm o dreth a gaiff ei atal ar daliadau penodol i breswylwyr y DU gan rai Aelod-wladwriaethau Ewrop a thiriogaethau perthynol a thrydydd parti eraill o dan delerau'r Gyfarwyddeb Cynilion Ewropeaidd a chytundebau trydydd parti cyfatebol. Bydd y dreth hon yn ychwanegol at unrhyw dreth dramor a ddidynnir gan y wlad y tarddodd y taliad ohoni.

Y gwledydd a allai ddidynnu'r Dreth Ataliedig Arbennig yw:

Andorra, Awstria, Curacao, Gibraltar, Jersey, Liechtenstein, Lwcsembwrg, Monaco, San Marino, y Swistir ac Ynys St Maarten

Pan fo Treth Ataliedig Arbennig yn cael ei didynnu, cewch eich trin fel eich bod wedi talu swm cyfatebol o Dreth Incwm yn y DU ym mlwyddyn y didyniad, a gellir gosod y swm hwn yn erbyn eich rhwymedigaeth dreth yn y DU ar gyfer y flwyddyn honno, neu gellir ei ad-dalu i chi os bydd y swm yn uwch na'r rhwymedigaeth honno.

Nodwch swm y Dreth Ataliedig Arbennig a ddidynnwyd o'r incwm. Os didynnwyd Treth Incwm y DU o'r incwm, dylid cynnwys hyn yma hefyd.

Dylech roi manylion pellach yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' ar ddiwedd yr adran 'Llenwi eich Ffurflen Dreth'.

English Content:
You pay tax for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 on the profits and claim relief for the losses of your 'basis period'. After the first one or two years as a partner, your basis period will be the same as the partnership's accounting period, unless the partnership changes its accounting date.

For example, if the partnership's accounting date is 31 December and you became a partner on 1 January 2016, your basis period for tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 is the 12 months from 1 January 2016 to 31 December 2016.

However, in the first year or two as a partner, or when you leave the partnership, your basis period may not be the same as the partnership's accounting period

Full details of the rules used to work out your basis period are in Help Sheet 222 - How to calculate your taxable profits.

Enter the date on which your basis period for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 started in this field.
Welsh Content:
Rydych yn talu treth ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 ar yr elw ac yn gwneud cais am ryddhad parthed colledion eich 'cyfnod sail'. Ar ôl y flwyddyn gyntaf neu'r ddwy flynedd gyntaf fel partner, bydd eich cyfnod sail yr un peth â chyfnod cyfrifyddu'r bartneriaeth, oni fydd y bartneriaeth yn newid ei dyddiad cyfrifyddu.

Er enghraifft, os yw dyddiad cyfrifyddu'r bartneriaeth ar 31 Rhagfyr a daethoch yn bartner ar 1 Ionawr 2014, eich cyfnod sail ar gyfer 2014 i 2016 yw'r 12 mis o 1 Ionawr 2014 i 31 Rhagfyr 2014.

Fodd bynnag, yn y flwyddyn gyntaf neu'r ddwy flynedd gyntaf fel partner, neu pan fyddwch yn gadael y bartneriaeth, efallai na fydd eich cyfnod sail yr un peth â chyfnod cyfrifyddu'r bartneriaeth.

Ceir manylion llawn o'r rheolau a ddefnyddir i gyfrifo'ch cyfnod sail yn Nhaflen Gymorth 222 How to calculate your taxable profits.

Nodwch y dyddiad y dechreuodd eich cyfnod sail ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 yn y blwch hwn.

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
You pay tax for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 tax year on the profits and claim relief for the losses of your 'basis period'. After the first one or two years as a partner, your basis period will be the same as the partnership's accounting period, unless the partnership changes its accounting date.

For example, if the partnership's accounting date is 31 December and you became a partner on 1 January 2016, your basis period for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 is the 12 months from 1 January 2016 to 31 December 2016.

However, in the first year or two as a partner, or when you leave the partnership, your basis period may not be the same as the partnership's accounting period.

Full details of the rules used to work out your basis period are in Help Sheet 222 - How to calculate your taxable profits.

Enter the date on which your basis period for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 started in this field.
Welsh Content:
Rydych yn talu treth ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 ar yr elw ac yn gwneud cais am ryddhad parthed colledion eich 'cyfnod sail'. Ar ôl y flwyddyn gyntaf neu'r ddwy flynedd gyntaf fel partner, bydd eich cyfnod sail yr un peth â chyfnod cyfrifyddu'r bartneriaeth, oni fydd y bartneriaeth yn newid ei dyddiad cyfrifyddu.

Er enghraifft, os yw dyddiad cyfrifyddu'r bartneriaeth ar 31 Rhagfyr a daethoch yn bartner ar 1 Ionawr 2016, eich cyfnod sail ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 yw'r 12 mis o 1 Ionawr 2016 i 31 Rhagfyr 2017.

Fodd bynnag, yn y flwyddyn gyntaf neu'r ddwy flynedd gyntaf fel partner, neu pan fyddwch yn gadael y bartneriaeth, efallai na fydd eich cyfnod sail yr un peth â chyfnod cyfrifyddu'r bartneriaeth.

Ceir manylion llawn o'r rheolau a ddefnyddir i gyfrifo'ch cyfnod sail yn Nhaflen Gymorth 222 - How to calculate your taxable profits.

Nodwch y dyddiad y dechreuodd eich cyfnod sail ar gyfer 2016 i 2017.

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com
