English Content:
Do not include questions in this box as HM Revenue and Customs can't answer specific questions from your tax return.

Enter the reason why you're reducing your Payments on Account.

The main reasons why you may want to reduce your Payments on Account for 2017 to 2018 are if:

  • you expect your 2017 to 2018 income to be lower than 2016 to 2017
  • you expect your allowances or reliefs to be higher
  • more of your 2017 to 2018 income will be taxed at source, because it will be taxed under PAYE
  • it will be covered by subcontractor deductions (on CIS25s)
  • because more of your income will come from savings, such as taxed interest or company dividends

You can enter a maximum of 240 characters, including spaces. You can only enter letters and numbers and the special characters '()*,-./£@&.

Don't use the 'Enter' (or 'Return') key on the keyboard when entering information into, or moving away from, this field. Use the spacebar on the keyboard if you need to make more than one entry.

  • os ydych yn disgwyl eich incwm fod yn is yn 2017 i 2017 nag yn 2016 i 2017

English Content:
This identification number is unique to you and is created, in code, from the entire content of your return. This number will appear on the latest printed or stored copy of your return. We suggest that you check to ensure that you have this number on the latest printed or stored copy of your return (it changes every time you amend your return prior to submission).

Please note: HMRC will now process your return. It takes up to 72 hours for it to update on to our system. You must wait until after 72 hours have passed before contacting us. In the meantime you will be able to go back into your account to correct any errors on your return or check any of the information you provided.

Awgrymwn eich bod yn gwirio er mwyn sicrhau bod y rhif hwn gennych ar y copi diwethaf o'ch ffurflen dreth a argraffwyd neu a storiwyd (mae'n newid bob tro rydych yn diwygio eich ffurflen dreth cyn cyflwyno).

English Content:
Married couple's allowance can only be claimed if either you, your spouse or civil partner (following the introduction of the Civil Partnership Act 2004) were born before 6 April 1935, and:

  • you are a married man or married woman who married before 5 December 2005
  • you are a married man, married woman or civil partner who married or formed a civil partnership on or after 5 December 2005

The allowance is made up of two amounts, a minimum amount (worth up to £322) plus an age-related amount dependent on the income of the husband (for marriages before 5 December 2005), or the person with the higher income (for marriages and civil partnerships formed on or after 5 December 2005) worth up to £835.50.

A married couple or civil partners may share the minimum amount of the allowance, but you must have asked us already to do this (either before 6 April 2016 or, if you married or formed a civil partnership during the year to 5 April 2017, by that date). If you want to change the way the allowance is given for 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 please contact your HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) office (it is already too late to make any change for 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017).

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 or 6 April 2018 to 5 April 2019 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HMRC know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.
Welsh Content:
Gellir dim ond hawlio Lwfans Par Priod os ganed chi neu eich priod neu eich partner sifil (yn sgil Deddf Partneriaeth Sifil 2004) cyn 6 Ebrill 1935, ac:

  • rydych yn ŵr neu’n wraig briod a briododd cyn 5 Rhagfyr 2005, neu
  • rydych yn ŵr priod, yn wraig briod neu'n bartner sifil a briododd neu a wnaeth ffurfio partneriaeth sifil ar neu ar ôl 5 Rhagfyr 2005

Mae'r lwfans yn cynnwys dau swm, isafswm (sy'n werth hyd at £322) yn ogystal â swm ar sail oedran sy'n dibynnu ar incwm y gŵr (ar gyfer priodasau cyn 5 Rhagfyr 2005), neu'r person gyda'r incwm uchaf (ar gyfer priodasau a phartneriaethau sifil a ffurfiwyd ar neu ar ôl 5 Rhagfyr 2005) sy'n werth hyd at £513.50.

Gall cwpl priod neu bartneriaid sifil rannu lleiafswm y lwfans, ond mae'n rhaid eich bod wedi gofyn i Gyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) eisoes i wneud hyn (naill ai cyn 6 Ebrill 2016 neu, os gwnaethoch briodi neu ffurfio partneriaeth sifil yn ystod y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017, erbyn y dyddiad hwnnw).

Os ydych am newid y ffordd y rhoddir lwfans ar gyfer 2017 i 2017, cysylltwch â'ch swyddfa CThEM (mae eisoes yn rhy hwyr i wneud unrhyw newid ar gyfer 2016 i 2017).

English Content:
From this page you can select the appropriate option to make the following type of amendments to the return you have already submitted:

  • Add a new section to your submitted return - Selecting this option will take you to the 'Tailor your return' pages where you need to answer various questions which will allow the system to automatically insert your missing section.
  • Amend a figure(s) you have already submitted - Selecting this option will take you to the 'Check your progress' page where you can follow the appropriate link to amend your figure(s). Once in the correct section, work through the pages to find the figure(s) you want to amend and make the necessary changes.
  • Delete a section from your submitted return - Selecting this option will take you to the 'Check your progress' page where you can follow the appropriate link to get to the section you want to delete. At the bottom of the page, please follow the delete link which will remove the specified section.
  • Add, delete a section and, or amend a figure - Selecting this option will take you first to the 'Tailor your return' pages because you must add the new section before making any other amendment (for example: delete a section and, or amend a figure). Follow the instructions for Add a new section above, then follow the instructions for delete a section and, or amend a figure(s).
Welsh Content:
Gallwch ddewis yr opsiwn priodol o'r dudalen hon i wneud y diwygiadau canlynol i'r ffurflen dreth rydych eisoes wedi ei chyflwyno:

  • Ychwanegu adran newydd i'r ffurflen dreth rydych eisoes wedi ei chyflwyno - Bydd dewis yr opsiwn hwn yn eich tywys i'r tudalennau 'Addasu eich ffurflen dreth' lle ddylech ateb amryw o gwestiynau a fydd yn caniatáu'r system i fewnosod eich adran goll yn awtomatig.
  • Diwygio ffigur(au) rydych eisoes wedi eu cyflwyno - Bydd dewis yr opsiwn hwn yn eich tywys i'r dudalen 'Gwirio eich cynnydd' lle'r gallwch ddilyn y cysylltiad priodol i ddiwygio eich ffigur(au). Unwaith y byddwch yn yr adran iawn, ewch drwy'r tudalennau i ganfod y ffigur(au) rydych am eich diwygio a gwnewch y newidiadau.
  • Dileu adran o'r ffurflen dreth a gyflwynwyd gennych - Bydd dewis yr opsiwn hwn yn eich tywys i'r dudalen 'Gwirio eich cynnydd' lle'r gallwch ddilyn y cysylltiad priodol i gyrraedd yr adran rydych am ei dileu. Ar waelod y dudalen dilynwch y cysylltiad dileu a fydd yn diddymu'r adran a nodwyd.
  • Ychwanegu/dileu adran a/neu ddiwygio ffigur - Bydd dewis yr opsiwn hwn yn eich tywys i'r tudalennau 'Addasu eich ffurflen dreth' oherwydd rhaid i chi ychwanegu'r adran newydd cyn gwneud unrhyw ddiwygiad arall (er enghraifft: dileu adran a/neu ddiwygio ffigur). Dilynwch y cyfarwyddiadau ar gyfer Ychwanegu adran newydd uchod, yna dilynwch y cyfarwyddiadau ar gyfer dileu adran a/neu ddiwygio ffigur(au).

English Content:
If you select 'yes' from the drop down menu, you will be asked to select a percentage rate of relief that is the foreign tax deducted that you want to set against your liability to UK tax on that same income.

Foreign Tax Credit Relief is not always available, or may not be available on the full amount of foreign tax you have paid. Relief is subject to the following rules:

  • you must be a UK resident
  • the income must arise in the foreign country and be properly chargeable under the foreign country's law
  • the amount of Foreign Tax Credit Relief must not exceed the UK tax on the same item of income or gains
  • where a Double Taxation Agreement exists between the UK and the other country, the amount of foreign tax available for the relief is restricted to the minimum foreign tax payable under the terms of the Agreement

To check if the UK has entered into a Double Taxation Agreement with the foreign territory you should go to Double Taxation Treaties which provides further information.

If a double taxation agreement does exist you must check what it says and how it applies to you. If foreign tax credit relief cannot be claimed for some or all of the foreign tax you will have to consider making a claim to the tax authority of the other country. You can find information about this claims process in the Double Taxation Relief Manual

If no Double Taxation Agreement exists, or the Agreement does not cover that particular foreign tax, relief is only available if the tax corresponds to UK Income or Capital Gains Tax.

See Help Sheet 263 - Foreign Tax Credit Relief (PDF 110K) for further information about foreign tax credit relief.

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach gweler y Nodiadau Tramor (PDF 128K)

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
We require you to enter your ‘net interest’. Bank statements or building society passbooks or electronic vouchers from authorised unit trusts or open-ended investment companies or investment trust companies may describe the information you require differently. The information you need to look out for is:

  • gross interest
  • tax deducted
  • net interest

1. If your statement shows all 3 amounts, copy the net interest figure over.

2. Your statement may just show gross interest and tax deducted. The net interest is what you get by taking the tax deducted away from the gross interest.

3. Your statement may just show 'net interest', so copy this figure here.
Welsh Content: Gallai cyfriflenni banc neu lyfrau cyfrif cymdeithasau adeiladu ddisgrifio hwn mewn ffordd wahanol. Gall eich cyfriflen ddangos tri swm, 'llog gros', 'treth a ddidynnwyd' a 'llog net'. Os felly, mae'n fater syml o gopïo'r ffigur llog net a'i nodi yn y blwch. Ond bydd rhai talwyr yn dangos y llog gros a'r dreth a ddidynnwyd. Y llog net yw'r hyn a gewch pan fyddwch yn tynnu'r 'dreth a ddidynnwyd' o'r llog gros. Mae rhai talwyr yn dangos 'llog net' yn unig ar eich cyfriflen ac felly'r unig beth sy'n rhaid i chi ei wneud yw nodi'r ffigur hwnnw yma.

English Content:
Please enter the amount of the 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 trading (or possibly certain capital) losses you are claiming relief for.

The general rule is that the claim relates to the later tax year (6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018), not the earlier tax year in which the loss is to be relieved (for example, 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017). The amount of the relief will be calculated by reference to the earlier tax year and will usually be set against other tax due or repaid as appropriate.
Welsh Content:
Nodwch swm colledion masnach (neu efallai colledion cyfalaf penodol) ar gyfer 2017 i 2017 yr ydych y gwneud cais am ryddhad ar eu cyfer.

Y rheol gyffredinol yw bod y cais yn ymwneud a blwyddyn dreth hwyrach (2017 i 2017), nid y flwyddyn dreth y mae'r rhyddhad ar y golled (er enghraifft 2016 i 2017). Cyfrifir swm y rhyddhad wrth gyfeirio at y flwyddyn dreth gynharach ac fel arfer fe osodir yn erbyn treth arall sy'n ddyledus neu a ad-dalir fel bo'n addas.

English Content:
The rate of taper relief depends on whether or not the asset disposed of was a business asset. A non-business asset for taper relief purposes is simply any asset other than a business asset (see Help Sheet 279).

If the gain arises on an asset which was not wholly a business or a non-business asset during the period you held it from 6 April 1998, the gain must be appropriately apportioned between the business and non-business elements. Part of the gain will qualify for the business asset rate of taper relief and the other part for the non-business asset rate of taper relief (see Help Sheet 279).

If you have to apportion a gain between business and non-business elements, treat the two parts as separate gains for the purposes of this calculator, one gain attracting business taper relief and the other non-business taper relief.

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com
Welsh Content:
Mae rhyddhad meinhau yn ddibynnol ar p'un a yw'r ased a waredir yn ased busnes ai peidio. At ddibenion rhyddhad meinhau mae ased nad yw'n ymwneud â busnes yn ased nad yw yn ased busnes (gweler Taflen Gymorth 279).

Os cododd yr ennill ar ased nad oedd yn gyfan gwbl yn ased busnes neu'r tu allan i'r busnes yn ystod y cyfnod yr oedd yn eich meddiant o 6 Ebrill 1998, rhaid dosrannu'r ennill fel y bo'n briodol rhwng yr elfennau sy'n ymwneud â'r busnesa'r rhai nad ydynt yn ymwneud â'r busnes. Bydd rhan o'r ennill yn gymwys am ryddhad meinhau ar gyfradd ased busnes a bydd y rhan arall ar gyfer rhyddhad meinhau ar gyfradd ased nad yw'n ymwneud â'r busnes (gweler Taflen Gymorth 279).

Os oes rhaid i chi ddosrannu'r ennill rhwng yr elfennau sy'n ymwneud â'r busnes â'r rhai nad ydynt yn ymwneud â'r busnes, dylech drin y ddwy ran fel enillion ar wahân at ddibenion y cyfrifiad hwn, un ennill yn gymwys am ryddhad meinhau ar gyfer busnes a'r llall ar gyfer rhyddhad meinhau ar gyfer ased nad yw'n ymwneud â busnes.

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
You can claim 100% capital allowances for:

  • designated energy-saving or water-efficient equipment used in your business, (even if you have otherwise used up your Annual Investment Allowance), see the ECA Scheme for more information
  • a new car with low CO2 emissions of not more than 75gm a km driven
  • equipment for refuelling vehicles with natural gas, biogas or hydrogen fuel.
  • Investment in electric charge-points for electric vehicles if purchased on or after 23 November 2016)
Welsh Content:
Gallwch hawlio lwfansau cyfalaf o 100% ar gyfer:

  • cyfarpar a ddynodwyd ar gyfer arbed ynni neu ddŵr a ddefnyddir yn eich busnes (hyd yn oed os ydych wedi defnyddio eich Lwfans Buddsoddi Blynyddol), gweler y Cynllun ECA i gael mwy o wybodaeth
  • car newydd gydag allyriant CO2 isel heb fod yn fwy na 110g/km wrth ei yrru (hyd yn oed os yw'r car yn costio mwy na £12,000)
  • cyfarpar ar gyfer ail lenwi cerbydau gyda nwy naturiol, biogas neu danwydd hydrogen
  • cerbydau nwyddau newydd gydag allyriadau sero ac sydd heb eu defnyddio - gweler www.hmrc.gov.uk/budget2010/bn05.htm am fwy o wybodaeth

English Content:
Include any:

  • cost of goods bought for re-sale
  • cost of raw materials used
  • direct costs of producing goods sold
  • adjustments for opening and closing stock and work in progress
  • commissions payable
  • discounts given

Taxi and minicab drivers and those in the road haulage industry should include fuel costs.

Don't include:

  • cost of goods or materials bought for private use
  • depreciation of equipment
Welsh Content:
Dylech gynnwys unrhyw:

  • costau nwyddau a brynwyd i'w hail werthu
  • costau deunyddiau crai a ddefnyddiwyd
  • costau uniongyrchol cynhyrchu nwyddau i'w gwerthu
  • addasiadau ar gyfer stoc agor a chau a gwaith ar y gweill
  • comisiynau sy'n daladwy
  • disgownt a roddwyd

Dylai gyrwyr tacsis a cherbydau bychain ('minicabs') a'r rhai sy'n ymwneud â'r diwydiant cludo ar y ffordd fawr gynnwys costau tanwydd.

Peidiwch â chynnwys:

  • costau nwyddau neu ddeunyddiau a brynwyd at ddefnydd preifat
  • dibrisiad cyfarpar

English Content:
If you received income from furnished holiday lettings in the EEA, choose 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, choose 'No'.

A furnished holiday letting is a property in the UK or European Economic Area (EEA) that is:

  • available for holiday letting on a commercial basis for 210 days or more during the year
  • actually let commercially as holiday accommodation for 105 days or more during the year
  • one where any periods of longer-term occupation do not exceed 155 days in the year

For further guidance and information see Help Sheet 253 - Furnished holiday lettings
Welsh Content:
Os derbynioch incwm drwy osod llety gwyliau wedi'i ddodrefnu yn yr AEE, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'.

Mae llety gwyliau wedi'i ddodrefnu yn eiddo yn y DU neu'r Ardal Economaidd Ewropeaidd (AEE) sydd:

  • ar gael fel llety gwyliau ar sail fasnachol am 210 diwrnod neu fwy yn ystod y flwyddyn, ac
  • yn cael ei osod fel llety gwyliau ar sail fasnachol mewn gwirionedd am 105 diwrnod neu fwy yn ystod y flwyddyn, ac
  • yn un lle nad yw unrhyw gyfnod o arhosiad tymor hir yn fwy na 155 diwrnod yn ystod y flwyddyn

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach, gweler Taflen Gymorth 253 - 'Furnished holiday lettings' ar GOV.UK

English Content:
To work out your profit or loss for the basis period you may have to add together and/or divide the results of the periods for which you have accounts. Enter here the amount of the adjustment needed to the profit or loss in either 'Net business profit for tax purposes' or 'Net business loss for tax purposes' above.

For further guidance and information please see the Notes on Self-employment (Full) (PDF 121K)

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com
Welsh Content:
I gyfrifo eich elw neu eich colled ar gyfer y cyfnod sail, efallai y bydd yn rhaid i chi ychwanegu a/neu rannu canlyniadau'r cyfnodau y mae gennych gyfrifon ar eu cyfer.Nodwch yma swm yr addasiad i'r elw neu'r golled sydd ei angen yn naillai 'Elw net y busnes at ddibenion treth'neu 'Colled net y busnes at ddibenion treth' uchod.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach gweler y Nodiadau ar Hunangyflogaeth (Llawn) (PDF 119K)

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content: From box 25 on your partnership statement

English Content:
You can claim overlap relief if you sold or closed down your business, or if you have changed your accounting date this year resulting in a change of basis period, and that basis period is now more than 12 months long.

Overlap profits

You may find that your basis period for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 overlaps with the basis period for the tax year 6 April 2015 to 5 April 2016.

Such overlaps can happen in the first three years after a business starts up or in a year in which there is a change of basis period. For example, if your business started on 1 January 2016 and your first accounts are for the 12 months to 31 December 2016, your basis periods are:

  • 2015 to 2016, 1 January 2016 to 5 April 2016
  • 2016 to 2017, 1 January 2016 to 31 December 2016

The period of overlap is 1 January 2016 to 5 April 2016. So, if the profit for the 12 months to 31 December 2016 is £12,000, the overlap profit is (94/365 x £12,000) = £3,090.40 (over 94 days).

If your basis periods for the tax year 6 April 2015 to 5 April 2016 and the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 overlap, keep a record of both the overlap profit and the overlap period and any overlap profit you have carried forward where you have not yet claimed overlap relief.

You must take off (as overlap relief) any overlap profits which arose in the tax year 6 April 2015 to 5 April 2016 or earlier years when working out your taxable business profits for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 if:

  • you sold or closed down your business in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017
  • your basis period for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 is more than 12 months long because
  • you changed your accounting date. The amount of overlap profits allowed as overlap relief is in proportion to the length of your basis period that exceeds 12 months and the length of your overlap period from earlier years

For example, you have overlap profits of £5,000 (over five months) from an earlier year. You change your accounting date. Your basis period is 14 months. There are five months of overlap profits available. The relief is in proportion to the number of months by which the basis period exceeds 12 months (that is, two months) and the length of the overlap period (that is, five months).

So, the overlap relief is:

2/5 x £5,000 = £2,000.

The balance of overlap profit, £3,000 (over three months), is carried forward. You can claim this as overlap relief in a later year.
Welsh Content:
Gallwch hawlio rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd os gwerthoch neu os caeoch eich busnes, neu os ydych wedi newid eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu eleni sy'n golygu bod y cyfnod sail wedi newid, ac mae'r cyfnod sail hwnnw bellach yn hirach na 12 mis.

Elw gorgyffwrddMae'n bosib y gwelwch fod eich cyfnod sail ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 yn gorgyffwrdd â'r cyfnod sail ar gyfer 2014 i 2016.

Gall gorgyffwrdd o'r fath ddigwydd yn ystod y tair blynedd gyntaf ar ôl i fusnes gychwyn neu yn ystod blwyddyn pan fo newid yn y cyfnod sail. Er enghraifft, osdechreuodd eich busnes ar 1 Ionawr 2016 ac mae eich cyfrifon cyntaf ar gyfer y 12 mis hyd at 31 Rhagfyr 2016, eich cyfnodau sail yw:

  • 2014 i 2016, 1 Ionawr 2016 hyd at 5 Ebrill 2016
  • 2016 i 2017, 1 Ionawr 2016 hyd at 31 Rhagfyr 2016

Y cyfnod o orgyffwrdd yw 1 Ionawr 2016 hyd at 5 Ebrill 2016. Felly, os yw'r elw ar gyfer y 12 mis hyd at 31 Rhagfyr 2016 yn £12,000, yr elw gorgyffwrdd yw (94/364 x £12,000) = £3,098 (dros 94 diwrnod).

Os yw eich cyfnodau sail ar gyfer 2014 i 2016 a 2016 i 2017 yn gorgyffwrdd, cadwch gofnod o'relw gorgyffwrdd a'r cyfnod gorgyffwrdd yn ogystal ag unrhyw elw gorgyffwrdd rydych wedi cario ymlaen pan nad ydych eisoes wedi hawlio rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd.

Rhaid i chi dynnu i ffwrdd (fel rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd) unrhyw elw gorgyffwrdd a gododd yn 2014 i 2016 neu flynyddoedd cynharach wrth gyfrifo'ch elw busnes trethadwy ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 os:

  • gwnaethoch werthu neu gau eich busnes yn 2016 i 2017
  • mae eich cyfnod sail ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 yn fwy na 12 mis oherwydd eich bod wedinewid eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu. Mae swm yr elw gorgyffwrdd a ganaiteir fel rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd yn gymesur â hyd eich cyfnod sail sydd yn fwy na 12 mis a hyd eich cyfnod gorgyffwrdd o flynyddoedd cynharach.

Er enghraifft, mae gennych elw gorgyffwrdd o £5,000 (dros bum mis) oflwyddyn gynharach. Rydych yn newid eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu. Eich cyfnod sail yw 14 mis. Mae pum mis o elw gorgyffwrdd ar gael. Mae'r rhyddhad yngymesur â'r nifer o fisoedd y mae'r cyfnod sail yn mynd tu hwnt i 12 mis (hynny yw, dau fis) a hyd y cyfnod gorgyffwrdd (hynny yw,pum mis).

Felly, y rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd yw:
2/5 x £5,000 = £2,000

Mae gweddill yr elw gorgyffwrdd, £3,000 (dros dri mis), yn cael ei gario ymlaen. Gallwch hawlio hwn fel rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd mewn blwyddyn hwyrach.

English Content:
Enter the amount due for the year, not the weekly amount. Don't include any amount you enter in the pension lump sum box on the next page.

You're taxed on the 'full amount' of State Pension you were entitled to for the year to 5 April 2017, which is the total of your weekly entitlements. Because the State Pension can be paid weekly, 4 weekly or quarterly in arrears, your total State Pension entitlement is unlikely to be the same as the actual payments you received in the year to 5 April 2017.

To find out your weekly State Pension entitlement, you can use the 'About the general increases in benefits' letter that the Pension Service sent you before the start of the 2016 to 2017 financial year. This letter tells you your weekly State Pension entitlement from 10 April 2016.

However if the amount of State Pension you receive has changed between 10 April 2016 and 5 April 2017 (for example, due to a change in your circumstances), then The Pension Service will have sent you a letter telling you what your new weekly entitlement is. You can use this new 'entitlement letter' to find out your weekly entitlement for the remainder of the year. Both these letters also include a breakdown of the components of your State Pension.

If you don't have the appropriate letter(s), you can contact  the the Pension Service on Telephone: 0345 606 0265 (Textphone: 0345 606 0285) and ask for a BR735 'Statement of Pension' form for the period 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017.

If you receive State Pension for the full year to 5 April 2017, to calculate the total amount you were entitled to for the year, multiply your weekly entitlement by 52. If your weekly entitlement changed during the year you'll need to multiply each amount by the number of weeks for which it was received up to a maximum of 52 weeks.

If you received State Pension for part of the year, you'll need to count the number of weeks from the date your State Pension began to 5 April 2017 and multiply this by your weekly entitlement to calculate your total entitlement for this tax year.

Quick guide to calculate the total of your weekly entitlements for a full year, if you were paid:

  • weekly - add up the 52 weekly amounts as shown on your bank statement or building society passbook (if you were paid by direct debit)
  • 4 weekly - multiply your four-weekly amount by 13
  • quarterly - multiply the quarterly amount by 4

As well as your basic pension, the entry should include:

  • any graduated pension
  • the age addition if you're over 80
  • increases paid by the Department for Work and Pensions to uprate a guaranteed minimum pension
  • any addition for a dependent adult
  • any extra pension paid because you deferred or temporarily gave up your State Pension
  • if you're married, or in a civil partnership, any State Pension payable to you because of your spouse's or civil partner's National Insurance contributions

Because they aren't taxable the figure shouldn't include:

  • any addition for a dependent child
  • annual Christmas bonus
  • Winter Fuel Payment
Welsh Content:
Nodwch y swm sy'n ddyledus ar gyfer y flwyddyn, nid y swm wythnosol. Peidiwch â chynnwys unrhyw swm a nodwch yn y blwch cyfandaliad pensiwn ar y dudalen nesaf.

Rydych wedi eich trethu ar y 'swm llawn' o Bensiwn y Wladwriaeth yr oedd gennych hawl iddo am y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017, sef cyfanswm eich hawliad wythnosol. Oherwydd y gellir talu Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth yn wythnosol, pob 4 wythnos neu'n chwarterol ar ffurf ôl-daliadau, mae'n annhebygol y bydd cyfanswm eich hawliad yr un peth â'r taliadau a gawsoch mewn gwirionedd yn y flwyddyn i 5 Ebrill 2017.

I ganfod eich hawliad wythnosol i Bensiwn y Wladwriaeth, gallwch ddefnyddio'r llythyr 'Ynglŷn â'r cynnydd cyffredinol mewn budd-daliadau' a anfonir gan y Gwasanaeth Pensiwn cyn dechrau'r flwyddyn ariannol 2016-17. Mae'r llythyr hwn yn sôn wrthych am eich hawliad wythnosol i Bensiwn y Wladwriaeth o 10 Ebrill 2016.

Fodd bynnag, os yw swm Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth a gewch wedi newid rhwng 10 Ebrill 2016 a 5 Ebrill 2017 (er enghraifft, o ganlyniad i newid yn eich amgylchiadau), yna bydd y Gwasanaeth Pensiwn wedi anfon llythyr atoch yn nodi eich hawliad wythnosol newydd. Gallwch ddefnyddio'r 'llythyr hawliad' newydd hwn i ganfod eich hawliad wythnosol am weddill y flwyddyn. Mae'r ddau lythyr hyn hefyd yn cynnwys dadansoddiad o'r rhannau sydd wedi eu cynnwys yn eich Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth.

Os nad yw'r llythyr(on) priodol gennych, yna ffoniwch y Gwasanaeth Pensiwn ar 0845 606 0275 (Cymraeg) neu 0345 606 0265 (Saesneg), (Ffôn testun 0345 606 0285), a gofynnwch am ffurflen BR735, 'Datganiad Pensiwn', am y cyfnod 6 Ebrill 2016 i 5 Ebrill 2017.

Os ydych yn derbyn Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth am y flwyddyn gyfan hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017, i gyfrifo'r cyfanswm yr oedd hawl gennych iddo ar gyfer y flwyddyn, lluoswch eich hawliad wythnosol gan 52. Os newidiodd eich hawliad wythnosol yn ystod y flwyddyn bydd angen i chi luosi bob swm gan y nifer o wythnosau y cafodd ei dderbyn, hyd at uchafswm o 52 wythnos.

Os cawsoch Bensiwn y Wladwriaeth am ran o'r flwyddyn, bydd angen i chi gyfrif nifer yr wythnosau o'r dyddiad y dechreuodd eich Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth tan 5 Ebrill 2017 a lluosi hwn gyda'ch hawliad wythnosol er mwyn cyfrifo cyfanswm eich hawliad am y flwyddyn dreth hon.

Fel arweiniad, i gyfrifo cyfanswm eich hawl wythnosol am flwyddyn lawn, os cawsoch eich talu:

  • yn wythnosol - adiwch y 52 swm wythnosol fel y dangosir ar eich cyfriflen banc neu lyfr pas cymdeithas adeiladu (os cawsoch eich talu gan ddebyd uniongyrchol)
  • bob pedair wythnos - lluoswch eich swm pedwar wythnos gydag 13
  • yn chwarterol - lluoswch y swm chwarterol gyda 4

Yn ogystal â'ch pensiwn sylfaenol, dylai'r cofnod gynnwys:

  • unrhyw bensiwn graddedig
  • yr ychwanegiad oedran os ydych dros 80
  • cynnydd a delir gan yr Adran Gwaith a Phensiynau i godi cyfradd pensiwn ag isafswm gwarantedig
  • unrhyw ychwanegiad ar gyfer oedolyn dibynnol
  • unrhyw bensiwn ychwanegol a delir i chi oherwydd eich bod wedi gohirio neu wedi rhoi'r gorau dros dro i dderbyn Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth
  • os ydych yn briod neu mewn partneriaeth sifil, unrhyw Bensiwn y Wladwriaeth sy'n daladwy i chi o ganlyniad i gyfraniadau Yswiriant Gwladol eich priod neu eich partner sifil

Gan nad ydynt yn drethadwy, ni ddylai'r ffigur gynnwys:

  • unrhyw ychwanegiad am blentyn dibynnol
  • bonws Blynyddol y Nadolig, neu
  • Taliad Tanwydd Gaeaf

English Content:
Information We Hold About You

HMRC are given information each tax year about income you receive. As a self-assessment customer we have created a page of information we hold to assist you when completing your tax return.

The information is read only. Once you have read the information, click on the tick box. The relevant sections of your tax return will then be populated with this data.

If you disagree with any of the information, you will need to access each section and amend the values. If you want to tell us why you are making changes please use the additional information page.
Welsh Content:
Gwybodaeth yn ein meddiant amdanoch chi

Bob blwyddyn dreth, mae CThEM yn cael gwybod am yr incwm a dderbyniwch. Rydym wedi creu tudalen wybodaeth i'ch cynorthwyo, fel cwsmer hunanasesiad, wrth i chi lenwi'ch ffurflen dreth.

Mae'r wybodaeth i'w darllen yn unig. Ar ôl i chi ddarllen yr wybodaeth, cliciwch ar y blwch ticio. Yna, caiff adrannau perthnasol eich ffurflen dreth eu llenwi â'r data hwn.

Os ydych yn anghytuno gyda'r wybodaeth, bydd yn rhaid i chi gyrchu pob adran ac addasu'r ffigurau. Os ydych am roi gwybod i ni pam eich bod yn gwneud newidiadau, defnyddiwch y dudalen 'Gwybodaeth ychwanegol'.

Read help.

English Content:
If you've income from property let jointly, choose 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, choose 'No'.

If you own and let property jointly with one or more other people, include only your share of the income and your share of the expenses. Enter the name and address of the person who prepares the property records in the 'Any other information' box on your Tax Return.

If you and your spouse live together, any income from property held in joint names is usually treated as if it belonged to both of you in equal shares (even if you own it in unequal shares) so you'll each be taxed on half the income.

However, if you're entitled to the income in proportion to your unequal share you may make an election on Form 17, ‘Declaration of beneficial interests in joint property and income’ to be taxed on the actual basis.

Civil partners who registered a civil partnership on or after 5 December 2005 are treated the same as married couples.
Welsh Content:
Os cawsoch incwm drwy osod eiddo ar y cyd, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'.

Os ydych yn berchen ar eiddo ac yn ei osod ar y cyd ag un neu fwy o bobl, dylech gynnwys eich cyfran chi o'r incwm a'ch cyfran chi o'r treuliau yn unig. Rhowch enw a chyfeiriad y person sy'n paratoi cofnodion yr eiddo yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' ar eich Ffurflen Dreth.

Os ydych chi a'ch priod yn byw gyda'ch gilydd, caiff unrhyw incwm a dderbyniwch ar y cyd o eiddo fel arfer ei drin fel petai'n eiddo i'r ddau ohonoch mewn cyfrannau cyfartal (hyd yn oed os ydych yn ei berchen mewn cyfrannau anghyfartal) felly caiff y ddau ohonoch eich trethu ar hanner yr incwm.

Fodd bynnag, os oes gennych hawl i'r incwm mewn cyfrannedd i'ch cyfran anghyfartal chi gallwch wneud dewis ar Ffurflen 17 'Declaration of beneficial interests in joint property and income' er mwyn cael eich trethu ar y sail wirioneddol.

Caiff partneriaid sifil a wnaeth gofrestru partneriaeth sifil ar neu ar ôl 5 Rhagfyr 2005 eu trin yr un fath â pharau priod.

English Content:
If you're employed as well as self-employed, the National Insurance Contributions and Employer Office may agree that some of your Class 4 National Insurance contributions (NICs) can be deferred until your overall contributions can be determined. If your application for deferment is agreed they'll send you a deferral certificate (form CA2703 Granted deferment of liability for Class 2 and Class 4 National Insurance contributions).

If you have already been given a 2016 to 2017 Class 4 NICs deferment certificate select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.

For more information see Defer your self-employed National Insurance.

If you want to apply for deferral contact HM Revenue and Customs.

English Content:
Enter the amount of losses brought forward from earlier years which are used in the year. You also only use losses brought forward to reduce gains to the annual exempt amount (when due) for the year. For the 2015 to 2016 tax year the annual exempt amount is:

  • £11,100 for individuals
  • £5,550 for most trustees

You need to tell us about your loss within 4 years of the end of the tax year you made the loss in. The latest date to claim 2014 to 2015 losses is 5 April 2019.

Clogged losses brought forward can only be set against gains of certain types.

The most common type of clogged loss is a loss on disposal to a connected person. These losses can only be set against gains on disposals to the same connected person. The other clogged loss is a loss transferred to you after 15 June 1999 by trustees when you become absolutely entitled to settled property. These losses can only be set, and in priority to any other losses, against gains arising on the same asset, or an asset derived from that asset.
Welsh Content:
Nodwch swm y colledion a ddygwyd ymlaen o flynyddoedd cynharach ac a ddefnyddiwyd yn y flwyddyn. Rydych hefyd ond yn defnyddio colledion a ddygir ymlaen i leihau enillion i'r swm blynyddol a eithrir (pan yn ddyledus) am y flwyddyn.

Y swm blynyddol a eithrir ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 yw:

  • £11,100 ar gyfer unigolion
  • £5,550 ar gyfer y rhan mwyaf o ymddiriedolwyr

Bydd yn rhaid i chi roi gwybod i ni am eich colled cyn pen 4 mlynedd o ddiwedd y flwyddyn dreth y gwneud y golled gennych. Y dyddiad olaf ar gyfer gwneud cais am golled 2014 i 2016 yw 5 Ebrill 2019

Gall colledion rhwystredig a ddygwyd ymlaen ond cael eu gosod yn erbyn enillion o fath penodol.

Y math mwyaf cyffredin o golledion rhwystredig yw colled sy'n codi wrth waredu ased i berson cysylltiol. Y golled rwystredig arall yw colled a drosglwyddir i chi ar ôl 15 Mehefin 1999 gan ymddiriedolwyr pan gewch hawl llwyr i eiddo setledig. Gellir gosod y colledion hyn, a hynny mewn blaenoriaeth i unrhyw golledion eraill, yn erbyn enillion sy'n codi o'r un ased, neu o ased a ddaw o'r ased hwnnw.

English Content:
You cannot use this calculator in all cases.

For example, it cannot be used where

  • the disposal is of an asset that qualifies both as a business and a non-business asset for taper relief purposes unless you have first apportioned any gain into the business and non-business parts
  • you have calculated the taper rate using the table at the end of Help Sheet 279
  • you have gains and you also have attributed to you gains where personal losses can be set off
  • you have a clogged loss which can be deducted from a 2008-09 gain.
  • certain anti-avoidance rules apply. These will be when:
    • you have entered into a transaction relating to an asset that you own, and the transaction limits your exposure to fluctuations in its value, or
    • you hold shares in a close company which changes its activities, or
    • you hold shares in a close company and, without disposing of them, enter into a transaction that affects their value.

Clogged losses can only be set against gains of certain types. The most common type of clogged loss is a loss on a disposal to a connected person. The other clogged loss is a loss transferred to you after 15 June 1999 by trustees when you become absolutely entitled to settled property.

For further guidance and information, please see the Capital Gains Summary Notes (PDF 127K).

Please note that this is a stand-alone calculator. The calculation will not be saved so you may wish to print a copy for your records.

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com
Welsh Content:
Ni allwch ddefnyddio'r gyfrifiannell hon ym mhob achos.

Er enghraifft, ni ellir ei defnyddio

  • pan rydych yn gwaredu ased sy'n gymwys fel ased busnes yn ogystal ag ased di-fusnes at ddibenion rhyddhad meinhau oni bai eich bod wedi dosrannu unrhyw ennill yn gyntaf i'r rhannau busnes a di-fusnes
  • pan rydych wedi cyfrifo'r gyfradd meinhau gan ddefnyddio'r tabl ar ddiwedd Taflen Gymorth 279
  • pan fo gennych enillion ac mae gennych enillion a briodolir i chi pan ellir gwrthbwyso colledion personol
  • Mae gennych golled rwystredig y gellir ei didynnu o ennill yn 2009-10.
  • pan fo rheolau gwrth arbed treth penodol yn berthnasol. Bydd y rhain yn bodoli:
    • pan fyddwch yn trfnu trafodyn mewn perthynas ag ased rydych yn ei berchen, ac mae'r trafodyn yn cyfyngu ar y perygl o amrywiad yn ei werth, neu
    • pan fydd gennych gyfranddaliadau mewn cwmni caeëdig sy'n newid ei weithgareddau, neu
    • pan fydd gennych gyfranddaliadau mewn cwmni caeëdig, a rydych yn trefnu trafodyn sy'n effeithio ar eu gwerth , heb eu gwaredu

Gellir gosod colledion rhwystredig yn erbyn rhai mathau penodol o enillion yn unig. Y math mwyaf cyffredin o golled rwystredig yw colled sy'n codi wrth waredu ased i berson cysylltiedig. Y golled rwystredig arall yw colled a drosglwyddir i chi ar ôl 15 Mehefin 1999 gan ymddiriedolwyr pan gewch hawl absoliwt i eiddo setledig.

Am arweiniad pellach a gwybodaeth gweler Nodiadau Crynhoi Enillion Cyfalaf (PDF 127K)

Sylwer mai cyfrifiannell arunig yw hon. Ni chaiff y cyfrifiad ei gadw felly efallai y byddwch am argraffu copi ar gyfer eich cofnodion.

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
You may still get some reduction if you had some foreign service but do not qualify for the full foreign service exemption.

To calculate this:

  • work out your total service in the job in months
  • work out the part of it that was foreign service, also in months
  • now take off £30,000 from the amount included in box D for your foreign service (do not alter box D itself)
  • multiply the result from the previous bullet by the number of foreign service months divided by the number of months in service overall

Please enter the result in box F.
Welsh Content:
Mae'n bosibl y cewch ostyngiad o hyd os oedd gennych rywfaint o wasanaeth tramor ond pan nad ydych yn gymwys am ryddhad gwasanaeth tramor llawn. I gyfrifo hwn:

  • cyfrifwch gyfanswm eich gwasanaeth yn y swydd mewn misoedd
  • cyfrifwch y rhan a oedd yn wasanaeth tramor, eto mewn misoedd
  • nawr didynnwch £30,000 o'r swm a gynhwyswyd ym mlwch D ar gyfer eich gwasanaeth tramor (peidiwch â newid blwch D ei hun)
  • lluoswch y canlyniad yn y bwled blaenorol gyda'r nifer misoedd y gwasanaeth tramor wedi ei rannu gyda nifer misoedd y gwasanaeth llawn.

Nodwch y canlyniad ym mlwch F.

  • a proportion of interest and other charges where borrowing is not used solely for the business

Welsh Content:
Nodwch gyfanswm y derbyniadau o'r holl gyfranddaliadau a gwarantau a restrwyd, cyn i unrhyw ryddhad, hawliadau neu ddewisiadau gael eu gwneud.

Mewn rhai amgylchiadau dylai'r swm a gewch gael ei ddisodli yn eich cyfrifiad gan werth marchnad yr ased a waredwyd gennych. Defnyddiwch y gwerth marchnad yn lle'r pris a gawsoch os gwnaethoch roi ased i ffwrdd, neu os gwerthwyd yr ased yn fwriadol gennych am lai na'i werth llawn, neu os gwaredwyd yr ased i berson cysylltiedig. Os ydych yn hawlio bod unrhyw gyfranddaliadau neu warantau a restrwyd bellach â'u gwerth yn ddibwys, dylech gynnwys y gydnabyddiaeth a bennwyd yn eich cais.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach, gweler Capital Gains Summary Notes (PDF).

Gellir dod o hyd i arweiniad ynglŷn ag ystyr 'gwerth marchnad' a 'derbyniadau gwaredu' ar dudalen CGN 174 a CGN 18. Mae ystyr 'cost caffael ar dudalen CGN 185 ac ystyr personau cysylltiedig' ar dudalen CGN 45.

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
If you're acting on behalf of someone else, select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.

These will be exceptional circumstances.

The law allows an executor to sign a tax return for the period from 6 April up to the date of the deceased's death.

The following people are authorised to complete a return on behalf of someone who is not mentally capable of understanding it:

  • a Receiver appointed by the Court of Protection (England and Wales)
  • a Curator Bonis appointed by the Office of the Accountant of Court (Scotland)
  • a Controller appointed by the Office of Care and Protection (Northern Ireland)
  • an Attorney appointed under an Enduring Power, registered in the appropriate court
  • any person so authorised by any of the above courts

If you haven't previously supplied evidence of your appointment you should attach documentation to this return.
Welsh Content:
Os ydych yn gweithredu ar ran rhywun arall yn rhinwedd eich swydd dewiswch 'Ydw' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Nac ydw'.

Bydd y rhain yn amgylchiadau eithriadol.

Mae'r gyfraith yn eich caniatáu ysgutor i lofnodi Ffurflen Dreth ar gyfer y cyfnod o 6 Ebrill hyd at ddyddiad marwolaeth yr ymadawedig.

Mae'r personau canlynol wedi eu hawdurdodi i gwblhau Ffurflen Dreth ar ran rywun nad oes ganddo'r/ganddi'r gallu meddyliol i'w ddeall:

  • Derbynnydd a benodir gan y Llys Nawdd (Cymru a Lloegr)
  • Curator bonis a benodir gan Swyddfa Cyfrifydd y Llys (Yr Alban)
  • Rheolwr a benodir gan y Swyddfa Gofal a Nawdd (Gogledd Iwerddon)
  • Atwrnai a benodir o dan Bŵer Parhaus, wedi'i gofrestru yn y llys priodol; neu
  • unrhyw berson a awdurdodir felly gan unrhyw un o'r llysoedd uchod.

Os na fyddwch wedi darparu tystiolaeth o'ch penodiad yn flaenorol, dylech amgáu'r dogfennau perthnasol gyda'r Ffurflen Dreth hon.

English Content: The date entered for 'Child 6 - end date' is not a valid date. Please amend.
Welsh Content: Nid yw'r dyddiad a nodwyd ar gyfer 'Plentyn 6 - dyddiad dod i ben' yn ddyddiad dilys. Dylech ei ddiwygio.

English Content: If you are not able to wait for a response, you can log out and return to the File a return service later, in order to confirm that HM Revenue & Customs has received your return.
Welsh Content: 'Os na allwch aros am ymateb, gallwch allgofnodi a dychwelyd i'r gwasanaeth Cyflwyno ffurflen dreth yn hwyrach, er mwyn cadarnhau bod Cyllid a Thollau EM wedi derbyn eich ffurflen dreth. Caiff eich ffurflen dreth ei chadw'n awtomatig. Os bydd angen help arnoch: Os bydd y broblem hon yn parhau ffoniwch y Ddesg Gymorth Gwasanaethau Ar-lein ar 0300 200 1900 o 8.00 tan 20.00, 7 diwrnod yr wythnos gan gynnwys gwyliau banc (rydym ar gau Dydd Nadolig, Gwyl San Steffan a Dydd Calan). Gwasanaeth Cymraeg ar 01792 452162 yn ystod oriau gwaith.

English Content:
Enter your business name. This could be your own name or it could be a trading business name.

You can enter up to 28 characters including spaces.

The name can only contain alpha, numeric and the following special characters: ' ( ) * , - . / & @ £. The enter (or return) key located on your keyboard is not accepted.

English Content:
A married couple or civil partners may share the minimum amount of the allowance. But you must have asked HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) already to do this (either before 5 April 2016 or, if you married or formed a civil partnership during the year to 5 April 2017, by that date).

If you want to change the way the allowance is given for 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 please contact your HMRC office (it is already too late to make any change for 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017).

Please select 'Yes - All' or 'Yes - Half' from the drop-down menu if you have already agreed that some of the minimum allowance is to be given to you otherwise, select 'No'.
Welsh Content:
Gall pâr priod neu bartneriaid sifil rannu isafswm y lwfans. Ond rhaid eich bod eisoes wedi gofyn i Gyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) wneud hyn (naill ai cyn 5 Ebrill 2016 neu, os gwnaethoch briodi neu ffurfio partneriaeth sifil yn ystod y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017, erbyn y dyddiad hwnnw) .

Os ydych am newid y ffordd y rhoddir lwfans ar gyfer 2017 i 2018 cysylltwch â'ch swyddfa CThEM (mae eisoes yn rhy hwyr i wneud unrhyw newid ar gyfer 2017 i 2017).

Dewiswch 'Iawn - I Gyd' neu 'Iawn - Hanner' o'r ddewislen os ydych wedi cytuno eisoes bod peth o isafswm y lwfans i fynd i'ch priod neu bartner sifil, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'.

English Content: The amount for 'Losses used against an earlier year's gain' + 'Losses used against income - amount claimed against 2016-17 income' + 'Losses used against income - amount claimed against 2014-15 income' must be less than or equal to 'Total losses of the year (enter '0' if there are none)'. Please amend.
Welsh Content: Rhaid i'r swm ar gyfer 'Colledion a ddefnyddiwyd yn erbyn enillion mewn blwyddyn gynharach' + 'Colledion a ddefnyddiwyd yn erbyn incwm - y swm a hawliwyd yn erbyn incwm 2016-17' + 'Colledion a ddefnyddiwyd yn erbyn incwm - y swm a hawliwyd yn erbyn incwm 2014-15' fod yn llai na, neu'n hafal i, 'Cyfanswm y colledion am y flwyddyn (nodwch '0' os nad oes rhai)'. Dylech ei ddiwygio.

English Content:
Select 'Yes' to put the calculated figure foreign tax credit relief on to your Tax Return.

If you would prefer to do your own calculation, select 'No, calculate foreign tax credit relief manually'. We'll provide a working sheet that you can print-off and fill in.

If you believe a different order may produce a better result, you can select 'No, re-calculate foreign tax credit relief'. We will still do the calculation but you can change the order in which foreign tax credit relief is calculated.
Welsh Content:
Dewiswch 'Ydw' er mwyn gosod y ffigur a gyfrifwyd ar gyfer rhyddhad credyd treth dramor ar eich Ffurflen Dreth.

Os yw'n well gennych baratoi eich cyfrifiad eich hun, dewiswch 'Nac ydw - cyfrifo'r rhyddhad credyd treth dramor â llaw. Byddwn yn darparu taflen waith y gallwch ei hargraffu a'i chwblhau.

Os credwch y gallai trefn wahanol roi gwell canlyniad, dewiswch 'Nac ydw - ailgyfrifo'r rhyddhad credyd treth dramor'. Byddwn yn dal i wneud y cyfrifiad ond gallwch newid y drefn y cyfrifir y rhyddhad credyd treth dramor.

English Content:
You can only set-off the loss displayed in 'Adjusted loss for the year' against total income if:

  • the loss is due to certain agricultural expenses and your property rental business includes land used for agricultural purpose
  • the loss arose as a result of claims to capital allowances (and your capital allowances exceed your balancing charges)

The loss that may be set-off is limited to the lowest of:

  • net capital allowances
  • adjusted loss for the year
  • the amount of your other income.

Enter the amount you wish to set-off together with the amount of any similar loss brought forward from last year.
Welsh Content:
Gallwch wrthbwyso'r golled a ddangoswyd yn 'Colled am y flwyddyn wedi'i haddasu' yn erbyn y cyfanswm incwm dim ond os yw'r golled wedi codi oherwydd rhai treuliau amaethyddol a bod eich busnes gosod yn cynnwys tir a ddefnyddiwyd at ddibenion amaethyddol, neu

  • os yw'r golled wedi codi oherwydd cais am lwfansau cyfalaf (ac mae eich lwfansau cyfalaf yn uwch na'ch taliadau mantoli).

Cyfyngir y golled y gellir ei gwrthbwyso i'r isaf o'r canlynol:

  • y lwfansau cyfalaf net, neu
  • y golled ar gyfer y fwyddyn wedi'i haddasu, neu
  • swm eich incwm arall

Nodwch swm rydych am ei wrthbwyso ynghyd â swm colled debyg a ddygwyd ymlaen o llynedd.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach gweler y Nodiadau ar Eiddo yn y DU (PDF 218K) a gweler Taflen Gymorth 251 - Agricultural land (PDF 53K) hefyd.

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

  • save the submission receipt after you have successfully submitted your return. The receipt is the proof of your submission.

  • yn cadw'r dderbynneb gyflwyno ar ôl i chi gyflwyno eich ffurflen dreth yn llwyddiannus. Y dderbynneb yw'r dystiolaeth eich bod wedi ei chyflwyno.

English Content:
Don't include questions in this box as we cannot answer specific questions about your tax return.

Please enter any additional information you feel is needed to support your entries.

You can enter a maximum of 700 characters, including spaces. You can only enter letters and numbers and the special characters '()*,-./£@&.

Please don't use the 'Enter' (or 'Return') key on the keyboard when entering information into, or moving away from, this field. Use the spacebar on the keyboard if you need to make more than one entry.

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 or 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HMRC know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.

Nodwch unrhyw wybodaeth ychwanegol rydych yn meddwl sydd ei hangen i ategu'r hyn rydych wedi'i nodi.

Gallwch nodi hyd at 700 nod, gan gynnwys bylchau Gallwch nodi llythrennau a rhifau a'r nodau arbennig '()*,-./£@& yn unig.

Peidiwch â defnyddio'r botwm 'Enter' (neu 'Return')ar y bysellfwrdd wrth nodi gwybodaeth yn y blwch hwn, neu wrth symud oddi yno. Defnyddiwch y bylchwr ar y bysellfwrdd os oes angen i chi wneud mwy nag un cofnod

English Content:
The following guidance only applies if you have a 'standard' 12 month accounting period and summarise the allowances available. If your accounting period is shorter or longer than a year, or began before 6 April 2016, or if you want to know more about capital allowances, please refer to Help Sheet 252 - Capital allowances and balancing charges (which includes worked examples), or contact HM Revenue and Customs, or your tax adviser.

If during the year, you dispose of (that is sell or give away) or stop using an item in your business for which you claimed capital allowances, there may be an adjustment called a balancing charge.

A balancing charge will arise if you had a property that qualified for Business Premises Renovation Allowance (BPRA) (further help for 'Business Premises Renovation Allowance') and within a period of 7 years from the date the property was used or made available for letting:

  • the premises are sold
  • a long lease is granted for a capital sum
  • the premises cease to be used for business activities
  • the premises are demolished or destroyed
  • the person who incurred the renovation costs dies
  • the proceeds from that disposal event exceed any balance of unrelieved expenditure

The amount of that charge will be the proceeds less any residue of that unrelieved expenditure (or just the proceeds if that residue is nil).The total amount of any BPRA balancing charge should also be included here.
Welsh Content:
Dim ond os oes gennych gyfnod cyfrifyddu 'safonol' o 12 mis ac eich bod yn crynhoi'r lwfansau sydd ar gael y bydd y cyngor canlynol yn gymwys. Os yw eich cyfnod cyfrifyddu yn fyrrach neu'n hirach, neu wedi dechrau cyn 6 Ebrill 2016, neu os ydych am wybod mwy am lwfansau cyfalaf, cyfeiriwch at Taflen Gymorth 252 - Capital Allowances and balancing charges in a rental business, neu cysylltwch â Cyllid a Thollau EM, neu'ch cynghorydd treth.

Os, yn ystod y flwyddyn, byddwch yn gwaredu ar (hynny yw gwerthu neu roi) neu'n peidio â defnyddio eitem yn eich busnes yr oeddech wedi hawlio lwfansau cyfalaf ar ei chyfer, gall fod addasiad o'r enw tâl mantoli.

Bydd tâl mantoli yn codi os oedd gennych eiddo yr oedd y Lwfans Adnewyddu Eiddo Busnes (BPRA) yn gymwys iddo (am gymorth ar 'Lwfans Adnewyddu Eiddo Busnes' ewch i www.gov.uk/guidance/bsiness-premises-renovation-allowance-bpra) ac o fewn cyfnod o 7 mlynedd o'r dyddiad y defnyddiwyd yr eiddo neu y darparwyd yr eiddo i'w osod ar rent:

  • gwerthir yr adeilad
  • caniateir prydles hir am swm cyfalaf
  • mae'r adeilad yn peidio â chael ei ddefnyddio ar gyfer gweithgareddau busnes
  • mae'r adeilad yn cael ei ddymchwel neu ei ddinistrio
  • mae'r person a aeth i gostau adnewyddu yn marw
  • mae'r enillion o'r gwarediad hwnnw yn fwy nag unrhyw weddill o wariant heb dderbyn rhyddhad

Swm yr hyn a godir bydd yr enillion llai unrhyw beth sy'n weddill o'r gwariant hwnnw heb dderbyn rhyddhad (neu'r enillion yn unig, os ydy'r gweddill yn 'ddim'). Dylid hefyd gynnwys yma cyfanswm unrhyw daliad mantoli ar gyfer BPRA.

English Content:
To claim for any employment expenses or capital allowances for equipment used in your employment, please make sure you select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.

You can only deduct the costs you had to pay out in doing your job.

This includes:

  • business travel and subsistence expenses – including Mileage Allowance Relief for using your own vehicle for work
  • fixed deductions for expenses
  • professional fees and subscriptions
  • other expenses and capital allowances

For further guidance and information please see the Notes on Employment.

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com.
Welsh Content:
Er mwyn gwneud cais ar gyfer unrhyw dreuliau cyflogaeth neu lwfansau cyfalaf ar gyfer cyfarpar a ddefnyddiwyd yn eich cyflogaeth, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'.

Gallwch ond didynnu'r costau yr oedd rhaid i chi dalu allan wrth wneud eich gwaith.

Mae hyn yn cynnwys:

  • treuliau teithio a chynhaliaeth busnes
  • didyniadau sefydlog ar gyfer treuliau
  • ffioedd a thanysgrifiadau proffesiynol
  • treuliau a lwfansau cyfalaf eraill

  • losses on sales of assets (minus any profits on sales)

  • colledion ar werthiannau asedion (llai unrhyw elw ar werthiannau)

English Content:
You can claim 18% Writing Down Allowance (WDA) for your main pool costs. Don't include 'special rate' expenditure, this needs to be entered in 'Capital allowances at lower rate on equipment, including cars with lower CO2 emissions'. If during the year you've spent more than the maximum Annual Investment Allowance (AIA) on equipment, or bought a car with CO2 emissions of 130g/km or less in the same period, add up your total main pool costs.

For cars purchased between 6 April 2009 and 5 April 2013, the CO2 emissions threshold was 160g/km.

Deduct:

  • any AIA up to your maximum entitlement (not cars) the amount you entered 'Annual Investment Allowance' field
  • equipment that qualifies for 100% First Year Allowances
  • the cost of items that go into a 'single asset pool' such as assets partly used for non-business purposes

Add this total to the balance of any main pool costs carried forward from the previous year, then deduct any payments (up to the original costs) received during the year from the sale of main pool equipment.

For more information about Capital allowances and balancing charges see Helpsheet 252 - Capital allowances and balancing charges.
Welsh Content:
Gallwch hawlio Lwfans Ar Bapur sy'n 18% ar gyfer costau eich prif gronfa. Peidiwch â chynnwys gwariant 'cyfradd arbennig', mae'n rhaid i hwnnw gael ei roi yn 'Lwfansau cyfalaf ar gyfradd is ar offer, gan gynnwys ceir ag allyriadau CO2 is'. Os, yn ystod y flwyddyn, eich bod wedi gwario mwy nag uchafswm y Lwfans Buddsoddi Blynyddol (LBB) ar offer, neu wedi prynu car ag allyriadau CO2 sy'n 130g/km neu'n llai yn yr un cyfnod, adiwch ynghyd gyfanswm costau eich prif gronfa.

Ar gyfer ceir a brynwyd rhwng 6 Ebrill 2009 a 5 Ebrill 2013, 160g/km oedd y trothwy allyriadau CO2.

Didynnwch:

  • LBB hyd at uchafswm eich hawl (dim ceir) rydych yn ei gynnwys yn y blwch 'Lwfans Buddsoddi Blynyddol',
  • offer sy'n gymwys ar gyfer Lwfansau Blwyddyn Gyntaf o 100%,
  • costau eitemau sy'n mynd i mewn i gronfa ar wahân

Ychwanegwch i'r cyfanswm hwn weddill costau'r prif gronfa a ddygwyd ymlaen o'r flwyddyn flaenorol, wedyn didynnwch daliadau (hyd at y costau gwreiddiol) a dderbyniwyd yn ystod y flwyddyn o werthu offer y prif gronfa.

Mae rhagor o wybodaeth ynhylch Lwfansau cyfalaf a costau mantoli i'w chael yn Nhaflen Gymorth 252 - Capital allowances and balancing charges

English Content:
Redundancy and other lump sum and compensation payments

If all you have is a redundancy payment up to £30,000 against which your employer has allowed an exemption, please just enter the amount of the payment in the 'Compensation and lump sum £30,000 exception' field.
For example, if you received a redundancy payment of £10,000 it would be covered by the £30,000 exemption so do not make an entry in the 'Redundancy and other lump sum and compensation payments' field and enter £10,000 in the 'Compensation and lump sum £30,000 exception' field.
If your redundancy payment is more than the £30,000 exemption limit, enter the amount over the limit in the 'Redundancy and other lump sum and compensation payments' field, the tax deducted in the 'Tax taken off boxes above' field and the £30,000 limit in the 'Compensation and lump sum £30,000 exception' field.
Welsh Content:
Diswyddo a chyfandaliadau ac iawndal eraill

Os mai'r unig beth sydd gennych yw taliad diswyddo o hyd at £30,000 (ac y mae eich cyflogwr wedi caniatáu eithriad yn ei erbyn), rhowch swm y taliad yn y blwch 'Eithriad o £30,000 ar gyfer iawndal a chyfandaliadau'.
Er enghraifft, os ydych yn derbyn taliad diswyddo o £10,000, byddai'n cael ei gwmpasu gan yr eithriad o £30,000 - felly, peidiwch â rhoi cofnod yn y blwch 'Tâl diswyddo a chyfandaliadau ac iawndaliadau eraill', a rhowch £10,000 yn y blwch 'Eithriad o £30,000 ar gyfer iawndal a chyfandaliadau'.

Os yw eich tâl diswyddo yn fwy na'r terfyn eithriad o £30,000, rhowch y swm sydd dros y terfyn yn y blwch 'Tâl diswyddo a chyfandaliadau ac iawndaliadau eraill', y dreth a ddidynnwyd yn y blwch 'Treth a ddidynnwyd o'r blychau uchod' a'r terfyn o £30,000 yn y blwch 'Eithriad o £30,000 ar gyfer iawndal a chyfandaliadau'

English Content:
Allowable expenses are those which:

  • had to be spent solely to earn the income
  • weren't spent for private or personal reasons
  • weren't spent on capital items, such as a computer

If the expenses exceed the income the result is a loss, which can be carried forward to a subsequent year. Some losses may be set against other types of income you may have included in 'Other taxable income (before tax and expenses taken off)'

For more information about setting off these losses, follow link Help Sheet 325 - Other taxable income explains the rules about setting off these losses.

  • nas gwariwyd am resymau preifat neu bersonol
  • nas gwariwyd ar eitemau cyfalaf fel cyfrifiadur.

Os ydy'r treuliau yn fwy na'r incwm y canlyniad yw colled, y gellir ei chario ymlaen i flwyddyn ddilynol. Gellir gosod rhai colledion yn erbyn mathau eraill o incwm y gallech fod wedi eu cynnwys yn 'Incwm trethadwy arall (cyn didynnu treth a threuliau eraill)'.

English Content:
Your employer must give you a record of your pay and tax. If you were working on 5 April 2017 you'll get an End of Year Certificate called a P60 by 31 May 2017. If you left an employment during the year you'll have been given a leaving certificate called a P45 Part 1A.

Enter the pay figure from the 'In this employment' box on your P60 or the figure from the 'total pay in this employment' box on your P45 for each employment you had. If you had more than one job in the tax year your P60 may include the pay and tax details of an earlier employment. You must include each employment on a separate 'Employment' page. The figure entered here is the pay figure after any contributions to your employer's pension scheme (sometimes described as superannuation). Take care when copying this figure from your P60.

You should deduct the following  payments (before tax is taken off) from the  P60 or P45 figure as these should be included in the 'Other UK Income' section of your return:

  • lump sums
  • benefits paid
  • termination of employment
  • retirement or death
  • payments or benefits from a former employer
  • paid for agreeing to restrict your activities

If your employer has reported the amount of a benefit from your employment on your form P11D and taxed that amount through your payroll, you should deduct that amount (before tax is taken off) from the P60 or P45 figure. You should enter the amount you've deducted from the P60 or P45 figure in the required fields as appropriate. Refer to any specific advice issued by your employer if you are unsure what figures to enter.

Where the P60 or P45 figure includes any amount in respect of income (including lump sums) covered by the third party arrangements or 'disguised remuneration' rules, include this amount (before tax is taken off) in the figure that you enter in the required field.

If you received Jobseeker's Allowance in the year to 5 April 2017 it may be included on your P60 or it may be on a P45 Part 1A - it should be included in the 'income' section of the return.  Further information about entering the correct pay details in this field can be found in the SA102 Employment notes.
Welsh Content:
Rhaid i'ch cyflogwr roi cofnod o'ch cyflog a threth i chi. Os oeddech yn gweithio ar 5 Ebrill 2016 byddwch yn derbyn Tystysgrif Diwedd Blwyddyn o’r enw P60, erbyn 31 Mai 2016. Os gadawoch gyflogaeth yn ystod y flwyddyn byddwch wedi derbyn tystysgrif gadael o'r enw P45 Rhan 1A.

Nodwch yn y blwch hwn naill ai ffigur y cyflog o'r blwch 'Yn y gyflogaeth hon' ar eich P60 neu'r ffigur o'r blwch 'Cyfanswm cyflog yn y gyflogaeth hon’ ar eich P45 ar gyfer pob cyflogaeth a fu gennych. Os oedd gennych fwy nag un swydd yn y flwyddyn dreth gall fod eich P60 yn cynnwys manylion cyflog a threth cyflogaeth flaenorol. Rhaid i chi gynnwys pob cyflogaeth ar dudalen 'Cyflogaeth' ar wahân. Y ffigur i'w nodi yma yw'r ffigur cyflog ar ôl unrhyw gyfraniadau i gynllun pensiwn eich cyflogwr (weithiau'n cael ei alw'n flwydd-dal). Cymrwch ofal wrth gopïo'r ffigur hwn oddi ar eich P60.

Dylech ddidynnu'r taliadau canlynol (cyn bod treth yn cael ei didynnu) o'r ffigur P60 neu P45 am y dylid cynnwys y rhain yn yr adran 'Incwm Arall y DU' ar eich ffurflen dreth:

  • cyfandaliadau
  • buddiannau a dalwyd
  • terfyniad cyflogaeth
  • ymddeoliad neu farwolaeth
  • taliadau neu fuddiannau gan gyn cyflogwr
  • taliadau am gytuno i gyfyngu ar eich gweithgareddau

Os yw eich cyflogwr wedi nodi swm buddiant o'ch cyflogaeth ar eich P11D ac wedi trethu'r swm hwnnw drwy eich cyflogres, dylech ddidynnu'r swm (cyn didynnu treth) a nodwyd ar eich P11D o'r ffigur ar y P60 neu'r P45. Dylech nodi'r swm a ddidynnwyd gennych o'r ffigur ar y P60 neu'r P45 yn y blychau angenrheidiol, fel y bo'n briodol. Dylech gyfeirio at unrhyw gyngor penodol a roddwyd i chi gan eich cyflogwr os ydych yn ansicr ynghylch pa ffigurau i'w nodi.

Pan fo'r ffigur P60 neu P45 yn cynnwys unrhyw swm mewn perthynas ag incwm (gan gynnwys cyfandaliadau) sy'n dod o dan drefniadau'r trydydd parti neu reolau 'cydnabyddiaeth gudd', cynhwyswch y swm hwn (cyn y didynnir treth) yn y ffigur a nodwch yn y blwch gofynnol.

Os derbynioch Lwfans Ceisio Gwaith yn y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2016, efallai ei fod wedi'i gynnwys ar eich P60 neu gallai fod ar P45 Rhan 1A - dylid ei gynnwys yn yr adran 'incwm' o'r ffurflen dreth. Am ragor o wybodaeth ynghylch nodi'r manylion cyflog cywir yn y blwch isod dilynwch y cysylltiad Nodiadau cyflogaeth

English Content:
If losses are deducted from your chargeable gains, choose 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, choose 'No'.

If you have allowable capital losses for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 these are usually deducted from your total allowable gains. Allowable losses brought forward are then deducted (ie 'used') but only to the extent necessary to reduce your gains, to £11,100 ('annual exempt amount').

For more information see the Capital gains summary notes

Os oes gennych golledion cyfalaf a ganiateir yn 2016 i 2017, fel arfer cânt eu didynnu o gyfanswm eich enillion caniataol. Wedyn didynnir (h.y. 'defnyddir') y colledion caniataol a ddygir ymlaen ond dim ond i'r graddau sy'n angenrheidiol i ostwng eich colledion i £11,100 ('swm blynyddol a eithrir').

Am wybodaeth bellach, dilynwch y cysylltiad Nodiadau Crynodeb o enillion cyfalaf.

English Content:
You may need to make an entry if you've disposed of an interest in an offshore fund. The rules relating to this can be quite complex; HM Revenue and Customs has published guidance in its Offshore Funds Manual and Savings and Investments Manual or alternatively you should ask your tax adviser. The following is only a general overview.

The term 'offshore fund' is defined in UK tax legislation; broadly such a fund is an investment scheme of which the trustees or operators are not resident in the UK (for example, unit trusts operated under Jersey laws and Belgian SICAVs are offshore funds). Other than 'open ended' investment companies, non-resident companies generally aren't offshore funds but you should check this with the fund manager or your tax adviser.

In certain circumstances, gains on disposals of holdings in offshore funds are taxable as income instead of being taxed as capital gains. If that is the case, you should enter the amount of the gain in this field. If not, give details of the disposal and the gain or loss in the Capital gains summary section.

Any income you receive from the offshore fund including 'reported income' should be returned by selecting the appropriate type of income in the 'Foreign income details' section.

Discretionary income payment from non-resident trust

If you've received an income payment from a non-resident trust, Help Sheet 262 - Income and benefits from transfer of assets abroad and Income from non-resident trusts has more details on how to complete this section
Welsh Content:
Efallai y bydd angen i chi gofnodi manylion os ydych wedi gwaredu buddiant mewn cronfa alltraeth. Mae'r rheolau sy'n berthnasol i hyn yn gallu bod yn eithaf cymhleth. Mae CThEM wedi cyhoeddi arweiniad yn ei llawlyfr Offshore Funds and Savings & Investments Manual, sydd ar gael yn http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/thelibrary/manuals-a-z.htm. Fel arall, dylech ofyn i'ch ymgynghorydd treth. Arolwg cyffredinol yn unig yw'r canlynol.

Mae'r term 'cronfa alltraeth' wedi'i ddiffinio o fewn deddfwriaeth treth y DU. Yn fras, cynllun buddsoddi yw cronfa o'r fath pan nad yw'r ymddiriedolwyr neu'r gweithredwyr yn byw yn y DU (er enghraifft, mae ymddiriedolaethau unedol a weithredir o dan gyfraith Jersey a SICAVs Gwlad Belg yn gronfeydd alltraeth). Ar wahân i gwmnïoedd buddsoddi 'penagored', nid yw cwmnïoedd dibreswyl yn gronfeydd alltraeth yn gyffredinol, ond dylech wirio hyn gyda rheolwr y gronfa neu eich ymgynghorydd treth.

Mewn rhai amgylchiadau, mae enillion o waredu daliadau mewn cronfeydd alltraeth yn drethadwy fel incwm yn hytrach na chael eu trethi fel enillion cyfalaf. Os yw hynny'n wir, dylech gofnodi swm yr enillion yn y blwch hwn. Os nad yw hynny'n wir, rhowch fanylion y gwaredu, yn ogystal â'r enillion neu'r golled yn yr adran 'Crynhoi Enillion Cyfalaf'.

Dylid dychwelyd unrhyw incwm yr ydych yn ei gael o'r gronfa alltraeth, gan gynnwys 'incwm y rhoddwyd gwybod amdano' drwy ddewis y math priodol o incwm yn yr adran 'Manylion incwm dramor'.

Taliad incwm dewisiadol o ymddiriedolaeth ddibreswyl

Os ydych wedi cael taliad incwm o ymddiriedolaeth ddibreswyl, mae rhagor o fanylion ar sut i lenwi'r adran hon yn Nhaflen Gymorth 262 - Income and benefits from transfer of assets abroad and Income from non-resident trusts.

English Content:
Important note

Only select 'Yes' to question 'Are you exempt from paying Class 4 NICs?' if

  • on 6 April xxxx you were at or over State Pension age
  • you were under 16
  • you were not resident in the UK for tax purposes during 20xx-xx
  • you are a trustee, executor or administrator - but only in some cases
  • you are a diver or diving supervisor - but only in some cases

You can get more information at NIM24500

English Content:
Personal expenses aren't allowable as a deduction so if you have previously included any amounts that were not wholly for the property rental business, enter the private proportion here.

For example, if you let a property for only 8 months in a year and you use it yourself for the other 4 months, you could put the full annual cost of insuring the property in 'Rent, rates, insurance, ground rents'. If you do, you should include the 4 months cost here.

Er enghraifft, os ydych yn gosod eiddo am ddim ond 8 mis mewn blwyddyn ac yn ei ddefnyddio eich hun am y 4 mis arall gallech roi'r gost flynyddol lawn o yswirio'r eiddo yn 'Rhent, trethi, yswiriant, rhenti tir'. Os gwnewch hynny, dylech gynnwys y gost am y pedwar mis.

English Content:
If you've been given a 2016 to 2017 Class 4 National Insurance contributions (NICs) deferment certificate, select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.

If you're employed as well as self-employed, the National Insurance Contributions and Employer Office may agree that some of your Class 4 NICs can be deferred until your overall contribution can be determined.

If your application for deferment is agreed, they will send you a certificate of deferment (form CA2703 - Granted deferment of liability for Class 2 and Class 4 National Insurance contributions).

If you want to apply for deferral please contact HM Revenue and Customs. For more information follow the link Defer your self-employed National Insurance.
Welsh Content:
Os ydych wedi derbyn tystysgrif gohirio cyfraniadau Yswiriant Gwladol Dosbarth 4 ar gyfer 2016 i 2017, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'.
Os ydych yn gyflogedig yn ogystal â hunangyflogedig, gall y Swyddfa Cyfraniadau Yswiriant Gwladol gytuno y gellir gohirio ychydig o'ch CYG Dosbarth 4 tan y gellir pennu cyfanswm cyflawn eich cyfraniadau. Os cytunir ar eich cais am ohiriad byddant yn anfon tystysgrif gohirio (ffurflen CA2703 Caniatâd i ohirio talu cyfraniadau Yswiriant Gwladol Dosbarth 2 a Dosbarth 4) atoch. Os ydych am wneud cais i ohirio cysylltwch â Chyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM). Am ragor o wybodaeth dilynwch y cysylltiad Gohiriwch eich Yswiriant Gwladol hunangyflogedig.

English Content:
If your chargeable gains before deducting losses total more than £11,100, choose 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, choose 'No'.

You must fill in the capital gains pages and attach your computations if in the tax year losses are deducted from your chargeable gains and your total chargeable gains before deducting losses are more than £11,100.

In working out your total chargeable gains include any gains attributed to you (for example, because you're a settlor or beneficiary of a non-UK Trust, or in certain cases where you're a member of a non-UK resident company) and any gains of earlier years becoming taxable in this tax year.

For further guidance and information, please see the Capital gains summary notes.
Welsh Content:
Os ydy eich enillion cyfalaf cyn didynnu colledion yn fwy na £11,000, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'

Rhaid i chi gwblhau'r tudalennau enillion cyfalaf ac atodi eich cyfrifiannau os, yn y flwyddyn dreth, didynnir colledion o'ch enillion cyfalaf ac mae cyfanswm eich enillion trethadwy cyn didynnu colledion yn fwy na £11,000.

Wrth gyfrifo cyfanswm yr enillion trethadwy gan gynnwys unrhyw enillion a briodolir i chi (er enghraifft, oherwydd eich bod yn setlwr neu'n fuddiolwr Ymddiriedolaeth nad yw wedi ei sefydlu yn y DU, neu mewn rhai achosion lle rydych yn aelod o gwmni dibreswyl) ac mae unrhyw enillion yn dod yn drethadwy yn y flwyddyn dreth hon.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach gweler Nodiadau Crynodeb o enillion cyfalaf

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
The information to complete this field can be found on your P11D form, provided by your employer.

The figure you enter should include any goods or services bought with a company credit card or token for you and your family or household.

For vouchers and credit cards use the figure in section C box 12.

For excess mileage allowance use the figure in section E box 12.

The total is made of:

  • the cost to you of providing any vouchers (including season tickets) which can be exchanged for money, goods or services
  • any extra cost to you in providing the money, goods or services for which the vouchers are exchanged
  • all expenses and other payments met by credit cards you provided

except

    • expenses directly in connection with the car(s) on your P11D at section F
    • expenses on your P11D more appropriate to section N

Don't include any vouchers, such as cash vouchers, which have suffered tax under PAYE.
Welsh Content:
Mae'r wybodaeth i lenwi'r blwch hwn i'w chael ar eich ffurflen P11D, a roddir i chi gan eich cyflogwr.

Dylai'r ffigur rydych yn ei nodi gynnwys unrhyw nwyddau neu wasanaethau a brynwyd gyda cherdyn credyd neu daleb cwmni ar eich cyfer chi neu eich teulu neu eich tŷ.

Ar gyfer talebau a chardiau credyd defnyddiwch y ffigur yn adran C, blwch 12.

Ar gyfer milltiroedd gormodol defnyddiwch y ffigur yn adran E blwch 12.

Mae'r cyfanswm yn cynnwys y canlynol:

  • y gost i chi o roi unrhyw dalebau (yn cynnwys tocynnau tymor) a ellir eu cyfnewid am arian, nwyddau neu wasanaethau
  • unrhyw gost ychwanegol i chi o ddarparu'r arian, nwyddau neu wasanaethau y cyfnewidiwyd y talebau ar eu cyfer
  • yr holl dreuliau a thaliadau eraill a dalwyd gan gardiau credyd a gyflenwyd gennych,
  • ar wahân i
    • treuliau sy'n gysylltiedig yn uniongyrchol â'r car/ceir ar eich P11D yn adran F
    • treuliau ar eich P11D sy'n fwy addas i adran N

Peidiwch â chynnwys unrhyw dalebau, megis talebau arian, sydd wedi denu treth o dan TWE.

Note: Selecting the File name will prompt your browser to download the attachment from HM Revenue & Customs. Depending on the size of the attachment and your internet connection speed, this could take a considerable amount of time.

English Content: If you receive a loan or advance from a close company as a participator, and the company releases or writes off the loan or advance, we treat it as your income. Boxes 12 and 13 qualify for the dividend allowance, you don't pay tax on the first £5,000 of dividends received.
Welsh Content:
Mae dosbarthiad anghymwysol yn cynnwys:

  • dyroddiad bonws gwarantau neu gyfranddaliadau y gellir eu hadbrynu (oni bai fod y dyroddiad wedi achosi dosbarthiad cymhwysol a fyddai wedi ei gynnwys yn y blychau difidend ar eich Ffurflen Dreth)
  • pan fydd cwmni yn derbyn dyroddiad bonws o'r fath ac yn ei 'dalu ymlaen' i rywun arall.

Swm y dosbarthiad i'w nodi yw

  • yn achos dyroddiad bonws gwarantau, swm y prifswm a warantwyd plws unrhyw bremiwm sy'n daladwy pan gaiff ei adbrynu
  • y gwerth nominal y cyfranddaliadau adbrynu plws unrhyw bremiwm sy'n daladwy pan gaiff ei adbrynu llai unrhyw gydnabyddiaeth newydd a roddir am y dyroddiad bonws hwnnw

Benthyciadau gan gwmnïau caeëdig a gawsant eu dileu neu eu rhyddhau

Pan fydd benthyciad neu flaenswm a roddir gan gwmni caeëdig i gyfranogwr neu aelod cysylltiad, yn cael ei ryddhau yn gyfan gwbl neu'n rhannol neu'n cael ei ddileu, bydd y swm a ryddheir neu a ddilëir ynghyd â swm o dreth a chaiff ei thrin fel petai wedi ei thalu yn cael ei drin fel rhan o'ch incwm. Os talwch dreth ar y gyfradd uwch, bydd yn rhaid i chi dalu mwy o dreth ar yr incwm hwn. Lluoswch y swm a gafodd ei ddileu neu ei rhyddhau gydag un nawfed, ychwanegwch y ffigur hwnnw at y swm a gafodd ei ryddhau neu ei ddileu a nodwch y cyfanswm.

Ar sail yr hyn a gofnodwyd gennych dyma gyfanswm yr holl gostau caniataol. Fel arfer bydd y costau caniataol yn cynnwys cost prynu'r ased, unrhyw fân gostau caffael ac unrhyw fân gostau gwaredu.

Y ffigur a ddangosir yma yw cyfanswm y derbyniadau gwaredu a gynhwyswyd yn y taflenni gwaith ar gyfer cyfrifo enillion cyfalaf a gwblhawyd gennych ar gyfer cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau a restrwyd yn ogystal â derbyniadau gwaredu gwarediadau o'r fath a nodwyd gennych ar wahân.

English Content:
Certain large payments (usually in cash and excluding pensions) or benefits from your employer or former employer may occur:

  • in connection with the termination of your job (whether agreed or paid before, on or after the termination)
  • when your terms of employment change
  • when you receive payments or other consideration for a restrictive covenant
  • in anticipation of retirement or on or after retirement or death - if made from an Employer Financed Retirement Benefits Scheme (EFRBS) (that is, a scheme providing benefits which include retirement and death benefits; it is usually set up by your employer but not registered by us)

For further guidance and information, if the payment was less straightforward, see the notes and Working Sheet in the Additional information notes.
Welsh Content:
Gallai rhai taliadau mawr (fel arfer ar ffurf arian parod ac eithio pensiynau) neu fuddiannau gan eich cyflogwr neu eich cyn gyflogwr godi:

  • mewn cysylltiad â therfyniad eich swydd (p'un y cytunwyd neu y talwyd cyn, ar, neu ar ôl y terfyniad)
  • ar ôl i'ch swydd ddod i ben ond cytunwyd ar y swm pan ddaeth y swydd i ben
  • pan fydd telerau eich cyflogaeth yn newid
  • pan fyddwch yn derbyn taliadau neu gydnabyddiaeth am gyfamod cyfyngu
  • wrth rhag weld y byddwch yn ymddeol neu ar ôl ymddeol neu farwolaeth - os talwyd gan Gynllun Buddiannau Ymddeol a Ariannir gan Gyflogwr (EFRBS) (hynny yw, cynllun sy'n darparu buddiannau sy'n cynnwys buddiannau ymddeol a marwolaeth; fel arfer caiff ei sefydlu gan eich cyflogwr ond fel arfer ni chaiff ei gofrestru gan CThEM)

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach, os oedd y taliad yn fwy cymhleth, gweler y nodiadau a'r Daflen Waith yn y Nodiadau gwybodaeth ychwanegol.

English Content: The taxable amount has automatically been calculated for you. If you are claiming foreign tax credit relief the figure is the same as the figure in the 'Amount of income arising or received before any tax taken off' field. If you are not claiming foreign tax credit relief the figure is the amount in the 'Amount of income arising or received before any tax taken off' field minus any amount in 'Foreign tax taken off or paid'.
Welsh Content: Cyfrifwyd y swm trethadwy yn awtomatig ar eich rhan. Os ydych yn hawlio rhyddhad credyd treth dramor bydd y ffigur yr un peth â'r ffigur yn y blwch 'Swm yr incwm sy'n codi neu a dderbyniwyd cyn didynnu unrhyw dreth'. Os nad ydych yn hawlio rhyddhad credyd treth dramor y ffigur yw'r swm yn y blwch 'Swm yr incwm sy'n codi neu a dderbyniwyd cyn didynnu unrhyw dreth' llai unrhyw swm yn 'Treth dramor a ddidynnwyd neu a dalwyd'.
