You can carry your loss forward to set against any future profits from the business. If you had any losses from earlier years that you’ve not already used up, include these in this field.

The time limit for claiming is 5 April 2020.

English Content: Please enter the dividend/distribution as shown on your dividend voucher. If you have accumulation units or shares the dividend is automatically re-invested but you must still include the dividend in this field. Don't include any amount shown as 'equalisation'; it is a repayment of capital (and should be deducted from the cost of the units or shares when calculating capital gains).

Peidiwch â chynnwys unrhyw swm a nodir o dan 'equalisation'; mae hwn yn ad-daliad o'r cyfalaf (a dylid ei ddidynnu o gost yr unedau neu'r cyfranddaliadau wrth gyfrifo'r enillion cyfalaf).

English Content:
If your 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 tax code was reduced during the year because of a change in circumstances, you may not have paid enough tax.

Look at your 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 PAYE Coding Notice. If it includes the message 'our estimate of the underpayment for the earlier part of the year is £xxxxx' then this amount is automatically shown on your return.

If this section does not apply to you and there is a zero present, select 'Yes', only select 'no' if the amount shown above is not correct to proceed.
Welsh Content:
Os ostyngwyd eich cod treth ar gyfer 2016 i 2017 yn ystod y flwyddyn oherwydd newid mewn amgylchiadau, efallai nad oeddech wedi talu digon o dreth. Edrychwch ar eich Hysbysiad Cod TWE 2016 i 2017. Os yw'n cynnwys y neges 'ein hamcangyfrif o'r dandaliad ar gyfer rhan gynharach y flwyddyn yw £xxxx' yna dangosir y swm ar eich ffurflen yn awtomatig.

Nodwch '0' os nad oes cofnod wedi ei gynnwys.

English Content:
You can claim capital allowances for the costs of, and improvements to, equipment and machinery (such as vehicles, tools, computers, business furniture) even if the item was purchased under hire purchase or an alternative finance arrangement (include the interest and other finance charges in the 'Interest on bank & other loans' field on the Total expenses page). Do not claim for things that you buy and sell as part of your trade - these should be claimed as business expenses.

Each year you can claim 25% of the cost or value of your equipment and machinery as an annual allowance. Add your equipment etc together and make a 'main pool' of cost or value (refer to the guidance about cars and items with any private use). The value of the pool goes down at the end of the year by the 25% you have claimed in this field. If your period of accounts is less than 12 months, the annual allowance has to be reduced proportionately. For example, if your accounts are for 6 months, the annual allowance will be 6 or 12 multiplied by 25%. Your starting point the following year is that reduced main pool value figure and you can claim 25% of that.

For further guidance and information please see the Notes on Self-employment (Full) (PDF 118K)

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com
Welsh Content:
Gallwch hawlio lwfansau cyfalaf ar gyfer costau caffael a gwella cyfarpar a pheiriannau (fel cerbydau, offer, cyfrifiaduron, dodrefn busnes) hyd yn oed os prynwyd yr eitem o dan delerau hurbwrcasu neu drefniant ariannu amgen (dylech gynnwys y llog a thaliadau ariannu amgen yn y blwch ar gyfer 'Llog ar fenthyciadau'r banc a benthyciadau eraill' ar y sgrîn ar gyfer Cyfanswm y treuliau). Peidiwch â gwneud cais am eitemau y byddwch yn eu prynu a'u gwerthu fel rhan o'ch masnach - dylai'r rhain gael eu cynnwys fel treuliau'r busnes.

Gallwch hawlio 25% o'r gost neu werth eich cyfarpar a'ch peiriannau bob blwyddyn fel lwfans blynyddol. Adiwch eich cyfarpar ac ati at ei gilydd i greu 'prif gronfa' o gostau neu werth (gweler yr arwiniad ynglŷn â cheir ac eitemau sydd â defnydd preifat). Mae gwerth y gronfa yn gostwng gan 25y cant sef yr hyn a hawlir gennych yn y blwch hwn. Os ydy cyfnod eich cyfrifon yn llai na 12 mis, rhaid gostwng yn gyfatebol y lwfans blynyddol. Er enghraifft, os ydy'ch cyfrifon ar gyfer 6 mis, bydd y lwfans blynyddol yn chwech neu ddeuddeg wedi eu lluosi gyda 25y cant. Eich man cychwyn yn y flwyddyn ddilynol yw'r ffigur gostyngol hwnnw yn y brif gronfa a byddwch yn hawlio 25 y cant ohono.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach gweler y Nodiadau ar Hunanasesiad (Llawn)

I edrych ar y nodiadau arweiniad Cymorth bydd angen i chi ddefnyddio rhaglen gweld ffeil PDF fel Adobe Reader neu Acrobat Exchange gan Adobe Systems Incorporated. Os nad oes gennych feddalwedd ar gyfer gweld PDF, gallwch ei gael o'u gwefan yn www.adobe.com.

English Content:
If your property rental business income includes premiums paid for the grant of a lease and other lump sum payments etc given in connection with the right to possession of a property, these payments are taxable on a special basis.

Broadly for leases over 50 years HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) treat the entire premium as a capital receipt and therefore not part of your business income. Don't include this here.

For leases up to 50 years HMRC treats the premium as partly capital and partly income; only the income is included here.

If you have assigned a lease without requiring payment there may still be a premium charge. Please contact your tax office if you're not sure if this affects you.
Welsh Content:
Os yw incwm eich busnes gosod eiddo yn cynnwys premiymau a delir am ganiatáu prydles a chyfandaliadau eraill etc y'u rhoddir mewn cysylltiad â'r hawl i feddiannu eiddo, mae'r taliadau hyn yn drethadwy ar sail arbennig.

Yn fras, ar gyfer prydlesi dros 50 mlynedd mae Cyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) yn trin y premiwm cyfan fel derbyniad cyfalaf ac felly ddim yn rhan o'ch incwm busnes. Peidiwch â chynnwys hwn yn y fan hon.

Ar gyfer prydlesi hyd at 50 mlynedd mae CThEM yn trin y premiwm fel bod yn rhannol yn gyfalaf a'n rhannol yn incwm; yr incwm sydd yn cael ei gynnwys yma yn unig.

Os ydych wedi neilltuo prydles heb fod angen taliad mae'n bosib fod tâl premiwm o hyd. Cysylltwch â'ch swyddfa CThEM os nad ydych yn siŵr os yw hyn yn eich effeithio arnoch chi.

English Content:
To continue working with a return you have already started, please select the appropriate client.

This client list shown below only includes your 'unauthorised' clients. You can only prepare returns but not submit until authorisation is in place.

To work with an authorised client, go to your authorised client list.

Mae'r rhestr cleientiaid hon a welir isod yn cynnwys eich cleientiaid 'nas awdurdodwyd'. Gallwch baratoi ffurflenni treth yn unig ond ni allwch eu cyflwyno tan i chi gael eich awdurdodi.

I weithio ar gleient a awdurdodwyd, ewch i'ch rhestr o gleientiaid a awdurdodwyd. I weithio ar gleient a awdurdodwyd, ewch i'ch rhestr o gleientiaid a awdurdodwyd

English Content:
Select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu if you are claiming foreign tax credit relief for this income (it is usually to your benefit) otherwise, select 'No'.

For further guidance and information, please see the Foreign Notes (PDF 128K).

For further information see Help Sheet 262 - Income and benefits from transfer of assets abroad and Income from non-resident trusts (PDF 92K).

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com
Welsh Content:
Dewiswch 'Ydw' o'r ddewislen os ydych yn hawlio rhyddhad credyd treth dramor ar gyfer yr incwm hwn (fel arfer bydd yn fanteisiol i chi), fel arall dewiswch 'Nac ydw'.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach gweler y Nodiadau Tramor (PDF 128K).

Am wybodaeth bellach gweler Taflen Gymorth 262 (PDF) - Income and benefits from transfer of assets abroad and Income from non-resident trusts.

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

  • 8am to 8pm Monday to Friday
  • 8am to 4pm Saturday
  • 9am to 5pm Sunday
Closed bank holidays, Easter Sunday, Christmas Day, Boxing Day and New Year's Day

English Content:
If your business started (or you started working for yourself) between 6 April 2016 and 5 April 2017, enter the appropriate date in this field.

You'll be taxable on any profits for the period beginning on the date you started working for yourself and ending on 5 April 2017.

If you haven't already registered for self-employment and Class 2 National Insurance contributions (NIC's), you must do so now. For more information about working for yourself.
Welsh Content:
Os dechreuodd eich busnes ar ôl 5 Ebrill 2016 nodwch y dyddiad priodol yn y blwch hwn.

Byddwch yn agored i dreth ar unrhyw elw ar gyfer y cyfnod sy'n dechrau ar y dyddiad y dechreuoch weithio i chi eich hun ac sy'n dod i ben ar 5 Ebrill 2017.

Yn y mwyafrif o achosion bydd angen i chi hefyd dalu cyfraniadau Yswiriant Gwladol Dosbarth 2.

English Content:
Include any other expenses of the rental business you have not previously included in your return, such as stationery, telephone, business travelling and other miscellaneous costs.

Where you are subletting the property and you (or an earlier tenant) paid a premium to your landlord when the lease was granted you may be able to claim for part of the premium paid if the payment is taxable on your landlord as income.

Pan eich bod yn is-osod yr eiddo a'ch bod (neu denant cynharach) wedi talu premiwm i'ch landlord pan ganiatawyd y brydles efallai eich bod yn gallu gwneud cais i hawlio rhan o'r premiwm a dalir os yw'r taliad yn drethadwy i'ch landlord fel incwm

English Content:
The taxable amount has automatically been calculated for you. If you are claiming foreign tax credit relief the figure is the same as the figure in the 'Amount' of income arising or received before any tax taken off' field. If you are not claiming foreign tax credit relief the figure is the amount in the 'Amount of income arising or received before any tax taken off' field minus any amount in 'Foreign tax taken off or paid'.

For further information see Help Sheet 262 - Income and benefits from transfer of assets abroad and Income from non-resident trusts (PDF 92K).

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com

English Content:
Student loan repayments are deducted by your employer and included on your Form P60 (End of year certificate) or payslips.

The P60 does not include student loan repayments deducted by any previous employer. So if you had more than 1 employment in the year you must use your payslips, in addition to the P60, to work out the amounts you will need to enter.

English Content:
Enter your total allowable losses of 2009-10 excluding any clogged losses. (You cannot use this loss allocator if you have a 2009-10 clogged loss which can be deducted from a 2009-10 gain.)

A loss is not an allowable loss unless you claim it and any loss arising as a result of an avoidance scheme may not be an allowable loss.

Your total allowable losses of 2009-10 are usually deducted from your total chargeable gains (before taper relief) for the same year.

There are restrictions on the deduction of some losses, known as clogged losses. The most common type of clogged loss is a loss on a disposal to a connected person. The other clogged loss is a loss transferred to you by trustees when you become absolutely entitled to settled property.

For further guidance and information, please see the Capital Gains Summary Notes (PDF 127K)

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com
Welsh Content:
Nodwch gyfanswm eich colledion caniataol ar gyfer 2009-10 gan eithrio unrhyw golledion rhwystredig. (Ni allwch ddefnyddio'r dyrannwr colledion hwn os oes gennych golled rwystredig yn 2009-10 y gellir ei ddidynnu o ennill yn 2009-10).

Nid yw colled yn golled ganiataol oni bai eich bod yn ei gwneud cais amdani ac ni chaniateir unrhyw golled sy'n codi o ganlyniad i gynllun osgoi.

Fel arfer didynnir cyfanswm eich colledion caniataol ar gyfer 2009-10 o gyfanswm eich enillion trethadwy (cyn rhyddhad meinhau) am yr un flwyddyn.

Mae cyfyngiadau yn bodoli ynglŷn â didynnu rhai colledion a elwir yn golledion rhwystredig. Y math mwyaf cyffredin o golledion rhwystredig yw colled sy'n codi pan waredir ased i berson cysylltiol. Y golled rwystredig arall yw colled a drosglwyddir i chi gan ymddiriedolwyr pan gawsoch hawl llwyr i eiddo setledig.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach ewch i Nodiadau Crynhoi Enillion Cyfalaf (PDF 127K)

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
Select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu if business taper relief has been applied to a gain on any asset otherwise, select 'No'.

Taper relief reduces the amount of the capital gain to be taxed on the sale of an asset, according to the number of 'whole years' you held the asset after 5 April 1998. This period is called the 'qualifying holding period'. The longer you have held the asset, the smaller the percentage of the gain to be taxed. The rate of taper relief depends on whether or not the asset was a business asset.

For further guidance and information, please see the Capital Gains Summary Notes (PDF 127K).

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com
Welsh Content:
Dewiswch 'Do' o'r ddewislen os defnyddiwyd rhyddhad meinhau busnes ar gyfer ennill neu unrhyw ased, fel arall dewiswch 'Naddo'.

Mae rhyddhad meinhau yn lleihau swm yr ennill cyfalaf i'w drethu wrth werthu ased, yn ôl nifer y blynyddoedd cyflawn y daliwyd yr ased ar ôl 5 Ebrill 1998. Gelwir y cyfnod hwn yn 'gyfnod dal cymwys'. Po hwyaf y daliwyd yr ased, y lleiaf fydd canran yr ennill fydd i'w drethu. Mae cyfradd y rhyddhad meinhau yn ddibynnol ar p'un a oedd yr ased yn ased busnes ai peidio.

English Content:
Tick the checkbox if at any time during 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 tax year you received a pension or social security benefits from overseas. You should also include any pensions or annuities paid in the UK but on behalf of an overseas pension provider who is outside the UK. Don't include purchased life annuities here; you should include income from purchased life annuities in the section for 'interest and other income from overseas savings'. You should also include any flexible draw down taken from an overseas pension scheme during a period of 'temporary' non-residence. Helpsheet 346 Pension savings tax charges - guidance for members of overseas pension schemes explains what counts as a period of 'temporary' non-residence.

Some overseas pension schemes are registered in the UK. Pensions from these schemes shouldn't be entered on the Foreign pages but in the UK pensions, annuities and other State benefits received section of your Tax Return. The scheme administrator will tell you whether this applies to your pension scheme.

If you expect to start receiving a pension or annuity before 6 April 2017, enter details of the provider and annual amount in the 'Any other information' field at the end of the 'Fill in your return' section. This will help HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) get your PAYE tax code right for next year.

It's possible that you have a pension that isn't taxable in the UK because of the terms of a double taxation treaty. To claim that your foreign pension isn't taxable in the UK, enter full details in the 'Any other information' field at the end of the return and identify the relevant double taxation treaty on which you're relying. Go to Double Taxation Treaties: non UK resident with UK income.

Arrears of foreign pension

If the amount of pension you received in 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 tax year included payments which relate to an earlier tax year you can claim to spread those payments back to the year they relate to as long as the pension is taxed on the arising basis. If you think this might be to your advantage, ask HMRC or your tax adviser.

For more information on

  • foreign pensions which are wholly or partly exempt from UK tax
  • social security benefits (a list of foreign benefits to exclude that correspond to UK benefits) follow the link for Foreign Notes

Include all other foreign benefits. If you're unsure about whether a benefit should be included or not, ask HMRC or your tax adviser.
Welsh Content:
Ticiwch y blwch gwirio os, ar unrhyw adeg yn ystod 2016 i 2017, y gwnaethoch dderbyn pensiwn neu fudd-daliadau nawdd cymdeithasol o dramor. Dylech hefyd gynnwys unrhyw bensiynau neu flwydd-daliadau a dalwyd yn y DU ond sydd ar ran darparwr pensiwn tramor sydd y tu allan i'r DU. Peidiwch â chynnwys blwydd-daliadau a brynwyd yma; dylech gynnwys incwm o flwydd-daliadau a brynwyd yn yr adran ar gyfer 'llog ac incwm arall o gynilion tramor'. Dylech gynnwys unrhyw ddidyniad hyblyg a gymerir o gynllun pensiwn tramor yn ystod cyfnod 'dros dro' o fod yn ddibreswyl. Mae Taflen Gymorth 346 - 'Pension savings tax charges - guidance for members of overseas pension schemes that are not UK registered pension schemes' yn esbonio beth a olygir gan gyfnod dibreswyl 'dros dro'.

Mae rhai cynlluniau pensiwn tramor wedi'u cofrestru yn y DU. Ni ddylid nodi pensiynau o'r cynlluniau hyn ar y tudalennau Tramor ond yn hytrach yn yr adran 'Pensiynau a blwydd-daliadau'r DU a budd-daliadau eraill y Wladwriaeth a gawsoch' ar eich Ffurflen Dreth. Bydd gweinyddwr y cynllun yn gallu dweud wrthych p'un a yw hyn yn berthnasol i'ch cynllun pensiwn.

Os ydych yn disgwyl dechrau derbyn pensiwn neu flwydd-dal cyn 6 Ebrill 2017, nodwch fanylion y darparwr a'r swm blynyddol yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' ar ddiwedd yr adran 'Llenwi eich ffurflen dreth'. Bydd hyn yn helpu Cyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) i gael eich cod treth TWE yn gywir ar gyfer y flwyddyn nesaf.

Mae'n bosibl fod gennych bensiwn nad yw'n drethadwy yn y DU oherwydd telerau cytundeb trethiant dwbl. Er mwyn hawlio nad yw eich pensiwn tramor yn drethadwy yn y DU, nodwch fanylion llawn yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' ar ddiwedd ffurflen dreth y talwr a nodwch y cytundeb trethiant dwbl perthnasol yr ydych yn dibynnu arno. Gweler Crynhoad y Trethiant Dwbl yn www.hmrc.gov.uk am wybodaeth ynghylch telerau'r cytundebau trethiant dwbl a drefnwyd yn y DU.

Ôl-ddyledion pensiwn tramor

Os yw swm y pensiwn y gwnaethoch ei dderbyn yn 2016 i 2017 yn cynnwys taliadau sy'n berthnasol i flwyddyn dreth gynharach, gallwch wneud cais i ledaenu'r taliadau hynny yn ôl i'r flwyddyn maent yn perthyn iddi, cyn belled â bod y pensiwn yn cael ei drethu ar y sail sy'n codi. Os credwch y gallai hyn fod o fantais i chi, gofynnwch i CThEM neu i'ch ymgynghorydd treth.

Am ragor o wybodaeth am

  • bensiynau tramor sydd wedi'u heithrio yn gyfan gwbl neu'n rhannol rhag treth y DU
  • budd-daliadau nawdd cymdeithasol (rhestr o fudd-daliadau tramor i eithrio sy'n cyfateb â budd-daliadau'r DU)

dilynwch y cysylltiad Nodiadau Tramor

Dylech gynnwys pob budd-dal tramor arall. Os ydych yn ansicr p'un a dylid cynnwys budd-dal ai peidio, gofynnwch i CThEM neu i'ch ymgynghorydd treth."

English Content:
Amount saved towards your pension in excess of the Annual Allowance

The Annual Allowance test is only for increases in your pension savings, which have arisen in a 'pension input period'. For this purpose increases in your pension savings (your 'pension input amount') means increases in your benefit rights (for defined benefits arrangements), increases to your promised pension pot (for cash balance arrangements) or amounts of contributions paid into your pension pot (for defined contribution or money purchase arrangements).

Enter only the amount of the increases in pension savings which in aggregate exceed your Annual Allowance. The increases are arrived at differently depending on the type of pension arrangement. Show only the amount of the excess.

You can ignore this field if you:

  • took all the benefits from particular pension arrangements within a scheme on severe ill-health grounds - this means you took benefits following a registered medical practitioner telling your pension scheme administrator that, because of your ill-health, you're unlikely to be able to work at any time before State Pension age or if your pension entitlement is paid as a 'serious ill-health lump sum' because you expect to live for less than 12 months or you are a member of the armed forces who has become entitled to a pension or other payments for disability, injury or illness due to military service
  • are the personal representative of a scheme member who died during the tax year and you're filling in this form on that person's behalf for the period up to the date of death

You're liable to a tax charge on the excess amount above your Annual Allowance if, in 'pension input periods', the amount of the increase in your pension savings in registered pension schemes and certain overseas pension schemes was more than your Annual Allowance (there is guidance for members of overseas pension schemes in Help sheet 346 Pension savings tax charges - guidance for members of overseas pension schemes that are not UK registered pension schemes).
Welsh Content:
Swm a gynilwyd tuag at eich pensiwn sy'n fwy na'r Lwfans Blynyddol

Mae'r prawf Lwfans Blynyddol ond ar gyfer cynnydd yn eich cynilion pensiwn, sydd wedi codi mewn 'cyfnod talu mewn i bensiwn'. At y diben hwn, mae cynnydd yn eich cynilion pensiwn (eich 'swm talu mewn i bensiwn') yn golygu cynnydd yn eich hawliau buddiannau (ar gyfer trefniadau buddiannau diffiniedig), cynnydd yn eich cronfa bensiwn a addawyd i chi (ar gyfer trefniadau arian parod) neu symiau'r cyfraniadau a dalwyd i mewn i'ch cronfa bensiwn (ar gyfer trefniadau cyfraniadau diffiniedig neu bryniannau arian).

Dylech ond nodi swm y cynnydd mewn cynilion pensiwn sydd, wrth gyfansymu, yn fwy na'ch Lwfans Blynyddol. Cyrhaeddir at y cynnydd mewn modd gwahanol, gan ddibynnu ar y math o gytundeb pensiwn. Dangoswch swm yr ormodaeth yn unig.

Gallwch anwybyddu'r blwch hwn os:

  • gwnaethoch dderbyn yr holl fuddiannau o drefniadau pensiwn penodol o fewn cynllun yn 2014-15 ar sail afiechyd difrifol - golyga hyn eich bod wedi derbyn buddiannau ar ôl i feddyg cofrestredig ddweud wrth weinyddwr eich cynllun pensiwn, oherwydd eich afiechyd, eich bod yn annhebygol o allu gweithio ar unrhyw adeg cyn i chi gyrraedd oedran Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth, neu, os caiff eich hawl i bensiwn ei dalu fel 'cyfandaliad afiechyd difrifol', eich bod yn debygol o fyw am lai na 12 mis, neu, eich bod yn aelod o'r lluoedd arfog sydd â hawl i bensiwn neu daliadau eraill ar gyfer anabledd, anafiadau neu salwch a achoswyd gan wasanaeth milwrol
  • ydych yn gynrychiolydd personol aelod o gynllun a fu farw yn ystod y flwyddyn dreth ac rydych yn llenwi'r ffurflen hon ar ran y person hwnnw ar gyfer y cyfnod hyd at ddyddiad y farwolaeth

Rydych yn agored i dreth ar y swm gormodol sy'n uwch na'ch Lwfans Blynyddol os, yn y 'cyfnodau talu i mewn i bensiwn', roedd swm y cynnydd yn eich cynilion pensiwn mewn cynlluniau pensiwn cofrestredig a rhai cynlluniau pensiwn dramor yn fwy na'ch Lwfans Blynyddol (mae arweiniad ar gyfer aelodau cynlluniau pensiwn dramor yn Nhaflen Gymorth 346 Pension savings tax charges - guidance for members of overseas pension schemes that are not UK registered pension schemes).

English Content:
If you are employed as well as self-employed, the National Insurance Contributions and Employer Office may agree that some of your Class 4 National Insurance Contributions can be deferred until your overall contributions can be determined.

If your application for deferment is agreed, they will send you a certificate of deferment (form CA2703).

Only select 'Yes' if you have already been given a certificate of deferment otherwise, select 'No'. For more information follow the link Defer your self-employed National Insurance.

If you want to apply for deferment, please contact HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC).
Welsh Content:
Os ydych yn gyflogedig yn ogystal â hunangyflogedig, gall y Swyddfa Cyfraniadau Yswiriant Gwladol gytuno y gellir gohirio ychydig o'ch cyfraniadau Yswiriant Gwladol Dosbarth 4 tan y gellir pennu cyfanswm cyflawn eich cyfraniadau. Os cytunir ar eich cais i ohirio, byddant yn anfon tystysgrif gohirio (ffurflen CA2703) atoch.

Dewiswch 'Iawn' dim ond os ydych eisoes wedi derbyn tystysgrif gohirio, fel arall dewiswch 'Na' Am ragor o wybodaeth dilynwch y cysylltiad Gohiriwch eich Yswiriant Gwladol hunangyflogedig.

Os ydych am wneud cais i ohirio cysylltwch â Chyllid a Thollau EM.

English Content:
Need more help with completing the entries on your Tax Return?

If you need more help with completing the entries on your tax return or general advice about Self Assessment contact the HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) Self Assessment Helpline. Alternatively, search for 'Contact HMRC' on the GOV.UK website and follow the 'Self Assessment' link.

Technical problem whilst completing your Tax Return?

If you experience any technical problems using the online return, please contact the HMRC Online Services Helpdesk.

English Content:
You can only deduct the costs you had to pay out in doing your job. If your employer has agreed a dispensation with HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) you mustn't deduct any expenses that are covered by that dispensation. If you need help with this, speak to your employer's pay section or contact HMRC.

If you use your own vehicle for work, you may be able to claim 'Mileage Allowance Relief'.

To work out how much tax relief you can claim, add up your business mileage for the tax year and multiply it by the approved mileage rates (go to www.gov.uk and search for rates and allowances for travel).

If your employer doesn't pay you a mileage allowance you can claim the full approved amount of Mileage Allowance Relief.

If your employer pays you a mileage allowance but it is less than the approved amount, you can claim Mileage Allowance Relief on the difference.

If your employer pays you more than the approved amount you'll have to pay tax on the difference.

Add together all of your allowable travel costs and business expenses and enter the total figure.
Welsh Content:
Gallwch ond didynnu'r costau yr oedd rhaid i chi dalu allan wrth wneud eich gwaith. Os yw eich cyflogwr wedi cytuno ar oddefeb gyda Chyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) rhaid i chi beidio âdidynnu unrhyw dreuliau sy'n cael eu cwmpasu gan yr oddefeb honno. Os oes angen cymorth arnoch gyda hyn, siaradwch ag adran cyflogau eich cyflogwr neu cysylltwch â CThEM

Os ydych yn defnyddio eich cerbyd eich hun ar gyfer gwaith, mae'n bosib y gallwch hawlio 'Rhyddhad Lwfans Milltiroedd'.

Er mwyn cyfrifo faint o ryddhad treth y gallwch ei hawlio, adiwch ynghyd eich milltiroedd busnes ar gyfer y flwyddyn dreth a'i luosi gan y cyfraddau milltiroedd cymeradwy (ewch i www.gov.uk a chwilio am gyfraddau a lwfansau ar gyfer teithio).

Os nad yw eich cyflogwr yn talu lwfans milltiroedd i chi gallwch hawlio'r swm cymeradwy llawn o Ryddhad Lwfans Milltiroedd.

Os yw eich cyflogwr yn talu lwfans milltiroedd i chi ond ei fod yn llai na'r swm cymeradwy, gallwch hawlio Rhyddhad Lwfans Milltiroedd ar y gwahaniaeth.

Os yw eich cyflogwr yn talu mwy na'r swm cymeradwy i chi, bydd yn rhaid i chi dalu treth ar y gwahaniaeth.

Adiwch at ei gilydd eich holl gostau teithio a ganiateir a'ch treuliau busnes a rhowch y cyfanswm.

English Content:
The redemption of bonus shares or securities is a qualifying distribution and is paid with a tax credit. If you pay tax at the higher rate(s) you will have further tax to pay on this income (which you'll have included in the Dividends section of your Tax Return), however you're entitled to an allowance, in terms of tax, for the higher rate tax you paid when those bonus shares or securities were issued. This allowance means the income is not taxed twice.

Enter the higher rate tax paid on the non-qualifying distribution of those shares (just the higher rate tax, not the tax credit or lower rate tax equivalent) - this will mean going back to the tax year in which they were issued and checking how much tax you paid on that income then.
Welsh Content:
Ystyrir adbryniant cyfranddaliadau neu warantau bonws yn ddosbarthiad a chaiff ei dalu gyda chredyd treth. Os ydych yn talu treth ar y gyfradd uwch bydd rhaid i chi dalu treth ychwanegol ar yr incwm hwn (y byddwch wedi ei gynnwys yn adran Difidendau eich Ffurflen Dreth, er hynny mae gennych hawl i gael lwfans, yn nhermau treth, ar gyfer y dreth ar y gyfradd uwch a daloch pan ddyrannwyd y cyfranddaliadau neu'r gwarantau bonws hynny.

Mae'r lwfans hwn yn golygu na chaiff yr incwm ei drethu ddwywaith.

Nodwch y dreth ar y gyfradd uchaf a dalwyd ar ddosbarthiad anghymwysol o'r cyfranddaliadau hynny (dim ond y dreth ar y gyfradd uchaf, nid y credyd treth neu'r hyn sy'n cyfateb iddi). Bydd hyn yn golygu mynd yn ôl i'r flwyddyn dreth y cawsant ei dyrannu a gwirio faint o dreth a daloch ar yr incwm pryd hynny.

English Content:
Payments deducted from your pay before it's taxed (the net pay arrangement)

If your payments to your employer's occupational pension scheme (or any associated Additional Voluntary Contributions) are deducted from your pay before it's taxed you will already have received your tax relief. Do not enter anything on this return.

If you make contributions towards a personal pension or retirement annuity, or you made payments to an employer's registered pension scheme and no tax relief was given at the time of payment, select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.

Personal Pension

If you're a UK individual who is building up benefits in a registered pension scheme, you can usually have tax relief on your payments (your contributions or those of someone else, other than your employer, on your behalf) into that scheme.

You must:

  • have taxable UK earnings, such as employment income or profits from self-employment, or
  • be resident in the UK for some time during the tax year, or
  • have been UK resident at some time in the 5 preceding years and when you joined the pension scheme, or
  • have earnings from overseas Crown employment, taxable in the UK (or your spouse does)

If your pension contributions and other pension inputs are more than the annual allowance, you will need to work out the separate tax charge, more information is available in Helpsheet 345 - Pension savings. Tax charges on any excess over the lifetime allowance/annual allowance and on unauthorised payments.

Personal pension contributions that had basic rate tax relief in the scheme by 'relief at source'

Under the 'relief at source' system, your pension provider claims basic rate tax relief (of 20%) on your personal contributions and adds that to your pension pot. Enter the total amount – that is, your personal contributions paid to the scheme, plus the tax relief.

Include any one-off contributions you made in the year and enter the details of any one off contributions in the any other information section.

Use the pension certificate or receipt you get from the administrator the payment to registered pension schemes field or work out the figure by dividing the amount you actually paid by 80 and multiplying the result by 100.

If you pay tax at 40% or 45% you should still put the amount you paid plus the basic rate (20%) tax relief. HMRC will work out the extra tax relief due to you over the basic rate claimed by your pension provider.

Retirement annuity

If you hold a retirement annuity contract and the retirement annuity provider doesn't operate the relief at source system (they don't claim the basic rate tax relief on your behalf) HM Revenue and Customs will work out the tax relief to give you credit in your tax calculation.

If you don't have any relevant UK earnings, don't enter any value in this field. For more information, go to the 'contributions' section of the Pension Tax Manual.

Payments to employer's scheme

If you made payments to an employer's registered pension scheme and no tax relief was given at the time of payment, you can claim relief for them now by entering the total unrelieved amount you paid in the tax year.

This may occur when:

  • your contributions to your employer's occupational pension scheme were more than your earnings from that employment
  • your employer was unable to deduct the contributions from your pay before taxing it (perhaps because your payment was made close to 5 April)
  • you are not an employee but you are a member of a public services pension scheme or a marine pilots' fund
  • you are a member of an occupational pension scheme but contributions were made on your behalf by someone else (who was not your employer)

Don't include here any personal contributions that had basic rate tax relief in the scheme by 'relief at source', such as a group personal pension scheme.

Payments to an overseas pension scheme

Put the amount that qualifies for tax relief in this box if you are eligible for migrant member relief, transitional corresponding relief or relief under a Double Taxation Agreement.
Welsh Content:
Taliadau a ddidynwyd o'ch cyflog cyn iddo gael ei drethu (y trefniant cyflog net)

Os caiff eich taliadau i gynllun pensiwn galwedigaethol eich cyflogwr (neu unrhyw Gyfraniadau Gwirfoddol Ychwanegol sy'n gysylltiedig â'r cynllun) eu didynnu o'ch cyflog cyn iddo gael ei drethu, byddwch eisoes wedi derbyn eich rhyddhad treth. Peidiwch â nodi unrhyw beth ar y ffurflen dreth hon.

Os ydych yn cyfrannu at bensiwn personol neu flwydd-dal ymddeol, neu eich bod wedi gwneud taliadau i gynllun pensiwn cofrestredig cyflogwr, ac na roddwyd rhyddhad treth pan gafodd ei dalu, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'.

Pensiwn Personol - Os ydych yn unigolyn yn y DU sy'n cronni buddiannau mewn cynllun pensiwn cofrestredig, gallwch fel arfer gael rhyddhad treth ar eich cyfraniadau i'r cynllun hwnnw (eich cyfraniadau chi neu rai rhywun arall ar eich rhan, heblaw eich cyflogwr).

Rhaid:

  • i chi gael enillion trethadwy yn y DU, er enghraifft incwm o gyflogaeth neu elw o hunangyflogaeth, neu
  • i chi breswylio yn y DU am gyfnod yn ystod y flwyddyn dreth, neu
  • eich bod wedi preswylio yn y DU ar ryw adeg yn y bum mlynedd flaenorol a phryd yr ymunoch chi â'r cynllun pensiwn, neu
  • bod gennych enillion o gyflogaeth dramor o dan y Goron sy'n drethadwy yn y DU (neu mae gan eich priod enillion)

Os yw eich cyfraniadau pensiwn a mewnbynnau pensiwn eraill yn fwy na'r lwfans blynyddol, bydd angen i chi gyfrifo'r tâl treth ar wahân - darllenwch Daflen Wybodaeth 345 Pension savings - Tax charges on any excess over the lifetime allowance and the annual allowance, and on unauthorised payments:

Cyfraniadau pensiwn personol oedd â rhyddhad treth ar y gyfradd sylfaenol yn y cynllun, drwy gyfrwng 'rhyddhad wrth y ffynhonnell'

O dan y system 'rhyddhad wrth y ffynhonnell', mae eich darparwr pensiwn yn hawlio rhyddhad treth ar y gyfradd sylfaenol (sef 20%) ar eich cyfraniadau personol ac yn ychwanegu hwnnw i'ch cronfa bensiwn. Rhowch y cyfanswm - hynny yw, eich cyfraniadau personol a dalwyd i'r cynllun, plws y rhyddhad treth.

Dylech gynnwys cyfraniadau unigol a wnaethoch yn ystod y flwyddyn a rhoi manylion cyfraniadau unigol yn yr adran gwybodaeth arall. Defnyddiwch y dystysgrif pensiwn neu'r dderbynneb a gewch yn y blwch taliad i gynlluniau pensiwn cofrestredig, neu cyfrifwch y ffigur drwy rannu'r swm a dalwyd gennych mewn gwirionedd ag 80, a lluosi'r swm hwnnw â 100.

Os ydych yn talu treth ar 40% neu 45% dylech yn dal rhoi'r swm a dalwyd gennych plws y rhyddhad treth ar y gyfradd sylfaenol (20%). Bydd CThEM yn cyfrifo'r dreth ychwanegol sy'n ddyledus i chi uwchlaw'r gyfradd sylfaenol a hawliwyd gan eich darparwr pensiwn.

Blwydd-dal ymddeol - Os oes gennych gytundeb blwydd-dal ymddeol ac os nad yw darparwr y blwydd-dal ymddeol yn gweithredu'r system rhyddhad wrth y ffynhonnell (ni fyddant yn hawlio rhyddhad treth ar y gyfradd sylfaenol ar eich rhan) bydd Cyllid a Thollau EM yn cyfrifo'r rhyddhad treth er mwyn rhoi credyd i chi yn eich cyfrifiad treth.

Os nad oes gennych unrhyw enillion perthnasol yn y DU, peidiwch aâ rhoi unrhyw werth yn y blwch hwn. Mae mwy o wybodaeth i'w chael yn yr adran 'contibutions' yn y 'Pensions Tax Manual'.

Taliadau i gynllun y cyflogwr

Os gwnaethoch daliadau i gynllun pensiwn cofrestredig cyflogwr ac na roddwyd rhyddhad treth ar adeg talu, gallwch hawlio rhyddhad ar eu cyfer nawr drwy roi'r cyfanswm na roddwyd rhyddhad ar ei gyfer a daloch yn ystod y flwyddyn dreth.

Gallai hynny ddigwydd pan:

  • oedd eich cyfraniadau i gynllun pensiwn galwedigaethol eich cyflogwr yn fwy na'ch enillion o'r gyflogaeth honno
  • nad oedd eich cyflogwr yn gallu didynnu'r cyfraniadau o'ch cyflog cyn ei drethu (efallai am y cafodd eich taliad ei wneud yn agos i 5 Ebrill)
  • nad ydych yn gyflogai ond eich bod yn aelod o gynllun pensiwn gwasanaethau cyhoeddus neu gronfa beilot forol
  • eich bod yn aelod o gynllun pensiwn galwedigaethol ond cafodd cyfraniadau eu gwneud ar eich rhan gan rywun arall (nad oedd yn gyflogwr i chi)

Peidiwch â chynnwys yma cyfraniadau personol wnaeth dderbyn rhyddhad ar y gyfradd sylfaenol drwy gyfrwng 'rhyddhad wrth y ffynhonnell', megis cynllun pensiwn personol grŵp

Taliadau i gynllun pensiwn tramor

Rhowch y swm sy'n gymwys ar gyfer rhyddhad treth yn y blwch hwn os ydych yn gymwys ar gyfer derbyn rhyddhad aelod mudol, rhyddhad trosiannol cyfatebol neu ryddhad o dan Gytundeb Trethiant Dwbl.

English Content:
Overview

You can start using cash basis from 6 April 2014 and if you:

  • run a small business e.g. sole traders and partnerships
  • have an income of £83,000 or less a year (this is the threshold to register for VAT)

You can also decide not to use cash basis if it's not suited to your business.

Why use cash basis

If you

  • run a small business, cash basis accounting may be better than traditional accounting
  • you only need to declare money when it comes in and out of your business
  • at the end of the tax year, you won't have to pay Income Tax on money you didn't receive in your accounting period.

When cash basis might not suit your business

If you:

  • want to claim interest or bank charges of more than £500 as an expense
  • run a business that's more complex, eg you have high levels of stock
  • need to get finance for your business - a bank could ask to see accounts drawn up using traditional accounting to see what you owe and are due before agreeing a loan
  • have losses that you want to offset against other taxable income ('sideways loss relief')

Income and expenses under cash basis

  • you only count the money you've actually received and expenses you've actually paid in a tax year
  • money you're owed isn't counted until you receive it
  • payments count - cash, by card, cheque, payment in kind or any other method

Examples of allowable business expenses:

  • office costs, eg stationery
  • travel costs, eg fuel, parking, train or bus fares
  • clothing expenses, eg uniforms
  • staff costs, eg salaries or subcontractor costs
  • things you buy to sell on, eg stock or raw materials
  • financial costs, eg insurance or bank charges
  • costs of your business premises, eg heating, lighting, business rates
  • advertising or marketing, eg website costs

Capital allowances

If you use cash basis accounting and buy a car for your business, you can claim this as a capital allowance. However, all other items you buy and keep for your business should be claimed as allowable expenses in the normal way.

Other considerations

  • businesses using traditional accounting (accruals basis) might have to make some adjustments if they switch to cash basis
  • you can choose how you record when you receive or pay money (e.g. the date the money enters or leaves your account or the date a cheque is written) but you must use the same method each tax year
  • cash basis might suit smaller businesses because, at the end of the tax year, you won't have to pay Income Tax on money you didn't receive in your accounting period
  • a loss incurred by a business adopting 'Cash basis' can only carry forward. No sideways or earlier year's tax relief can be claimed
  • your business grows during the tax year you can stay in the scheme up to an income of £166,000. Above that you'll need to use traditional accounting for your Income Tax return for the next tax year, unless your income drops back below the VAT threshold in place at the end of that tax year

Losses

  • any losses you make can't be set off against your other income
  • terminal loss must be set against any profits (after deducting losses brought forward) from the same business taxed in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017
  • any remaining terminal losses must be set against the profits of the same business taxed in the 3 prior years. Starting with the latest year

Who can't use the scheme

  • Lloyd's underwriters
  • farming businesses with a current herd basis election
  • farming and creative businesses with a section 221 ITTOIA profit averaging election
  • businesses that have claimed business premises renovation allowance
  • businesses that carry on a mineral extraction trade
  • businesses that have claimed research and development allowance
  • limited companies
  • limited liability partnerships
  • dealers in securities
  • relief for mineral royalties
  • lease premiums
  • ministers of religion
  • pool betting duty
  • intermediaries treated as making employment payments
  • managed service companies
  • waste disposal
  • cemeteries and crematoria

If you can't use cash basis, you'll need to use traditional accounting to work out your taxable profits.
Welsh Content:
Trosolwg

Dull o gyfrifo elw neu golled eich busnes ar gyfer eich ffurflen dreth Hunanasesiad, yw sail arian parod.

Gallwch ddefnyddio sail arian parod ar gyfer 2014 to 2016:

  • os ydych yn fusnes hunangyflogedig e.e. unig fasnachwyr a phartneriaethau
  • os oes gennych incwm o £83,000 neu lai y flwyddyn (mae'n rhaid i chi gofrestru ar gyfer TAW dros y trothwy hwn)

Gallwch ddechrau defnyddio sail arian parod o 6 Ebrill 2014 ymlaen. Serch hynny, gallwch hefyd benderfynu nad ydych am ddefnyddio sail arian parod am na fydd, o bosib, yn gweddu i'ch busnes.

Sut mae sail arian parod yn gweithio

Gallwch benderfynu cofnodi incwm a threuliau eich busnes ar draws y flwyddyn dreth drwy un o'r dulliau canlynol:

  • defnyddio sail arian parod - cofnodi arian pan fydd eich busnes yn ei dderbyn, a phan fydd yn gadael eich busnes, mewn gwirionedd (mae pob math o arian yn cynnwys - arian parod, taliadau â chardiau, sieciau ac unrhyw ddull arall)
  • defnyddio dull traddodiadol o gyfrifo (sail croniadau) - cofnodi incwm a threuliau pan fyddwch yn codi anfonebau ar eich cwsmeriaid neu'n derbyn bil

Incwm a threuliau o dan sail arian parod

Incwm

  • rydych ond yn cyfri'r arian a dderbyniwyd gennych mewn gwirionedd mewn blwyddyn dreth
  • ni chaiff arian sy'n ddyledus i chi ei gyfrifo tan eich bod wedi ei dderbyn
  • mae taliadau'n cyfrif - arian parod, drwy gerdyn, siec, taliadau ar ffurf nwyddau neu unrhyw ddull arall

Treuliau

Treuliau yw costau busnes y mae'n bosib y gallwch eu didynnu o'ch incwm er mwyn cyfrifo eich elw trethadwy.

Os ydych yn defnyddio'r sail arian parod, rydych yn cyfri'r treuliau a dalwyd gennych mewn gwirionedd yn unig. Nid yw arian sydd arnoch yn cael ei gyfrif hyd nes eich bod yn ei dalu.

Mae'r canlynol yn enghreifftiau o dreuliau busnes a ganiateir pan fyddwch yn defnyddio'r sail arian parod:

  • costau rhedeg o ddydd i ddydd, e.e. trydan, tanwydd
  • costau gweinyddol, e.e. offer ysgrifennu
  • pethau a brynir gennych er mwyn eu gwerthu, e.e. stoc
  • pethau a ddefnyddir gennych yn eich busnes, e.e. peiriannau, cyfrifiaduron, faniau
  • llog a thaliadau a godir o hyd at £500, e.e. llog ar orddrafftiau banc

Os ydych yn defnyddio'r sail arian parod, ni allwch hawlio lwfans cyfalaf ar unrhyw beth heblaw ceir.

Pethau eraill i'w dwyn i ystyriaeth

  • mae'n bosib bydd raid i fusnesau sy'n defnyddio dull traddodiadol o gyfrifo (sail croniadau) wneud ychydig o addasiadau os ydynt yn trosglwyddo i sail arian parod
  • gallwch ddewis eich dull o gofnodi pan fyddwch yn derbyn neu'n talu arian (e.e. y dyddiad pan fydd yr arian yn mynd i'ch cyfrif neu'n ei adael, neu'r dyddiad pan ysgrifennir siec) ond mae'n rhaid i chi ddefnyddio'r un dull bob blwyddyn dreth
  • mae'n bosib bydd sail arian parod yn fwy addas i fusnesau bach oherwydd, ar ddiwedd y flwyddyn dreth, ni fydd raid i chi dalu treth incwm ar arian na dderbyniwyd gennych yn ystod eich cyfnod cyfrifyddu

Os ydych yn defnyddio sail arian parod a bod eich busnes yn tyfu yn ystod y flwyddyn dreth, gallwch barhau'n rhan o'r cynllun hyd at incwm o £162,000. Uwchlaw'r swm hynny, bydd raid i chi ddefnyddio dull traddodiadol o gyfrifo ar gyfer eich ffurflen Dreth Incwm am y flwyddyn dreth nesaf, heblaw bod eich incwm yn gostwng yn ôl islaw'r trothwy TAW ar ddiwedd y flwyddyn dreth honno.

Pwy na allant ddefnyddio'r cynllun?

Dyma'r busnesau na allant ddefnyddio'r cynllun:

  • Tanysgrifenwyr Lloyd's
  • busnesau ffermio sydd â dewis sail heidiol gyfredol
  • busnesau ffermio a chreadigol sydd â dewis cyfartalu elw, adran 221 ITTOIA
  • busnesau sydd wedi hawlio lwfans adnewyddu eiddo busnes
  • busnesau sy'n cynnal masnach mwyngloddio
  • busnesau sydd wedi hawlio lwfans ymchwil a datblygu
  • cwmnïau cyfyngedig
  • partneriaethau atebolrwydd cyfyngedig

Bydd hyn yn eich galluogi i gadw trefn ar eich colledion gan wneud yn sicr nad ydych yn anghofio eu hawlio. English Content:
A separate computation for each disposal of an asset must be provided with your return.

If you have completed an online worksheet for a disposal this will automatically attach to your return.

You must attach separate computations for all other disposals of assets and details of any claims, elections or notices you wish to make or give. Alternatively, you may provide this information in Any other information at the end of the Capital Gains section.

English Content:
You can claim tax allowances called capital allowances for the cost of purchasing, and improvements to, vehicles and equipment such as vans, cars, tools, computers, furniture and fixtures (even if the items were purchased under hire purchase) that you use in your holiday lettings business. The costs of such items, or the depreciation on them, aren't allowable as an expense in working out your taxable profits.

You can claim capital allowances for plant and machinery (such as furniture and fixtures) for use in a dwelling-house if you have a property business which qualifies as a furnished holiday letting business.

Add up any amounts claimed as capital allowances and enter the total of these here.

Further information on Capital allowances and balancing charges.
Welsh Content:
Gallwch hawlio lwfansau treth a elwir yn lwfansau cyfalaf am gostau prynu a gwella cerbydau ac offer megis faniau, ceir, offer, cyfrifiaduron, dodrefn a darnau gosod (hyd yn oed os prynwyd yr eitemau o dan hurbwrcas) yr ydych yn eu defnyddio yn eich busnes llety gwyliau. Nid yw costau eitemau o'r fath, na’r dibrisiant arnynt, yn cael eu caniatáu fel traul wrth gyfrifo eich elw trethadwy.

Gallwch hawlio lwfansau cyfalaf ar gyfer offer a pheiriannau (megis dodrefn a darnau gosod) sydd i'w defnyddio mewn annedd-dŷ os oes gennych fusnes eiddo sy'n gymwys fel busnes llety gwyliau wedi'i ddodrefnu.

Dylech adio unrhyw symiau a hawlir fel lwfansau cyfalaf at ei gilydd, a nodi'r cyfanswm yma.

Rhagor o wybodaeth am Capital allowances and balancing charges.

Welsh Content: Yn y flwyddyn dreth 6 Ebrill 2016 i 5 Ebrill 2017:

English Content:
If you've subscribed for shares in Venture Capital Trusts and you were aged 18 or over when the shares were issued you are entitled to tax relief.

The amount of relief will be the smaller of:

  • the amount you subscribed (up to a maximum of £200,000) at 30%
  • the amount that reduces your tax bill to zero for the year

Enter the amount you subscribed, up to £200,000. Please keep any certificates the trusts provide.
Welsh Content:
Os ydych wedi tanysgrifio ar gyfer cyfranddaliadau Ymddiriedolaeth Cyfalaf Mentro ac roeddech yn 18 neu'n hŷn pan ddyroddwyd y cyfranddaliadau bydd hawl gennych gael rhyddhad treth.

Swm y rhyddhad fydd y lleiaf o:

  • y swm a danysgrifiwyd gennych (hyd at uchafswm o £200,000) ar 30% neu
  • y swm sy'n gostwng eich bil treth am y flwyddyn i 0.

Nodwch y swm a danysgrifiwyd gennych, hyd at £200,000. Dylech gadw unrhyw dystysgrifau a ddarperir gan yr ymddiriedolaethau.

English Content:
You must withhold Income Tax at basic rate from the amount you pay if you:

  • make annual payments to someone under a legal obligation in connection with your trade or profession

For example, if the annual payment or patent royalty you should pay is £100 (i.e. the gross amount), you must withhold 20% of this, or £20, and pay the other person £80.
Welsh Content:
Rhaid i chi ddal Treth Incwm ar y gyfradd sylfaenol yn ôl o'r swm yr ydych yn ei dalu os ydych yn:

  • gwneud taliadau blynyddol i rywun o dan ymrwymiad cyfreithiol mewn cysylltiad â'ch masnach neu broffesiwn

Er enghraifft, os yw'r taliad blynyddol neu freindal patent y dylech ei dalu yn £100 (h.y. y swm gros), mae'n rhaid i chi ddal 20% o hyn yn ôl, neu £20, a thalu £80 i'r person arall.

English Content:
You can claim tax relief for any gift, or sale at less than market value, to a charity of a 'qualifying interest in land', that is, the whole of your beneficial interest in that freehold or leasehold land in the UK.

Enter the value of the net benefit to the charity of the land minus any amounts or benefits received from the charity. Add to that value any costs you bear in connection with the gift or sale, such as legal or valuer's fees. The charity must give you a certificate specifying the land and interest it has accepted from you.

The net benefit to the charity is usually the market value of the qualifying investment, but special rules apply if the charity is placed under any obligation in connection with the transfer to it of the investment.

For more information follow the link Help Sheet 342 - Charitable giving.
Welsh Content:
Gallwch hawlio rhyddhad treth am unrhyw rodd

neu werthiant am lai na werth y farchnad o 'fuddiant cymhwysol mewn tir' i elusen, hynny yw, y cyfan o'ch buddiant llesiannol yn y tir rhydd-ddaliadol neu brydlesol hwnnw yn y DU.

Nodwch werth y budd net i'r elusen o'r tir llai unrhyw symiau neu fuddiannau a dderbyniwyd gan yr elusen. Ychwanegwch unrhyw fân gostau a dalwyd gennych at y gwerth hwnnw, mewn cysylltiad â'r rhodd neu'r gwerthiant, megis ffioedd cyfreithiol neu ffioedd priswyr. Rhaid i'r elusen roi tystysgrif i chi yn dynodi'r tir a'r buddiant a dderbyniwyd ganddi oddi wrthych.

Y budd net i elusen yw, fel arfer, gwerth y farchnad o'r buddsoddiad cymwys, ond mae rheolau arbennig os rhoddir yr elusen dan unrhyw rwymedigaeth mewn cysylltiad â'r trosglwyddiad iddo o'r buddsoddiad.

Mae Taflen Gymorth 325 Other taxable income (PDF 62K) yn esbonio'n fwy manwl sut i gwblhau'r adran hon.

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
Answer 'Yes' to this box if:

  • you or your partner were entitled to and received Child Benefit during the 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 tax year (and the payments had not stopped before 6 April 2016)
  • someone other than you or your partner claimed Child Benefit for a child who lived with you during the 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 tax year

Otherwise, if the above does not apply answer 'No'.

Additional information can be found on the High Income Child Benefit Tax Charge pages on GOV.UK.
Welsh Content:
Atebwch 'Iawn' i'r blwch hwn os:

  • oedd gennych chi neu eich partner yr hawl i, a gwnaethoch dderbyn, Budd-dal Plant yn ystod y flwyddyn dreth 2016 i 2017 (a doedd y taliadau heb ddod i ben cyn 6 Ebrill 2016); neu
  • gwnaeth rhywun heblaw amdanoch chi neu eich partner hawlio Budd-dal Plant ar gyfer plentyn a oedd yn byw gyda chi yn ystod y flwyddyn dreth 2016 i 2017

Fel arall, os nad yw'r uchod yn berthnasol, atebwch 'Na'.

Am wybodaeth ychwanegol, dilynwch y cysylltiad i Tâl Incwm Uchel Budd-dal Plant- GOV.UK

English Content:
This section explains who can or cannot file a return online using this service.

Please note: Not everyone can use this service and some will need to use alternative software, for example, if you were not living in the UK in the tax year (non resident) or you claim the remittance basis. The remittance basis is an alternative tax treatment that is available to individuals who are a UK resident but not domiciled in the UK and have foreign income and gains.

You can find further information about Residence, Domicile and the Remittance Basis of taxation in booklet RDR1 Guidance Note: Residence, Domicile and the Remittance Basis.
Welsh Content:
Mae'r adran hon yn egluro pwy sy'n gallu a phwy na all gyflwyno Ffurflen Dreth ar-lein gan ddefnyddio'r gwasanaeth hwn.

Sylwer: Ni all pawb ddefnyddio'r gwasanaeth hwn, a bydd yn rhaid i rai pobl ddefnyddio meddalwedd arall, er enghraifft, os nad oeddech yn byw yn y DU yn ystod y flwyddyn dreth (nid oeddech yn breswyl yn y DU) neu os ydych yn hawlio'r sail drosglwyddo. Mae'r sail drosglwyddo yn driniaeth wahanol o ran treth sydd ar gael i unigolion sy'n breswyl yn y DU ond nid yw eu domisil yn y DU, a bod ganddynt incwm ac enillion tramor.

Mae rhagor o wybodaeth am Breswyl, Domisil a'r Sail Drosglwyddo o ran trethi ar gael yn y llyfryn RDR1 Guidance Note: Residence, Domicile and the Remittance Basis.

English Content:
Overview

You can start using cash basis from 6 April 2014 and if you:

  • run a small business e.g. sole traders and partnerships
  • have an income of £83,000 or less a year (this is the threshold when you have to register for VAT)

You can also decide not to use cash basis if it’s not suited to your business.

Why use cash basis

If you

  • run a small business, cash basis accounting may be better than traditional accounting
  • you only need to declare money when it comes in and out of your business
  • At the end of the tax year, you won't have to pay Income Tax on money you didn't receive in your accounting period.

When cash basis might not suit your business

If you:

  • want to claim interest or bank charges of more than £500 as an expense
  • run a business that's more complex, e.g. you have high levels of stock
  • need to get finance for your business - a bank could ask to see accounts drawn up using traditional accounting to see what you owe and are due before agreeing a loan have losses that you want to offset against other taxable income ('sideways loss relief')

Income and expenses under cash basis

  • you only count the money you've actually received and expenses you've actually paid in a tax year
  • money you're owed isn't counted until you receive it
  • payments count - cash, by card, cheque, payment in kind or any other method

Examples of allowable business expenses:

  • office costs, e.g. stationery
  • travel costs, e.g. fuel, parking, train or bus fares
  • clothing expenses, e.g. uniforms
  • staff costs, e.g. salaries or subcontractor costs
  • things you buy to sell on, e.g. stock or raw materials
  • financial costs, e.g. insurance or bank charges
  • costs of your business premises, e.g. heating, lighting, business rates
  • advertising or marketing, e.g. website costs

Capital allowances

If you use cash basis accounting and buy a car for your business, you can claim this as a capital allowance. However, all other items you buy and keep for your business should be claimed as allowable expenses in the normal way.

Other considerations

  • businesses using traditional accounting (accruals basis) might have to make some adjustments if they switch to cash basis
  • you can choose how you record when you receive or pay money (e.g. the date the money enters or leaves your account or the date a cheque is written) but you must use the same method each tax year
  • cash basis might suit smaller businesses because, at the end of the tax year, you won't have to pay Income Tax on money you didn't receive in your accounting period
  • a loss incurred by a business adopting 'Cash basis' can only carry forward. No sideways or earlier year's tax relief can be claimed
  • your business grows during the tax year you can stay in the scheme up to an income of £166,000

Above that you'll need to use traditional accounting for your Income Tax return for the next tax year, unless your income drops back below the VAT threshold in place at the end of that tax year.

Losses

  • any losses you make can't be set off against your other income
  • terminal loss must be set against any profits (after deducting losses brought forward) from the same business taxed in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017
  • any remaining terminal losses must be set against the profits of the same business taxed in the 3 prior years. Starting with the latest year

Who can't use the scheme

  • Lloyd's underwriters
  • farming businesses with a current herd basis election
  • farming and creative businesses with a section 221 ITTOIA profit averaging election
  • businesses that have claimed business premises renovation allowance
  • businesses that carry on a mineral extraction trade
  • businesses that have claimed research and development allowance
  • limited companies
  • limited liability partnerships
  • dealers in securities
  • relief for mineral royalties
  • lease premiums
  • ministers of religion
  • pool betting duty
  • intermediaries treated as making employment payments
  • managed service companies
  • waste disposal
  • cemeteries and crematoria

If you can't use cash basis, you'll need to use traditional accounting to work out your taxable profits.
Welsh Content:
Trosolwg

Gallwch ddechrau defnyddio sail arian parod o 6 Ebrill 2014, a os ydych chi:

  • ydych yn rhedeg busnes bach, e.e. unig fasnachwyr a phartneriaethau
  • oes gennych incwm o £83,000 neu lai'r flwyddyn (dyma'r trothwy pan fod yn rhaid cofrestru ar gyfer TAW)

Gallwch ddechrau defnyddio'r sail arian parod o 6 Ebrill 2014. Fodd bynnag, gallwch benderfynu hefyd nad ydych am ddefnyddio'r sail arian parod gan nad yw, o bosib, yn addas ar gyfer eich busnes.

Pam defnyddio'r sail arian parod?

Os ydych yn rhedeg busnes bach, mae'n bosib y bydd y sail arian parod yn fwy addas i chi na chyfrifyddu traddodiadol.

Mae hynny am fod yn rhaid i chi roi gwybod am arian dim ond wrth iddo fynd i mewn ac allan o'ch busnes. Ar ddiwedd y flwyddyn dreth, ni fydd yn rhaid i chi dalu Treth Incwm ar arian na wnaethoch ei dderbyn yn ystod eich cyfnod cyfrifyddu.

Pan na fydd y sail arian parod, o bosib, yn addas ar gyfer eich busnes

Mae'n debygol na fydd y sail arian parod yn addas ar eich cyfer os:

  • ydych am hawlio llog neu gostau banc sy'n fwy na £500, fel traul
  • ydych yn rhedeg busnes sy'n fwy cymhleth, e.e. mae gennych lawer o stoc
  • oes angen i chi ariannu eich busnes - gall banciau ofyn am gael gweld cyfrifon a luniwyd drwy gyfrwng cyfrifyddu traddodiadol, er mwyn gweld faint sydd arnoch, a faint sy'n ddyledus i chi, cyn cytuno ar fenthyciad
  • oes gennych golledion rydych am eu gosod yn erbyn incwm trethadwy arall ('rhyddhad colledion i'r ochr')

Incwm a threuliau o dan y sail arian parod

  • rydych dim ond yn cyfrif yr arian a dderbyniwyd gennych mewn gwirionedd, a'r treuliau a dalwyd gennych mewn gwirionedd, mewn blwyddyn dreth
  • ni chaiff arian sy'n ddyledus i chi ei gyfrif hyd nes eich bod yn ei dderbyn
  • mae taliadau'n cyfrif - arian parod, drwy gerdyn, siec, taliadau mewn nwyddau neu ddulliau eraill

Mae'r canlynol yn enghreifftiau o dreuliau busnes a ganiateir pan fyddwch yn defnyddio'r sail arian parod:

  • costau swyddfa, e.e. deunydd ysgrifennu neu filiau ffôn
  • costau teithio, e.e. tanwydd, parcio, tocynnau trenau neu fysiau
  • treuliau dillad, e.e. gwisgoedd unffurf
  • costau staff, e.e. cyflogau neu gostau isgontractwyr
  • pethau a brynwch er mwyn eu gwerthu, e.e. stoc neu ddeunyddiau crai
  • costau ariannol, e.e costau yswiriant neu gostau banciau
  • costau adeiladau eich busnes, e.e. gwresogi, goleuo, cyfraddau busnes
  • hysbysebu neu farchnata, e.e. costau gwefan

Lwfansau cyfalaf

Os ydych yn defnyddio'r sail arian parod ac yn prynu car ar gyfer eich busnes, gallwch hawlio hwnnw fel lwfans cyfalaf. Fodd bynnag, dylid hawlio'r holl eitemau eraill rydych yn eu prynu a'u cadw ar gyfer eich busnes fel treuliau a ganiateir, yn y modd arferol.

Ystyriaethau eraill

  • efallai y bydd yn rhaid i fusnesau sy'n defnyddio cyfrifyddu traddodiadol (ar sail croniadau) wneud rhai addasiadau os byddant yn newid i'r sail arian parod
  • gallwch ddewis sut i gofnodi pan fyddwch yn derbyn neu'n talu arian (e.e. y dyddiad y mae'r arian yn dod i mewn neu'n gadael eich cyfrif, neu'r dyddiad yr ysgrifennir siec) ond mae'n rhaid i chi ddefnyddio'r un dull bob blwyddyn dreth
  • efallai y bydd arian parod yn addas ar gyfer busnesau bach oherwydd, ar ddiwedd y flwyddyn dreth, ni fydd yn rhaid i chi dalu Treth Incwm ar arian na wnaethoch ei dderbyn yn ystod eich cyfnod cyfrifyddu
  • dim ond colledion y gellir eu cario ymlaen gan fusnesau sy'n defnyddio'r sail arian parod. Ni ellir hawlio rhyddhad i'r ochr, na rhyddhad treth blwyddyn gynharach

Os ydych yn defnyddio'r sail arian parod a bod eich busnes yn tyfu yn ystod y flwyddyn, gallwch barhau i fod yn y cynllun gydag incwm hyd at £162,000. Os yw'r incwm yn uwch na hynny, bydd yn rhaid i chi ddefnyddio cyfrifyddu traddodiadol ar gyfer eich Ffurflen Dreth Incwm am y flwyddyn dreth ddilynol, heblaw bod eich incwm yn disgyn yn ôl yn is na'r trothwy TAW ar ddiwedd y flwyddyn dreth honno.

Colledion

  • ni ellir gosod colledion a wneir gennych, yn erbyn eich incwm arall
  • mae'n rhaid gosod colledion terfynol yn erbyn elw (ar ôl didynnu colledion a ddygwyd ymlaen) o'r un busnes a drethwyd yn 2016 i 2017
  • os oes colledion terfynol yn weddill, mae'n rhaid eu gosod yn erbyn elw'r un busnes a drethwyd yn y 3 blynedd flaenorol. Dylech ddechrau gyda'r flwyddyn ddiweddaraf

Pwy na all ddefnyddio'r cynllun?

Ni all y busnesau canlynol ddefnyddio'r cynllun:

  • tanysgrifenwyr Lloyd's
  • busnesau ffermio gyda sail dewis diadell gyfredol
  • busnesau ffermio a chreadigol gyda dewis elw ar gyfartaledd Adran 221 ITTOIA
  • busnesau sydd wedi hawlio lwfans adnewyddu safle busnes
  • busnesau sy'n cynnal masnach tynnu mwynau
  • busnesau sydd wedi hawlio lwfans ymchwil a datblygu
  • cwmnïau cyfyngedig
  • Partneriaethau Atebolrwydd Cyfyngedig
  • gwerthwyr gwarantau
  • rhyddhad ar gyfer breindaliadau mwynau
  • premiymau prydlesi
  • gweinidogion yr Efengyl
  • toll cronfa fetio
  • cyfryngwyr yr ystyrir eu bod yn gwneud taliadau cyflogaethau
  • cwmnïau gwasanaeth a reolir
  • gwaredu gwastraff
  • mynwentydd ac amlosgfeydd

Os na allwch ddefnyddio'r sail arian parod, bydd yn rhaid i chi ddefnyddio cyfrifyddu traddodiadol er mwyn cyfrifo eich elw trethadwy.

English Content:
You will usually receive your interest etc after tax (at 20%) has been taken off (deducted) by the payer, for example, the bank or building society or unit trust manager. What you need to enter is the net amount, (that is, the interest etc after tax was taken off) the amount that actually increased the balance in the account.

We require you to enter your 'net interest'. Bank statements or building society passbooks or electronic vouchers from authorised unit trusts or open-ended investment companies or investment trust companies may describe the information you require differently. The information you need to look out for is:

  • gross interest
  • tax deducted
  • net interest

1. Your statements may show all 3 amounts; if so, copy the net interest figure over.

2. Your statement may just show gross interest and tax deducted. The net interest is what you get by taking the tax deducted away from the gross interest.

Your statement may just show 'net interest', so copy this figure here.

If you have more than one account add up all your net interest etc figures and input the total here.

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 or 6 April 2018 to 5 April 2019 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HMRC know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.
Welsh Content:
Byddwch fel arfer yn derbyn eich llog etc ar ôl i'r talwr ddidynnu treth (ar 20%), er enghraifft y banc neu'r gymdeithas adeiladu neu reolwr ymddiriedolaeth unedol. Yr hyn sydd ei angen i chi nodi yw'r swm net, (hynny yw, y llog etc ar ôl didynnu treth) y swm a gynyddodd werth eich cyfrif.

Rydym angen i chi nodi eich 'llog net'. Gallai cyfriflenni banc neu lyfrau cyfrif cymdeithasau adeiladu neu dalebau electronig gan ymddiriedolaethau unedol awdurdodedig neu gwmnïau buddsoddi penagored neu gwmnïau ymddiriedolaeth fuddsoddi ddisgrifio'r wybodaeth sydd ei hangen arnoch mewn ffordd wahanol. Dyma'r wybodaeth sydd angen i chi edrych amdani:

  • llog gros
  • treth a ddidynnwyd
  • llog net

1. Gallai eich datganiadau ddangos y 3 swm; os felly, dylech ddefnyddio ffigur y llog net.

2. Gallai eich datganiad ddangos llog gros a threth a ddidynnwyd yn unig. Y llog net yw'r hyn a gewch pan fyddwch yn tynnu'r dreth a ddidynnwyd o'r llog gros.

Gallai eich datganiad ddangos 'llog net' yn unig, felly dylech ddefnyddio'r ffigur hwnnw yn y fan hon.

Os oes gennych fwy nag un cyfrif, adiwch ynghyd eich holl ffigurau llog net etc a rhowch y cyfanswm yn y fan hon.

English Content:
Foreign service exemption is due if at some time during your employment you were 'not resident and ordinarily resident in the UK' or you qualified for the Seafarers' Earnings Deduction (or before 6 April 1998 the Foreign Earnings Deduction).

If:

  • 75% of your service was foreign service (you were not resident and ordinarily resident in the UK), or
  • your last 10 years were foreign service and overall your service was longer than 10 years, or
  • your total service was more than 20 years and half was foreign service (including any 10 of the last 20 years) you get full foreign service exemption.

You may still get some reduction if you had some foreign service but do not qualify for the full foreign service exemption.

If you are eligible to claim a deduction for foreign service please select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.

Bydd rhyddhad am wasanaeth tramor yn ddyledus os nad oeddech 'yn preswylio neu fel arfer yn preswylio yn y DU' ar ryw adeg yn ystod eich cyflogaeth neu roeddech yn gymwys i gael Didyniad Enillion Morwyr (neu Ddidyniad Enillion Tramor cyn 6 Ebrill 1998).

Os oedd:

  • 75% o'ch gwasanaeth yn wasanaeth tramor (nid oeddech yn preswylio neu fel arfer yn preswylio yn y DU), neu
  • eich 10 mlynedd olaf yn wasanaeth tramor a drwyddi draw roedd eich gwasanaeth yn hwy na 10 mlynedd, neu
  • cyfanswm eich gwasanaeth yn 20 mlynedd neu'n hwy ac roedd ei hanner yn wasanaeth tramor (gan gynnwys unrhyw 10 o'r 20 mlynedd diwethaf)

cewch ryddhad am y gwasanaeth tramor llawn.

Os ydych yn gymwys i hawlio didyniad am wasanaeth tramor dewiswch 'lawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'.

English Content:
If you think you have paid too much tax you must tell HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) where you want any repayment to be sent. If you paid your tax due by credit or debit card, we will always try to repay back to the card you paid with first before making any repayment as requested. This will prevent delays.

If you did not pay by card and a repayment is due, HMRC will repay direct to your bank or building society account - this is the safest and quickest method - or you can authorise a nominee to receive your repayment.

To tell HMRC who you want to receive your repayment,  select an option from the drop-down menu below.

Please note: HMRC normally issue repayments within 2 weeks. But, HMRC monitor all online transactions and have measures in place to protect you against fraud. This may cause a slight delay in the repayment being issued. Please allow up to 4 weeks before contacting HMRC to chase up this repayment.
Welsh Content:
Os credwch eich bod wedi talu gormod o dreth, rhaid i chi roi gwybod i Gyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) i ble'r hoffech anfon yr ad-daliad. Os ydych wedi talu eich treth gan ddefnyddio cerdyn credyd neu ddebyd, byddwn bob amser yn ceisio ad-dalu'r arian i'ch cerdyn yn gyntaf, cyn gwneud unrhyw ad-daliad y gofynnir amdano. Bydd hyn yn osgoi oedi.

Os na wnaethoch dalu gan ddefnyddio cerdyn, a bod ad-daliad yn ddyledus, bydd CThEM yn ad-dalu'n uniongyrchol i'ch cyfrif banc neu gymdeithas adeiladu - dyma'r dull cyflymaf a mwyaf diogel - neu gallwch awdurdodi enwebai i gael eich taliad.

Dewiswch opsiwn o'r ddewislen isod er mwyn rhoi gwybod i CThEM pwy sydd am gael eich ad-daliad.

Sylwer: Mae CThEM fel arfer yn anfon ad-daliadau cyn pen 2 wythnos. Mae CThEM, fodd bynnag, yn monitro pob trafodyn ar-lein, ac mae ganddynt fesurau i'ch amddiffyn yn erbyn twyll. Gall hyn achosi ychydig o oedi cyn anfon yr ad-daliad. Dylech adael hyd at 4 wythnos cyn cysylltu â CThEM i wneud ymholiadau am yr ad-daliad hwn.

English Content:
You pay tax for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 on the profits for your 'basis period' for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017. In the first year or two that you are a partner, or when you leave the partnership, your basis period may not be the same as the partnership's accounting period (for which it prepares its accounts).

Help Sheet 222 - How to calculate your taxable profits provides details of the rules used to work out your basis period, and any adjustment needed to work out your profits for your basis period.

If the adjustment is negative, put a minus sign (-) before the figure.
Welsh Content:
Os nad yw'ch cyfnod sail yr un peth â chyfnod cyfrifyddu'r bartneriaeth, bydd angen i chi gyfrifo elw neu golled y cyfnod sail ac yna cymharu hyn â'ch cyfran chi o'r elw neu'r golled ar gyfer cyfnod cyfrifyddu'r bartneriaeth a ddaeth i ben yn 2016 i 2017. Os nad oes cyfnod cyfrifyddu yn dod i ben yn 2016 i 2017, nodwch eich cyfran chi o elw neu golled y bartneriaeth ar gyfer y cyfnod 6 Ebrill 2016 i 5 Ebrill 2017.

Nodwch yr addasiad sydd ei angen, hynny yw, y swm i'w ychwanegu at ffigur elw neu golled y bartneriaeth neu i'w dynnu ohono i bennu'r elw neu'r golled ar gyfer y cyfnod sail.

Os ydy'r ffigur yn negyddol, rhowch arwydd minws (-) cyn y ffigur.

English Content:
You must register for VAT with HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) if your business' VAT taxable turnover is more than £82,000. When you register, you’ll be sent a VAT registration certificate. This confirms:

  • your VAT number
  • when to submit your first VAT Return and payment
  • your 'effective date of registration' - this is the date you went over the threshold, or the date you asked to register if it was voluntary

See VAT Registration on GOV.UK
Welsh Content:
Mae'n rhaid i chi gofrestru ar gyfer TAW gyda Chyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) os yw trosiant trethadwy TAW eich busnes yn fwy nag £83,000.

Ar ôl cofrestru bydd tystysgrif cofrestru TAW yn cael ei hanfon atoch. Mae'r dystysgrif yn cadarnhau:

  • eich rhif TAW
  • pryd i gyflwyno eich Ffurflen TAW gynaf a'ch taliad cyntaf
  • y 'dyddiad y daw i rym' ar gyfer eich cofrestriad - hwn yw'r dyddiad yr aethoch dros y trothwy, neu'r dyddiad y gwnaethoch ofyn i gofrestru os oedd yn wirfoddol

Gweler VAT Registration ar GOV.UK

English Content:
There is a change of accounting date if:

  • you have drawn up your accounts to a date which isn't the same as the date used for tax purposes last year
  • you intend to draw up accounts for more than 12 months and no accounting date falls in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017
  • you changed your accounting date last year, this was not accepted by HM Revenue and Customs, and you've drawn up your accounts to the same date this year. (If you've changed back to your old date this isn't treated as a change of accounting date)

You will usually want your new accounting date to count for tax otherwise your basis period won't end on the same date as your accounts. If you intend this to be only a temporary change, you may wish to ignore it for tax purposes. You can then work out your tax using the same basis period as last year.

Select this box if you've changed your accounting date.
Welsh Content:
Bydd y dyddiad cyfrifyddu'n newid:

  • Os ydych yn llunio eich cyfrifon eich hun hyd at ddyddiad nad yw 'r un peth â'r dyddiad a ddefnyddiwyd at ddibenion treth y llynedd.
  • Os ydych yn bwriadu llunio cyfrifon ar gyfer cyfnod sy'n hwy na 12 mis ac nid oes dyddiad cyfrifyddu yn disgyn yn y flwyddyn dreth 2016 i 2017.
  • Os newidioch eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu'r llynedd ac ni chafodd ei dderbyn gan CThEM, ac rydych wedi llunio eich cyfrifon hyd at yr un dyddiad eleni. (Fodd bynnag os ydych wedi newid yn ôl i'r dyddiad blaenorol ni chaiff hyn ei drin fel newid yn y dyddiad cyfrifyddu).

Fel arfer byddwch am i'ch dyddiad cyfrifyddu newydd gyfrif at ddibenion treth, fel arall ni fydd eich cyfnod sail yn dod i ben ar yr un dyddiad â'ch cyfrifon. Fodd bynnag, os ydy'r newid hwn yn un dros dro yn unig, efallai yr hoffech ei anwybyddu at ddibenion treth. Gallwch wedyn gyfrifo eich treth gan ddefnyddio'r un cyfnod sail â'r llynedd.

Dewiswch y blwch gwirio hwn os ydych wedi newid eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu.

English Content:
Please include:

  • Widow's Pension or Bereavement Allowance*
  • Widowed Mother's or Widowed Parent's Allowance*
  • Industrial Death Benefit Pension*
  • Carer's Allowance*
  • Statutory Sick, Maternity, Paternity and Adoption Pay and Shared Parental Pay - but only if paid by HM Revenue and Customs (if paid by your employer you should include it in the 'Employment' section of your return)

*Please don't include the Christmas Bonus and Winter Fuel Payment, any Cold weather Payments, any additional amounts paid for child dependency or child allowance.
Welsh Content:
Dylech gynnwys:

  • Pensiwn Gweddwon neu Lwfans Profedigaeth*
  • Lwfans Mam Weddw neu Lwfans Rhiant Gweddw*
  • Pensiwn Budd-dal Marwolaeth Ddiwydiannol*
  • Lwfans Gofalwr*
  • Tâl Salwch, Tâl Mamolaeth, Tâl Tadolaeth a Thâl Mabwysiadu Statudol a Thâl Ar y Cyd i Rieni - ond dim os telir y rhain gan CThEM (os cafodd ei dalu gan gyflogwr dylech ei gynnwys ar y tudalennau Cyflogaeth).

*Peidiwch â chynnwys Bonws y Nadolig a Thaliad Tanwydd Gaeaf, Taliadau Tywydd Oer, symiau ychwanegol a delir ar gyfer plant dibynnol neu lwfans plant.

English Content:
To help you complete your return we have shown below information which we hold.

Once you have reviewed this information, it will be added to your return and you have the opportunity to amend or delete from the relevant sections. For more information, read the help notes.

The 'Information we hold on you' page will only be displayed once.
Welsh Content:
Er mwyn eich cynorthwyo i lenwi'ch Ffurflen Dreth, rydym wedi dangos yr wybodaeth sydd gennym isod.

Ar ôl i chi adolygu'r wybodaeth hon, caiff ei hychwanegu i'ch Ffurflen Dreth, a bydd gennych gyfle i ddiwygio neu ddileu'r hyn sydd yn yr adrannau perthnasol. Mae mwy o wybodaeth i'w chael ar y nodiadau cymorth.

Unwaith yn unig y dangosir y dudalen 'gwybodaeth sydd gennym yn eich cylch'.

English Content:
You can claim to have the loss relieved by reference to income of an earlier year.

There are 2 ways of doing this:

  • If your business was set up and commenced trading on or after 6 April 2013, you can claim relief for the loss calculated by reference to your income (but not capital gains) of the three years 2013 to 2014 to 2015 to 2016. The loss is first relieved by reference to your 2013 to 2014 income. If there is any balance of loss left, this is relieved by reference to your 2014 to 2015 income. Finally, any remainder is relieved by reference to your 2015 to 2016 income, or
  • You can claim relief for the loss to be calculated by reference to your income for 2015 to 2016. If the loss is more than your 2015 to 2016 income, you can, if you wish, claim relief for the balance of the loss to be calculated by reference to your capital gains for 2015 to 2016, or against your income or your income and capital gains of 2016 to 2017. This option is available to any business.

The amount of loss that you can claim may be restricted.

Do not make these claims if you used cash basis.

The time limit for these claims is 31 January 2019.

If your business ceased in 2016 to 2017 you can claim relief for losses in the final 12 months against profit in the same business in the 3 previous years. Start with the latest year.

The time limit for this claim is 5 April 2021.

These claims relate to 2016 to 2017 even though they are calculated by reference to your income or capital gains and circumstances of the earlier years. If you want to claim relief enter the total loss to be relieved by reference to earlier years income and gains or profits here and provide details of the amount for each year in the 'Any other information' field at the end of this section.

For more information see Help Sheet 227 - Losses.
Welsh Content:
Gallwch hawlio rhyddhad am y golled drwy gyfeirio at incwm blwyddyn flaenorol.

Mae 2 ffordd o wneud hyn:

  • os sefydlwyd eich busnes ac os dechreuodd fasnachu ar neu ar ôl 6 Ebrill 2012, gallwch hawlio rhyddhad am y golled sydd i'w gyfrifo drwy gyfeirio at eich incwm (ond nid enillion cyfalaf) o'r 3 blynedd 2012 i 2013 hyd at 2014 i 2016. Ceir rhyddhad gyntaf am y golled drwy gyfeirio at eich incwm yn 2012 i 2013. Os oes unrhyw golled yn weddill, ceir rhyddhad drwy gyfeirio at eich incwm yn 2013 i 2014. Yn olaf, ceir rhyddhad am unrhyw golled sy'n weddill drwy gyfeirio at eich incwm yn 2014 i 2016, neu
  • gallwch hawlio rhyddhad am y golled sydd i'w gyfrifo drwy gyfeirio at eich incwm ar gyfer 2014 i 2016. Os bydd y golled yn fwy na'ch incwm yn 2014 i 2016, gallwch hawlio rhyddhad am y golled sy'n weddill, os dymunwch, sydd i'w gyfrifo drwy gyfeirio at eich enillion cyfalaf ar gyfer 2014 i 2016, neu yn erbyn eich incwm neu eich incwm a'ch enillion cyfalaf o 2016 i 2017 . Mae'r opsiwn hwn ar gael i unrhyw fusnes.

Gellir cyfyngu ar swm y golled y gallwch ei hawlio.

Peidiwch â gwneud y ceisiadau hyn os gwnaethoch ddefnyddio sail arian parod.

Y dyddiad cau ar gyfer y ceisiadau hyn yw 31 Ionawr 2018.

Os daeth eich busnes i ben yn 2016 i 2017, gallwch hawlio rhyddhad am golledion yn y 12 mis olaf yn erbyn elw yn yr un busnes yn y 3 blynedd flaenorol. Dechreuwch gyda'r flwyddyn ddiweddaraf.

Y dyddiad cau ar gyfer y cais hwn yw 5 Ebrill 2020.

Mae'r rhain yn honiadau yn ymwneud â 2016 i 2017 er eu bod yn cael eu cyfrifo drwy gyfeirio at eich incwm neu enillion cyfalaf ac amgylchiadau'r blynyddoedd cynharach . Os ydych am hawlio rhyddhad nodwch gyfanswm y golled i gael ei ryddhau drwy gyfeirio at incwm ac enillion neu elw yma flynyddoedd cynharach ac yn darparu manylion am y swm ar gyfer pob blwyddyn yn y maes ' Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' ar ddiwedd yr adran hon.

Am ragor o wybodaeth, gweler Taflen Gymorth 227 - Losses.

English Content:
If you are employed as well as self-employed, the National Insurance Contributions and Employer Office may agree that some of your Class 4 National Insurance Contributions can be deferred until your overall contributions can be determined.

If your application for deferment is agreed, you will receive a certificate of deferment (form CA2703).

Only select 'Yes' if you have already been given a certificate of deferment otherwise, select 'No'.

For more information go to Defer your self-employed National Insurance.
Welsh Content:
