Os cytunir ar eich cais i ohirio, byddant yn anfon tystysgrif gohirio (ffurflen CA2703) atoch.

Dewiswch 'Iawn' dim ond os ydych eisoes wedi derbyn tystysgrif  gohirio, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'

English Content:
Include any:

  • rent for business premises
  • business and water rates
  • light, heat, power costs
  • property insurance
  • security
  • use of home as office (business proportion only)

Don't include:

  • costs of any non-business part of premises
  • costs of buying business premises

If you work from home you should keep details of the time spent, how much electricity and gas, for example, has been used and the area of your home used for business. HM Revenue and Customs can accept reasonable estimates where it is minor use.

  • yswiriant eiddo
  • diogelwch

Peidiwch â chynnwys:

  • costau unrhyw ran o eiddo nad ydyw at ddefnydd busnes
  • costau prynu eiddo busnes

Os ydych yn gweithio o gartref dylech gadw manylion yr amser a dreulir, faint o drydan a nwy, er enghraifft, a ddefnyddir a'r rhan o'ch cartref a ddefnyddir ar gyfer busnes. Gall Cyllid a Thollau EM dderbyn amcangyfrifon rhesymol pan fo defnydd bach.

English Content:
The tax credits relate to company dividends received by the partnership. The partnership's dividend voucher shows the amount of the dividend and the tax credit.

You will find this figure in box 26 on your partnership return.
Welsh Content:
Mae'r credydau treth mewn perthynas â difidendau cwmni a dderbyniwyd gan y bartneriaeth. Bydd taleb ddifidend y bartneriaeth yn dangos swm y difidend a'r credyd treth

Mae'r ffigur hwn i'w weld ym mlwch 26 ar ffurflen dreth eich partneriaeth.

English Content:
Enter the total indexation allowance, if any, for this disposal.

Indexation allowance gives you an allowance equal to the amount by which the cost of your asset would have risen if its value had kept pace with inflation between the time you acquired it or, if later, 31 March 1982, and April 1998. Any accumulated allowance, up to April 1998, may be taken into account for disposals after that date. There is no indexation allowance on assets acquired after 31 March 1998.

For further guidance and information, please see the Capital Gains Summary Notes (PDF 127K)

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com
Welsh Content:
Nodwch gyfanswm y lwfans mynegeio, os o gwbl, ar gyfer gwarediad hwn.

Mae lwfans mynegeio yn rhoi lwfans i chi sy'n gyfwerth â'r swm y byddai cost eich ased wedi codi petai ei werth wedi cadw i fyny â chwyddiant rhwng yr adeg y gwnaethoch ei gaffael, neu os yn hwyrach, 31 Mawrth 1982 ac Ebrill 1998. Gellir cymryd unrhyw lwfans cronedig, hyd at Ebrill 1998 i ystyriaeth ar gyfer gwarediadau ar ôl y dyddiad hwnnw. Does dim lwfans mynegeio ar gael ar asedion a gafaelwyd ar ôl 31 Mawrth 1998.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach ewch i Nodiadau Crynhoi Enillion Cyfalaf (PDF 127K)

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
You need to check if each of your foreign dividends qualify for the UK dividend tax credit because, although the tax credit is available in most cases, a number of qualifying conditions apply. Further information can be found in Foreign notes.

If this foreign dividend qualifies for the tax credit, choose 'Yes' from the drop-down menu. Otherwise choose 'No' if it doesn't qualify for the dividend tax credit.

Dewiswch 'Ydy' o'r gwymplen os ydy'r difidend tramor hwn yn gymwys am gredydau treth. Fel arall dewiswch 'Nac ydy' os nad yw'r difidend tramor hwn yn gymwys am gredyd treth difidend.

English Content: If the balance in your 'main pool' and/or 'special rate pool' after claiming Annual Investment Allowance, together with any balance carried forward from any previous year, less any amount you got from disposing of the equipment you no longer use, is £1,000 or less, you may claim that whole amount, or part of it, as a 'small pools allowance' instead of the 18% or 8% Writing Down Allowance. Enter the amount of this allowance in this field. The balance to carry forward will be nil.
Welsh Content: Os yw'r gweddill yn eich 'brif gronfeydd' a/neu'r 'cronfeydd cyfradd arbennig' sy'n weddill ar ol hawlio'r Lwfans Buddsoddi Blynyddol, ynghyd ag unrhyw swm a gariwyd ymlaen o unrhyw flwyddyn flaenorol, llai unrhyw swm a gawsoch wrth gael gwared ar yr offer nad ydych yn ei ddefnyddio bellach yn £1,000 neu lai, gallwch hawlio'r swm cyfan, neu ran ohono, fel 'lwfans cronfeydd bach' yn hytrach na'r 18% neu 8% o Lwfans ar Bapur. Nodwch swm y lwfans hwn yn y blwch hwn. Bydd y gweddill i'w gario ymlaen yn sero.

English Content:
If any of the following apply to you from 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 choose 'Yes' from the drop-down menu:

  • employee (with pay or benefits)
  • director (with pay or benefits)
  • office holder
  • agency worker
  • you received payments or benefits from a former employer (excluding a pension)

otherwise select 'No'.

For information

  • an office holder is someone such as a chairperson, secretary or treasurer of an organisation
  • you should use the Employment page to report income from any foreign employment, directorship or office
  • you'll need 1 Employment section for each employment, directorship etc

Don't complete the Employment pages if you:

  • held an office (but not as a director) and were only reimbursed for actual out of pocket expenses (no other payments were made to you at all)
  • were a company director but received no payments of any kind or benefits from that directorship
  • held an office or employment but no liability to UK Income Tax arises on those earnings because you were resident or domiciled outside the UK

If any of the above applies to you, add why you are not completing an Employment page in the 'Any other information' field and give the name of the particular directorship you are not submitting a page for.

If you fall into any of the categories that do not require an employment page this may result in HM Revenue and Customs deciding you no longer need to fill in a return.

If you think you will receive income from this source in future tax years, you should answer 'Yes' to this question and fill in the Employment section declaring nil income from the directorship, to save you having to re-register for Self Assessment.

Important

If you held 2 or more offices or employments with the same employer or associated employers, and earnings from one are chargeable to UK Income Tax but the earnings from the others aren't, you should complete an Employment page for each employment.
Welsh Content:
Os yw unrhyw un o'r canlynol yn berthnasol i chi o 6 Ebrill 2014 hyd at 5 Ebrill 2016, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen:

  • cyflogai (gyda chyflog neu fuddiannau)
  • cyfarwyddwr (gyda chyflog neu fuddiannau)
  • deiliad swydd
  • gweithiwr asiantaeth
  • derbynioch daliadau neu fuddiannau gan gyn gyflogwr (ac eithrio pensiwn)

fel arall, dewiswch 'Na': Er gwybodaeth

  • deiliad swydd yw rhywun sydd, er enghraifft, yn gadeirydd, ysgrifennydd neu'n drysorydd sefydliad
  • dylech ddefnyddio'r dudalen Cyflogaeth i nodi incwm o unrhyw gyflogaeth dramor, swydd fel cyfarwyddwr dramor neu fel deiliad swydd dramor
  • bydd angen un adran Cyflogaeth arnoch ar gyfer pob cyflogaeth, swydd fel cyfarwyddwr etc

Peidiwch â chwblhau'r tudalennau Cyflogaeth os:

  • oeddech yn dal swydd (ond nid oeddech yn gyfarwyddwr) a gwnaethoch dderbyn ad-daliadau dim ond am y treuliau a dalwyd yn wirioneddol gennych chi eich hun (ni wnaed unrhyw daliadau eraill i chi o gwbl)
  • oeddech yn gyfarwyddwr cwmni ond ni chawsoch unrhyw daliadau neu fuddiannau o gwbl am wneud y swydd honno fel cyfarwyddwr
  • oeddech yn dal swydd neu mewn cyflogaeth ond nid oes rhwymedigaeth i Dreth Incwm y DU yn codi ar yr enillion hynny oherwydd roeddech yn preswylio neu roedd eich domisil, y tu allan i'r DU

Os yw unrhyw un o'r uchod yn berthnasol i chi, nodwch yn y blwch 'unrhyw wybodaeth arall' pam nad ydych yn cwblhau tudalen Cyflogaeth a rhowch enw'r swydd benodol honno fel cyfarwyddwr nad ydych yn cyflwyno tudalen ar ei chyfer.

Os dewch o dan unrhyw gategori lle nad oes angen tudalen gyflogaeth, gallai hyn beri i Gyllid a Thollau EM benderfynu nad oes angen i chi lenwi ffurflen dreth mwyach. Os credwch y byddwch yn derbyn incwm o'r ffynhonnell hon yn y dyfodol, dylech ateb 'Iawn' i'r cwestiwn hwn a llenwi'r adran Cyflogaeth, gan ddatgan na chawsoch incwm o'r swydd fel cyfarwyddwr, i'ch arbed rhag gorfod ail-gofrestru ar gyfer Hunanasesiad.

Pwysig

Os oeddech yn dal 2 neu fwy o swyddi neu gyflogaethau gyda'r un cyflogwr neu gyflogwyr cysylltiedig, a bod enillion o un yn drethadwy o dan Dreth Incwm y DU ond yr enillion o'r llall ddim, dylech lenwi tudalen Cyflogaeth ar gyfer bob cyflogaeth.

English Content:
Select the check box if you received any other overseas income and gains.

This includes:

  • gains on disposals of holdings in offshore funds
  • payment or value of benefit received from a person abroad
  • gains on foreign life insurance policies, life annuities and capital redemption policies
  • discretionary income payments from non-resident trusts

Don't select this check box if you will show the relevant amounts in the 'Taxable amount' box for 'All other income received by a person abroad and any remitted 'ring fenced' foreign income'.

You should also check this box if you leave out any amounts from the 'Taxable amount' boxes because you're claiming an exemption in relation to a transfer of assets for:

  • dividend income received by a person abroad
  • all other income received by a person 'abroad' and any remitted 'ring fenced' foreign income
  • payment or value of benefit received from a person abroad
Welsh Content:
Dewiswch y blwch gwirio os cawsoch unrhyw incwm ac enillion tramor eraill.

Mae hyn yn cynnwys:

  • enillion wrth waredu daliadau mewn cronfeydd alltraeth (ac eithrio'r symiau a nodwyd yn y blwch 'Swm trethadwy' ar gyfer 'Pob incwm arall a gafwyd gan berson sydd dramor ac unrhyw incwm tramor a 'ddiogelwyd' ) ac incwm dewisiadol o ymddiriedolaethau dibreswyl
  • taliad neu werth buddiannau gan berson sydd dramor
  • enillion ar bolisïau yswiriant bywyd dramor, blwydd-daliadau bywyd a pholisïau adbrynu cyfalaf
  • os ydych wedi hepgor incwm o'r blychau 'Swm trethadwy' ar gyfer 'Pob incwm arall a gafwyd gan berson sydd dramor ac incwm a ddiogelwyd ac a drosglwyddwyd i'r DU', 'Incwm difidend a gafwyd gan berson sydd dramor' neu o 'Daliad neu werth buddiant a gafwyd gan berson sydd dramor', oherwydd eich bod yn hawlio rhyddhad mewn perthynas â throsglwyddo asedion
  • taliadau incwm dewisol gan ymddiriedolaethau nad ydynt yn breswyl

Dylech, fodd bynnag, wirio'r blwch hwn hefyd os byddwch yn hepgor unrhyw symiau o'r blychau 'Swm trethadwy' oherwydd eich bod yn hawlio eithriad mewn perthynas â throsglwyddiad asedion ar gyfer: Dylech, fodd bynnag, wirio'r blwch hwn hefyd os byddwch yn hepgor unrhyw symiau o'r blychau 'Swm trethadwy' oherwydd eich bod yn hawlio eithriad mewn perthynas â throsglwyddiad asedion ar gyfer:

  • Incwm difidend a dderbyniwyd gan berson tramor'
  • Pob incwm arall a dderbyniwyd gan berson tramor' ac unrhyw incwm tramor a ddiogelwyd a drosglwyddwyd
  • Taliad neu werth budd-dal a dderbyniwyd gan berson tramor

English Content:
If the partnership:

  • carries on the business of farming or market gardening
  • has income from selling or allowing others to reproduce literary or artistic works which were created by one or more of the partners

you may be able to claim an adjustment for 'averaging'.

For more information please view the:

  • Help Sheet 224 - Farmers and market gardeners
  • Help Sheet 234 - Averaging for creators of literary or artistic works

Enter in this field the amount by which your profit is changed by the averaging claim. Put a minus sign (-) before the figure if the adjustment reduces your profit. This entry does not change the amount of any loss to be included later in the return.
Welsh Content:
Os yw'r bartneriaeth:

  • yn cynnal y busnes ffermio neu arddio masnachol
  • yn cael incwm drwy werthu gwaith llenyddol neu artistig a grëwyd gan un neu fwy o'r partneriaid neu o ganiatáu i eraill ei atgynhyrchu efallai y gallwch hawlio addasiad ar gyfer 'cyfartalu'.

Am fwy o wybodaeth gweler:

  • Taflen Gymorth 224 Farmers and market gardeners (PDF 84K)
  • Taflen Gymorth 234 Averaging for creators of literary or artistic works (PDF 68K)

Nodwch y swm y newidir eich elw gan y cais am gyfartalu yn y blwch hwn. Rhowch arwydd minws (-) o flaen y ffigur os bydd yr addasiad yn gostwng eich elw. Nid yw'r cofnod hwn yn newid swm unrhyw golled i'w chynnwys yn ddiweddarach ar y ffurflen dreth.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach gweler y Nodiadau ar Partneriaeth (Llawn) (PDF 84K)

I fwrw golwg ar y nodiadau arweiniad y mae angen i chi ddefnyddio porwr PDF. Gallwch gael un yn www.adobe.com

English Content:
Expenses payments received

The information to complete this field can be found on your P11D form section N box 16, provided by your employer.

  • travelling and subsistence - include the amounts for fares, hotels, meals etc. including travel between home and a permanent workplace. Don't include reimbursements of expenses in connection with a company car or van
  • entertainment - include all sums reimbursed, any round sum payments, any specific entertainment allowance and any sums paid to third parties
  • general expenses allowance

You will need to add together all the amounts in section N on your P11D. Enter the total figure.

Balancing charges

This will only apply if you dispose of an asset for which you received capital allowances (and it cannot apply to motor vehicles). If you think you may be affected please contact HM Revenue and Customs.

Further guidance and information on balancing charges.
Welsh Content:
Taliadau treuliau a gafwyd

Mae'r wybodaeth i gwblhau'r blwch hwn i'w chael ym mlwch 16 yn adran N ar eich ffurflen P11D. Rhoddodd eich cyflogwr y ffurflen hon i chi.

  • teithio a chynhaliaeth – dylech gynnwys y swm ar gyfer tocynnau, gwestai, prydau ac ati, gan gynnwys teithio rhwng y cartref a'r gweithle parhaol. Peidiwch â chynnwys ad-daliadau am dreuliau mewn perthynas â char neu fan cwmni
  • adloniant – nodwch bob swm a ad-dalwyd, unrhyw daliadau swm crwn , unrhyw lwfans adloniant penodol ac unrhyw symiau a dalwyd i drydydd parti
  • lwfans treuliau cyffredinol

Bydd angen i chi adio'r symiau yn adran N ar eich P11D at ei gilydd. Nodwch y cyfanswm.

Taliadau mantoli

Dim ond os ydych yn cael gwared ar ased y gwnaethoch gael lwfansau cyfalaf amdani y bydd hyn yn berthnasol (ac ni all fod yn gymwys i gerbydau modur). Os ydych o'r farn y gallai hyn effeithio arnoch, cysylltwch â Chyllid a Thollau EM.

Rhagor o arweiniad a gwybodaeth am daliadau mantoli.

English Content:
The scheme reference number or promoter reference number

If you've used a scheme or arrangement to obtain tax advantage that you're required to disclose and you:

  • have been issued with a scheme reference number in tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017
  • expect to receive a tax advantage from the scheme or arrangement in tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 or in a period covered by a future return

you should enter the scheme reference number(s) and the tax year in which you expect to gain the tax advantage in this section, even if you've entered the reference number on a previous tax return.

In most cases you'll have received the scheme reference number from the scheme promoter on form AAG6, but in some cases you may have received the number direct from HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC).

You should not use this section if you're an employer and the notifiable arrangements concerned are arrangements connected with employment. A scheme reference number for employment products should be notified separately using form AAG4.

Tax advantage here means:

  • relief or increased relief from, or repayment or increased repayment of, Income Tax or capital gains tax, or the avoidance or reduction of a charge to that tax or an assessment to that tax or the avoidance of a possible assessment to that tax
  • the deferral of any payment of tax or the advancement of any repayment of tax
  • the avoidance of any obligation to deduct or account for any tax

If you were party to more than 3 schemes, you should report details of the additional schemes on form AAG4 Disclosure of avoidance scheme.

If you don't disclose a scheme or arrangement to obtain a tax advantage that you're required to disclose you'll be liable to a penalty.

Further information on the rules for disclosure of tax avoidance schemes and arrangements.

The tax year in which the expected advantage arises

Enter the year that the expected tax or National Insurance contributions advantage first arises.

This may be:

  • the year to 5 April 2017, put 2016 to 2017
  • a future year, for example 2017 to 2018
  • an earlier year, for example 2015 to 2016, if this is the first time you have reported the SRN and you included it in a previous tax return, you must carry on reporting until there is no tax advantage
Welsh Content:
Cyfeirnod y cynllun neu gyfeirnod yr hyrwyddwr

Os ydych wedi defnyddio cynllun neu drefniant i gael mantais dreth y mae'n ofynnol i chi ei datgelu a:

  • rhoddwyd cyfeirnod cynllun i chi yn 2016 i 2017
  • disgwyliwch dderbyn mantais dreth o'r cynllun neu drefniant yn 2016 i 2017 neu gyfnod sy'n cael ei gwmpasu gan ffurflen dreth yn y dyfodol

dylech nodi'r cyfeirnod(au) a'r flwyddyn dreth yr ydych yn disgwyl ennill y fantais dreth ynddi yn yr adran hon, hyd yn oed os ydych wedi nodi'r cyfeirnod ar ffurflen dreth flaenorol.

Yn y rhan fwyaf o achosion byddwch wedi derbyn cyfeirnod y cynllun oddi wrth hyrwyddwr y cynllun ar ffurflen AAG6, ond mewn rhai achosion efallai eich bod wedi derbyn y rhif yn uniongyrchol gan Gyllid a Thollau (CThEM).

Ni ddylech ddefnyddio'r ffurflen hon os ydych yn gyflogwr ac mae'r trefniadau i'w hysbysu sydd o dan sylw yn drefniadau sy'n gysylltiedig â chyflogaeth. Dylai cyfeirnod ar gyfer cynhyrchion cyflogaeth gael ei nodi ar wahân gan ddefnyddio ffurflen AAG4.

Mae mantais dreth yma'n golygu:

  • rhyddhad neu ryddhad wedi'i gynyddu rhag, neu ad-daliad neu ad-daliad wedi'i gynyddu o, Dreth Incwm neu dreth enillion cyfalaf, neu osgoi neu leihau costau ar gyfer y dreth honno neu asesu'r dreth honno neu osgoi asesiad posibl o'r dreth honno
  • gohirio unrhyw daliad o dreth neu ddyrchafu unrhyw ad-daliad o dreth

English Content:
When basis periods overlap (for example in the first 2 years of business or following a change in accounting date) you should keep a record of both the overlap profit and the overlap period. The overlap profit is carried forward each year until you are able to claim overlap relief.

Overlap profit carried forward

The amount to enter here will be the overlap profit carried forward from previous years, plus any new overlap profits this year minus any entry in the 'Overlap relief used for the year 2016 to 2017' field.
Welsh Content:
Pan fydd cyfnodau sail yn gorgyffwrdd (er enghraifft yn nwy flynedd gyntaf y busnes yn dilyn newid yn y dyddiad cyfrifyddu) dylech gadw cofnod o'r elw gorgyffwrdd yn ogystal â'r cyfnod gorgyffwrdd. Caiff yr elw gorgyffwrdd ei gario ymlaen bob blwyddyn tan eich bod yn gallu hawlio rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd.

Elw gorgyffwrdd a gariwyd ymlaen

Y swm i'w nodi yma bydd yr elw gorgyffwrdd a gariwyd ymlaen o flynyddoedd cynharach yn ogystal ag unrhyw elw gorgyffwrdd newydd eleni llai unryw sam a nofwyd y blwch 'Rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd a ddefnyddiwyd ar gyfer y flwyddyn 2016 i 2017.

English Content:
If the sale or disposal was under a contract, the date of sale is usually the date of the contract. If, unusually, the contract was conditional, so that one or more conditions had to be met before the contract became binding, the date of sale, or disposal, is the date on which the last of the conditions was met.

Where there was no contract, the date of sale, or disposal, is when ownership was transferred. Or if you received a capital sum from an asset but did not actually dispose of it, the date you received the money is treated as the date of disposal.
Welsh Content:
Os oedd y gwerthiant neu'r gwaredu o dan gytundeb, fel arfer y dyddiad gwerthu yw dyddiad y cytundeb Os, yn anarferol, roedd y cytundeb yn un amodol, fel bod rhaid i un neu ragor o amodau gael eu cyflawni cyn bod y cytundeb yn dod yn gyfrwymol, y dyddiad gwerthu neu'r dyddiad gwaredu yw'r dyddiad pan gyflawnwyd yr amod diwethaf.

Pan nad oedd cytundeb yn bodoli, y dyddiad gwerth neu'r dyddiad caffael yw pan drosglwyddwyd perchnogaeth yr ased. Neu os derbyniwyd swm cyfalaf o ased ond ni wnaethoch ei waredu, ystyrir mai'r dyddiad gwaredu yw'r dyddiad a gawsoch yr arian.

English Content:
Please add a short description of why this figure is different to the one quoted. Please tell us the name and date of the document you are using to complete this figure. You can not enter more than 200 characters here.

You may obtain the figure from a Notice of Entitlement or Form BR735 provided by the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP).

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 or 6 April 2018 to 5 April 2019 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HMRC know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.
Welsh Content:
Ychwanegwch ddisgrifiad byr i nodi pam fod y ffigur hwn yn wahanol i'r un a ddyfynnwyd. Rhowch enw a dyddiad y ddogfen rydych yn ei defnyddio i gwblhau'r ffigur hwn. Ni allwch nodi mwy na 200 yma.

Gallwch gael y ffigur o Hysbysiad Hawliad neu Ffurflen BR735 a roddir gan yr Adran Gwaith a Phensiynau.

English Content:
If all you have is a redundancy payment up to £30,000 against which your employer has allowed an exemption, enter the amount of the payment. For example, if you received a redundancy payment of £10,000 it would be covered by the £30,000 exemption so do not make an entry in 'Redundancy and other lump sum and compensation payments' and enter £10,000 here.

If your redundancy payment is more than the £30,000 exemption limit, enter the amount over the limit in 'Redundancy and other lump sum and compensation payments', the tax deducted in 'Tax taken off boxes above' and the £30,000 limit here.

If your payment was £40,000 you would enter £10,000 in 'Redundancy and other lump sum and compensation payments', the tax deducted in 'Tax taken off boxes above' and £30,000 here.

The maximum exemption is £30,000 for each job however jobs with the same employer, or with employers under the same or common control, count as 1 job. For example, if you received redundancy payments from 2 companies in the same group, you only get one exemption of up to £30,000. If your termination settlement extends to more than 1 year you can carry forward any unused exemption.

For further guidance and information if the payment was less straightforward, see the notes and Working Sheet in the Additional information notes.
Welsh Content:
Os mai taliad diswyddo o hyd at £30,000 yw'r unig beth sydd gennych ac mae eich cyflogwr wedi caniatáu eithriad nodwch swm y taliad. Er enghraifft, os cewch dâl diswyddo o £10,000 byddai wedi ei gwmpasu gan yr eithriad o £30,000. Felly, peidiwch â chofnodi unrhyw beth yn 'Cyfandaliadau diswyddo a thaliadau iawndal eraill' a nodwch £10,000 yma.

Os ydy eich tâl diswyddo yn fwy na'r terfyn rhyddhad o £30,000 nodwch y swm sydd uwchben y terfyn yn 'Cyfandaliadau diswyddo a thaliadau iawndal eraill', y dreth a ddidynnwyd yn 'Treth a ddidynnwyd o'r blychau uchod' a'r terfyn o £30,000 yma.

Os oedd eich taliad yn £40,000 byddech yn nodi £10,000 yn 'Cyfandaliadau diswyddo a thaliadau iawndal eraill' y dreth a ddidynnwyd yn y blwch 'Treth a ddidynnwyd o'r blychau uchod' a £30,000 yma.

Uchafswm y rhyddhad yw £30,000 ar gyfer pob swydd, fodd bynnag mae swyddi gyda'r un cyflogwr, neu gyda chyflogwyr o dan yr un rheolaeth neu reolaeth gyffredin yn cyfrif fel un swydd. Er enghraifft, os cewch daliadau diswyddo o ddau gwmni yn yr un grŵp, cewch un swm o ryddhad o hyd at £30,000 yn unig. Os bydd eich setliad terfynu yn ymestyn dros fwy nag un flwyddyn gallwch gario'r rhyddhad sydd heb ei ddefnyddio ymlaen.

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach os oedd y taliad yn fwy cymhleth, gweler y nodiadau a'r Daflen Waith yn y Nodiadau gwybodaeth ychwanegol.

English Content: For most new items which you have bought you can claim 'first year allowances'. Small businesses can claim 50% first year allowances on their investments in equipment and machinery, excluding cars, long life assets or leased machinery. Medium sized businesses can claim 40%. These items, at their reduced value, should go into the main pool in the 2nd year, unless they have been used privately in which case they will go into their own 'single asset' pool. (You do not have to claim 1st year allowance if you do not want to, instead add the cost to the relevant pool.)
Welsh Content: Gallwch hawlio lwfansau blwyddyn gyntaf ar gyfer y rhan fwyaf o eitemau newydd a brynwyd gennych. Gall busnesau bach hawlio lwfansau blwyddyn gyntaf o 50% ar eu buddsoddiadau ar gyfarpar a pheiriannau ac eithrio ceir, asedion ac oes hir neu beiriannau ar brydles. Gall busnesau o faint canolig hawlio 40%. Dylid cynnwys gwerth gostyngol yr eitemau hyn yn y gronfa yn yr ail flwyddyn oni bai y cawsant eu defnyddio yn breifat. Yn yr achos hwnnw dylent gael eu cynnwys mewn cronfa 'ased unigol'. Does dim rhaid i chi hawlio'r lwfans blwyddyn gyntaf yn lle hynny gallwch ychwanegu'r gost i'r gronfa berthnasol.)

English Content:
The attachments feature is not intended for you to send general correspondence or information about issues unrelated to the Tax Return.

It should not normally be necessary to send an attachment with your Tax Return. All of your tax liability must be declared within the Tax Return. If you want to provide further information you may be able to enter this in the 'Any other information' field, or if you have a query, you can Ask HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) a question.

If HMRC require you to send an attachment with your Tax Return, this will be clear from the Tax Return itself or from the additional guidance provided in the form of Help Sheets.

HMRC will reject any attachment that is not in PDF format or contains a virus.

In order to safeguard HMRC services to customers, there are limits on the size and number of attachments that can be accepted.

Please select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu you need to send an attachment otherwise, select 'No'

You are reminded that if you do not successfully submit your Tax Return, with or without attachments, by the 31 January deadline, you will incur a late filing penalty.
Welsh Content:
Ni fwriadwyd i'r nodwedd ar gyfer atodiadau gael ei defnyddio er mwyn i chi anfon gohebiaeth gyffredinol atom ynglŷn â materion nad ydynt yn ymwneud â'r Ffurflen Dreth.

Fel arfer ni ddylai fod angen anfon atodiad gyda'ch Ffurflen Dreth. Rhaid datgan eich holl rwymedigaeth i dreth o fewn y Ffurflen Dreth Os ydych am ddarparu gwybodaeth bellach efallai y gallech ei nodi yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' neu os oes gennych ymholiad Gofynnwch gwestiwn i Gyllid a Thollau EM.

Os bydd CThEM am i chi anfon atodiad atom gyda'ch Ffurflen Dreth, bydd hyn yn eglur o'ch Ffurflen Dreth ei hun neu o'r arweiniad pellach a roddir yn y Taflenni Cymorth.

Bydd CThEM yn gwrthod unrhyw atodiad nad yw mewn fformat PDF neu sy'n cynnwys firws.

Er mwyn diogelu gwasanaethau CThEM i gwsmeriaid, mae yna derfynau ar faint a nifer yr atodiadau y gellir eu derbyn.

Dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen os oes angen i anfon atodiad, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'

Fe'ch atgoffir os nad ydych yn cyflwyno eich Ffurflen Dreth yn llwyddiannus, ynghŷd â neu heb atodiadau, erbyn dyddiad cau 31 Ionawr, fe godir cosb am gyflwyno'n hwyr arnoch.

English Content:
You can't claim any allowances for plant or machinery provided for use in a dwelling house.

The following guidance only applies if you have a 'standard' 12 month accounting period and summarise the allowances available. If your accounting period is shorter or longer than a year, or began before 6 April 2016, or if you want to know more about capital allowances, Capital allowances and balancing charges:HS252 (which includes worked examples). Alternatively contact HM Revenue and Customs or your tax adviser.

Business and private use

Where you use an item of equipment for both business and private purposes, the allowances you claim should be reduced by the amount of your private use. To do this, calculate the capital allowances due for each item which has any private use separately using a 'single asset pool' and reduce the allowances you claim by the private use proportion.

You may also be entitled to other types of capital allowances depending on the cost, type of asset, and qualifying conditions, such as:

  • 18% Writing Down Allowance (WDA)
  • 8% WDA
  • 'small pools allowance'
  • 100% capital allowances
  • restricted annual allowance for cars costing more than £12,000 bought before 6 April 2009

Enter the total of any of these allowances here.

There are new rules for claiming capital allowances if you buy, sell or lease a property containing fixtures.

For more information go to the Notes on UK property and Capital allowances.
Welsh Content:
Mae'r arweiniad isod yn gymwys dim ond os oes gennych gyfnod cyfrifyddu 'safonol' o 12 mis ac mae crynodeb o'r lwfansau ar gael. Os ydy eich cyfnod cyfrifyddu'n fyrrach neu'n hwy na blwyddyn, neu os y dechreuodd cyn 6 Ebrill 2016, neu os ydych am wybod mwy am lwfansau cyfalaf, yna darllenwch Daflen Gymorth 252 - Capital allowances and balancing charges (sy'n cynnwys enghreifftiau), neu cysylltwch a Chyllid a Thollau EM neu eich cynghorydd treth.

Defnydd busnes a phreifat

Pan fyddwch yn defnyddio eitem o gyfarpar at ddibenion busnes yn ogystal a phreifat, dylai'r lwfans a hawliwch gael eu gostwng gan swm eich defnydd preifat. I wneud hyn, cyfrifwch y lwfansau cyfalaf sy'n ddyledus ar gyfer pob eitem sydd ag unrhyw ddefnydd preifat ar wahân gan ddefnyddio cronfa ased unigol, gan ostwng y lwfansau a hawliwch gan y gyfran at ddefnydd preifat.

Gallai fod hawl gennych hefyd i fathau eraill o lwfansau ,cyfalaf yn dibynnu ar y gost, math o ased, ac amodau cymhwyso, er enghraifft:

  • lwfans ar bapur (WDA) o 18 %
  • lwfans ar bapur (WDA) o 8 %
  • lwfans cronfeydd bach
  • lwfansau cyfalaf 100 y cant
  • lwfans blynyddol cyfyngedig ar gyfer ceir sy'n costio mwy na £12,000 a brynwyd cyn 6 Ebrill 2009
  • lwfans adeiladau amaethyddol neu ddiwydiannol - sy'n ddyledus ar unrhyw adeiladau amaethyddol, adeiladau diwydiannol a rhai adeiladau penodol eraill

Nodwch yma gyfanswm unrhyw rai o'r lwfansau hyn.

Am fwy o arweiniad a gwybodaeth, gweler y Nodiadau ar Eiddo yn y DU ac ewch i www.gov.uk/business-tax/capital-allowance.

English Content:
Box J deals with further exemptions that may reduce the figure in box C. Add together any amounts included in box C that were:

  • funded by contributions made by your employer before 6 April 2008 but you were taxed on the contributions in the year they were made (HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) may ask you about these)
  • paid because of your own contributions
  • from an overseas scheme (there are more conditions attached to this (you must qualify under Extra Statutory Concession A10) contact your HMRC office if you are not sure)
Welsh Content:
Mae blwch J yn delio gydag eithriadau pellach a all gostwng y ffigur ym mlwch C. Ychwanegwch at ei gilydd unrhyw symiau sydd ym mlwch C os oeddent:

  • wedi eu hariannu gan gyfraniadau a wnaed gan eich cyflogwr cyn 6 Ebrill 2008 ond roeddech wedi eich trethu ar y cyfraniadau yn y flwyddyn y cawsant eu gwneud (efallai bydd Cyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) yn eich holi ynghylch y rhain)
  • wedi eu talu oherwydd cyfraniadau chi'ch hun
  • o gynllun dramor (mae yna ragor o amodau ynghlwm i hyn - rhaid i chi fod yn gymwys o dan Gonsesiwn All-statudol A10 (cysylltwch â'ch swyddfa CThEM os nad ydych yn sicr)

English Content:
Enter the total due to you in the year to 5 April 2017, before any tax was taken off the payments.

If any non-cash benefits were provided you will have to work out their cash value or equivalent.

If you need help with this, look at Chapter 27 in the 480 booklet 'Expenses and Benefits: A Tax Guide', or refer to the guidance in the Employment Income Manual (EIM) (references to the EIM are given in brackets below).

Exclude from this total any:

  • payments from HM Revenue and Customs registered pension schemes
  • payments from foreign government retirement benefit schemes
  • benefits (other than relevant benefits from an Employer Financed Retirement Benefits Scheme (EFRBS). See the guidance notes for further information and detail about other relevant benefits) received or provided while you were still an employee
  • payment for counselling services received on leaving (EIM13745)
  • legal costs paid by your employer to your solicitor as part of a termination settlement compensating for the loss of your employment (EIM13740)
  • special payments made by your employer into a registered pension scheme as part of the termination arrangements (EIM13735)
  • lump sums paid to members of the armed forces paid under Royal Warrant, Queen's Order or Order in Council

For further guidance and information, see the notes and Working Sheet in the Additional information notes.
Welsh Content:
Nodwch y cyfanswm sy'n ddyledus i chi yn y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017, cyn bod unrhyw dreth wedi'i thynnu o'r taliadau.

Os darparwyd unrhyw fuddiannau nad oeddynt ar ffurf arian, bydd angen i chi gyfrifo eu cyfwerth mewn arian neu swm tebyg.

Os oes angen cymorth arnoch, edrychwch ar Bennod 27 yn llyfryn 480 'Expenses and Benefits: A Tax Guide' neu cyfeiriwch at yr arweiniad yn yr ‘Employment Income Manual’ (EIM) yn www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/index.htm (rhoddir cyfeiriadau i'r EIM yn y cromfachau isod)

Ni ddylech gynnwys y canlynol yn y cyfanswm hwn:

  • taliadau o gynlluniau pensiwn a gofrestrwyd gyda Chyllid a Thollau EM
  • taliadau o gynlluniau buddiannau ymddeol llywodraethau tramor
  • buddiannau (ac eithrio buddiannau perthnasol o Gynllun Buddiannau Ymddeol a Ariannwyd gan Gyflogwr (EFRBS). Gweler y nodiadau arweiniad am wybodaeth bellach a manylion ynglŷn â buddiannau perthnasol eraill) a gafwyd neu a ddarparwyd tra roeddech yn dal yn gyflogai
  • taliad am wasanaethau cynghori a roddwyd pan wnaethoch adael (gweler EIM13745)
  • costau cyfreithiol a dalwyd gan eich cyflogwr i'ch cyfreithiwr fel rhan o setliad terfynu yn eich digolledu am golli eich swydd (gweler EIM13740)
  • taliadau arbennig a wnaed gan eich cyflogwr i gynllun pensiwn cofrestredig fel rhan o'r trefniadau terfynu (gweler EIM13735)
  • cyfandaliadau a dalwyd i aelodau'r lluoedd arfog a dalwyd o dan Warant Frenhinol, Gorchymyn y Frenhines neu Orchymyn y Cyfrin Gyngor

Am arweiniad a gwybodaeth bellach gweler y nodiadau a'r Daflen Waith yn y Nodiadau gwybodaeth ychwanegol.

English Content: Amend other property assets summary
Welsh Content: Diwygio crynodeb o asedion ar ffurf eiddo

English Content: Foreign Property
Welsh Content: Eiddo tramor

English Content:
If you need help with this, please look at Chapter 27 in the 480 booklet 'Expenses and Benefits: A Tax Guide', or refer to the guidance in the Employment Income Manual (EIM) at www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/index.htm (references to the EIM are given in brackets below)

Please enter the total of:

  • any salary included in the lump sum that was due to you on leaving
  • holiday pay
  • payments in lieu of notice, whether contractual or paid habitually by the employer (other than damages) (see EIM12975-12979)
  • bonus payments
  • compensation for changes in your employment terms
  • payments made to guarantee your future conduct ('restrictive covenants') for example, agreeing not to compete with your former employer (see EIM3600+)
  • any other contractual amount or benefit excluding contractual redundancy payments or benefits
Welsh Content:
Os oes angen cymorth arnoch, edrychwch ar Bennod 27 yn llyfryn 480 'Treuliau a Buddiannau: Canllaw Treth' neu cyfeiriwch at yr arweiniad yn y Llawlyfr Incwm Cyflogaeth (EIM) yn www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/index.htm (rhoddir cyfeiriadau i'r EIM yn y cromfachau isod)

Nodwch gyfanswm:

  • unrhyw gyflog a gynhwyswyd yn y cyfandaliad a roddwch i chi pan wnaethoch adael
  • cyflog gwyliau
  • taliadau yn lle rhybydd diswyddo, p'un ai o dan gytundeb neu a delir yn arferol gan y cyflogwr (oni bai am iawndal) (gweler EIM 12975-12979)
  • taliadau bonws
  • iawndal ar gyfer newidiadau yn nhelerau eich cyflogaeth
  • taliadau a wnaed i warantu eich ymddygiad yn y dyfodol ('cyfamodau cyfyngu') er enghraifft, cytuno i beidio â chystadlu yn erbyn eich cyn gyflogwr (gweler EIM3600+)
  • unrhyw swm neu fuddiant cytundebol ac eithrio taliadau neu fuddiannau diswyddo o dan gytundeb.

English Content:
This refers to the Income Tax charge on benefits received where you have owned or contributed to the acquisition of property (pre-owned assets). Further examples of the types of benefit which might lead to a tax charge can be found in the Inheritance Tax Manual - section IHTM44000.

Property here means land and buildings or chattels (for example, works of art, furniture, antiques, cars or yachts) or any assets held in a settlement other than land or chattels.

You may have to pay tax if you meet both of the following conditions.
The first condition is that during 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 you:

  • occupied land without paying a full market rent for it
  • used or had possession of chattels without paying fully for the benefit
  • could benefit from settled property where income from the property you have settled is treated as yours for income tax purposes. (Note this condition is not met if the income is treated as yours only because your spouse or civil partner can benefit.)

The second condition is that at some time since 17 March 1986, you:

  • owned the land or chattels you are now benefiting from
  • owned and disposed of other assets and used the proceeds of that disposal to acquire the lands and chattels you are now benefiting from
  • gave assets to someone else, including cash, and they used it to acquire, directly or indirectly, the land or chattels you are now benefiting from (Please note: 'Gave' in this instance includes sales or part sales to connected parties and sales at an undervalue)
  • you settled assets into the trust from which you can benefit

The amount of benefit on which you will pay tax is:

  • for land and buildings the annual open market rent you could obtain if you let the land (including buildings), less any rent you actually paid in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017; further guidance can be found in the Inheritance Tax Manual - section IHTM44010.
  • for chattels - interest at the prescribed rate on the capital value of the chattels, less any rent you actually paid in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017; further guidance can be found in the Inheritance Tax Manual - section IHTM44016.
  • for assets other than land or chattels - interest at the prescribed rate on the capital value of the assets, less any tax chargeable on any income and gains arising; further guidance can be found in the Inheritance Tax Manual - section IHTM44025.

The prescribed rate is the official rate of interest at the valuation date, which for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 is 4%.The annual open market rent for land or the capital value of chattels is the figure that applied when you first had to pay tax in respect of pre-owned assets. That value then applies for the next 5 tax years. If you started paying tax in respect of pre-owned assets in tax year 6 April 2006 to 5 April 2007, you will need to have re-established the annual open market rent of the land or capital value of chattels as at 6 April 2011 (or the date that the benefit actually began if later in the tax year) to give the value to use for tax years 6 April 2011 to 5 April 2012 until 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017.

If the benefit arises from assets other than land or chattels in a settlement, the capital value must be established at the start of each tax year (or the date that the benefit actually began if later in the tax year).

If you disposed of, or contributed to, only part of the property that you now benefit from or if you have only benefited for part of the year or if you still retain part of the property, the charge is reduced.

Please enter in the 'Any other information' field at the end of the 'Fill in your return' section, how you worked out the benefit or charge that you are now entering here.

If the benefit is from a settlement and tax is payable on the settlement income, then deduct that tax from the benefit you are entering in the 'Tax taken off income' field and provide full details in the 'Any other information' field at the end of the 'Fill in your return' section.

You will not have to pay the Income Tax charge on the benefit if:

  • the property you are benefiting from now could be liable to Inheritance Tax when you die (which includes assets subject to a reservation of benefit' for Inheritance Tax purposes, or which would be subject to a reservation if you did not pay full consideration for the use of the land or chattels) or
  • the total benefit for the year is £5,000 or less (before deducting any rent actually paid) or
  • you gave cash that directly or indirectly funded the acquisition of the assets you benefit from now and the gift was made before 6 April 2006. (Please note that this date applies where you are first chargeable to tax in the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017, you will never be subject to a POA charge for cash gifts made before 6 April 1998).

There are several exclusions and exemptions from the charge. For help with deciding whether you are liable and how to work out your benefit further guidance can be found in the Inheritance Tax Manual - section IHTM44000 or the Probate and Inheritance Tax Helpline on Telephone 0300 123 1072.

You do not have to pay this Income Tax charge if you elect within the required time scale for your estate to pay the Inheritance Tax on the property when you die. Full details about elections, including how and when to elect and the form to use, are available in the Inheritance Tax Manual - section IHTM44070. You can also get the election form IHT500 and its guidance notes IHT501 from the Probate and Inheritance Tax Helpline on Telephone 0300 123 1072.
Welsh Content:
Mae hwn yn cyfeirio at y Dreth Incwm a godir ar fuddiannau a gawsoch pan oeddech yn berchen neu wedi cyfrannu at gaffael eiddo (eiddo roeddech yn berchen arnynt eisoes). Ar gyfer enghreifftiau pellach o'r mathau o fuddion allai arwain at godi treth gweler arweiniad POA yn y Canllaw Treth Etifeddiant ar ein gwefan yn [IHTM44000]. Mae eiddo yma'n golygu tir ac adeiladau, eiddo personol (er enghraifft, gweithiau celf, dodrefn neu hynafolion, ceir neu gychod hwylio) ac unrhyw beth arall a gedwir mewn setliad ar wahân i dir neu eiddo personol.

Mae eiddo yma'n golygu tir ac adeiladau neu eiddo personol (er enghraifft, gweithiau celf, dodrefn, hynafolion, ceir neu gychod hwylio) ac unrhyw asedion a gedwir mewn setliad ar wahân i dir neu eiddo personol.

Efallai y bydd yn rhaid i chi dalu treth os ydych yn bodloni'r ddau amod canlynol.

Yr amod gyntaf yw, yn ystod 2014-15:

  • roeddech wedi meddiannu tir heb dalu rhent llawn y farchnad ar ei gyfer
  • roeddech wedi defnyddio neu wedi feddu ar eiddo personol heb dalu'n llawn am y budd
  • roeddech yn medru elwa o eiddo sefydlog lle mae'r incwm a gewch o'r eiddo yn cael ei drin fel eich un chi at ddibenion treth incwm. (Sylwer na fydd yr amod hwn yn cael ei fodloni os yw'r incwm yn cael ei drin fel eich un chi dim ond oherwydd gall eich priod neu bartner sifil elwa).

Yr ail amod yw, ar unrhyw adeg ers 17 Mawrth 1986:

  • roeddech yn berchen ar y tir neu eiddo personol rydych bellach yn elwa ohono
  • roeddech yn berchen ar ac wedi gwaredu asedion arall ac wedi defnyddio derbyniadau'r gwarediad hwnnw i gaffael y tir a'r eiddo personol rydych bellach yn elwa ohonynt
  • rhoesoch asedion i rywun arall, gan gynnwys arian parod, a gwnaethon nhw ei ddefnyddio i gaffael yn uniongyrchol neu'n anuniongyrchol, y tir neu'r eiddo personol rydych chi bellach yn elwa ohonynt. (Sylwer: mae 'Rhoesoch' yn yr achos yma'n cynnwys gwerthiannau neu rannol werthiannau i bartïon cysylltiedig â gwerthiannau ar danbrisiad), neu
  • gosodoch asedion i mewn i'r ymddiriedolaeth y gallwch elwa ohoni

Swm y buddiant y byddwch yn talu treth arno yw:

  • ar gyfer tir ac adeiladau y rhent blynyddol ar y farchnad agored y gallech ei gael petaech yn gosod y tir (gan gynnwys adeiladau), llai unrhyw rent y buoch dalu yn 2014-15; am arweiniad gweler Canllaw Treth Etifeddiant yn [IHTM44010]
  • ar gyfer eiddo personol - llog ar y gyfradd benodedig ar werth cyfalaf yr eiddo personol, llai unrhyw rent y buoch dalu yn 2014-15; am arweiniad gweler Canllaw Treth Etifeddiant yn [IHTM44016]
  • ar gyfer asedion nad ydynt yn tir neu eiddo personol - llog ar y gyfradd benodedig ar werth cyfalaf yr asedion, llai unrhyw dreth a godir ar unrhyw incwm ac enillion a godir; am arweiniad gweler Canllaw Treth Etifeddiant yn [IHTM44025]

Y gyfradd benodedig yw gyfradd swyddogol y llog ar y dyddiad prisio, sef 4 y cant ar gyfer 2014-15. Y rhent marchnad agored flynyddol ar gyfer tir neu werth cyfalaf eiddo personol yw'r ffigur sy'n gymwys pan fu rhaid i chi dalu treth yn gyntaf mewn perthynas ag asedion yr oeddech yn berchen arnynt eisoes. Mae'r gwerth hwnnw'n gymwys ar gyfer y 5 flwyddyn dreth nesaf. Os gwnaethoch ddechrau talu treth mewn perthynas ag eiddo yr oeddech yn berchen arnynt eisoes yn 2006-07, bydd angen i chi ailsefydlu'r rhent marchnad agored flynyddol neu werth cyfalaf eiddo personol fel y bu ar 6 Ebrill 2011 (neu'r dyddiad y dechreuodd y buddiant os yn hwyrach yn y flwyddyn dreth) er mwyn cael gwerth i'w ddefnyddio ar gyfer 2011-12 hyd at 2016-17.

Os yw'r buddiant yn codi o asedion nad yw'n tir neu eiddo personol mewn setliad, mae'n rhaid sefydlu'r gwerth cyfalaf ar ddechrau bob blwyddyn dreth (neu'r dyddiad y dechreuodd y buddiant os yn hwyrach yn y flwyddyn dreth).

Os gwnaethoch waredu neu gyfrannu at ran o'r eiddo yn unig rydych bellach yn elwa ohono, neu os gwnaethoch elwa am ran o'r flwyddyn yn unig neu os ydych a dal rhan o'r eiddo yn eich meddiant, gostyngir y tâl.

Yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' ar ddiwedd y rhan 'Llenwch eich ffurflen', nodwch sut y buoch weithio allan y budd neu'r gost yr ydych yn nodi yma.

Os yw'r buddiant o setliad ac mae treth yn daladwy ar yr incwm o'r setliad, yna didynnwch y dreth honno o'r buddiant yr ydych yn nodi yn y blwch 'Treth a dynnir oddi ar incwm' a darparwch fanylion llawn yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' ar ddiwedd y rhan 'Llenwch eich ffurflen'.

Ni fydd yn rhaid i chi dalu'r Dreth Incwm a godir ar y buddiant os:

  • y gallai'r eiddo yr ydych yn elwa ohono fod yn agored i Dreth Etifeddiant pan fyddwch yn marw (sy'n cynnwys asedion sy'n destun i 'rhodd â buddiant amodol' ar gyfer dibenion Treth Etifeddiant, neu a fyddai'n destun i amod os na fyddech yn talu ystyriaeth lawn am y defnydd o dir neu eiddo personol) neu
  • cyfanswm y buddiant am y flwyddyn yw £5,000 neu'n is (cyn didynnu unrhyw rent sydd wedi ei dalu) neu
  • rhoesoch arian parod a ariannodd yn uniongyrchol neu'n anuniongyrchol caffaeliad yr asedion yr ydych yn elwa ohonynt nawr, a gwnaethpwyd y rhodd cyn 6 Ebrill 2004 (Sylwer bod y dyddiad hwn yn gymwys pan rydych yn agored i dreth am y tro cyntaf yn 2011-12); ni fyddwch byth yn atebol i dâl POA am roddion arian parod a wnaethpwyd cyn 6 Ebrill 1998)

Mae sawl gwaharddiad ac eithriadau o'r tâl. Am help gyda phenderfynu p'un a ydych yn agored i'r dreth ai peidio, mae arweiniad manwl yng Nghanllaw Etifeddiant Treth yn [IHTM44000] neu ffoniwch Linell Gymorth Profiant ac Etifeddiant ar 0300 123 1072 .

Does dim rhaid i chi dalu'r Dreth Incwm os ydych yn dewis talu'r Dreth Etifeddiant ar yr eiddo pan fyddwch yn marw o fewn yr amser angenrheidiol i'ch ystâd Mae manylion llawn ynghylch dewisiadau, gan gynnwys sut a phryd i ddewis a'r ffurflen i ddefnyddio, ar gael yn y Canllaw Treth Etifeddiant yn [IHTM44070]. Gallwch hefyd gael y ffurflen ddewis IHT500 a'i nodiadau arweiniad IHT501 o 0845 234 1000 neu 0300 123 1072.

English Content:

Enter here any amounts included in 'Gift Aid payments made in the year to 5 April 2017' where the charity to which donations have been made is outside the UK.

If you've entered any figures in this field you should provide a breakdown of those figures in the 'Any other information' field at the end of the 'Fill in your return' section. This breakdown should list the names of the non-UK charities, the countries in which they're based and the amount donated to each charity.

English Content:
Complete the 'Gains on foreign life insurance policies etc', 'Number of years' and 'Tax treated as paid' fields if you've made a gain on a foreign life insurance policy, foreign capital redemption policy or foreign life annuity.

Don't include in this field any amount(s) you've already included in the 'All other income received by a person abroad and any remitted 'ring fenced' foreign income' field.

If you've received a certificate from your insurer showing a 'chargeable event gain' then complete these boxes using the information on the certificate unless:

  • you're not the sole owner of the policy (but see below if you jointly own the policy with your spouse or civil partner)
  • you've been resident outside the UK for part of the period since the policy was taken out
  • on or after 21 March 2007 you paid premiums exceeding £100,000 in total into the policy or policies in a tax year and you received a rebate of commission in respect of those premiums or commission was reinvested in the policy as additional premium

In which case you'll need Help Sheet 321. If you jointly own the policy with your spouse or civil partner, you should each enter half of the gain.

Help Sheet 321 - Gains on foreign life insurance policies

In some cases, the insurer may have sent you more than one certificate relating to a particular gain, with the later certificate showing a revised figure of benefits paid or amount of chargeable event gain. In this case, you should use the details on that later certificate.

If you've a cluster of policies with the same insurer where any of them are issued on particular terms, so that for example only one policy can be surrendered for more than the premiums paid, then you need to refer to Helpsheet 321.

If you've made gains from more than one identical policy, you can add them together and treat them as one policy. However, if you've made gains from more than one policy, and they aren't identical, you'll need to give details in the 'Any other information' field at the end of the 'Fill in your return' section, following the advice in Help Sheet 321.

If you've not received a certificate from your insurer showing the chargeable event gain you'll need Help Sheet 321 to help you complete these fields.
Welsh Content:
Cwblhewch y blychau 'Enillion ar bolisïau yswiriant bywyd tramor', 'Nifer y blynyddoedd' a 'Treth a gafodd ei thrin fel petai wedi ei thalu' os ydych wedi gwneud ennill ar bolisi yswiriant bywyd tramor, polisi adbrynu cyfalaf tramor neu flwydd-dal bywyd tramor.

Peidiwch â chynnwys yn y blwch hwn symiau rydych eisoes wedi eu cynnwys yn y blwch 'Pob incwm arall a dderbyniwyd gan berson sydd dramor ac unrhyw incwm tramor a 'ddiogelwyd'.

Os ydych wedi derbyn tystysgrif gan eich yswiriwr yn dangos 'ennill ar ddigwyddiad trethadwy' yna cwblhewch y blychau hyn gan ddefnyddio'r wybodaeth ar y dystysgrif oni bai fod un o'r canlynol yn gymwys:

  • Nid y chi yw unig berchennog y polisi (ond gweler isod os ydych yn berchen y polisi ar y cyd gyda'ch priod neu eich partner sifil)
  • Rydych wedi bod yn preswylio y tu allan i'r DU am ran o'r cyfnod ers i'r polisi gael ei drefnu
  • Ar neu ar ôl 21 Mawrth 2007 gwnaethoch dalu premiymau a oedd yn uwch na £100,000 yn gyfan

gwbl i'r polisi neu'r polisïau mewn blwyddyn dreth a chawsoch ad-daliad comisiwn mewn perthynas â'r premiymau hynny neu ail-fuddsoddwyd y comisiwn yn y polisi fel premiwm ychwanegol.

Yn yr achos hwn bydd angen dilyn y cysylltiad isod Taflen Gymorth 321 arnoch. Os oeddech yn berchen y polisi ar y cyd gyda'ch priod neu'ch partner sifil dylai pob un ohonoch nodi hanner yr ennill.

Taflen Gymorth 321 - Gains on foreign life insurance policies

ewn rhai achosion, gall yr yswiriwr fod wedi anfon mwy na un dystysgrif yn ymwneud ac ennill penodol atoch, gyda'r dystysgrif hwyrach yn dangos ffigur diwygiedig o fudd-daliadau a dalwyd neu swm o ennill achlysur trethadwy. Yn yr achos hwn dylech ddefnyddio y manylion ar y dystysgrif ddiweddaraf hynny.

Os oes gennych gasgliad o bolisïau gyda'r un yswiriwr pan fod unrhyw un ohonynt yn cael eu rhoi ar delerau penodol, fel mai, er enghraifft dim ond un polisi all gael ei ildio am fwy na'r premiymau a dalwyd, yna mae angen i chi gyfeirio at Daflen Gymorth 321.

Os ydych wedi gwneud enillion o fwy nag un polisi o'r unfath, gallwch eu hychwanegu at ei gilydd a'u trin fel un polisi. Fodd bynnag, os gwnaethoch enillion o fwy nag un polisi ac nid ydynt yr unfath, bydd angen i chi roi manylion yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' ar ddiwedd yr adran 'Cwblhau eich ffurflen dreth', gan ddilyn y cyngor a roddir yn Nhaflen Gymorth 321.

Os na chawsoch dystysgrif gan eich yswiriwr yn dangos yr ennill achlysur trethadwy yna bydd angen Taflen Gymorth 321 arnoch hefyd i'ch helpu i gwblhau'r blychau hyn.

English Content:
The Capital section is split into four sections:

These are intended as broad titles and the detail of what to include in each section is included in the help text icons

Entrepreneurs' relief - Any details of gains or losses on disposals for which Entrepreneurs' relief has been claimed, must be included in the 'Other property, assets and gains' section only.

Please select which section you need to complete

Please complete the 'Unlisted shares and securities' section for listed shares and securities where any of the following apply:

  • Employee Shareholder Status
  • Enterprise Investment Scheme
  • Seed Enterprise Investment Scheme
  • Share Loss relief where losses are claimed against income

Rhyddhad mentrwr - Rhaid cynnwys manylion unrhyw enillion neu golledion ar warediadau yr hawlir Rhyddhad Mentrwr arnynt, yn y blwch 'Enillion yn y flwyddyn, cyn colledion' yn yr adran 'Eiddo, asedion ac enillion eraill' yn unig.

Dewiswch pa adran sydd angen i chi ei llenwi

Llenwch yr adran 'Cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau nas rhestrwyd' ar gyfer cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau a restrwyd pan fo unrhyw un o'r canlynol yn berthnasol:

  • Cynllun Buddsoddiad Menter
  • Cynllun Buddsoddiad Menter 'Seed'
  • Rhyddhad colli cyfranddaliadau pan hawlir colledion yn erbyn incwm

English Content:
If you invested in shares that were issued during the year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 (or during the year 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 and you're carrying back relief - read Helpsheet 341 - Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief, you may be able to claim Income Tax relief under the Enterprise Investment Scheme.

The amount by which your tax liability will be reduced will be the smaller of:

  • the amount you subscribed (up to a maximum of £1,000,000) at 30%
  • the amount that reduces your tax bill to zero for the year

To qualify for relief you must have received both form EIS3 Enterprise Investment Scheme Certificate and claim to relief from the company you invested in, or form EIS5 Enterprise Investment Scheme from the fund manager of an approved investment fund. Helpsheet 341 - Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief, explains the qualifying conditions for tax relief.

Enter the total amount of the subscription on which you are claiming relief (up to a maximum of £1,000,000) for the year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017, and in the 'additional information' field enter:

  • the name of the company invested in
  • the total amount of the subscription on which you are claiming relief for the year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 (if you have subscribed more than £1,000,000 - Helpsheet 341 Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief explains how relief can be allocated to the shares)
  • the date of issue of the shares
  • the name of the office authorising the issue of the EIS3 or EIS5 and its reference
Welsh Content:
Os gwnaethoch fuddsoddi mewn cyfranddaliadau a ddyroddwyd yn ystod y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017 (neu yn ystod y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017 os ydych yn cario rhyddhad yn ôl - darllenwch Daflen Gymorth 341 Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief), mae'n bosib y gallwch hawlio rhyddhad Treth Incwm o dan y Cynllun Buddsoddiad Menter.


Y swm y bydd eich atebolrwydd treth yn cael ei leihau ganddo bydd y lleiaf o'r:

  • swm a danysgrifiwyd gennych (hyd at uchafswm o £1,000,000) ar gyfradd o 30%
  • swm sy'n lleihau eich bil treth i sero am y flwyddyn


Er mwyn bod yn gymwys ar gyfer rhyddhad, rhaid eich bod wedi derbyn naill ai ffurflen EIS3 Cynllun Buddsoddiad Menter (EIS)-Tystysgrif a chais am ryddhad gan y cwmni y gwnaethoch fuddsoddi ynddo, neu ffurflen EIS5 Enterprise Investment Scheme gan reolwr cronfa fuddsoddi gymeradwy. Mae Taflen Gymorth 341 Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief yn esbonio'r amodau cymwys ar gyfer rhyddhad treth.

Nodwch gyfanswm y tanysgrifiad rydych yn hawlio rhyddhad arno (hyd at uchafswm o £1,000,000) ar gyfer y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017, a nodwch yn y blwch 'gwybodaeth ychwanegol':

  • enw'r cwmni y buddsoddwyd ynddo
  • cyfanswm y tanysgrifiad rydych yn hawlio rhyddhad arno ar gyfer y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017 (os ydych wedi tanysgrifio mwy na £1,000,000 mae Taflen Gymorth 341 Enterprise Investment Scheme - Income Tax relief yn esbonio sut y gellir dyrannu rhyddhad i'r cyfranddaliadau)
  • dyddiad dyroddi'r cyfranddaliadau
  • enw a chyfeirnod y swyddfa sy'n awdurdodi anfon yr EIS3 neu'r EIS5

English Content: You may find it useful to summarise your loss relief claims in this worksheet. This will enable you to keep track of your losses and make sure you do not forget to claim relief for them. For detailed instructions on using this worksheet, please see the Help Sheet HS227 (PDF).

Bydd hyn yn eich galluogi i gadw trefn ar eich colledion gan wneud yn sicr nad ydych yn anghofio eu hawlio. I gael cyfarwyddyd manwl ynghylch defnyddio'r daflen waith hon, gweler Taflen Gymorth HS227. Mae'r daflen waith hon at eich defnydd chi yn unig ac ni chaiff ei hanfon at Gyllid a Thollau EM pan gyflwynir eich ffurflen dreth. Fodd bynnag, caiff gopi ei chynnwys pan fyddwch yn argraffu eich ffurflen dreth, at ddibenion eich cofnodion.

English Content:
If you were party to one or more tax avoidance schemes in 2016 to 2017, select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.

If you've used a scheme or arrangement to obtain tax advantage that you're required to disclose and you:

  • have been issued with a scheme reference number
  • expect to receive a tax advantage from the scheme or arrangement in a period covered by a future return

you must enter the scheme reference number(s) and the tax year in which you expect to gain the tax advantage in this section, even if you have entered the reference number on a previous return.

You should choose 'No' if you're an employer and the notifiable arrangements concerned are arrangements connected with employment. A scheme reference number for employment products should be notified separately using Form AAG4 or from the orderline on Telephone: 0300 200 3610 Fax: 0300 200 3611.

Tax advantage here means:

  • relief or increased relief from, or repayment or increased repayment of, income tax or capital gains tax, or the avoidance or reduction of a charge to that tax or an assessment to that tax or the avoidance of a possible assessment to that tax
  • the deferral of any payment of tax or the advancement of any repayment of tax
  • the avoidance of any obligation to deduct or account for any tax

If you fail to disclose a scheme or arrangement to obtain a tax advantage that you're required to disclose you'll be liable to a penalty.
Welsh Content:
Os oeddech yn gyfranogwr mewn un neu ragor o gynlluniau osgoi treth dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'.

Os ydych wedi defnyddio cynllun neu drefniant i gael mantais dreth y mae'n rhaid i chi eu datgelu ac rydych:

  • wedi derbyn cyfeirnod y cynllun neu
  • yn disgwyl derbyn mantais dreth o'r cynllun neu'r trefniant neu mewn cyfnod a gwmpesir gan ffurflen dreth yn y dyfodol

rhaid i chi nodi cyfeirnod(au) y cynllun a'r flwyddyn dreth y disgwyliwch gael y fantais dreth yn yr adran hon, hyd yn oed os ydych wedi nodi'r cyfeirnod treth ar Ffurflen Dreth flaenorol.

Dylech ddewis 'Na' os ydych yn gyflogwr ac mae'r trefniadau hysbysadwy dan sylw yn drefniadau mewn perthynas â chyflogaeth. Dylid hysbysu cyfeirnod y cynllun ar gyfer cynnyrch cyflogaeth ar wahân drwy ddefnyddio Ffurflen AAG4 sydd ar gael o wefan GOV.UK neu drwy ffonio'r Llinell Gyswllt Gymraeg ar 0300 200 1900 neu'r Llinell Archebu Saesneg ar 0300 200 3610. neu Ffacs 0300 200 3611.

Yma mae manteision treth yn golygu:

  • rhyddhad neu ryddhad uwch rhag, neu ad-daliad neu ad-daliad uwch o dreth incwm neu dreth enillion cyfalaf, neu osgoi neu leihau tâl treth neu asesiad o'r dreth honno neu osgoi'r posibilrwydd o godi asesiad ar y dreth honno
  • gohirio taliad o'r dreth neu gynnydd mewn ad-daliad o'r dreth, neu
  • osgoi unrhyw ymrwymiad i ddidynnu neu gyfrif am unrhyw dreth

Os byddwch yn methu â datgelu cynllun neu drefniant i gael mantais treth y mae'n ofynnol i chi eu datgelu, byddwch yn agored i gosb.

English Content:
Wages and salaries paid to staff or employees

Include any:

  • salaries
  • wages
  • bonuses
  • pensions
  • benefits

Other staff costs

Include any:

  • agency fees
  • subcontract labour costs and employer's National Insurance contributions etc

Don't include your own:

  • wages and drawings
  • pension payments
  • National Insurance contributions
  • any payments made for non-business work

It will help if you keep a record of any money you take for your own personal use from your

  • business cash
  • business bank account
  • personal bank account if you do not have a separate business account

English Content:
In certain limited circumstances you can claim to have the loss from your rental income offset against your total income forl 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017. You can only offset the loss if it arises as a result of claims to capital allowances and your amount in the 'Capital allowances for equipment and vehicles (but not for furnished residential lettings)' field exceeds your amount in the 'Balancing charges' field.

The above mentioned fields are within the 'Calculating adjusted profits and losses for tax purposes' page in the Income from land and property abroad section of your Tax Return.

The loss that may be set off is limited to the lowest of:

  • the amount of any capital allowance in the 'Capital allowances for equipment and vehicles (but not for furnished residential lettings)' field, after deducting any balancing charges in the 'Balancing charges' field
  • the amount of the loss in the 'Adjusted profit or loss for the year' field
  • the amount of your other income

The above mentioned fields are within the 'Calculating adjusted profits and losses for tax purposes' page in the Income from land and property abroad section of your Tax Return.

Enter the amount you wish to set off.
Welsh Content:
Mewn rhai amgylchiadau prin gallwch hawlio bod y golled o incwm rhent yn cael ei wrthbwyso yn erbyn cyfanswm eich incwm am 2016 i 2017. Gallwch wrthbwyso'r golled dim ond os ydy'r golled yn codi o ganlyniad i geisiadau am lwfansau cyfalaf (ac mae'r swm yn y blwch 'Lwfansau cyfalaf ar gyfer cyfarpar a cherbydau (ond nid ar gyfer eiddo preswyl ar osod) yn uwch na'ch swm yn y blwch 'Taliadau mantoli').

Mae'r blychau y sonnir amdanynt uchod o fewn tudalen 'Cyfrifo elw a cholledion wedi'u haddasu at ddibenion treth' yn yr adran ar gyfer Incwm o dir ac eiddo yn eich Ffurflen Dreth.

  • swm unrhyw lwfans cyfalaf yn y blwch 'Lwfansau cyfalaf ar gyfer cyfarpar a cherbydau (ond nid ar gyfer eiddo preswyl ar osod) yn uwch na'ch swm yn y blwch 'Taliadau mantoli', neu
  • swm y golled yn y blwch 'Elw neu golled wedi'i addasu am y flwyddyn', neu
  • swm eich incwm arall.

Mae'r blychau y sonnir amdanynt uchod o fewn tudalen 'Cyfrifo elw a cholledion wedi'u haddasu at ddibenion treth' yn yr adran ar gyfer Incwm o dir ac eiddo dramor yn eich Ffurflen Dreth.

Nodwch y swm rydych am ei wrthbwyso.

English Content:
Enter the date which your books and accounts start.

Every business must keep books or records by law. It's usual to keep your business records year by year. HM Revenue and Customs suggest you 'make up your books or records' to the same date each year (your accounting date).

More information about Self-employed records you need to keep

If you've been working for yourself for less than 12 months you will have to choose your accounting date (and you usually keep to that date each year). You can choose any date you like but as the tax year ends on 5 April you may find it easier to use 5 April. The first day of your business or trading year will be the beginning of your accounting period, that is, the period (usually a year) from one accounting date to the next covered by your books and records.
Welsh Content:
Nodwch y dyddiad pan mae eich llyfrau a chyfrifon yn dechrau.

Rhaid i bob busnes cadw cofnodion yn ôl y gyfraith. Mae'n arferol cadw eich cofnodion busnes blwyddyn wrth flwyddyn. Mae Cyllid a Thollau EM yn argymell eich bod 'yn cau eich llyfrau neu gofnodion' ar yr un dyddiad bob blwyddyn (eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu).

Am fwy o wybodaeth ynghylch hyn gweler Cofnodion hunangyflogedig sydd angen i chi eu cadw

Os buoch yn gweithio i chi eich hun am lai na 12 mis, bydd yn rhaid i chi ddewis eich dyddiad cyfrifyddu (a byddwch fel arfer yn cadw i'r un dyddiad bob blwyddyn). Gallwch ddewis unrhyw ddyddiad a hoffech, ond gan fod y flwyddyn dreth yn dod i ben ar 5 Ebrill, efallai y byddai'n hawsach defnyddio 5 Ebrill. Diwrnod cyntaf eich blwyddyn masnachu neu eich blwyddyn busnes bydd cychwyn eich cyfnod cyfrifyddu, hynny yw, y cyfnod (fel arfer blwyddyn) o un dyddiad cyfrifyddu i'r nesaf a gwmpasir gan eich llyfrau a chofnodion.

English Content:
Please enter your dividend income shown in box 14A and 22A on your partnership statement.

If you’re not claiming Foreign Tax Credit Relief, you can claim the foreign tax you’ve already paid in the ‘Total foreign tax taken off ‘field.

If you received a notional tax credit on dividends from overseas companies before 6 April 2016, include the amount in the ‘Total foreign tax taken off ‘field.

The nominated partner will inform you about the amounts to claim (see the notes for the SA802 ‘Partnership Foreign’ pages for more information).

If you’re claiming Foreign Tax Credit Relief, include only the amount of any notional dividend tax credit in ‘Total foreign tax taken off ‘field.
Welsh Content: Nodwch eich cyfran chi o incwm y bartneriaeth a drethwyd ar 10% ac a ddangoswyd ym mlwch 14A a 22A ar ddatganiad eich partneriaeth.

English Content:
Based upon your entries this is the total number of disposals of property and other assets (other than disposals of shares and securities) you made in the year to 5 April 2017.

Enter the number of capital gains computation worksheets you have completed. The worksheet should represent each disposals of property and other assets. You will have to do this separately for each asset sold.

Note that in certain circumstances you may have to pay capital gains tax on gains made by a non-UK resident Trust or a non-UK resident company in which you have an interest. You may also have to pay capital gains tax on gains which arose in earlier years but become taxable in this. However, you should not include the number of any such attributed or deferred gains in the total number of disposals. You should, however, include such gains in the relevant boxes.
Welsh Content:
Ar sail yr hyn a gofnodwyd gennych dyma gyfanswm nifer y gwarediadau o eiddo ac asedion eraill (heblaw am waredu cyfranddaliadau a gwarantau) a wnaethoch yn y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2016.

Y ffigur a ddangosir yma yw nifer y taflenni gwaith ar gyfer cyfrifo enillion cyfalaf a gwblhawyd gennych ar gyfer gwarediadau o eiddo ac asedion eraill yn ogystal â nifer y gwarediadau o'r fath a nodwyd gennych ar wahân.

Sylwer mewn'rhai amgylchiadau efallai y bydd rhaid i chi dalu treth enillion cyfalaf ar enillion a wnaed gan Ymddiriedolaeth nad yw wedi ei sefydlu yn y DU neu gwmni dibreswyl y mae gennych fuddiant ynddo. Efallai y bydd rhaid i chi hefyd dalu treth enillion cyfalaf ar enillion a gododd mewn blynyddoedd cynharach ond a ddaeth yn drethadwy yn y flwyddyn hon. Er hynny, ni ddylech gynnwys nifer yr enillion priodoledig neu'r enillion a ohiriwyd yng nghyfanswm y gwarediadau. Fodd bynnag dylech gynnwys enillion o'r fath yn y blychau perthnasol.

Welsh Content: 1. Cyfeirnod y Bartneriaeth:

English Content:
If you own UK land or property which produces rents or other receipts we treat you as operating a property rental business (whether you have one or several properties).

Enter the total income from your property rental business excluding any UK furnished holiday lettings profit. Income includes receipts in cash or in kind. It is taxable when it is earned even if you receive it later (so any 6 April 2015 to 5 April 2016 rental income paid after 5 April 2016 should be included). Do not include rents for the year to 5 April 2017 that have been paid in advance (during the year to 5 April 2016).

Include rental income from:

  • a tenancy
  • leasing or licensing agreements over your land or property
  • furnished, unfurnished, commercial and domestic accommodation (including amounts you receive for the furniture), excepts where you run a guest house or bed and breakfast
  • any land

Receipts other than rent are also taxable, for example:

  • rent charges and ground rents
  • income from the grant of sporting rights
  • income from letting others tip waste on your land
  • receipts from a film crew who pay to film on your land
  • income for the use of a caravan or houseboat at a fixed location
  • way leaves if the land to which the way leave relates is used in your property rental business
  • local authority grants towards the cost of repairs

If you let your property furnished, any sums the tenant pays you for the use of furniture should be included here. Exclude premiums for the grant of a lease and reverse premiums (these go in 'Premiums for the grant of a lease' and 'Reverse premiums and inducements' fields). If tax (to be entered in the 'Tax taken off total rents and other income from property' field) has been taken off any of your rental income, make sure the figure entered here is the amount before tax was deducted.

Don't include Real Estate Investment Trust or Property Authorised Investment Funds dividends/distributions here.

If you think the information you are adding has an effect on your 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018 or 6 April 2018 to 5 April 2019 PAYE Tax codes there is guidance to tell you how to let HM Revenue and Customs know of the change - If you think your code is wrong.
Welsh Content:
Os ydych yn berchen ar dir neu eiddo yn y DU sy'n cynhyrchu rhenti neu dderbyniadau eraill, rydym yn eich trin fel petaech yn gweithredu busnes gosod eiddo (p'un a oes gennych un eiddo neu sawl un).

Nodwch gyfanswm yr incwm a gewch o'ch busnes gosod eiddo ac eithrio unrhyw elw o lety gwyliau wedi'i ddodrefnu yn y DU. Mae incwm yn cynnwys derbyniadau mewn arian parod ac mewn buddiannau. Mae'n agored i dreth pan gaiff ei ennill hyd yn oed os derbyniwch yr incwm yn ddiweddarach (felly dylid cynnwys unrhyw incwm rhent ar gyfer 2014-15 a dalwyd ar ôl 5 Ebrill 2016). Peidiwch â chynnwys rhenti ar gyfer y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017 a dalwyd o flaen llaw (yn ystod y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2016).

Cynhwyswch incwm rhent o:

  • tenantiaeth
  • cytundebau prydlesi neu drwyddedu eich tir neu eich eiddo
  • llety wedi'i ddodrefnu, heb ei ddodrefnu a llety masnachol a domestig (gan gynnwys symiau rydych yn cael am y dodrefn), oni bai eich bod yn rhedeg gwesty bach neu wely a brecwast
  • unrhyw dir

Mae derbyniadau heblaw rhent yn agored i dreth hefyd, er enghraifft:

  • taliadau rhent a rhenti tir
  • incwm drwy ganiatáu hawliau hela
  • incwm drwy ganiatáu i eraill dipio gwastraff ar eich tir
  • derbyniadau gan griw ffilmio sy'n talu am yr hawl i ffilmio ar eich tir
  • incwm am ddefnyddio carafán neu gwch preswyl mewn safle sefydlog
  • hawliau tramwyo os defnyddir y tir y mae'r hawl tramwyo yn ymwneud ag ef yn eich busnes gosod eiddo
  • grantiau awdurdodau lleol tuag at gostau atgyweirio
  • incwm o dir ac eiddo mewn Ymddiriedolaethau Ardal Fentro

Os ydych yn gosod eich eiddo wedi'i ddodrefnu, dylid cynnwys yma unrhyw symiau a delir i chi gan y tenant am ddefnyddio'r dodrefn. Dylid eithrio premiymau am ganiatáu prydlesi a phremiymau gwrthdro (dylid cynnwys y rhain yn y blychau 'Premiymau ar gyfer caniatáu prydles' a 'Premiymau gwrthdro a chymelldaliadau'). Os yw'r dreth (sydd i'w nodi yn y blwch 'Treth a ddidynnwyd o gyfanswm y rhenti ac incwm arall drwy osod eiddo') wedi ei didynnu o unrhyw incwm rhent a gawsoch, dylech sicrhau mai'r ffigur a nodir yma yw'r swm cyn didynnu treth.

Peidiwch â chynnwys difidendau/dosraniadau Ymddiriedolaethau Buddsoddi mewn Eiddo Diriaethol na Chronfeydd Buddsoddi Awdurdodedig mewn Eiddo.

English Content: Usually you will be given tax relief, through the PAYE system, for your payments to an employer's compulsory scheme to provide a pension to your spouse or civil partner, or financial support for your children, in the event of your death. Very occasionally, for example if you have to make a lump sum contribution to the scheme on your retirement, you do not get all the relief you are entitled to through PAYE. The maximum relief you can have is £100 at the basic rate of 20% (£20). Work out the tax relief you have not been given and enter here (up to the maximum £20).
Welsh Content: Fel arfer cewch ryddhad treth drwy'r system TWE, ar gyfer taliadau i gynllun gorfodol eich cyflogwr i ddarparu pensiwn i chi a'ch priod neu eich partner sifil, neu gymorth ariannol ar gyfer plant os byddwch farw. Yn achlysurol iawn, er enghraifft os bydd angen i chi gyfrannu ar ffurf cyfandaliad i'r cynllun pan fyddwch yn ymddeol, ni fyddwch yn cael yr holl ryddhad y mae gennych hawl iddo drwy TWE. Y rhyddhad uchaf y mae'n bosib ei gael yw £100 ar y gyfradd sylfaenol o 20% (£20). Cyfrifwch y rhyddhad ar y gyfradd dreth sylfaenol na chawsoch ryddhad ar ei gyfer a nodwch y swm yma (hyd at uchafswm o £20).

The taxable amount has automatically been calculated for you. If you are claiming foreign tax credit relief the figure is the same as the figure in the 'Amount' of income arising or received before any tax taken off' field. If you are not claiming foreign tax credit relief the figure is the amount in the 'Amount of income arising or received before any tax taken off' field minus any amount in 'Foreign tax taken off or paid'.

For further information see Help Sheet 262 - Income and benefits from transfer of assets abroad and Income from non-resident trusts (PDF 92K).

To view the guidance notes you need to use a PDF file viewer. You can get one at www.adobe.com

If you've stopped working for yourself, you're taxable on any profits for the period beginning on the day after your last accounting period and the date your business ceased. You may be entitled to a tax relief called 'overlap relief'.

You must also tell us the date you stopped working for yourself. If you no longer need to pay Class 2 National Insurance contributions, we will arrange for your bills to stop. Complete the online form here Stopping self-employment

Efallai y bydd hawl gennych gael rhyddhad treth a elwir yn 'rhyddhad gorgyffwrdd' os nad 5 Ebrill oedd eich dyddiad cyfrifo.
