English Content:
You can use this Self Assessment Online service to enter the total amount of Child Benefit received. If either you or your partner earned in excess of over £50,000 the partner with the greater income includes the Child Benefit on their Self Assessment return.

If your income is over £50,000, go to the 'Tailor your Return' section and answer a few questions to ensure this section is relevant. Work out your income for Child Benefit purposes for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 by following steps 1 to 4.

Step 1 - work out your 'net income'

Add up your taxable income, include things such as:

  • income from employment including any company benefits
  • profits from self-employment
  • taxable social security benefits
  • pensions including the State Pension
  • savings, dividend and rental income

then take off any tax relief's that apply such as:

  • payments made gross to pension schemes - those have been made without tax relief
  • trading losses, for example trade loss relief or property loss relief

This is your 'net income'.

Your net income is then adjusted, follow steps 2 to 4 below.

Step 2 - take off Gift Aid donations

If you made a Gift Aid donation, take off the 'grossed-up' amount - what you paid plus the basic rate of tax.

Step 3 - take off pension contributions

If you made a contribution to a pension scheme where your pension provider has already given you tax relief at basic rate, take off the 'grossed-up' amount - what you paid plus the basic rate of tax.

Step 4 - add back tax relief for payments to trade unions or police organisations

Tax relief of up to £100 is available if you make payments to a trade union or police organisation for superannuation, life insurance or funeral benefits. If you took off an amount for this type of payment at step 1, add it back.
Welsh Content:
Gallwch ddefnyddio'r gwasanaeth Hunanasesiad Ar-lein hwn er mwyn nodi cyfanswm y Budd-dal Plant a dderbyniwyd. Os buoch chi neu eich partner yn ennill mwy na £50,000, mae'r partner sydd â'r incwm mwyaf yn rhoi'r Budd-dal Plant ar ei ffurflen dreth Hunanasesiad.

Os yw eich incwm dros £50,000, ewch i'r adran 'Addasu eich Ffurflen Dreth' ac atebwch ychydig o gwestiynau er mwyn sicrhau bod yr adran hon yn berthnasol.

Gweithiwch allan eich incwm at ddibenion Budd-dal Plant ar gyfer y flwyddyn dreth 6 Ebrill 2016 i 5 Ebrill 2017 gan ddilyn camau 1 i 4.

Cam 1 - gweithiwch allan eich 'incwm net'

Cyfrifwch eich incwm trethadwy -dylech gynnwys pethau fel:

  • incwm o gyflogaeth gan gynnwys unrhyw fuddiannau cwmni
  • elw o hunangyflogaeth
  • buddiannau nawdd cymdeithasol trethadwy
  • pensiynau gan gynnwys Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth
  • cynilion, difidendau ac incwm rhent

yna didynnwch unrhyw ryddhad treth sy'n gymwys, fel

  • taliadau a wnaed yn gros i gynlluniau pensiwn - maent wedi'u gwneud heb ryddhad treth
  • colledion masnachu, er enghraifft, rhyddhad colled masnach neu ryddhad colled eiddo

Dyma yw eich 'incwm net'

Caiff eich incwm net ei addasu wedyn - camau 2 i 4 isod.

Cam 2 - didynnwch gyfraniadau Rhodd Cymorth

Os gwnaethoch gyfraniad Rhodd Cymorth, didynnwch y swm wedi ei grosio i fyny - yr hyn a dalwyd gennych ynghyd â chyfradd sylfaenol y dreth.

Cam 3 - didynnwch gyfraniadau pensiwn

Os gwnaethoch gyfraniad i gynllun pensiwn pan fod eich darparwr pensiwn eisoes wedi rhoi rhyddhad treth i chi ar y gyfradd sylfaenol, didynnwch y swm wedi ei grosio i fyny - yr hyn a dalwyd gennych ynghyd â chyfradd sylfaenol y dreth.

Cam 4 - ychwanegwch yn ôl rhyddhad treth ar gyfer taliadau i undebau llafar neu sefydliadau'r heddlu

Mae rhyddhad treth o hyd at £100 ar gael os ydych yn gwneud taliadau i undeb llafur neu sefydliad yr heddlu ar gyfer blwydd-dal, yswiriant bywyd neu fuddiannau angladd.

Os gwnaethoch ddidynnu swm ar gyfer y math hwn o daliad yng ngham 1, ychwanegwch y swm yn ôl.

English Content:
Personal expenses are not allowable as a business deduction so if you've included in the 'Property expenses (rent, repairs, legal fees, cost of services provided)' field (which was on the previous page), any amounts that were not wholly for the business, enter the private (non-business) proportion in this field.

For example, if you let a property for only 8 months in a year and you use it yourself for the other 4 months, you could include the full annual cost of insuring the property in the 'Property expenses (rent, repairs, legal fees, cost of services provided)' field. If so enter the 4 months cost in this field.

English Content:
You will usually be entitled to an annual exempt amount of £11,000.

You aren't entitled to the annual exempt amount for 2016 to 2017 if you're not domiciled in the UK and are claiming to be taxed on the remittance basis for 2016 to 2017.

If this applies to you you can't use the Self Assessment online service to file your return.

For further guidance and information see the Residence, remittance basis etc notes.

English Content:
Tax Return for the year ended 5 April 2017

This is a printed version of the information that will be transmitted to HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) once authorised by you. Before transmitting the return information to HMRC using the Online Service, your tax agent must provide you with a copy of your tax return information. Before your return information can be sent to HMRC, you must send your tax agent confirmation in writing that the return information is correct and complete to the best of your knowledge and belief. Your written confirmation may be in electronic or non-electronic form. If you confirm that this copy of your tax return information is correct and complete and it contains false information or you conceal any part of your income or chargeable gains, you can be prosecuted. You may also have to pay substantial financial penalties. It is recommended that you retain this copy.

Where your return contains nomination details to enable a repayment to be sent to a bank, building society or other nominee, the receipt of these nomination details will be taken to be your formal approval of the nomination.

Declaration:
I confirm that I advised my tax agent on ____________(Date) that this copy of my tax return information is correct and complete and authorised them to submit my return information using the Online Service.

Signature

_____________________________
Welsh Content:
Ffurflen Dreth ar gyfer y flwyddyn sy'n dod i ben 5 Ebrill 2017

Fersiwn wedi ei argraffu yw hwn o'r wybodaeth fydd yn cael ei anfon i Gyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) unwaith rydych wedi ei awdurdodi. Cyn anfon yr wybodaeth sydd ar y ffurflen i CThEM gan ddefnyddio'r Gwasanaeth Ar-lein, rhaid i'ch asiant treth roi copi o'r wybodaeth sydd ar eich ffurflen dreth i chi. Cyn gall yr wybodaeth ar eich ffurflen dreth gael ei hanfon i CThEM, rhaid i chi anfon cadarnhad ysgrifenedig eich asiant treth fod yr wybodaeth yn gywir ac yn gyflawn hyd eithaf eich gwybodaeth a'ch cred. Gall eich cadarnhad ysgrifenedig fod ar ffurf electronig neu anelectronig. Os cadarnhewch fod y copi hwn o'r wybodaeth sydd yn eich ffurflen dreth yn gywir a chyflawn a'i fod yn cynnwys gwybodaeth ffug neu os ydych yn cuddio unrhyw ran o'ch incwm neu enillion trethadwy, gellir eich erlyn. Yn ogystal, efallai y bydd yn rhaid i chi dalu cosbau ariannol sylweddol. Argymhellir eich bod yn cadw'r copi hwn.

Lle mae eich ffurflen dreth yn cynnwys manylion enwebu i alluogi ad-daliad i gael ei anfon at fanc, cymdeithas adeiladu neu enwebai arall, cymerir mai derbyniad manylion yr enwebiad fydd eich cymeradwyaeth ffurfiol o'r enwebiad.

Datganiad:
Rwyf yn cadarnhau fy mod wedi cynghori fy asiant treth ar ____________ (Dyddiad) fod y copi hwn o'r wybodaeth sydd yn fy ffurflen dreth yn gywir ac yn gyflawn ac rwyf yn ei awdurdodi/ei hawdurdodi i gyflwyno'r wybodaeth sydd yn fy ffurflen dreth drwy ddefnyddio'r Gwasanaeth Ar-lein.

Llofnod

English Content:
Choose 'Yes' from the drop-down menu if you want to use the worksheet for one or more of your asset disposals (you can complete a maximum of 20 worksheets) otherwise, choose 'No'.

If you use a computation worksheet this will automatically be added as an attachment to your return and information from the worksheet will be included in your Capital Gains summary details which you will see later.

You will also have the opportunity later to include summary details from any computations that are not included in a computation worksheet. Those computations must then be provided either in the additional information section at the end of the Capital Gains section or as an attachment to your return.

Er enghraifft, os oedd gennych yr hawl i dderbyn Budd-dal Plant ar gyfer dau blentyn yn ystod y cyfnod hwn, yna nodwch '2'.

Os ydych wedi nodi gwerth yn y blwch hwn, mae'n rhaid i chi ateb y cwestiwn iawn neu na i'r blwch nesaf.

English Content:
If your only foreign income was:

  • untaxed foreign interest received (up to £2,000), and/or
  • taxed foreign dividends (up to £300)

you may return them in the interest and dividends sections of the Return by selecting 'Yes' to 'Did you receive any interest' and 'Did you receive any dividends' in the 'Tailor your return' section.

For 6 April 2015 to 5 April 2016 onwards, the penalty for failing to declare income that arises outside the UK can be up to 200% of the tax due on the income.

However, please read the help for the fields 'Untaxed UK interest etc. (amounts that have not been taxed)' and 'Foreign dividends (up to £300) (do not include this amount on your foreign pages)' which are within the 'UK interest' and 'Dividends' sections of the 'Fill in your return' pages.

If you are claiming the remittance basis of taxation, you will need to complete the Non-residence etc pages. In these circumstances you will not be able to use HMRC’s software to file online and will need to use an alternative. You can find a list of alternative software providers at www.gov.uk/software-tax-returns.
Welsh Content:
Os mai eich unig incwm tramor oedd:

  • llog tramor heb ei drethu a dderbyniwyd (hyd at £2,000), a/neu
  • difidendau tramor wedi'u trethu (hyd at £300)

gallwch eu nodi yn adrannau llog a difidendau'r Ffurflen Dreth drwy ddewis 'Iawn' i'r cwestiynau 'A wnaethoch dderbyn llog' ac 'A wnaethoch dderbyn difidendau' yn yr adran 'Addasu eich Ffurflen Dreth'.

O 2016 to 2017 ymlaen, gall y gosb am beidio â datgan incwm sy'n deillio o'r tu allan i'r DU fod hyd at 200% o'r dreth sy'n ddyledus ar yr incwm.

Fodd bynnag, dylech ddarllen yr help ar gyfer y blychau 'Llog y DU ac ati heb ei drethu (symiau nad ydynt wedi'u trethu)' a 'Difidendau tramor (hyd at £300) (peidiwch â chynnwys y swm hwn ar eich tudalennau tramor)' sydd yn adrannau 'Llog y DU' a 'Difidendau' y tudalennau 'Cwblhewch eich Ffurflen Dreth'.

Os ydych yn hawlio'r sail drosglwyddo o drethu, bydd rhaid i chi lenwi'r tudalennau Dibreswyl etc. Yn yr amgylchiadau hyn, ni fyddwch yn gallu defnyddio meddalwedd CThEM i gyflwyno ar-lein a bydd rhaid i chi ddefnyddio meddalwedd gwahanol. Ceir rhestr o ddarparwyr meddalwedd gwahanol yn www.gov.uk/software-tax-returns.

English Content:
You may be entitled to claim blind person's allowance.

If you or your spouse or civil partner are registered blind, the local authority will enter your name(s) on its register of blind people on the production of an ophthalmologist's certificate. If you live in Scotland or Northern Ireland, local authorities aren't obliged to keep registers of blind people, although some do. But you can claim the allowance if your eyesight, or that of your spouse or civil partner, is so bad you can't do any work for which eyesight is essential. Your eye specialist will normally certify you blind before you're entitled to this allowance.

If you were registered for the first time after 5 April 2017 you may still be entitled to claim on this Tax Return if you have evidence that your sight condition existed in the year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017.

If you're registered blind, choose 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, choose 'No'.
Welsh Content:
Efallai y gallwch hawlio lwfans person dall.

Os ydych chi neu eich priod neu bartner sifil wedi eich cofrestru'n ddall, bydd yr awdurdod lleol yn nodi eich enw(au) ar eu cofrestr ar gyfer pobl ddall pan fyddwch yn cyflwyno tystysgrif gan offthalmolegydd.

Os ydych yn byw yn Yr Alban neu yng Ngogledd Iwerddon, does dim rhaid i awdurdodau lleol gadw cofrestr o bobl ddall, er bod rhai yn gwneud hynny. Serch hynny, gallwch hawlio'r lwfans os yw eich golwg mor wael fel na allwch gyflawni gwaith y mae golwg yn hanfodol ar ei gyfer.

Fel arfer bydd eich arbenigwr llygaid yn ardystio eich bod yn ddall cyn y gallwch hawlio'r lwfans hwn.

Os cawsoch eich cofrestru am y tro cyntaf ar ôôl 5 Ebrill 2017, efallai y gallwch wneud cais ar y ffurflen dreth hon os oes gennych dystiolaeth i ddangos bod y cyflwr eisoes yn bodoli yn y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017.

Os yw ein cofnodion yn dangos eich bod wedi'ch cofrestru'n ddall, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen. Fel arall, dewiswch 'Na'.

English Content:
If you have made a loss that you want to use against income for this tax year.

If the loss is more than your income (or your income is nil), enter your income amount (or nil) in the field. You can claim the balance of your loss against any capital gains for the 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 tax year.

Please enter the amount you want to claim to offset in this field.

Don't fill in this field if your used cash basis.

English Content:
If you disposed of chargeable assets worth more than £44,400 choose 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, choose 'No'.

You must fill in the capital gains pages and attach your computations if in the tax year you disposed of chargeable assets which were worth more than £44,400.

In working out if the assets you disposed of were worth more than £44,400 use the market value of any assets you gave away or sold for less than full value and ignore the following:

  • disposals of exempt assets such as private cars, shares held within Personal Equity Plans or Individual Savings Accounts
  • disposals of your own home, where:
    • it has been your only home during your ownership and was not used for any other purposes, for example, in your business
    • the house has been used as your home throughout your ownership (but you can ignore the last 18 months of ownership)
    • the garden and grounds disposed of, at the same time, didn't exceed half a hectare
    • disposals of assets to your spouse or civil partner (if you were living together at some time during the year)
Welsh Content:
Os gwnaethoch waredu asedion trethadwy a oedd yn werth mwy na £44,000 dewiswch 'Do' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Naddo'.

Rhaid i chi gwblhau'r tudalennau enillion cyfalaf ac atodi eich cyfrifiannau os gwnaethoch waredu asedion trethadwy a oedd werth mwyn na £44,000 yn y flwyddyn dreth.

Wrth gyfrifo p'un a oedd yr asedion a waredwyd gennych yn werth mwy na £44,000 defnyddiwch werth marchnad unrhyw asedion a rhoesoch neu a werthoch am lai na'i gwerth llawn ac anwybyddwch y canlynol:

  • gwaredu asedion sydd wedi eu heithrio er enghraifft, ceir preifat, cyfranddaliadau a gedwir o fewn Cynlluniau Ecwiti Personol (PEP) neu Gyfrifon Cynilion Unigol (ISAs)
  • gwaredu eich cartref eich hun, pan:
    • fo'r lle wedi bod eich unig gartref yn ystod eich perchenogaeth ac ni chafodd ei ddefnyddio at unrhyw ddibenion eraill, er enghraifft yn eich busnes
    • defnyddiwyd y tŷ fel eich cartref trwy gydol eich perchenogaeth ohono (ond gallwch anwybyddu'r 18 mis olaf o'ch perchenogaeth)
    • doedd yr ardd a'r tir a waredwyd ar yr un adeg, ddim yn fwy na hanner hectar.
    • gwaredu asedion i'ch priod neu eich partner sifil (os oeddech yn byw gyda'ch gilydd ar ryw adeg yn ystod y flwyddyn)

English Content:
If you've had any Income Tax refunded or off-set by HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) or Jobcentre Plus, select 'Yes' otherwise select 'No'.

This could be a repayment of Construction Industry Scheme (CIS) deductions (if you work in the construction industry), PAYE tax (for example, a repayment in respect of a trivial pension commutation claim), or tax paid on savings income. Or it could be an amount HMRC has reallocated to go against an existing debt.
Welsh Content:
Os ad-dalwyd unrhyw Dreth incwm i chi neu os cafodd ei wrthbwyso gan CThEM neu'r Ganolfan Byd Gwaith, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen, fel arall dewiswch 'Na'.

Gallai hyn fod yn ad-daliad o ddidyniadau Cynllun y Diwydiant Adeiladu (CIS) (os ydych yn gweithio yn y diwydiant adeiladu), treth TWE (er enghraifft, ad-daliad mewn perthynas â chais cymudiad pensiwn dibwys) neu dreth a dalwyd ar gynilion. Neu gallai fod yn swm a ail-ddyrannwyd gan CThEM i'w osod yn erbyn dyled sydd eisoes yn bodoli.

English Content:
If you're exempt from paying Class 4 National Insurance contributions (NICs), select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.

You're exempt from paying Class 4 NICs if on 6 April 2016 you were:

  • at or over State Pension age at the beginning of the year of assessment (including if you reach State Pension age on 6 April 2016)
  • under 16
  • during the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 you were not resident in the UK for tax purposes (if you are not sure please contact HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) or your tax adviser)

If you're a trustee or a diver or diving instructor you may also be exempt, contact HMRC if you think this applies.
Welsh Content:
Os ydych wedi eich eithrio rhag talu CYG Dosbarth 4, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen fel arall, dewiswch 'Na'.

Cewch eich eithrio rhag talu Cyfraniadau Yswiriant Gwladol (CYG) Dosbarth 4 os oeddech ar 6 Ebrill 2014:

  • wedi cyrraedd neu dros oedran Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth, ar ddechrau flwyddyn yr asesiad (gan gynnwys os ydych yn cyrraedd oedran Pensiwn y Wladwriaeth ar 6 Ebrill)
  • o dan 16 oed, neu
  • yn ystod 2016 i 2017 nid oeddech yn preswylio yn y DU at ddibenion treth (os nad ydych yn siŵr yna cysylltwch â Chyllid a Thollau EM (CThEM) neu eich ymgynghorydd treth)

Os ydych yn ymddiriedolwr neu'n ddeifar neu'n oruchwyliwr mae'n bosib y byddwch hefyd wedi eich eithrio, cysylltwch â CThEM os ydych yn credu bod hyn yn gymwys.

English Content:
Transfer your personal allowance

If you want to transfer £1,100 of your personal allowance to your spouse or civil partner, please select 'Yes' from the drop-down menu otherwise, select 'No'.

If your income for the tax year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 was less than £11,000 (excluding up to £5000 in tax-free savings interest) you could benefit from transferring £1,100 of your personal allowance to your spouse or civil partner to reduce the amount of tax they pay. You could benefit as a couple if all of the following apply:

  • you were married to, or in a civil partnership with, the same person for all or part of the tax year
  • your spouse or civil partner’s income was more than £11,000 and less than £43,000

Use our online Marriage Allowance calculator to see how much you can benefit.

Please note: You can only apply to transfer 10% of your personal allowance on your tax return. If you are the recipient of a transfer (the person receiving the extra allowance) do not complete this section, your transferred allowance will be included in your calculation if a transfer is already in place or will be amended once an application is received.
Welsh Content:
Os ydych am drosglwyddo £1,060 o'ch lwfans personol i'ch priod neu bartner sifil, dewiswch 'Iawn' o'r ddewislen. Fel arall, dewiswch 'Na'.

Os oedd eich incwm ar gyfer y flwyddyn a ddaeth i ben 5 Ebrill 2017 yn llai na £11,000 (ac eithrio hyd at £5,000 mewn llog rhydd o dreth ar gynilion), gallech elwa o drosglwyddo £1,060 o'ch lwfans personol i'ch priod neu bartner sifil er mwyn gostwng swm y dreth y mae'n ei dalu. Gallech elwa fel pâr os yw pob un o'r canlynol yn gymwys:

  • roeddech yn briod, neu mewn partneriaeth sifil, â'r un person am y flwyddyn dreth gyfan neu am ran ohoni
  • roedd incwm eich priod neu bartner sifil yn fwy na £11,000 ac yn llai na £43,000

Defnyddiwch ein cyfrifiannell Lwfans Priodasol ar-lein i weld faint y gallwch elwa o'r lwfans.

Welsh Content: Ni allwch nodi mwy na 28 nod ar gyfer 'Enw'r busnes'. Dylech ei ddiwygio.

English Content:
Stock dividends
If you took up an offer of shares, instead of receiving a cash dividend, this is a stock dividend. The company should have provided a dividend statement showing 'the appropriate amount in cash' or 'the cash equivalent of the share capital'.

Bonus issues of securities and redeemable shares and close company loans written off or released
If you received a bonus issue of securities or redeemable shares, you need to enter the amount of distribution received.

Close company loans written off or released
Where a loan or advance, made by a close company to a participator or associate, is wholly or partly written off or released, the amount written off or released, plus an amount of tax treated as paid, becomes part of your income. If you pay tax at the higher rate(s) you will have more tax to pay on this income.

Select this check box if you received income from Stock dividends, bonus issues of securities and redeemable shares and loans written off.
Welsh Content:
Difidendau stoc
Os gwnaethoch dderbyn cynnig am gyfranddaliadau yn lle derbyn difidend ar ffurf arian, ystyrir hyn yn ddifidend stoc. Dylai'r cwmni fod wedi rhoi datganiad o'r difidend yn dangos y swm priodol o arian neu'r swm 'cyfatebol mewn arian o gyfalaf y cyfranddaliadau'.

Dosbarthiadau anghymwysol

Mae dosbarthiad anghymwysol yn cynnwys:
 

  • dyroddiad bonws gwarantau neu gyfranddaliadau y gellir eu hadbrynu (oni bai fod y dyroddiad wedi achosi dosbarthiad cymhwysol a fyddai wedi ei gynnwys yn y blychau difidend ar eich Ffurflen Dreth)
  • pan fydd cwmni yn derbyn dyroddiad bonws o'r fath ac yn ei 'dalu ymlaen' i rywun arall

Os ydych yn talu treth ar y cyfradd(au) uwch bydd treth yn ddyledus ar yr incwm ym mlwch 13; rhoddir credyd am dreth gyfradd gyffredin difidend a'i drin fel wedi ei dalu.

Benthyciadau gan gwmnïau caeëdig a gawsant eu dileu neu eu rhyddhau

Pan fydd benthyciad neu flaenswm a roddir gan gwmni caeëdig i gyfranogwr neu aelod cysylltiad, yn cael ei ryddhau yn gyfan gwbl neu'n rhannol neu'n cael ei ddileu, bydd y swm a ryddheir neu a ddilëir ynghyd a swm o dreth a chaiff ei thrin fel petai wedi ei thalu yn cael ei drin fel rhan o'ch incwm. Os talwch dreth ar y gyfradd uwch, bydd yn rhaid i chi dalu mwy o dreth ar yr incwm hwn.

Dewiswch y blwch gwirio hwn os cawsoch incwm o ddifidendau stoc, dosbarthiadau anghymwysol a benthyciadau a ddilëwyd.

Welsh Content: Rhaid i'r swm a nodwyd ar gyfer 'Cyfanswm unrhyw bensiynau neu fudd-daliadau trethadwy eraill y Wladwriaeth' fod yn llai na £10,000,000,000. Dylech ei ddiwygio.

Welsh Content: Cyfrifwyd y cofnod hwn yn awtomatig ar eich cyfer o'r ffigurau a nodwyd gennych. Dynodir colled gan yr arwydd minws o flaen y ffigur, er enghraifft -£1,200.00.

Welsh Content: Rhaid i'r swm a nodwyd ar gyfer 'Cyfanswm yr elw neu golled wedi'i addasu' fod yn llai na £10,000,000,000. Dylech ei ddiwygio.

English Content: Enter general
Welsh Content: Nodi cyffredinol

English Content:
Post cessation expenses

If you've paid expenses in connection with a business that has been ceased, you may be able to get tax relief on those payments (if made within 7 years of your cessation). The tax relief will be given for the tax year in which the payments were made.

A claim for expenses paid in the year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017 must be made by 31 January 2018.

Enter the total amount you are claiming in this field. (If, exceptionally, you are claiming relief against capital gains, please provide details in the 'Any other information' field at the end of the 'Fill in your return' section).

Include payments, made in the year 6 April 2016 to 5 April 2017, that were for:

  • making good, or as damages for, defective work done, or defective services or goods supplied
  • any legal or professional costs for any claim against you for that defective work etc
  • insurance against such expenses
  • recovering debts that were taken into account in calculating your business profits (before you ceased)

Additionally debts that have become bad or have been released under a formal voluntary arrangement within 7 years of the business ceasing may also be included.

If, while you were in business, you had reduced your taxable profits by expenses that had not actually been paid and those expenses are still unpaid at 5 April 2017, reduce the amount you are claiming now by the unpaid amount.

If you recover any of the amounts spent, perhaps from an insurance policy or from a third party, you should enter the amounts received in the 'Other UK income' section of your tax return.

Pre-incorporation losses

You may be able to set any remaining losses against your income from the company, if you:

  • have carried forward losses from your business to go against future profits
  • transfer your business to a company before all those losses have been used
  • received, solely or mainly, shares in that company in exchange for the transfer of your business, and
  • are the beneficial owner of the shares and the company has carried on business throughout the year (or from the date of transfer to 5 April)

Relief for former employee's liabilities and costs

If the amount of liabilities or costs to be entered relating to your actual or alleged wrongful acts in a former employment, exceed your total income in the year you may be able to claim the excess against capital gains. There are special rules limiting the relief if you did not pay for these costs etc yourself.

Employment loss relief

Relief for losses arising from an employment or office is only available in exceptional circumstances as the general rule is that employment expenses cannot exceed the earnings from which they are deductible. A loss may arise where all or part of any capital allowances due cannot be deducted from the earnings from the employment. And, exceptionally, a loss may also arise directly from the conditions of the employment. Enter any employment loss relief you are claiming to set against other income of the same tax year and give details in the 'Any other information' field. If you wish to claim relief now for an employment loss arising in the tax year 6 April 2017 to 5 April 2018, enter the relief and the year you are claiming relief for under 'income tax losses'.
Welsh Content:
Treuliau ôl-derfynu

Os bu rhaid i chi dalu treuliau mewn cysylltiad â'r busnes ers i'r busnes hwnnw ddod i ben, efallai y gallwch gael rhyddhad treth ar y taliadau hynny (os gwnewch y cais o fewn saith mlynedd i'r busnes ddod i ben). Rhoddir y rhyddhad treth ar gyfer y flwyddyn y gwnaed y taliadau ynddi.

Rhaid i gais am dreuliau a dalwyd yn y flwyddyn 6 Ebrill 2016 i 5 Ebrill 2017 gael ei wneud erbyn 31 Ionawr 2017.

Nodwch yn y blwch hwn y cyfanswm yr ydych yn ei hawlio. (Os, yn eithriadol, yr ydych yn hawlio rhyddhad yn erbyn enillion cyfalaf, rhowch fanylion yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall' ar ddiwedd y rhan 'Llenwch eich ffurflen'.

Dylech gynnwys taliadau a wnaed yn y flwyddyn hyd at 5 Ebrill 2017, a oedd ar gyfer:

  • gwneud iawn, neu fel iawndal am waith diffygiol, neu am wasanaethau neu nwyddau diffygiol a gyflenwyd
  • unrhyw gostau cyfreithiol neu broffesiynol ar gyfer unrhyw hawliadau yn eich erbyn am y gwaith diffygiol hwnnw ac ati
  • yswiriant yn erbyn treuliau o'r fath
  • adennill dyledion a gymerwyd i ystyriaeth wrth gyfrifo elw eich busnes (cyn i chi orffen)

Yn ychwanegol at hyn gellir cynnwys hefyd,dyledion sydd wedi troi'n ddrwg neu sydd wedi ei rhyddhau o dan drefniant gwirfoddol ffurfiol o fewn saith mlynedd o pan ddaeth y busnes i ben.

Os oeddech wedi gostwng eich elw trethadwy tra'r oeddech mewn busnes trwy ddefnyddio treuliau nad oeddynt wedi eu talu mewn gwirionedd, ac mae'r treuliau hynny yn dal heb eu talu ar 5 Ebrill 2017, dylech leihau'r hyn rydych yn eu hawlio nawr gan y swm sydd heb ei dalu.

Os byddwch yn adfer unrhyw symiau a wariwyd, efallai o bolisi yswiriant neu drydydd parti, dylech nodi'r symiau a gafwyd yn yr adran 'Incwm arall y DU' ar eich Ffurflen Dreth.

Colledion cyn ymgorffori

Os ydych:

  • wedi cario colledion ymlaen o'ch busnes i'w gosod yn erbyn elw yn y dyfodol
  • yn trosglwyddo eich busnes i gwmni cyn i'r holl golledion gael eu defnyddio
  • wedi derbyn cyfranddaliadau'n unig neu'n bennaf, yn y cwmni hwnnw yn gyfnewid am drosglwyddo eich busnes, ac
  • yn berchennog llesiannol y cyfranddaliadau ac mae'r cwmni wedi cynnal ei fusnes trwy gydol y flwyddyn (neu o'r dyddiad trosglwyddo i 5 Ebrill) yna efallai y gallwch osod unrhyw golledion sy'n weddill yn erbyn eich incwm o'r cwmni.

Rhyddhad ar gyfer rhwymedigaethau a chostau cyn gyflogai

Os ydy swm rhwymedigaethau neu gostau sydd i'w nodi yn ymwneud â gweithredoedd anghyfreithlon gwirioneddol neu honedig a gyflawnwyd gennych mewn cyflogaeth flaenorol, yn fwy na chyfanswm eich incwm yn y flwyddyn, efallai y gallwch hawlio'r swm gormodol drwy ei osod yn erbyn enillion cyfalaf. Mae rheolau arbennig sy'n cyfyngu ar y rhyddhad os daloch y costau hyn ac ati eich hun.

Rhyddhad colledion ar gyfer cyflogaeth

Mae rhyddhad ar gyfer colledion sy'n deillio o gyflogaeth neu swydd ar gael mewn amgylchiadau eithriadol yn unig oherwydd y rheol gyffredinol yw na all treuliau cyflogaeth bod yn fwy na'r enillion y maent yn dynadwy ohono. Gall colled ddigwydd pan na ellir didynnu'r holl neu ran o lwfansau cyfalaf o enillion o'r gyflogaeth.

Ac mewn amgylchiadau eithriadol, gall colled hefyd ddigwydd yn uniongyrchol oherwydd amodau'r gyflogaeth. Nodwch unrhyw ryddhad colledion ar gyfer cyflogaeth rydych yn ei hawlio i wrthbwyso yn erbyn incwm arall o'r un flwyddyn dreth, a rhowch fanylion yn y blwch 'Unrhyw wybodaeth arall'. Os ydych am hawlio rhyddhad nawr am golled ar gyfer cyflogaeth a ddigwyddith yn 2017 i 2017, nodwch y rhyddhad a'r flwyddyn yr ydych yn hawlio rhyddhad ar ei chyfer o dan 'colledion incwm treth'.

English Content: The amount entered for 'Total of any other taxable State pensions and benefits' is in an incorrect format. Monetary fields can only contain numbers, a decimal point and a minus (-) sign if the value is negative. Please amend.
Welsh Content: Mae'r swm a nodwyd ar gyfer 'Cyfanswm unrhyw bensiynau neu fudd-daliadau trethadwy eraill y Wladwriaeth' yn y ffurf anghywir. Gall blychau ariannol gynnwys dim ond rhifau, pwynt degol ac arwydd minws (-) os ydy'r gwerth yn negyddol. Dylech ei ddiwygio.
